review: Its quite shrimple. Once you get to a certain point (I.E, whenever your food outpaces eating and you make enough ammo to survive each night) you get to focus on making the numbers bigger. author: {'steamid': '76561198056657886', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 22592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21970, 'last_played': 1709038129}
review:
If you like blocky building games you have to at least try Colony Survival. It is unique in that you can't really craft much, but you hire colonists to gather materials and do the majority of the crafting. It's a game about balancing production versus security because as your colony grows, so does the threat level from zombies, mostly at night.

You spend alot of time managing your colony, but it's not a typical management type of game. You are in the colony and you decide what to build and where to place every block just like you would in minecraft.

The game is very well done despite being made by a very small dev team. It's been in EA a long time and that might turn some people off, but they are still very active and updating the game fairly often. Almost every Friday the devs release a blog detailing what they are currently working on or want to do for the future of the game.

I do have issue with the current progression. I get they want us to have to travel outside our colonies for some resources, but there isn't much in the way of different biomes in the game and the maps are fairly small compared to minecraft or creativerse. Having to find tin under the snow caps in mountains or having to find zinc under a mammoth tree is ok for single player, but try joining a popular multiplayer server and you will be buying tin and zinc in the marketplace because the places you can get tin or zinc are very limited, which in my opinion defeats the purpose of having us travel outside our colonies. It just feels forced and not a natural part of the progression.

I would like to see tin and zinc put back in the iron layer so we could mine it underground in our own colonies. Or make it go even deeper, I don't care. If the game can't be played in full in a multiplayer server, then there is a flaw in the progression, IMHO.

That said, I love the game. It is alot of fun to find a good spot on the map to build your colony and then figure out how to make it grow. The maps are very scenic. The latest update to the way the water looks is a huge step up. It looked terrible for so long. It is really nice now.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969677028', 'num_games_owned': 539, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1504, 'last_played': 1711161620}
review: This game has been a surprising gem! The gameplay does an amazingly good job at marrying single player exploration, discovery, and action with an excellently thought out base economy, defense, and management system. On top of all that it even gives you a simple, but attractive backdrop to build your most creative and intricate little worlds in. After 25 hours I'm still getting pulled in to "just 1 more day" loops polishing my hill fort turned quaint hamlet and I could see endless hours of fun in multiplayer building masterpieces with friends while laughing about the accidental gaps we left in our defenses that caused dozens of our poor little townies to get eaten. We even get updates and dev blogs still! (Thanks devs for not abandoning this one, I love it)

author: {'steamid': '76561197972056778', 'num_games_owned': 496, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 1549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1549, 'last_played': 1540470062}
review:
Tach Leute,

Colony Survival liegt bei mir schon etwas länger im Steam-Regal herum. Insgesamt ist es ein gutes, ganz brauchbares Strategie-Crafting-Survival-Game, mit simplen Tower-Defence-Elemente. Es ist eben eher einer einfachen, minimalistischen Spielkultur zuzuordnen. Wer geile Grafik, wunderbare Landschaften, Explosionen und volumentrischen Rauch erwartet ist hier an der falschen Adresse. 

Alles ist ziemlich gechillt in Colony Survival.

Ebenso gechillt lässt es deshalb auch der Entwickler angehen, so ein- zweimal im Jahr gibt es ein Update, mit ein paar netten Ideen. 

Mit den fast 25 Euros liegt das Spiel über der Grenze des Zumutbaren; offen gesprochen, wenn ihr das Spiel zwischen 10 und 15 Euro gekauft bekommt, dann ist das zu vertreten.

Von mir gibts wegen der netten Spielideen, dem gechillten Gaming und der guten Funktionalität 6/10 Punkte, es gäbe eine 7/10 wenn der Preis im Rahmen liegen würde.

In diesem Sinne,

Herzlichst,

Euer, 

Survivalstevie

review:
Very good game, updates always add something new and game changing. This game is pretty much like Minecraft but way better graphics, less boring, and gives you the player a challenge to keep your colony alive.

You'll be running the place, if you like telling people what to do and being the boss of everything, this game is for you. You can build up your colony as big as you can possibly handle.
You can even get friends with you to either join your colony and be the boss of it too, or you and your friends can all have your own colonies.

WARNING: Can get addicting lol

author: {'steamid': '76561199014239822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 11700, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9135, 'last_played': 1706908752}
review:
Colony Survival je strategická sandboxová hra, která se odehrává ve světě plném pixelového vojevůdců, kteří budují a brání své kolonie. Hra nabízí zajímavou kombinaci budování a obrany, která ji odlišuje od ostatních strategických her.

Jedním z nejlepších prvků hry je možnost stavět a rozvíjet vlastní kolonii. Hráč má možnost vybudovat různé druhy budov, jako jsou domy pro obyvatele, farmy pro pěstování potravin, dílny pro výrobu zbraní a nářadí, a mnoho dalšího. Každá budova má svůj konkrétní účel a přispívá k rozvoji kolonie. Je zde také možnost vylepšovat a rozšiřovat tyto budovy, což nabízí hlubší strategické možnosti.

Dalším zásadním aspektem hry je obrana kolonie před útoky nepřátel. Hráč musí najímat vojáky a postavit obranné věže, které budou bránit kolonii před nepřátelskými invazemi. Obranné věže mohou být upraveny a vylepšeny, aby byly schopny odolat silnějším útokům. Hra tak kombinuje elementy budování a obrany, čímž vytváří napínavou a zábavnou strategickou hru.

Grafika hry je pixelová, což může některé hráče odradit. Nicméně, i přestože grafika není na nejvyšší úrovni, dokonale zapadá do celkového stylu hry a nebrání zábavě. Hra také nabízí mnoho možností přizpůsobení, takže hráči mohou přizpůsobit hru svým preferencím.

Colony Survival je zábavná sandboxová strategická hra, která kombinuje budování a obranné prvky. Nabízí mnoho možností pro kreativitu a strategické rozhodování. Pokud máte rádi hry tohoto žánru, stojí za to ji vyzkoušet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067192884', 'num_games_owned': 446, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 3611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3611, 'last_played': 1687420675}
review:
Great game, 
I discovered it thanks for the Yogscast, and i had a blast on my playthrough. 
My only regret is that i can't grind more.

I can't wait for future updates to add more things to do.
I assume the game is currently around 40-60 hours for a complete full achievement run, with quite a bit of time spent on building. For the price tag, good value IMO.

The devs seems quite active and keep in mind this is still an early access, but is already quite good and fun.
It also have a mod workshop to expand on furnituresand such you might want in your game.

Overall solid game, grind is well balanced, i love the settlement management, you got all the info you need via tools in game.
It's easy to adjust your ratios, manage multiple colonies and the difficulty scales up really well, until you get to the end and you start to feel unbeatable (except that time i was building and left a hole in a side wall, yikes).
The game has good building options (and more to come), you can really build beautiful bases if that's your thing.

In the future i hope for some more thing to be added in outpost as for when i last played, they kinda give you a handfull of  new materials and that's kinda it.

I guess the only questions you have to ask yourself before buying are :
-Do i like the game art style ? 
-Do i like first person building games like minecraft ?
-Do i like colony management games ?

If so, grab it. 
Even with friends if you can, and try to do a race between all of you, quite fun.

review: It's got that sleepy-yet-exciting charm of those 2010's-era public minecraft servers we stayed up too late on. What begins as a motley crew of berry boys quickly devolves into an insane conglomeration of production lines and killboxes as your colony's economy grows ever-more complex. At least until your wanton mismanagement of the copper nails economy kills everyone everywhere. A labor of love by the devs that really is charming as hell.

review: This game is criminally underrated, I have been wanting to play a game like this for years, and love how its a mix between a tower defence and a survival sandbox. This game brings so many aspects of so many different games together and it works perfectly. Can't wait to see the future of this game and am exited for whats next.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042947950', 'num_games_owned': 781, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 8135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5451, 'last_played': 1706125807}
review:
Great game. When playing on the harder difficulties, there is a very delicate line between "everything easy" to "getting completely wrecked by the zombies". 

Love how the production lines intersect and turning one wheel can screw you over big time if there isn't enough food or resources for ammunition for the night.

9/10 - big fan, can't wait for future updates. Would love to see more traps like spikes for zombie defense.

author: {'steamid': '76561198915519235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 73, 'playtime_at_review': 628, 'last_played': 1712457359}

author: {'steamid': '76561198137079143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 8748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8748, 'last_played': 1701986333}
review:
Overall, its a good survival management game. You as the players main job is to issue jobs, explore to setup bases and outposts, perform research ("press button to complete" is all you have to do once you have resources), manage whats priority to construct crafting materials wise, build nice houses or an underground giant room full of beds depending on if you prefer efficiency or building design. The NPCs don't have any needs bar their own bed and some food, they have no morale needs or comfort needs. 

Its a good game to get invested and focused into something at the start, but towards the end its really just about building things to keep you busy; I am in full knowledge the game is in "Early Access" but the game really does lack end game material and you are more or less entertaining yourself by the end. I'd wait on a sale to buy it. The devs do update the game with community desired features and also fix bugs well; eg we had a game breaking bug that only happened to the odd player, 1 out of 3 players in my world experienced it (as well as other players online) and the devs reverted the update within an hour and then fixed it a few hours or so.

Positives:
Updates are scarce but contain improvements and wanted content
Multiplayer works well only in a PvE aspect
There are a lot of jobs/roles for colonists to fill
Unlocking new tech even on another run still feels rewarding
NPCs can help with clearing large areas of blocks
The graphics with the NPC models sit well together
The UI isnt intrusive
Building is simple and being near/in ur colony gives access to your whole stockpile which makes it very convenient to build to dig out somewhere
I can shoot my friends with a gun
Trading with other colonies in a constant trade or one off trade of an item
In MP, you can have your friends take up different roles in their colony's eg player 1 focuses on crafting, player 2 does resource gathering, trade stuff and it work fine. Means theres no barriers (apart from tech tree) to have say a rifleman in a colony where we dont make rifles, the ammo or have the bench to "use it", we just can and it adds a lot of flexibility

Negatives:
As said, end game/ near the end is kinda stand around and watch zombies die or build
PvP is possible but a colony vs colony not so much, the colonists dont seem to shoot players from what I've seen
Biomes feel limited but the current ones are unique enough
No weather system, can make the world feel a bit dead, could have seasons too to change how crops work making the game harder (winter, food storage, better yields in season X etc) 
The colonists have no morale or comfort needs, would add some difficulty
Player upgrades are limited to HP, no tool usage or such
Lack of Zombie variety, just HP increase (maybe add resistance to damage type X or Y, faster, slower etc)
Players cannot see what another player is holding being block or weapon, they cannot hear a weapon from a player being fired

author: {'steamid': '76561198944330456', 'num_games_owned': 199, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 558, 'last_played': 1702482384}
review:
Colony Survival is an amazing game that has completely captivated me with its unique blend of strategy, building, and survival. One of the biggest strengths of this game is undoubtedly its endless creativity and the possibilities it offers to players.

The game allows players to build and manage their own colony in an open world, where they must tackle strategic challenges related to building defenses and resource management. Every game element is carefully designed, offering a great balance between challenge and reward.

The game's graphic design is simply stunning. The combination of pixel art and a user-friendly interface creates a captivating visual experience. The music and sound effects add to the game's atmosphere, with every sound of construction or enemy attack adding another layer of realism.

I am excited about the opportunity to collaborate with other players and build massive colonies. The multiplayer mode provides an excellent chance to share ideas and work together to achieve common goals.

Colony Survival is a great choice for anyone who loves strategic games where it's important not only to plan efficiently but also to collaborate as a team. This game offers endless hours of entertainment and is full of opportunities for creativity and experimentation. I highly recommend it to all genre enthusiasts!

author: {'steamid': '76561198202483633', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 11205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11004, 'last_played': 1701561817}
review:
Colony Survival is a decent game, but just super hard to get into. The game is constantly changing for the better, and getting new layers of polish.

Without spoiling much of the journey this game is, you build a colony and advance through the ages. 

What might be boring to some, ends up becoming an imperialist's Minecraft; One cool enough it's willing to add muskets! 
I'd also lovingly describe it as a Tower defense game with supply logistics and custom paths! Custom paths shaped by your colony and your methods of dealing with the enemies.

The game takes a different focus, focusing on your towns and colonies, instead of your abilities as the player. Aside from certain colonist jobs, everything is hand-built by you or your peers.

review: After playing this game for more than 50 hours during the later half of its early access release, I can say for sure that this game is a fun and rather strong strategy/resource management game, with the fun twist of physically having to establish and build everything in real time. While it could use some general and endgame improvements, I had a good time playing this and experimenting with all the different avenues this game provides. Although I wouldn't personally pay as much as the game costs for its current iteration, I can assure that this game should be a nice time for any at all interested.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020017157', 'num_games_owned': 254, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 7455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7354, 'last_played': 1700317535}
review:
Good fun, since I got it in a humble bundle. But holy shit $36.50 AUD? That's an absurdly high price for what this game is. For me it has great fun gameplay and and a fair bit of replay value. I enjoy playing this every year or so for about 20-30 hours. 

The game is also being updated at about the same speed I am. Which is to say, one medical procedure every couple of years. It has picked up recently (same) to a few a year but it's still very much the same base game as it was when it released 6.5 years ago. 

If you like playing modded minecraft with factories and production lines, it's like that but about 20-30% of the content you get in a standard factory modpack.

author: {'steamid': '76561198378217700', 'num_games_owned': 771, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 6283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6279, 'last_played': 1702932752}
review:
[h1]Colony Survival - игра в которой вам предстоит строить базу, нанимать жителей и защищаться от толп зомби. [/h1]

[h1]Немного об игре[/h1]

[h3]Вы король и вам нужно построить хорошую защиту от толп зомби которые будут идти на вас первоначальная задача у зомби уничтожить знамя (можно настраивать численность и можно отключать),так же вам нужно будет пища, для этого вы должны строить поля и различные верстаки и печки для готовки.Так же вам нужно изучать различные предметы для изготовления.В игре вы можете построиться где угодно главное чтобы было в зоне знамя чтобы можно было нанимать рабочих.[/h3]

Мною же игра была куплена в первые дни после выхода в стиме..за эти 6 лет многое было добавлено и переработано.

[h1]Плюсы:[/h1]
[h3]1.Красивая графика [/h3]
[h3]2.Красивые шейдеры[/h3]
[h3]3.Хорошая оптимизация[/h3]
[h3]4.Много различных занятий[/h3]
[h3]5.Русский язык (в игре он есть)[/h3]
[h3]6.Множество исследование [/h3]
[h3]7.Большое разнообразие блоков[/h3]
[h3]8.Много достижений[/h3]
[h3]9.Приятно что разработчики за столько лет не забросили свой проект [/h3]
[h3]10.Мир в игре очень большой (если не бесконечный)[/h3]

[h1]Минусы: [/h1]
[h3]1.Цена (419р 2017г)[/h3]
Сейчас же цена 880р как по мне лучше подождать скидку
[h3]2.При выходе обновлений может удалиться ваш мир,так же были сброшены все достижения[/h3]

author: {'steamid': '76561197999564595', 'num_games_owned': 396, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 6827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3115, 'last_played': 1701303763}
review:
It's meh... but I still play it once a year.
there are a lot of things that I can't tell if they're a feature or a bug.
It's come a long way since 2017, villagers path finding allows for multi layered bases now.

This game is simple and the fun is in the cheese like making a maze so long it takes days for mobs to get into the base, I think this is what the daytime guard posts are for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101714675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 457, 'last_played': 1628288673}
review: Great game to chill on, seen this game after watching some of the Yogscast members play it. If you like building and protecting your pawns this would be a great game for you. It sorta like a tower defense game mix with Minecraft. I first got this game back when it didn't have much to offer but now with the newest update they gave us more things to enjoy! The game went up in price but you have to expect that given that they have been working hard on this game and provide constant updates and feedback if you check the notes!

author: {'steamid': '76561198162019218', 'num_games_owned': 57, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 768, 'last_played': 1696542197}
review:
Майнкрафт? Но совсем о другом.
Даже вместо настроения глубокого одиночества навеваемого майнкрафтом, здесь совсем другое.
Я бы сказал что настолько же сильно отличается от майнкрафта, насколько сильно от него отличается "7days to die", но в другом направлении .
В общем игра намного интереснее, чем может показаться на первый взгляд.
Благодаря гибким настройкам сложности - подойдет как хардкордным стратегам, так и под чисто творческий настрой порыться в песочнице с кубиками.
Норм мультиплейер, есть и сервера на которых есть какая-то активность.
С технической стороны реализовано старательно: всё плавно, красиво, хорошо оптимизировано, механиками и интерфейсами удобно пользоваться и легко разобраться если не полениться.

author: {'steamid': '76561198885560839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1696296661}
review: Гра класна, але була б краща якби юніти мали анімації а не вистрілювали наприклад з рогатки без всяких рухів і немов з бластера... Подивившись на текстури деяких блоків дивуюсь, в майнкрафт доводилось для такого ефекту завантажувати реалістичні текстурпаки і шейдери а тут зразу є "але лише деякі блоки". В іншому видно що над грою працювали нові крафти, технології і логіка хвиль монстрів.

author: {'steamid': '76561199161443550', 'num_games_owned': 12, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 278, 'playtime_at_review': 2624, 'last_played': 1712333802}
review:
Personally, I saw a block-based game and wanted to have some adventure and such. That didn't happen. I'd say it's a good game if you get it for the right reasons, and it's under active development, so that's a big plus.

Do I think it's overpriced? Heck yeah! But I'm probably not the best person to gauge that.

Side note: The devs are generally pretty nice folks, and you can usually contact them (and get plugged in to the community) in the CS Discord.

Overall: 5/10

That's my take, but hey! Find out for yourself!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044354296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1618, 'last_played': 1602861324}
review: This game will always be a passion project that is unfairly compared to Minecraft due to the simplistic blocky world. However I feel that a lot of people get immediately turned off from this game because this game differs from Minecraft heavily in terms of the UI and other controls. If you can get past the simplistic designs, the core civilization builder, tower defender, and free creative building world is actually insanely cool. You can really mimic the feeling of a Minecraft solo world but will the fun added bonus of a civ builder with various goals and quality of life needs for your people. I fully love the idea and hope to one day see it  come to reach its full potential.

author: {'steamid': '76561199087922521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1210, 'last_played': 1697132884}
review: I remember seeing this game on youtube around 6 years ago.  At this time I had no PC and only had access to my father's crappy windows 7 laptop.  I remember being so bummed to find out I couldn't play the game on my xbox and tried to download it on my potato laptop.  4 years ago I finally built my first gaming PC.  The first game I installed was Colony Survival I remember logging 50 hours on my other steam account and had a blast although I had no idea what I was doing.  This last week I remember being very disappointed with Starfield causing me to search through my steam library again.  At the very bottom not even installed I saw Colony Survival,  I figured why not give it another shot.  I was completely blown away by how much had been added and improved in the couple years since I have played.  This game is so fun, as someone who loves minecraft and has thousands of hours on the game, it is basically a minecraft server I have always wanted.  Minecraft with a tower defense aspect, where you have freedom to build, skills to unlock, and a whole colony to manage.  I have been very impressed with the community and also the development team who actively improve this game and listen to the community.  I would recommend this game to everyone it is one of my favorite.  Also I haven't tried out the multiplayer mode myself but I have seen many play it and it looks just as well put together.  I am excited to see what this game adds as it nears it's full release.

review: The closest game I can compare it to is Minecraft - except the emphasis is on building and protecting your colony, It's a great basis for a game, but it's still in development, so it doesn't yet have things (Writing this in September, 2023) like good roof blocks, etc. But it's very much playable and it is fun. The leveling up system (the research) isn't complex, but it's not boring, either.

author: {'steamid': '76561198334128235', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6169, 'last_played': 1695535626}
review: i will start with what i dislike about this game. about a year ago, i had started a world in which i would progress in for months, once those months were up, i  had what id say a pretty decent colony, with most of the progression done. i had built my base underground, below water level. here is why i stopped playing until recently. the water physics are wack because the create a source block when they spread. you know what happened to my colony? flooded. i broke a wrong block when i was next to a natural lake. all of my crops were gone. my colonists drowned. i left and never returned until recently. now i will go on to what i loved about the game. a lot of the game is primarily addicting, and with the addition of colonists, it makes the expansionism and relativity addicting game-play even more so because of automation. i loved this even more then Minecraft, i would say love if it weren't for the one incident i stated previously, i would've been playing this through-out last year and into this year on my school breaks and such. i would heavily recommend others and would warn others aswell of the water physics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018118916', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3753, 'last_played': 1697275775}
review:
Part Minecraft, part tower defense, part colony sim. Currently, a solid 7/10 and could easily be an 8/10 with a little refinement. Well worth buying and I was happy to sink over 60 hours into the game (most games are lucky to get past 10 hours).

[u] Pros [/u]
- The crafting/defense/sim aspects of the game work well together, and keeping the balance of weapons, food, and luxuries keeps you hooked.
- Great world generation, far view distance and good lighting engine.
- Clear progression and research tree.
- Allowing you to build additional bases encourages exploration.
- Simple digging/building jobs can be automated.
- Lift and hang-glide provide fun ways to travel.
- Didn't experience any bugs.
- Developer is active and listens to players.

[u] Cons [/u]
- Lots of the mechanics are relatively shallow. For example, harder enemies just have more health, so all you have to do is add more units to fight them. The shared inventory means there is no real complexity for logistics.
- Beyond creating outposts, there is no reason to explore (e.g. no dungeons or rare loot).
- No real end game, so no incentive to keep playing, other than to build creative structures. 
- Lack of decoration blocks.
- Little guidance on finding various blocks/items and wiki is not up to date.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091991006', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 4788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4340, 'last_played': 1696279251}

review:
Last update (0.9 i think) broke the game for me, now you HAVE to play with outposts (multiple colonys) and i hate it. You now have to go and look for every biome to get all the ores to progress, still no auto sell/buy in merchant.

The way the science research is setup now its easier to pull all of your teeth than play the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198388453784', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 8039, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7958, 'last_played': 1704731440}
review:
This game, like Minecraft, Necesse, Rimworld and Vintage Story (Not on steam as of now). Have created a way for many of us to see our passions that involve seeing terraformation, construction and architecture at a Large scale without the constraints of menial things like Physics. I have used the creative functions to make fantastic wonders that go thousands of blocks in the sky, where it can fit many 1000 x 1000 village sections through using the Copy and Paste commands. There are features from this game that I'd definitely want to use in Minecraft, such as the cuboidal chunk system that allows for infinite block height. And I will enjoy seeing the features such as the designed windows and shingles for the new update!

Though, I'd enjoy greater colouration of blocks, such as using the different wood types for different wood planks that can work with coatings and the dyes available. And maybe in the future, getting the sheep mob that can have dyed wool, or cows for coated leather that can be used as a form of furniture, such as wall covering or window curtains (which can also work with cotton.) And about forms of furniture, actual furniture! I'd say this game, even in beta. Have features that i'd say would go beyond even lightly modded minecraft. And I hope that features such as from Vintage Story could worm their way in too (with their own fling, of course.) I thank you, the Boltjez brothers. For creating a game with fantastic potential.

review:
Este es un juego 100/10 es como minecraft pero con estadística.
Es una obra de arte y casi arruina mi vida ya que prefería jugar este juego que estudiar para mi examen de admisión de la preparatoria. pero aun así no pasó a mayores y logre entrar junto a una hermosa colonia.
Este juego es muy divertido y se lo recomiendo a cualquiera que quiera una experiencia diferente.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116104816', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 61647, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30421, 'last_played': 1709825119}
review:
Love this game.

Other reviews cover many specifics, though early reviews don't necessarily reflect current functionality.

One thing I'll mention is the 2-man dev team. They are very involved and regularly discuss their efforts and solicit feedback from users.

I see some reviews knocking the length of time in early access. To me this is completely irrelevant. I say take as much time as you want to make the game great, then release it. I got thousands of quality hours out of Factorio in EA and over 500 in Colony Survival. There aren't many other entertainment options in life that provide those kind of hours for such a relatively low cost. Early Access simply doesn't matter.

Great job Devs! Keep up the good work!

author: {'steamid': '76561198131293618', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 407, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1669175017}
review:
Bir gün, büyük bir canavar sürüsü kolonime saldırdı. Muhafızlarım cesurca savaştı, ama sayıca azdılar. Her şeyin kaybolduğuna inanmak üzereyken, daha önce araştırdığım yeni bir teknolojiyi hatırladım: balista. Hemen birkaç balista inşa ettim ve onları duvarlara yerleştirdim. Balitalar, canavarlara ok yağdırdı ve onlar kısa sürede yenildi.

Zafer kazandım, ama biliyordum ki canavarlar geri gelecek. Kolonimi korumak istiyorsam, yeni teknolojiler araştırmaya ve daha güçlü savunmalar inşa etmeye devam etmem gerekecekti. Ama emindim ki bunu yapabilirdim. Güçlü bir kolonist ekibim vardı ve hayatta kalmaya kararlıydık.

Bu oyunun oyun mekanikleri çok karmaşık ve zor. Kolonistlerin ihtiyaçlarını, kaynakların üretimini ve koloninin savunmasını takip etmek gibi birçok farklı şey var. Ama aynı zamanda çok ödüllendirici. Yeni bir teknolojiyi başarıyla inşa ettiğinizde veya bir canavar sürüsünü yendiğinizde, gerçek bir başarı gibi hissediyor. Zorlayıcı, ama strateji oyunlarını seven herkese kesinlikle bu oyunu tavsiye ederim.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996972442', 'num_games_owned': 1008, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 600, 'last_played': 1688870760}
review:
I'm going to start off this review by saying it isn't for me. I bought this game expecting something different, but I probably should have done more research. Oh well, that's on me. Despite this, if the game in the future does look at my suggestions, then I'll probably flip it to positive.

Colony Survival is a colony management game in first person. Since it kinda looked like Minecraft colony or w/e mod, I thought I'd be doing more. However, if you are not a creative person and enjoy building things, this game is not for you.

The game has little interaction outside of placing blocks. Everything is automated by colonists. You can dig things at a reasonable speed, but you have no reason to other than finding new infinite resources of materials. Maybe there's something later for me, but the early game has been: Build food production, build more jobs for colonists to do based on research, keep food production higher than consumption.

You're meant to build a colony, research and get to the end goal while protecting your colony flag from zombies. You can play the game in siege mode, where zombies will attack your walls, but colonists eat more food. So the better solution is either a maze for the walking dead to go down while being shot at, or a large perimeter with many guards. You don't get a weapon to use other than clicking the zombies, and you largely don't need to.

If there were more interactions, such as weapons or crafting things manually, I might have enjoyed the game more. But setting up automation in first person wasn't very satisfying to me like it would be in other games. Games like Satisfactory have you visibly see the parts moving around. You have giant machines doing the work for you, and you have to plan things out. This game most things are created and go into a number screen for something else to use or be made. It's very easy to feel disconnected due to that.

I suppose the other thing after saying that would be nice if there was more visual indicators of what your colonists are doing. Lifelessly standing at their post with an icon over their head tells me what they're doing, but I don't feel like they're doing it. At some point it feels like block people making numbers go up with you making choices on what numbers go up next.

author: {'steamid': '76561199047177121', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 5947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5809, 'last_played': 1706173333}
review:
Colony Survival is a game that shares similarities with Minecraft, but it has its own unique identity. The game offers a wealth of possibilities, allowing you to create and manage your own colony with intricate defenses. As night falls, you'll need to be prepared to defend your colony from the dangers that lurk in the darkness. However, it's important to note that the latest big update has brought significant changes to the game. While I haven't had the chance to fully explore the newest update, it appears that the initial nights may offer a bit more safety compared to before.

In Colony Survival, the freedom to build and shape your colony is a key feature. You have the opportunity to design and construct defenses that suit your playstyle, ensuring the safety and prosperity of your colony. Whether you prefer towering walls, cunning traps, or a combination of strategies, the game allows you to experiment and find the best defense strategies that work for you.

The recent update has likely introduced new elements and features that can further enhance the gameplay experience. While I haven't had extensive hands-on time with the latest version, the changes promise to add depth and variety to the game. Exploring these updates will undoubtedly provide new challenges and opportunities for players to enjoy.

In summary, Colony Survival is a game that offers a unique blend of colony management and defense mechanics. It shares similarities with Minecraft but carves out its own niche in the gaming landscape. With the ability to shape and defend your colony, the game provides a satisfying level of creativity and strategy. While I haven't fully experienced the latest update, it appears to have made significant changes that add to the overall depth and enjoyment of the game. If you're a fan of colony-building and strategic defense games, Colony Survival is definitely worth checking out.

review: This game is hands down my favorite colony builder! The fact i get to custom build everything or research my colony to build things for me that i still get to design makes it so fun. The new updates on threat level make the game SO MUCH better than it was before :) Super hooked and totally worth the price especially with the hundreds of hours you can sink into it and each time you play you can alter your play style. Modding is amazingly easy and really just adds to the fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198150027013', 'num_games_owned': 32, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1872, 'last_played': 1695464588}
review:
I love buying early access games. It's sometimes quite interesting to watch how games gradually change over time. Sometimes for the better and other times it's not good there. Colony Survival is somewhere in between. I have been following the development of the game for a long time, but I bought it a few days ago (autumn 2023) and have already recorded about 30 hours. I was easily engrossed in the game as I like these open world sandbox type Minecraft style games.
+ nice block graphics
+ hiring colonists and defending the base against zombies

review: Always wanted to play Minecraft but then you get there and have to do everything yourself and it's boring. Well look no further. Get your men to do it all, mine, craft even fight monsters. And the best part is they have no happiness feature. So you can cram as many people into tiny rooms, keep them permanently underground even! I love being King of my empire and watching them struggle to make porridge everyday for me to just eat it all!

author: {'steamid': '76561197987498188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 116, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1711412463}
review:
So far very enticing.
It's just scratching an itch that Minecraft doesn't. Not only with the base building and colony organization, but also with the faster loading, further render distance, naturally more polished look (e.g. lighting) and more little differences.

What puts me off right now:
- Weird progression (very linear and forcing heat on you, without any believable reason)
- Weird mob spawns (so far only at night, quite randomly) > here I would wish for some fixed spawns, so you could 1. plan accordingly 2. don't get surprised while exploring > or do it the other way around, but make is possible to bring guards with you
- No real reason for exploration before unlocking outposts
- No real reason to build anything good looking > just build bunkers or towers

I really like where the game is going and hope for some fresh changes throughout the year.
Good luck to the devs!

author: {'steamid': '76561198120883899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 8061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5820, 'last_played': 1710905575}
review: This game has a lot of promise and since it's in Early Access I haven't lost hope for it yet. The problem is that it takes absolutely forever to get anything done in this game, and because of the limitations set on the player, there's not much you can do in the meantime. The changes made in 0.9 have made this worse, making the game take even longer and the player can't even collect blocks on their own to build with, so you have to wait for your colonists to do anything. The best thing that could be done for this game is to half the production time for EVERYTHING.

review:
Dost nedodělaná hra, spousta bugů přes které se nedá pokračovat, málo informací o dalším postupu, hledání nových surovin je neuvěřitelně otravný, grafika je spíš nějaká alfa verze, žádné animace, všechno je to spíš jako dívat se na excel tabulku jak se přičítají a odčítají čísla... nikde není nic vysvětlené žádná wiki nic...
Hru jsem hrál s tím že se těším až přijde něco dalšího nového ale vlastně to nikdy nepřišlo, stále dokola to samé... nejradši bych dal refund a koupil si to tak v 70% slevě... dost drahý za to co to vlastně je...

author: {'steamid': '76561198042044934', 'num_games_owned': 2134, 'num_reviews': 336, 'playtime_forever': 6132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6132, 'last_played': 1681534887}
review:
While I do like this game, I don't feel like it's getting better or that it was really amazing to begin with. 

Progression is almost entirely linear, and it often leads to most bases ending up with the same maze defense due to zombie scaling. It used to be that you could supplement your workers with your own work, by crafting your own items. Now, all but 5 something items are only able to be made by colonists, leaving you with little to nothing to do until they've finished doing their tasks, which only really allows you to get a few more colonists to repeat the loop or crafting and placing. 

You can absolutely make visually impressive structures, but it's nothing that you can't make in other block/voxel games that have a greater variety of material choices and a lack of threat that a zombie might decide they can't reach your base's banner and start breaking everything. The shaders are nice, but they impact performance more than they should.

The only saving grace I can really give it is that multiplayer is fun. Tunnel to your friends base to make their base the only way to your banner and overwhelming them, working together to create a crossfire trench, it has mechanics that allow mischievous and friendly players to interact with each other.

It's not a bad game I guess, it's just that everything it does somewhat well, another game does better while also actually promoting interactivity. 2/3rds of my time in this game was spent tabbed out, waiting for colonists to finish their tasks. The rest was spent running back and forth like you're in a Minecraft Multiplayer Server Hub World or placing down blocks my colonists built.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039451764', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5854, 'last_played': 1681652840}
review:
This is a really good, well-developed game that I thoroughly enjoye playing. The main point of the game is to build Colonies and outposts and automate workflows for food, research, tool creation and defence. It is quite detailed and a suprising amount of things rely on one another so it can be confusing to pick up and the online resources for this game are sub-par so niche issues will have to be worked out by youtself. But if you just build everything you should not have to encounter this issue

The game requires full attention for the first 100 or so days but after that its the kind of thing you can leave for 20 minutes for an episode and then come but to and spend the resources you have.

The entire game takes about 100 hours to get all achievements, the main reason being the get to day 500 time based achievement.

author: {'steamid': '76561199087047775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 685, 'last_played': 1684699454}
review:
Das Spiel macht Laune, natürlich im Coop mehr als allein. Es ist mittlerweile auch komplett in Deutsch übersetzt und ist dadurch noch zugänglicher. Die zwei niederländischen Entwickler sollten aber etwas mehr am Ball bleiben, zB. wenn es um die Integration der Übersetzungen geht, die User für das Spiel machen. Dass man sich (unbezahlt) tagelang hinsetzt und eine Übersetzung überarbeitet, wofür die Entwickler eigentlich dankbar sein sollten, diese dann aber wochenlang als Pull request in github rumliegt motiviert nicht gerade fürs nächste Mal ...

Trotzdem, das Spiel an sich motiviert über längere Zeit, da es immer neue Rezepte und Dinge zu bauen und optimieren gibt.

author: {'steamid': '76561199170715422', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 12715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12659, 'last_played': 1709832344}
review:
Hra skvělá o tom žádná , roztomilá grafika , západ slunce atd .
Velmi dobre updaty do doby nez se prokoušete k bambitkám , kde zacina velmi velký kámen úrazu . Na přechod z kusiniku na strelce je to problém kvuli nevyvázenosti jednotlivých nutných priprav - susici pec , uhlíri , alchymisti , puskari atd nejsou konzistentne rychlí pri vyrobe a pokavad mate temer 400 kolonistu a hrozbu 620+ jako já tak vám strelný prach dojde velmi rychle , není videt pocet nabojnic jako napriklad u kusnich sipek nebo u luku . Fáze prechodu z kusi na strelné je v podstate smrtici .
Nelibi se mi uzavreni moznosti stavet kdekoliv bez moznosti koupe zvetseni radiusu bezpecnosti nebot 5 bloku za 2500 bodu kolonie - sry moc malo za hodne bodu a nektere vyzkumy postradaji smysl jako napriklad barvir luceren ( modra , cervena .... ) - vyzkoumam ho , postavim ho ,ale stejne nelze mit tyto lanterny nebot pestovani alkany , topolovky atd je v nedohlednu . U starsich verzich byl vyzkumny strom jednodusi a musim rict zabavnejsi nez nyní nebot mit vyzkum rogala , ktere v zakladu nevyuziju mi prijde nadbytecna . System vicero mini-zakláden ehm budiz ,ale kdyz vyuziju prapor na to ,ze maji utocit pouze na moji hlavni zakladnu tak to ocekavam a ne ze mi umiraji kazdou noc 2000 metru od me hlavni base i tak ...... Hra dobra , ale s jiz zminovanymi neduhy a skoda , ze neni u hry hudba .

review: I love this game's idea, a quite simple yet fun idea. The graphics are quite lovely and there is always something I can do. As your colony advances more and more zombies attack every night, making you always be on your toes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102659963', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 10611, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 340, 'playtime_at_review': 8306, 'last_played': 1711412524}
review: Man, where do I start? I've had the game for a little while but was never hooked until the recent update. I'm addicted. Factory games like Satisfactory are fun, but always eventually bored me because there was nothing to fight. Factorio is also great but there's something different about this game being 1st person. Access to builders and excavators that allow me to raise massive cities or hollow out mountains with ease really helps my creativity thrive without the boredom of placing blocks one at a time. It's a beautiful combination between voxel based crafting games, tower defense, and colony sims. The best part is that it still has so much potential, especially for multiplayer! I have a server with some friends and despite each of us having colony populations in the thousand(s), there's no lag. Optimization is flawless. This game can still go in lots of directions... I can imagine future pvp, with colonies having standing armies that could invade others and steal resources, as long as players were not able to manipulate blocks within another player's banner zone. For how cheap this game is, it's a great deal as it will deliver hours and hours of playtime. Great job Pipliz, thank you for all of your work and I'm looking forwards to future updates!

author: {'steamid': '76561198010214619', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 65513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2345, 'last_played': 1691502774}
review:
Ich hatte dieses Spiel schon länger auf der Wunschliste, ich frage mich warum ich es erst jetzt gekauft habe. Es ist genau nach meinem Geschmack: leichter Einstieg und ein Anstieg des Schwierigkeitsgrades wie ich es möchte. Vom entspannten Zugucken wie die Arbeiter ihre Jobs erledigen und wie sich das Inventar füllt (erinnert mich etwas an alte Anno-Zeiten) bis "oh, die Horden kommen!" ist alles dabei. 

Viele haben es ja schon geschrieben, es ist an einigen Stellen (v.a bei der Grafik) wie Minecraft aber mit Tower Defense Inhalten. Am Tag wird gearbeitet, in der Nacht kommen die Horden (je nach Bedrohungsgrad mehr oder weniger Zombies) und versuchen, zum Banner der Basis zu kommen. Und das finde ich so viel spannender an Colony Survival: hier lohnt es sich eine Basis zu bauen, XXL Felder anzulegen usw weil ich die Waren effektiv brauche. In Minecraft wurden die Kisten immer voller und wozu eine große Basis bauen? Für wen? Ja, es ist schon schön in MC zu bauen, aber es ist nicht so grundlegend, nicht soo wichtig.

Dann der Multiplayer, diese einfache Installation des Servers unter Linux ohne 1000 Abhängigkeiten (Stichwort Eco) ist einfach eine Freude. Dazu alles schön dokumentiert, super! Am Morgen die Entwickler angeschrieben, am Nachmittag die Antwort der Entwickler "ist in der nächsten Version eingebaut". Wow! Großes Lob an die zwei Entwickler aus den Niederlanden! 

Von mir gibt es eine klare Kaufempfehlung, außer vielleicht für Leute die die beste und realistischste Grafik brauchen um sich in einem Spiel wohl zu fühlen.

author: {'steamid': '76561199005509996', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 3455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3394, 'last_played': 1679167471}
review: The mechanic of chests that store all and can be accessed anywhere seems great in early game, but as recipes and ingredients pile up it becomes very hard to know where something is being used and the end game becomes very frustrating. For example, to build a blast furnace I need 8 steel parts, I am making them, but something is getting before I can get 8 for the blast furnace. This is not a recipe I set up, it was automatically added after a science update, What is spending the steel parts? I don't know, I would have to check dozens of machines some with a dozen recipes to discover. I just gave up and leave the game running in the background for hours till I get something I need. I am only continue to play because I hate stop playing a game before I get my goal, in this case all science except prestige chests.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021175584', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 45550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14309, 'last_played': 1707089492}
review:
I don't really know what I expected from that game but so far i'm satisfied with it. :-)

It looks like another Mincraft Clone but I feel it is It's own thing in a way. The Gameplay is intuitive and it doesn't take long to get the hang of it. Major difference for me was the inventory system in which you have full access to all items in your colony as long as you stay in a specific range of the Center of your colony/outpost.
Thats another plus point in my books. You have a Safe Zone where no Mob spawns at night even if its in total darkness and this eliminates the need for you to put torches absolutely everywhere.
The Mobs themselves are a bit minimalistic and may not everyones taste but i like that you can easily destinguish them based on their strengh. In greater Numbers they can pose a real threat and if you're not careful they overwhelm you. Even when that happens that doesn't mean game over. Seal every entrance, clear the area, rehire your colonists, improve your defenses and then reopen the gates.
It feels like a Tower Defense with an economy touch.
Another Pluspoint in my books is the ressource farming. You don't have to do that yourself! Just create a worksplace for a Colonist, hire it and it will produce ressources every day till it gets eaten by Monsters. What i miss is the need to have an open Colony in the first place. There would be an opportunity to create a merchant or caravan to deliver goods from f.e. an Outpost to the main Colony and vice versa. Without that angle yet in place just create an settlement of any kind, wall it off (min 2 blocks) completlely and you're safe. So every defense and it's perimeter is optional. Sadly you don't seem to gain anything from actually defending.
Another thing that makes it a bit stale is the ressource consumption of your Colonists. They only use the basics (food and tools) with no ill effect wether or not you improve on them.
f.e. You can technically run a metropolis on Berrymeals and stonetools. There I see an opportunity to implement some other mechanics like fighting strength bonus after a hardy a.o. blessed meal or a tool requirement for certain types of ressources á la Minecraft.

But with all my pet peeves it's still a game a definately recommend! It looks good for what it is, runs smoothly witout me having any crashes or lacks, you can be creative with your constructions, have fun while doing it and in my opinion you get your moneys worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561199143143293', 'num_games_owned': 23, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1128, 'last_played': 1662861504}
review: I love this game, but it feels linear. The game just feels so incomplete. There's really nothing like a boss that can really destroy your colony completely. Evolution is entirely up in the science tree, once you reach a certain point, there's basically no reason to go any further, you've got a huge supply of food, which is never lacking, and it just seems impossible to lose from that point on, like if there wasn't a real danger, the difficulty of the game doesn't increase, it just stays the same forever, without any bosses or anything like that. I've heard that previous updates had natural scaling, but that's been removed, No depth, no natural difficulty scaling, progression is boring, meaning there are points where there's literally no reason to progress. I really think this game has great potential, and that it should be exploited to the fullest.

author: {'steamid': '76561199004519682', 'num_games_owned': 485, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1677128227}
review:
I've come back to check out this game from time to time and it's just not a good colony sim. You don't actually command anyone. You  place a job block then recruit a colonist to do that job. The nightly defense is beyond easy (literally just dig a moat in a zig zag pattern so your defense colonists can shoot the zombies). The building aspects are a cheap Minecraft knockoff. There's no management to the game, nothing to balance. It's literally just making sure you're producing an abundance of meals before placing job blocks for new colonists and setting up the most basic killbox that exists in the colony sim genre. 

How this game has such a high rating when it's been in early access for almost 6 years is beyond me. It's like a demo for a colony sim that has potential but it's over half a decade old. There is nothing here that isn't done better by the vast majority of colony sims on Steam. I paid $15 USD for this game years ago and it's still not worth $5.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997852484', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 4847, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4847, 'last_played': 1662232137}
review:
May seem silly to some folks, but I don't recommend this game until it comes out of EA. I played longer than I should have so I could 100% the cheevos but they reset them, so now I feel a bit foolish for caring about achievements and wasting time grinding all of them. So, if you like achievements, just be wary that this is the first EA game (I've played quite a few) that resets the achievements. (I like to look through my screenshots and achievements from time to time for a little nostalgia)

But 80 hours for $20 bucks? I got my money's worth. First 10-20hrs are pretty fun, but it gets dull. Exploration and setting up new colonies in other parts of the world is extremely lackluster. Trees, grass, and leaves are just a different color in other biomes...that's the only difference besides two or three other jobs you can give to your colonists in specific biomes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198864502411', 'num_games_owned': 75, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1277, 'last_played': 1709604928}
review: I love this game, but it feels to linear. there's like no depth with anything in this game, the way the zombies scale, is just really easy. there's no real threat in this game. the progression is entirely in the science tree, once you hit a certain point, there's basically no reason to go any further. you're completely self sustainable, and its just boring, because there's no natural difficulty scaling, no bosses, challenges, or progression, you just build and build, or climb the science tree, which, is kinda lame. I heard that previous updates had natural scaling, but that got taken out, so I'm kinda just like :/ No depth, no natural difficulty scaling, progression is boring, aka there's points where there's literally no reason to progress. I think this game needs a progression overhaul, cause rn its lacking massively.

author: {'steamid': '76561199009137771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 882, 'last_played': 1706200931}
review:
Colony Survival is a truly exceptional game that offers an unmatched blend of strategy, survival, and base building gameplay. From the moment you start playing, you'll be captivated by the stunning graphics and attention to detail in every aspect of the game. The gameplay itself is challenging, yet satisfying, as you work to build and maintain a thriving colony. You'll have to gather resources, construct buildings, and fend off enemies to keep your colony thriving. The AI in the game is top-notch, and the enemy waves become progressively more difficult as you progress through the game, keeping things interesting and challenging.

The community of players is fantastic, with helpful and friendly players always available to offer advice and support. The development team is equally impressive, with a dedication to improving the game and constantly adding new features and content. Whether you're a fan of strategy, survival, or base building games, you'll find something to love in Colony Survival.

if you're looking for a game that will keep you entertained for hours on end, look no further than Colony Survival. With its unique blend of gameplay elements, stunning graphics, and fantastic community, it's the perfect choice for any gamer looking for an immersive and enjoyable experience. Highly recommend

author: {'steamid': '76561198137491730', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 5168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1736, 'last_played': 1706295607}
review:
Here is my honest review for Colony Survival

The overall game progression is pretty smooth but there is a steep learning curve when you get past the caveman ungabunga  stage, zombies are unrealistic and don't have any brain cells left in their decaying body, i think this is due to the path-finding not allowing them to move freely and only travel in straight lines. This makes it a little to easy for zombies to handle, the zombies can also not drop down more than 1 block at a time so a 2 block high wall will keep them at bay.

The multiplayer is something i am yet to try but it seems easy enough to set up and the actually multiplayer mechanics can be seen from single player such as science research treaties and diplomacy between colonies.

The way the progression system works is very well thought through allowing for simple game play, the progression is done through a science tree where you will have to get resources from the stage before in order to progress, this is a way better progression system than in a game such as ark survival evolved as you can just jump ahead in ark.

There aren't really any special combat mechanics and you cant see any hand held objects, your character doesn't really have a walk animation but it does have some sound in game. Speaking about sound, there is a sound played when the player or guards get injured but not sound for zombies getting injured or idle noises. Every crafting block makes its own noise when a product is completed there which is quite a good thing to have when you have a lot of different people working.

The graphics on the game are immaculate, every block is 3D textured and most of them have really smooth textures, there is also a focus mechanic when you get close to a block which just amplifies how amazing the overall visuals are. 

The price of the game when off sale is fair as i can tell a lot of effort has gone into every single mechanic and detail of the game. I picked the game up for 10 GBP while it was on sale and it is definitely worth every penny.

I am going to give this game quite a high review as it is in early access and nearing the end of it. 

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197993501310', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2501, 'last_played': 1630836254}

author: {'steamid': '76561197983835657', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 497, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1674943202}
review:
Игра не удалась. По сути это не выживалка и даже не симулятор колонии. Это клон Майнкрафта. Только ванильного Майнкрафта и сильно кастрированного. Весь игровой процесс состоит в постройке корявенького замка своей мечты, вяло отбиваясь на автопилоте от унылых зомбей. Если бы вы купили Майнкрафт - у вас был бы продуманный, очень красивый и разнообразный мир. Тут его нет. Так, простенький унылый и абсолютно пустой мирок. У вас было бы масса блоков для реализации своей мечты. А с модами всё это улучшилось бы на порядок. Здесь этого нет. Очень скудный набор, блоки примитивны, моды почти никакой помощи не оказывают. В Майнкрафте вы поставили бы ретекстур по своей душе и шейдеры, делающие мир вокруг живым. Здесь можете об этом забыть и с подозрением смотреть на воду, пытаясь понять можно туда спрыгнуть или это песок такой. В Майнкрафте вы могли бы поставить группу модов Май колониес и получить симулятор колонии. Настоящий, очень продуманный, глобальный. Здесь ... так. Если очень хорошо пофантазировать ,сойдёт за сим. В Майнкрафте вы можете устроить себе такое выживание, что морковку рвать на огороде будете с осторожностью. И лекарства с едой тщательно подбирать. Здесь - нарисовать лабиринт, поставить несколько болванчиков и на этом выживание закончится.
В общем если хотите иногда чуть-чуть повозиться с постройкой базы, потупить для души - игру можно взять. Со скидкой. Побольше! Если вы хотите полноценную игру - это точно не она. Просто очередное паразитирование на Майнкрафте.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009064701', 'num_games_owned': 639, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 21900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19974, 'last_played': 1682782437}
review:
This is an incredibly addictive game. Whether you love base building, zombie survival, minecraft like worlds, or exploration this has something for you. I got this game in 2018 and have seen the game continuously improved and added to by the developers. I have been part of some of the beta testing and answered many surveys to help the developers. Because of this, I've seen many examples of the communities feedback having a big impact on the games development which feels very rewarding.

I already have 300+ hours into the game and in that time I have created many colonies, some that have fallen to the zombie menace and others that have become a massive metropolis with thousands of colonists.

I've never found an first person game that lets you manage so many thousands of colonists and in such an enjoyable way. The other thing that astounds me is this is quite a beautiful game, especially when you set the graphics to max, the draw distance, shadows and textures are all impressive and even with all this and thousands of colonists I am able to run it with a high stable FPS.

Really recommend this game and can't wait to see what comes next for the game!

review: The game feels like managing a village in minecraft but with a much tighter focus on the city's progression and less on survival elements. The systems are pretty easy to understand and the balance is good to be low-stress in the early game when you're still figuring out what you want to do and then ramp up later in the game. Most importantly the devs are always moving forward with the game and are very open about what they're doing with it. I'd say the game is definitely worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198365703194', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1240, 'last_played': 1623421686}
review:
总体来说，性价比不高。40我愿意，70太贵了

一开始玩会比较有新鲜感和趣味，玩几天就不太想碰了。

游戏节奏偏慢，没什么工具给你加快建造速度，内容有点单一重复，没有陪你一起玩的好朋友的话会玩的特别累
（  而且屁民有时候会智商下线，你要管食物管屁民数量管僵尸管早夜晚的守卫管科技管房子管屁民与工作区域距离。
屁民吃得多，去工作区域时的路太远的话，夕阳的时候他到了地方然而又回家睡觉了，不干活还吃一堆!!!  
我感觉他们才是皇帝，我才是屁民:)   ）

可用于建筑的方块比较少，不能像Minecraft按shift依附边缘，所以建大建筑有点痛苦。


从b站2017年左右看“逆风笑”玩到现在等5年了吧，希望能快点玩到完善的游戏
————————————————————

关于mod

上次玩是前年

有个屁民24小时工作的mod，

我特别满意，

007是福报，

为我工作为王国贡献自我，这不是莫大的荣幸？

希望下次更新为床不用建就能招屁民，

觉都不睡了还要什么床？

希望下下次食物都不吃，

现在为王国节省食物，

等王国壮大起来你和你子子孙孙就能吃上无尽的粮食

author: {'steamid': '76561198107763063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1672994157}
review:
我购买前浅浅看了一下评论，好评颇多，结果上手后发现，游戏节奏太慢了。
。
说和mc相似吧，玩家自己却不能进行物品的制作，导致玩家能做的事情其实选项很少，玩家也没有增加开采效率的装备。
。
我游戏5小时4个半小时在锄大地，土壤矿石锄得还很慢，地上包着一层叶子卵用没有，真拿叶子造房子那颜色乱的一匹看得眼睛疼，由于不能主动制作物品，只能调整npc制作，但是又真的懒得去仔细改繁琐的制作顺序等等，实际导致科技解锁并不快。
。
npc们就算人多了，没有任何音效，围着一堆人就看着他们面无表情不发声音的工作，实在也是一种精神污染，由于这个原因玩起来反而有一种孤独感。这种游戏性第一人称真的有点累。
。
假设可以驱动npc挖地块就好了，可能一切都会更好。
。
虽然感谢汉化者的努力，但我现在进入游戏实际就是纯英文，创建世界时也勾选了创意工坊mod可能是因为更新失效了，虽然我觉得自己搞用词玩梗没什么，但之前官方还搭过线，又有点让我质疑官方有没有进行语言支持的意愿。文本量这么少，实话说文本显示ui已经丑的到底了，根本也不用在乎ui兼容问题，套个机翻可能都行。。。这，到现在还是没有实际的语言支持选项。

review:

The only thing i would criticise would ve the simplicity of things builders are able to build. It would ve great if you could just copy some existing building And order the builders to build a copy of it somewhere else. Maybe i just didn't notice where it Is, but if it's not here, it would be great if you could add it. Otherwise, it's a great game. 
Sorry for my bad english, MVBak

review:
This game keeps my attention for many hours. It has good progression and I like that it's not as stressful or complicated to play as other games in the same genre (i.e. I still want to play it after work).

A few years ago, the end game fizzled out a little early, but so much content has been added since then that I'm hopeful for a longer playthrough this time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095724331', 'num_games_owned': 260, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 4750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2495, 'last_played': 1711140657}
review:
Ne paye pas de mine graphiquement mais comme souvent, le gameplay compense.

Combo Tower Defense / Craft / Gestion plutôt réussi surtout depuis la MAJ 0.9 qui a totalement redéfinit le contenu. Les colonies deviennent nécessaires et sympa à gérer.

Seul reproche : les nuits sont un peu longue faute d'actions à y réaliser. Ce serait bien d'avoir un système pour définir les péons en service jour/nuit histoire de répartir leur production et ne pas juste "attendre" l'aube. Donc pour l'heure : faites vous un stock pour pouvoir construire la nuit sinon ZzzzZZZzzz ;) .

Conseil pour débutant : faites rapidement une enceinte même en bois. Si vous canalisez les zombies sur une seule entrée, pas besoin de mettre beaucoup de garde et en attendant de faire un labyrinthe plus élaboré, ça vous suffira à survivre et vous développer sereinement.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041863115', 'num_games_owned': 1349, 'num_reviews': 183, 'playtime_forever': 3408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3359, 'last_played': 1672513128}
review:
[h1]This is a (rare) early access example of devs NOT knowing when to STOP, polish what they have and release the game. [/h1] My other example is Fortresscraft Evolved, only CS is  SO MUCH worse. I rarely give early access games a negative review. You know, because i can read and understand that a game is not finished. That's the deal. And especially not ones i have 50+ hours in. 
[h1]But this game was finished and at it's best (minus some polishing) about 2 versions ago. This amazing, charming game has been actively "patched" into a tedious, cumbersome CRAP GAME![/h1] See end of review for a "fix".

They keep on changing everything.[b] Every new "big patch" now is the worst version the game ever was. Not in balance or bugs (it's early access), but in it's actual (changed) core features and (changed) concept.[/b] In every single patch in recent time their aim seems to be to make the game MORE cumbersome, MORE tedious, MORE grindy. Everything that "helps" this target is "improved", everything that  was fun or creative (how awful!!) is changed/flatout removed.

So it's not just the grind. There are mods for that. No, the core mechanics are actively changed to make everything take absolute ages, and extremly irritating to use.[b] Now in 0.90 especially by removing all direct control and force-routing everything thorugh the (incredibly cumbersome, slow and messy!) indirect colonists job management system. [/b]

Imagine Factorio (sorry for the insult), only you can't craft in your inventory at all BUT with the alternative automation mechanics being much, MUCH worse. 

[h3]You can select and play a MUCH better and much more fun and creative version of the game, chosing earlier versions in the beta tab (game properties on steam) . I would recommend using 0.7 at highest. . When the achievable aim was a big, impressive colony, not tedious micro management of frustrating and bad mechanics.[b] And your colonists didn't literally  starve because they refused to eat  available bread without honey....My favourite "STOP devs, you're DONE!" sign btw.[/b]  [/h3]

author: {'steamid': '76561199256219319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 968, 'last_played': 1710933035}

review:
Very good game that is very fun both solo and multiplayer. Love the constant updates, and will definitely be seeing this game through to 100%!

There is a lot of content once you get past the first few days, which they've since made easier to survive after this most recent update. Pretty sure the zombies used to spawn after your first villager, but now it's about research, so you are able to build up a decent colony before starting the zombie nights.

It is worth getting for sure!

author: {'steamid': '76561198119272717', 'num_games_owned': 72, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 106947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 8855, 'playtime_at_review': 47150, 'last_played': 1712449696}
review: I have owned this game for many years,  I played earlier versions and loved playing them, but then I came in and was able to do the testing when they went to 9.0  I was amazed at the difference and how much more fun it was.  The Dev team really talk to you on the discord unlike other games where their names are there and they never talk.  And they Listen I mean really listen.  They are interested in what you have to say.  This I think makes the game itself even better.   During my playtime on 9.0 I built a very large colony.  The Devs now use that for their splash screen.   I was honored that they picked my build for it!  I LOVE how they cleared the achievements from the old versions and created new one for ver 9.0.  So many other games don't do this and you have nothing to work towards when they upgrade.  I just think it is wonderful and it feels like a brand new game.  I love where they make it easy to change up your play styles.  Cheats or no Cheats mods or no Mods.   Everyone can play it the way they want and just be happy!  So Merry Christmas Pipliz and Zun!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999784951', 'num_games_owned': 681, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 6235, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1252, 'last_played': 1702233162}
review:
énorme découverte pour ma part ! 

Pour la faire courte c'est MInecraft qui rencontre un City builder et un Tower Defense ! 

Vous devez protéger à tout prix votre drapeau, pour cela vous aurez l'aide de gueux qui vont travailler pour vous et faire tous les jobs les plus ingrats, vous êtes un chef d'orchestre et votre rôle principale sera de les protéger lors de la nuit tombée car des zombies vont tout faire pour manger vos gueux et votre drapeau!

Le coté craft et récolte de ressources est réellement minimaliste depuis la 0.9, ne vous attendez pas à jouer à Minecraft ( même si il est possible d'utiliser un texture pack via les mods ) le gameplay tourne principalement sur la logistique de votre base et de construire un château impénétrable pour votre royaume!

Vraiment tès chill, c'est un jeu que je recommande pour les amoureux de ces trois genres.
évidemment la coop est un gros plus! :)

author: {'steamid': '76561199303399123', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 720, 'last_played': 1671835599}
review:
You need to lower Shader Quality to make grass and water not good to look at, but actually BEARABLE to look at. This is not early access, it's not even alpha, this is a PROTOTYPE GAME that does not deserve its current price 15 euros. I don't know about the game before the update, so I can't compare. But this is bad, really bad...

Colony Survival is the stone age of Minecraft.

If you actually want to play a better version of Minecraft, play Vintage Story, it's hundred times better than Minecraft, and thousand times better than this.

Oh, and one more thing. If you still want to buy this game, I suggest that you test it within 2 hours, because otherwise you won't be able to get a refund.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100778274', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 6668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6383, 'last_played': 1698447285}
review: I wish I could give a in between recommendation for this game. I mean I like the game and enjoy it. But there are issues I have found in the game and hope for them to be either edited or fixed. It has been 22 months since the last update for the game but when a game is in Early Access I don't expected it to have a easy time. I have been reading the posts they have been doing here about what they are working on and understand why it's taking so much longer on this update. They pretty much have had to scrap most of the coding to change it to be how they believe the game should be. They also play and test the game and use that to build upon the game play. They do have a Beta branch for the game so people can check out what they have done so far to the game in a not as polished end result as they give us in the official updates. I somewhat understand that they feel they should have a price increase but I also find it should wait till the game is no longer in Early Access as to not push away future buyers. Many people don't feel the game is worth the price it is now and raising it more will make them go and do what they can to stop others from spending the money on the game in the future. I also believe that we should wait to see the response to the update and any future plans before doing something drastic in such away.

review: This game takes resource-chain production and marries it with a smidge of tower defense, minecraft-esque building, and dwarf fortress/oxygen not included vibes. You set up jobs and your colonists carry them out. You also can command colonists to build/destroy large swaths of area, so you're not the only one who can do some building or mining. Each night the zombies attack, so you have to keep your defenses manned and ammunition stocked. This game is truly addicting and I highly recommend it! Devs are still active and a large update is coming soon as of this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561198873766821', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 8277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8200, 'last_played': 1683910200}
review:
Introduction:
Colony Survival is a solid game. I've followed it since its early beginnings on youtube and have owned the game for several years now, and for those from back then, remember the bread crate?

The Devs:
Anyway, Colony survival has very dedicated devs who are currently in the process of revamping the game from the ground up to make it as immersive and detailed as possible. You can always count on them for updates of content and information. 

The Game:
The game itself is very fun with you building a colony of people from the ground up with three objectives in mind. 1.) Innovate - You'll have access to a detailed and progressive tech tree to advance down. 2,) Defend - You'll have to face off against waves of monsters every night using varying defensive structures of your design along with a combination of men at arms and traps (Unless you play peaceful). 3.) Survive - In your coarse of development you'll have to deal with neigh inevitable monster breaches and unaccounted famines. So tell me, will you, your colony, survive? 

Online:
Also, you can play online with friends, or strangers. Whichever fits you better, though I haven't ever tried online so I can't tell you how good/bad it is.

My Rating:
It's a solid 9/10 game for me, and if you like citybuilders, then you should buy it. As you can see its hours of fun.
Thanks for reading, I hope this was useful.
