author: {'steamid': '76561198083045446', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 6015, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1954, 'last_played': 1701259845}
review:
The game is strangely addictive. There is a learning curve, the building and digging can seem grindy at first, but you need to push through to the digger and builder tech, that automates all those tasks for you. 
Build main colony, explore and set up new ones. There is plenty for you to spend your time with, let your creativity loose and build as you fancy. 
I hope the dev keeps working on this and new features are added.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026483938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 4163, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3087, 'last_played': 1664908790}
review:
Alright story for context to my assessment and quick overview of the game.
 I'm currently at a max colony size of 100 people which is 4 out of 30 upgrade steps in that catagory. and i'm playing with no day monsters and normal night monsters, i've averaged 4 people on guard duty day and night just to be safe as day time doesn't make the exsisting monsters that've spawned disappear. the controls for the avatar are fairly simple and easy to understand, placing the AI can be a little tricky with some of the jobs. The Guard jobs targeting algorthyms are excellent having witnessed my strongest guard type not attack his previous target instead attacking a healthier enemy leaving his previous target to be finished off by another weaker guard a few seconds later who had been reloading, and the first guard had LOS the entire time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024448288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 45946, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14260, 'last_played': 1709588889}
review:
As a co-op game it's a great time to spend with friends. Playing together with friends really brings out the creative side, instead of focusing on min-maxing and it is cool to see people's different building styles. It is quite relaxing to play as well, so it is easy to talk with your friends without being interrupted by the game.

My issue with the single player is that I often lose focus with my colonies (although I have one really impressive save). This game shines when you are able to really grow your colony: not just making them large but also pretty. Getting to 1000+ colonists isn't hard, but doing so in a base that's pretty is a lot more fun and a larger challenge.

author: {'steamid': '76561199152608598', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 16272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2692, 'last_played': 1674164891}
review:
** Updated Review For December 2022 **

What.. an.. update..

Sirs you have one thing right the minute you load up the game!

'This could have been Colony Survival 2'

So I dragged my friend away from his Christmas dinner and said!

'Dude this game we played a few years ago for months straight has just added a FEW new things..'

Oh how very much I underestimated a 'FEW'.

Pros,

I don't even know how to define this game any more? Survival? Simulator? Management? God Simulator? Flood Simulator? To be honest it is all of the above and more.
The amount of new tech's added on top of what already was a vast amount, it is so in depth now with so many more cogs churning the insatiable lust for more DUDES, even more so with so many achievements added, more goals, more guys, more DIRT.
On top of the new tech's we have new biome's, new monster variants, hundreds of new items, tons of new jobs and so many more ways to uniquely define your colony's defence and what they stand for.
Where the game truly shines is the developers, their clear care and attention to detail on this labour of love is what separates this game from others in the same over-flooded genre.

I am so sick of this genre like so many others, but these guys didn't sell out like Mojang, they didn't go weird like CMZ, they stuck to what they know we wanted, listened to their fans and have produced such an incredible update that I am simply blown away and can't get enough.

But there are faults, well less faults and more suggestions that me and my friend have been nattering about.

Cons,

Some of the achievements as of 26/12/22 are rather bugged, I think about 5 of mine which I have completed will not come through which is sad when others are, hopefully a future update will rectify this and not mean I have to restart a 20+ hour world.
This is a personal gripe more than anything, I wish water was a little less realistic and spread a little slower, because my GOD flooding 30+ levels was NOT fun.
I do think that there should be the option to tune what guards attack what type of creature now, meaning I could have different types of guard out rather than just spamming one large group of one type of guard.
More server settings would also be nice, perhaps even the option to convert older world's to the new format,  but I know this is a little much to ask.
Alerts for when you are low on an item would also be a really nice update, just so we get a little optional ping when the 'volunteer workforce' eat through all of my chicken meals.
Some of the AI pathing is a little messy still, but I think this is just an issue as you get more guys, at the end of the day the coding is a marvel and I cannot imagine how complex the code is for 500+ guys to do different things all at once.

But NONE of those things directly affect gameplay to the point where it bothers you overly.

What the team has pulled off here is incredible and I look forward to future projects but also more updates for this game, fine tuning what is already here but there is still SO MUCH potential which is what keeps this game alive and being worth a buy at any price in all honesty.

With the developers RIGHTFULLY upping the price soon, pick up a copy and get stuck in for a few hundred levels.

PS,

Dev team if you read this, UNLOCK MY ACHIEVEMENTS <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198998219550', 'num_games_owned': 29, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 9996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 138, 'playtime_at_review': 3746, 'last_played': 1711656073}

author: {'steamid': '76561198058734736', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1624021024}
review:
Had quite a bit of fun with a friend when I received this yesterday, but hours later I honestly feel the game has just gotten worse with hardly any additional content.

Nearly every minute, the game released a new job talking about the work a colonist needs to do, and it's generally a whole lot of crap with very little being done.

Of course, multiplayer, the only saving grace, is still kind of broken, seeing as once a certain amount of playtime is reached, all fun will teleport out randomly for everyone but the people enjoying it, meaning large-scale creative projects with friends are completely out.

It's kind of a rudimentary brain dead sim mixed with the worst elements of an early access game, and it had some promise, but even if I think it could eventually reach a "fun" state, I can't even find it in myself to support my friends anymore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198931286318', 'num_games_owned': 70, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 4370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3290, 'last_played': 1675111360}
review:
So this game is good but it is far from perfect. You build your own colony and you are trying to survive. Building in this game is awasome and your creativity is the limit. This game is hard at the beggining even on easy mode. One thing I really hate is monsters. They serve no purpouse then to spicy chilly. It is one of the games most important thing but i turn them off becouse they are just anoying. What I enjoy is the building and managing the colony. I also like the reasearche. This game has great multiplayer. I really enjoy role playing with my friends in this game. The fun we out with was great.

+ Building
+ Managing colony
+ Multiplayer
+ Catchy gameplay

- Monsters
- Way too hard

My suggestion is to nerf monsters and give them drops which you can use in crafting. Over all a good game to play with friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561199041049061', 'num_games_owned': 45, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1258, 'last_played': 1645025995}
review:
Игра неплохая, но есть некоторые минусы. Один из них плохой перевод не всё переведено и некоторые места криво, сам допиливал перевод однако 2 раза зафейлил всё. В первый раз я скопировал перевод на англиский и делал там а оно почему то не захотело так работать, а во второй раз случайно откатил файл в итоге -часа 2-3. В плане оптимизации всё тоже хромает что очень печально. Сама игра интересная но может быстро надоесть.

Изменено: Я потратил ещё 1 час на то что бы повторно перевести всё и исправить но вот проблема, этот файл не хочет работать... По всей видимости где то не вмещается текст и поэтому ломает весь файл, разбираться в этом я уже не буду.

author: {'steamid': '76561199136224212', 'num_games_owned': 87, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 13158, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 48, 'playtime_at_review': 831, 'last_played': 1711885667}
review:
2021 год 9 июня: Я хочу сказать, что игра очень хороша! Можно строить свои государства, есть туториал, легко понять механику игры! Есть ветвь исследований, что добавляет контент! Вообщем, кому нравиться строить, развиваться, исследовать, то эта игра для вас!
2023 год 1 июля, да спустя 2 года с лишним, я решил написать продолжение обзора на последнюю версию игры с новой системой аванпостов и биомов в версии игры 0.9.0! Скажу так, система делает что бы ты не бегал на огромные расстояния как это было в системе новых биомов в версии игры 0.7.0! Ваши аванпосты будут располагаться рядом с основной колонией. Так же новая система обороны вашего поселения, в виде ловушек, новых охранников, новых мобов. Так же не рекомендую использовать читы, по типу свободного полета или лута, иначе вы отключите свои достижения стим, и не сможете их заработать. Лучше пройти игру на все достижения, а потом свободно летать!) Так же если будут подобные масштабные обновления на игру, я буду продолжать свой обзор на нее! Всем удачки :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198130253273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 882, 'last_played': 1623849823}
review:
俺の作った集落に住まわせてやるから働けｵﾗｧ！！！ってゲーム。

クソ弱エネミーが夜に集まってくるのだが住民もクソ弱なので注意だ。
集落がハッテンしてくると建築しかすることがない。

だがこのゲームの良い点は《俺の作った最強の建築物に住民が寝泊りしたり職場にしたりする》ことだ！
ウフフ！ほら！ここにベッド置くからね！キミの職場に近いところに家を建てたよ！
ほら！ねぇ！！！ﾌﾋｯ！！ﾌﾋﾋｯ！！！！ほらぁ！便利でしょぉぉぉおお！！俺が作ったこのくぁw背dｒｆｔｇｙふじこｌｐ；＠：「」

ステキな俺様建築で働く愚民どもを眺めるのが好きなら買いだ。
マイクラ的建築が苦手だったり楽しく感じられない人には圧倒的に向かないかもしれない。

author: {'steamid': '76561197968346189', 'num_games_owned': 795, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 1095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 336, 'last_played': 1623601480}
review:
The game needs a lot of depth. The game makes sense when you have cheats on and are flying around, because you yourself do not actually do much. It is more of an automation game. 

With out a fast forward button I feel there is a lot of waiting around. 

As a "tower defense" it is very low excitement or strategy, the zombies just line up the same route every day. They only gain health for different zombie types.

review: This game is amazing, in this game you start a colony you have to manage your food and supplying in order to survive you need to get more resources in order to expand you colony and get more people but be careful as when you expand more zombies come each night so you better be prepared, this game has an amazing survival experience its simple and fun this game has at least 20 hours of game play but could have unlimited because there really isn't a end point, this game is worth the money and I rate it a 10/10 game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993616665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 3089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3074, 'last_played': 1672430130}
review:
This game is a hugely fun combination of Minecraft, tower defence, and town management. You build defences (mazes, walls, etc) with the Minecraft mechanics and station guards at the entrances and overlooking your death maze. Meanwhile you're balancing assigning your citizens to various roles which they carry out during the day mostly autonomously

Where it really started to shine for me was when you could lay our block building areas, and assign your citizens to build them automatically. At that point this game became "Use your workers to create the most ostentatious castle possible, and then watch them work from on high"

If that pitch interested you, and you don't mind an obtuse control system and a not totally complete game, it's fantastic for what it is

author: {'steamid': '76561198048631115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 3478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2537, 'last_played': 1624672913}
review:
Had quite a bit of fun with a friend when this came out, but years later I honestly feel the game has just gotten worse with hardly any additional content.

Nearly every week, the developer's release a post talking about their work on the game, and it's generally a whole lot of words with very little being said.

Of course, multiplayer, the only saving grace, is still kind of broken, seeing as once a certain number of villager/monster spawns are reached, all entities will teleport around randomly for everyone but the host, meaning large-scale creative projects are completely out.

It's kind of a rudimentary factorio mixed with sandbox elements, and it had some promise, but even if I think it could eventually reach a "finished" state, I can't even find it in myself to support the developers anymore.

review: In my opinion I love playing this game , I always play this game in my free time and I hope that they add more stuff like some vikings to the north that attacks every 10 days in the morning (You guys comment how many enemies are gonna attack.) Then they have axes and then when we unlock the matchlocks the vikings become pirates that uses blunderbusses and swords and this time they attack every 15 days and I really like we should have a storyline so that we can have lore behind the colonists against the zombies. I am looking to see more  so that we have much more of a challenge and I would really like further expansion to the guns and add like flintlocks, muskets and halberds and I see much more potential in this game and I'll be looking forward to the updates of the devs. And I'll make more rviews of the game soon ;)

review:
Has so much potential, but developers only overhaul things rather than add things to the game. Due to this the game looks almost identical to it's older days even if almost 4 years have passed. It's always nice to update things if they need to be, but the game becomes stale far too quickly.

Here is some things that could be update but the community ignores: villagers feel lifeless, the grind is real and boring, the enemy diversity is horrible and lacking, no transportation of any kind, etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054324372', 'num_games_owned': 539, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 259, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1621365120}
review:
it's so slow, boring and badly designed.

Bad bits of gameplay:
Siege mode just increases food consumption and it glitches on and off often.
Having nearly everyone as food gatherers doesn't increase the food supply for days. 
Can't assign workers to specific role locations.
Wheat farming often leaves workers idle while it grows making them useless temporarily. (This ties into the previous comment because if 1 wheat farmer worked multiple farms, it'd be much more sensible).
Night time is boring.

UI:
The Main UI and interaction system isn't very good.
The UI for handling jobs isn't in alphabetical order which makes it slow to use.

Other notes
People keep comparing this game to minecraft. It's not because it's a different style of game. It's just built in a similar way.
The thing is though, the bits that are inspired by minecraft are the only good bits. Building and the world generation. 
Otherwise, it's just a boring game.

I just realised how mean this review is so...

The good:
The concept is nice and the villagers do their jobs.
It's alright visually. The noise on the normal maps should be lowered for the textures though because it's just... noisy.
Pathing by lots of units doesn't seem to affect performance too badly which is nice, a bit of deviation would be good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198930946206', 'num_games_owned': 26, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 695, 'last_played': 1680320159}
review: 2017년엔 확실히 재미가있었다 연구도 다양 시민늘리기가쉽고 재미도있었다 근데 2021년 지금은 똥망겜이다 절대 추천하지않는다  주민포인트같은것이 생겨서 주민한명뽑을라면 8정도를소모해야돼는데 모으기도 쉽지않다 그리고 화살이랑 화살탄약도 만들기 드릅게 복잡하다 한 4개정도의 일자리 수준인데 위에서 말한것처럼 주민뽑기가 하늘에 별따기다 그리고 연구도 드릅게많다 차라리 2018년정도가 연구도많고 주민도 쫙쫙뽑아서 자신만에 제국을만들수있었던거처럼 롤백좀해줘라 ㅈㅂ 개 ㄵ됐다 초보자들도 입문하기가 싑지않다.. 절대 추천하지않는다

author: {'steamid': '76561198082554971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 5735, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3835, 'last_played': 1673810755}
review:
i would have liked the game go in a diffrent direction then its heading to

i would rate this game a lesser minecraft

to be fair the dev is active kinda and the game gets updatet over the months

its the devs focus on where the game develops that i disslike 

this could be a fun and interesting mediveal game where you are the leader taking up on the task to make your own empire great but the devs do an poorly job on that instead it is idle yourself while a very static tribe of npc picks up berrys and watches wheat to grow

the game is out for what feels like a decade and still much lesser then early minecraft and i have seen devs recreate that on yt in a month 

the game basicly plays as tower defence game where your created kingdome gets invaded by zombies and you defend it with employed soldairs
over the game you research better weapons to help defending thats it ! thats the whole game so you as player aint needed

the graphic
is minecraft with lots of shader mods installed 

the building
is not as good as minecraft and less animated i know its high critism here to say in minecraft i feel my character building and here i do not it just insta places things in minecraft i see my character swing the pickaxe to mine here i see a progress bar
yeah you can research ai building but the buildings ai can come up with is just plain so eye candy buildings are playermade

the pvp
only player interaction no real kingdome fights more a coop game

the world
is boring you dont need to explore anything every place is as good as the other there are no caves no dungeons to explore
and theirby here would be so much potential for the game to find a niche minecraft cannot reach
imagine leading a group of npc into a goblin/orc/whatever village creating sieges and fight kingdome vs kindome
bigger enemy castles could lead attacks on your kingdome for the ai kingdoms could expand over time the sad truth the game does not go this direction only more techs more techs hey gus we have new techs 

i dont care about techs as much as you want to add or how much simple text numbers get reworked if the game is idle and boring as it is 

also their are gamebreaking bugs never gotten fixed just google the water flooded my whole mine issue
as it feels now the game is treated as more or less abondend money grab

review:
This game has the potential to be an incredible game. But for me there's just not enough, the villagers don't feel alive whatsoever, literally just a tool for automation, and the enemies are as bare bones as they come, not a fan. There also isn't a lot of material or shape variety in the blocks either which really limits things when it comes to building. You'd be best off playing Minecraft, finding an NPC village and making it your own little by little, way more content there.

 I just can't recommend this game yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198355827056', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 757, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1610748852}
review:
I put a little time into this game, and even played multiplayer. I have to say after a while, its no longer fun because all you do is run around micromanaging everyone to do things. Pawns or colonists will stand at their work station and if there is no supplies to build, they will just sit there trying to build. No attempt to do other things. I get everyone has a dedicated task, but after hours of play, it gets a little annoying to have to constantly make rounds to check on everyone. Its like being a kindergarten teacher heard little kids around with broken toys. 

Its fun for the first few hours, as you are a small colony, cause you can go out and explore a bit, but once you get a large colony, you can kiss your free time goodbye, you become a micromanager and its not even fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075306853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 1644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1330, 'last_played': 1618091845}
review:
I like this game, but also I'm a bit disappointed. I think it's a good concept, but it could be a lot more.


Tower Defense

The zombie attacks are more annoying than challenging. All you gotta do is build a labyrinth route around a few soldiers. And yeah the waves get stronger, but they don't need a different approach. It's like tower defense in god mode.

How could it be better?

If you build a TD combat system get some inspiration from other good TD games. In Colony Survival, there are no area effects attacks, no slowers, poison, traps and there is no restriction in how you can build the route. 

It would be even more fun, if zombies could find other ways. They could climb walls, fly, damage your buildings, or create clocks to climb onto. This would force the player to make a more functional castle, and not just a bottleneck gate with all the guards. 
It would also be great if raids wouldn't come evenly. Unlocking new science for example could unleash a huge wave that you need to pay attention to, reorganise your defenses, and rebuild after.

I just turned off the zombies, because this system is boring.


Explore the World

You could wander around to a new tree texture in another biome, but why would you, if you can build the same colony anywhere!? The environment should affect how your colony works. How about having difference in what you could grow, and how it yields in different biomes? Or what ores you have access to? This would make it more interesting how colonies interact.

I just started somewhere with a good view, but nothing else is affected by the environment and the world.


Colony Building

There is no requirement for functional building. The colonists' well being is determined by food, but you can just pile up their beds in the middle of the forest next to their workstations.

I think living or working in a building, the building material quality, or decorations could improve happiness (like in ECO).

Building is the most fun part of the game, but I keep doing it completely for my own amusement. The colonists provide a good excuse to expand the colony with new buildings.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985037543', 'num_games_owned': 1460, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 4364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1690297984}
review:
This game is way more fun than i expected, and way more chill
The games difficulty (Zombies) scale based upon your number of colonists, so you decide how big the waves are gonna get. Also you can assign your colonists to almost any labor you want (mining, digging, farming, building), so its really up to you how much effort you wanna put into tower defense/base designing/colony management. All in a good pace. The only thing that may be a bit lackluster is the tutorial, which is just 5 short pages of text. but all in all, very enjoyable!

author: {'steamid': '76561198037631550', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 13390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 13389, 'last_played': 1711911259}
review:
holy shit this game is amazing! i have never played any minecraft or minecraft clone, but this was correctly advertised to me as a super fun tower defense-ish game where you are getting other nerds to play minecraft for you! i am in the midst of building a mega castle that overlooks the mega-agracultrual-towers, and i have all my archers lined up to knock out any would be no gooders! really fun game!

EDIT: this game has grown so much since i began playing it and it just keeps getting better and better. Cloud saves let me take my most recent colony i began on steam deck to my main PC and its flat out gorgeous now with the updated water and lighting effects. there is a sort of mist that appears in the early mornings and clears thruout the day and when i stand on top of a really tall mountain top or tower with the draw distance maxed out I can see basically all of my outposts and it sort of makes me proud of how large my colony has grown. honestly one of the best games ive ever played 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198858515735', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1669845650}
review: The game is awesome, the only thing I hate is how the colonists should run from the zombies, not stand there like an idiot or watch your friend be mauled by a zombie. But overall it's a really good game. It's like Minecraft, but this time you can actually manage the colonists and tell them what to do. You make them farm so they all have food, make them gather resources for you to build with or for them to craft with, you make them a guard post for them to shoot zombies on and protect the colonists, and you build an epic base with big walls around it. I recommend this game because it's a really good game with a lot of potential and it's really fun to watch the colonists go to work. Make sure you keep the slaves- I mean paid workers in check and fed. heheh.

review: It's cool that you can have the world builder and exploration (and crafting & technology) aspects of games like minecraft without so much of the micromanagement. The ability to hire colonists to do things that would otherwise take hours is awesome and super convenient. It makes creating megastructures something I'd actually consider doing now lol. The fact that the creators are continuously updating this game gives it a ton of replayability.

author: {'steamid': '76561199008333594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2224, 'last_played': 1709394694}

author: {'steamid': '76561198151330778', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 12566, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3041, 'last_played': 1694453312}
review:
Brilliant game, to be honest. The game's been in development for what, 10 years? It's gone through several remakes. And somehow stayed out of development hell; this game is well made.
The performance is insanely good. Let's compare it to minecraft, because it's easy to do. 
A mediocre PC can run this game with the minecraft equivalent of 64 chunks of render distance coupled with decent shaders, while simulating the pathfinding of thousands of colonists and monsters, without a hitch. The optimisation is insane and you can tell the devs have put a lot of effort into it!

The content of the game is nice. It's relaxing, and I found that managing a colony gave me the motive to build really nice structures that I could never motivate myself to make in other games. Automating your resources and to some extent your construction process helps a lot.

Your colony is at constant risk of collapse, because if too many monsters get in it's game over. Recent updates have made the game much more forgiving in this aspect, the main part being the sacred failsafe which effectively gives you a chance to wipe out the monsters and get your colony back on its feet before they return in full force again.

But this is also where my one gripe with the game lies. The devs tried to address the vicious growth cycle that used to exist in the game of [recruiting more colonists means more monsters means you need more guards and you need to grow all your supply chains to accommodate]. This was a valid issue, but I think their solution was poor. The bulk of the monster "threat level" now comes from science progressions and lockboxes (store points to allow you to get upgrades to population cap, safe zone size etc.)
But the amount of these you need is unrelated to the actual population of your colony. This means a smaller population makes the game way harder and a high enough one makes it much easier, in general. And you can just remove lockboxes when you don't need them to make the monsters mostly go away; the game's difficulty has to effectively be self enforced because you can escape it all with almost no effort.

Anyway. Relaxing. Gameplay loop is long enough to make it worth your while even on one incomplete playthrough. You can build better looking stuff than you think you can and it's also a good game to play with friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117391036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1613939727}
review:
Update: I really can't recommend this game at this point, I would say throw it on your wish list and check it out in a few years... lol but I don't think this one is going to make enough meaningful updates to become a game that gets enough funding to stay alive. Other than tweaking mechanics, as others have said, not much has changed in the many years of development and they have opted to "delay/cancel" any meaningful logistic systems and with a game that's pushing you to have a workforce of a few hundred peasants (robots) it really takes quite a bit from it. While this game could have been excellent idea, as it ages, it really just feels like a really nice mod for minecraft in a sense. 

Extended/Original Review:

The reason I can't recommend it is because of how "hollow" the game is and for the amount of years it's been in development. Its not really a colony sim either, there's just too little to do and the NPCs are extremely minimal, they have a single animation, they walk to their work station, take a break for meal, work station, sleep station. Thats it. If they were replaced with robots and a charging station instead of a bed, it would actually make sense how simple they are. 

-Its Minecraft
-NPCs provide unlimited resources, you find a single resource block, you can mine it indefinitely with NPC. 
- Storage containers are all linked together, no supply lines or moving of resources. 
- Enemies are easily directed and manipulated through a created maze in which you have 4 types of ranged attacks to take them out, very very basic tower defense. There's really no variables to make it interesting. 
-The NPCs have no needs other than a meal and a bed which can be placed anywhere. 
- A two block deep gap is all that is necessary around your base, walls are just decoration to deter the enemy. If you build a wall, they only need to be 2 blocks high. 

The rest of the game turns into decorating, there are no bonuses for pathway/roads construction, rooms or room bonuses... anything to drive the player to do anything other than slap farms and crafting stations together while keeping an eye on the increasing threat as your colony grows. 

When it comes to "colony sims" there is a lot more of the "basics" to be expected even from simple resource flow/movement would have made this game much more interesting. 

The potential is there but at its current pace, I don't think its going to ever reach its real potential.

author: {'steamid': '76561198988849673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 51189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27991, 'last_played': 1695901301}
review: Colony Survival is a type of game in which you spend hundreds of hours. The "normal" game is ready in about 20 hours, and that's it. But if you want to get all the available items, achievements and explore what's in the game, you need to take a few hundred hour-long journey in front of the computer. and if you get tired of "vanilla", you can play a multiplayer game or dozens of modes.

review:
Hallo, ich bin der Alex und ich wolte vorab  sagen dass ich streams zu dem game auf dem kanal Dragon Knight mache.

Jetzt zu Rezension, dass spiel an sich hatt eine grundlegend super idee, es gibt auch langsam jede menge kontent aber das einzige was mich persönlich stört ist die monstervielfalt es gibt wircklich viel zu wenige von denen, ein riesen zombie oder ein zombie könig währe doch super, das wir höchstwarscheinlich in der nächsten zeit nicht kommen, Und an alle die denken das dass game nich mehr programiert wird, es wird weiter gearbeitet, alle neuen infos findet ihr im fridayblog, sie arbeiten nur ein einem sehr großen update auf das ich mich schon sehr freue LG Dragon Knight

author: {'steamid': '76561198016018135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 24334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21396, 'last_played': 1672095312}
review: Wenn man bedenkt dass es immer noch ein Early-Access-Spiel ist, kann ich nur sagen: Besser als so einige fertige Spiele! Es kommen immer wieder Updates die den Spielfluss so ändern, dass sich auch ein Neubeginn lohnt. Und einmal angefangen und den Dreh halbwegs raus, macht es einfach süchtig und man vergisst die Zeit.  Ich persönlich mag die Mischung aus Aufbaustrategie, Klötzchenbau und Tower-Defense (Zombie-Angriffe) sehr. Man kann die Schwierigkeit der Zombies nach Belieben während des Spiels anpassen und entweder rein zweckmäßig oder auch sehr kreativ bauen. Alles in allem ein lohnender Kauf und auch nachdem man einmal "fertig" ist lohnt sich nach ner Weile ein neues Spiel, da es wieder genug Updates gab. Von daher ist Early-Accsess echt mal positiv und nicht wie in den meisten Speien eine Umschreibung für viele Fehler.

author: {'steamid': '76561198175815342', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 829, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 827, 'last_played': 1619871536}
review:
Game is honestly really fun, lots of things to do. Not sure if it's worth 20 bucks, but it's alright. 

The game itself is prett good, you can maybe compare it to other games like Minecraft, but it isn't really that. Build a village, have villagers work for you and build a mighty kingdom in a beautiful world. If you like the idea of that, it's pretty good :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198350709238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 17448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1857, 'last_played': 1671288360}
review:
『フレンド居ねぇから、フレンド前提のマルチプレイ系実績止めて！』　
 　お薦めしますが難点がちらほら。
　一言で言えばサンドボックス(マイクラ)と村経営シミュレーションを合体させたような難易度の低いゲーム。
　難易度は低い、というのは人によっては難点ですが僕にとっては利点でゆっくりまったり楽しむタイプなので難易度上げられたら逆に投げます。
　まあ、外敵対策をシッカリしてればですが。
　敵のルーチンがしっかりしていて拠点を目指してやってくる。
　進行ルートが無いとペナルティで村人の食事量が上がる(らしい)。
　と、言う感じですがそれゆえにキルゾーンを用意してやればソコで袋叩きにできます。てかコレできないとゾンビの量が量だから偉い事に・・・・
　つか夜のみで敵出現率最低でもかなり来る。
　まあ、雰囲気重視で防衛線張ると難しいと思います。
　あと、かなり最後までお勧めするかで『はい』と『いいえ』で迷った要素があります。
　このゲーム、先ほども言いましたが『サンドボックスと村経営シミュレーションを合体させたようなゲーム』です。
　サンドボックス系には時間を早めるコマンドが無いのは当然ですが、村や町経営シミュレーションだと標準装備と言っても過言ではありません。
　ソレが有りません。
　コロニーが育つとプレイヤーがやる事はあまりなくなり、そうなると時間経過を待って様子を見るというのが全部等倍。
　さらに昼と夜の概念があるのは良いが、今の所夜にある事は『敵が湧く(設定では昼でも湧く)』、『ソレを迎撃する』ぐらいで、夜が取っても暇！
　ベッドがあるんだから使わせろ！　と言いたくなるぐらいには暇。
　
　ココからは愚痴です。
　住民には必ずベッドが必要で職場の近くにベッドを用意したのに、ソレを違うのが使い始める。
　ベッドと住民と職業を紐づけさせてくれよ！
　防衛要員用のベッドに農家が寝てる。しかも農場遠い。
　その農場要員用ベッドに防衛要員が寝る。
　交代時間とうとうがシビアではないので良いが・・・・
　という感じですかね。
　あとは色々となんか足りてない感が凄いですが、ソコは早期アクセス故に仕方ない部分なんで今後に期待ということで。
　というか今後に期待な部分が8割ぐらいで『はい』を押した理由です。
　コレで完成とかだと間違いなく、躊躇もなく『いいえ』を押します。
　あとゲームプレイ時間30時間ですが、ソレで底が見える程度には”今”の底は浅いです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198029900145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 27265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10916, 'last_played': 1704425747}
review: Like minecraft with zombies and AI drones, very fun,  I like to build, everything is cubes, so it's a bit simplistic on the graphics side, but very very high detail blocks, so an interesting contrast.  It's a lot of fun for a casual builder but gets tedious after a while, definitely make use of builders and diggers!

review:
Day 1: oh hey look at this I found a spot for my colony, time to get building.

Day 2: okay, I have colonists, nice, oh wait zombie aaa ded

Day 3: I learnt how to make guards and farmers, cool, no more ded.

Day 4: More colonists and oh no why is the bread running low.

Day 5: More zombies, and your dead.

10/10 would recommended watching your colony crumble before you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198851689183', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 4109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 302, 'playtime_at_review': 1756, 'last_played': 1712310212}
review:
Shut just shut up already! No No No! This is not a Minecraft copy game this is very different. Does not even follow the same thing Minecraft does lore wise.

This is were you are a president of a colony or colony leader and you take care of you colony recruiting colonist, surviving against zombies as well as an extremely good path finding system.
At the moment the game is kinda like tower defense but I am sure they will fix it.

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198042353460', 'num_games_owned': 489, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1609871013}
review:
I found it to be severely lacking in features and it feels too unfinished for the price. I like the idea, but I really dislike the graphics (imo graphics are the least important in any game, but here it just puts me off) and it doesn't play intuitively. At it's current state it's a janky Minecraft with tower defense mechanics. I expected something more in the vain of Rimworld.

If the graphics don't put you off and you like the idea of a first person tower defense game with a bit of a learning curve, then give it a go. Im going to play Minecolonies instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041536466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1609733482}
review:
I think I could see a type of person who likes this game, but I imagine most people see this game in the store and think it kinda looks similar to Minecraft with taskable villagers and check it out for that reason. I just want to tell that person that this game is not that.

Basically any resource you find becomes infinite the second you tell a colonist to mine it instead of yourself. He will stand on the ore and a bar will fill and then you will get an item in your communal storage. Cool, right? Yeah, except this is how every resource is done and it kinda gets old fast. The game is min-max from the get go, and the only encouragement the game provides for any sort of artistic building is for the player's own ocd. You can look at screenshots of this game in the community to see what I mean, the game is just "how do I get the AI to do exactly what I want, in the most efficient way possible" and you build tall gross structures all of the same material to show that. No block variety and thus not that much satisfaction when you finish making a beige castle.

It just kinda lacks reason/power behind anything you do. Why am I upgrading resources and techs? Because these two-bit idiots behind me will stare at a zombie a few feet away and be shocked when it eats them. It's like the worst part about being a middle manager, your workers can't micro themselves at all. It's just kinda boring and tiring.

review: Awesome game! At first i thought it would feel like a minecraft clone, but nope, it feels like it's own original game, voxel games tend to have similarities to minecraft because they use cubes, which minecraft doesn't technically own. if i had to compare it to other games it would be like minecraft+age of empires+tower defense. Its it's own unique game and is ACTUALLY still getting updates!! so yeah, not a waste of money at all, worth it's price! as it is still In developement (it's on version 0.8) It isn't perfect as far as the looks or some UI goes, but that also doesn't distract from the gameplay

author: {'steamid': '76561198880842875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 958, 'last_played': 1697314384}
review: This game is very good, it can be a little bit hard at times and sometimes a bit stressful when like what feels like 1,000+ zombies come to your colony and kill your one day guard (r.i.p Beth the Night Guard, Bob the Berry Farmer (possibly), and Barry the Day Guard, and many other brave colonists, and yes I sometimes name colonists). However once you get the hang of it that game is really fun. The only issue I have with it is that with one of the newer updates replacing calories with meals and colony happiness with colony points, I find their is no real reason to get better food items other than getting slightly more colony points when everything requires berries to make (that and I made an entire sewer system to my colony only to learn that cooked fish don't count as meals). Also, there isn't much of a wikipedia or something telling you what a specific item does in the game (the existing wikipedia isn't very helpful and it can be hard to find stuff), it took me ten minutes to learn that a Fish Farmer and Fisherman were two different jobs. Either way, it is a good game (though it has a few flaws), and I hope it gets more attention in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133625020', 'num_games_owned': 569, 'num_reviews': 338, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1609281390}
review:
This is a very strange game that would do greatly with a sequel. I don't really care much for graphics but the sight at this game is headache inducing. It is way too bright and the minecraft trope needs to die. I love voxel graphics, but this is quite literally copying minecraft. The trees are a carbon copy. There needs to be a proper tutorial, too. The gameplay mechanics are a little odd at first, but are quite simple to pick up. $20 for this game is way too much. $5 and things would be justified. I have played far better games for less. The steam page is also very misleading in terms of gameplay. The vast majority of time spent in this game is done by group selecting blocks and waiting around for night to come. Pretty damn lame.

4/10  - Lazy, misleading, and boring.

author: {'steamid': '76561198315243415', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 5001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4400, 'last_played': 1688606775}

author: {'steamid': '76561198369857671', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1712416965}
review: Игра очень хорошая. Очень сильно напоминает Майнкрафт. Плюсы игры - её нельзя пройти (Так как нету точной цели прохождения, есть только задача - прокачиваться, а прокачиваться тут можно бесконечно), оптимизация отличная (На фулл настройках фпс ниже 55 не падает), есть мультиплеер (Я хз он рабочий или нет, но другие сервера есть), тут можно создавать несколько колоний и обмениваться между ними, долгая прокачка (Как и колонии так и рецептов с ресурсами), графика красивая но не идеальная (В будущем думаю исправят или сделают лучше), есть монстры (Добавляет интереса игре, и их можно настраивать). Теперь минусы - нету дверей (Возможно они не нужны но без них как то непривычно), нету окон (Думаю в будущем добавят), особенных зомби нету (Топово было бы если бы были какие то особенные зомби, а то тут получается защита базы в жанре товер дефенс что является главным минусом), нету инструментов для игрока (Просто руками еб0шишь и вот тебе инструменты, чувствую себя Халком), мало видов защиты (Было бы топ если было к примеру катапульта ну или какие то мощные постройки для обороны). Моя личная оценка 8/10. Игра ещё в раннем доступе по этому судить её строго - тупо. Разработчик старается и это видно. Цена в 400р большая, было бы норм хотя бы за 250 её продавать ибо дорогая слишком.

author: {'steamid': '76561198332846233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 945, 'last_played': 1676240147}
review:
Edit: I found out that you can, actually, use weapons. I was made aware of this via the community.

This game is heavy in development and I am in love with it! I've been making notes and ideas for a game that I have been wanting to put together for a while now, and this game is very similar to what I've been interested in making. The concept is to build a home for a colony and manage resources in order to survive nights and make technological advancements in order to make survival easier while also expanding your colony. 

While the concept is there, a lot of flaws in the gameplay is apparent. My main gripes with the game involve the player's ability to interact with the colony in an impactful way. While you can instruct your colonists to employ jobs and workload, you as the player cannot interact with the colony outside of collecting basic resources like dirt, wood, stone and ores. While, at first glance this shouldn't be an issue, the main question that I spent playing this game was "Why can't I do this task?".

Things like gathering water or fishing, or even crafting materials for your colony aren't available to the player. This is extremely apparent later into the game as monsters seem to come in larger waves and the demand for resources is a lot higher. You can't make food for your colony during nights so I had to resort to making roughly 70% of my colonists berry pickers since it's the most abundant and available resource before night comes. Fishing is pointless until you unlock olives, which means you have to unlock wheat farming and cooking. Even at that, cooked fish and lobster aren't considered meals as far as I'm aware, meaning it isn't necessary for colony survival. 

You are essentially forced to build your entire settlement inside a walled area. As nights got more and more stressful I found it necessary to build a snaking pathway from my colony to the outside world to make sure that my guards had enough time to kill the monsters. My fifth colony lasted the longest with around 90 colonists. With fifteen guards I still didn't have enough time to kill all of the monsters encroaching on the colony and eventually I had to start removing jobs in my colony to keep up with the demand of guards, eventually running out of food and ammo because there wasn't enough constant production of it during the nights. 

If I could add or change some things about this game in its current state, I would:

- Give the player the ability to craft or use items in the job blocks provided to colonists.
- Allow fishing to be a viable means of food production earlier into the game.
- Make it so that guards have a faster rate of fire. 
- Water should not expand infinitely. My settlement flooded while expanding downwards and I couldn't use buckets or anything to remove the water.

All in all, I would recommend this game! It still has a lot to work on but I will continue to follow this game in its updates and will certainly explore more that this game has to offer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043283447', 'num_games_owned': 386, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 120, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 119, 'last_played': 1621140865}
review:
The game is a very interesting concept with a lot of potential, that being said it is clearly an early access game with a lot of work remaining. If you expect a finished, polished game, you may want to wait a couple more years.

Starting out as a new player it can be a bit confusing to figure out what it is you need to do. Once you figure things out there's a lot of waiting around for villagers to gather stuff, but unlike other city sim games, there's no way to fast Forward. This is especially boring during night when you're waiting several minutes while villagers do nothing.

Many items in game use placeholder textures that cleatly need to be updated. For example the furnace is just a solid gray block with an icon painted onto it.

The devs have been updating the game, so hopefully this will eventually be a good game. Worth getting during a sale.

Some things I think the game needs:

1. More reason to explore on your own and enhance your main character. Ideally your main character would be like a hero that can grow powerful. Maybe have treasures you can find that enhance your colony, dungeons, etc.

2. More AI units than zombies. Add other types of monsters that require different defenses. Also perhaps NPC factions you can develop trade routes with.

3. Events! Have natural disasters and other things happening randomly to spice tings up!

review:
I can not in good faith recommend this game. 
It's buggy, looks awful, and is flat-out unbalanced. For a game in the works for 5 years it does not show it, the developers don't listen to their community sitting inside an echo chamber for the development process, doing shotty workarounds for basic functions. 
Here let me give you an example; for the entire 4 years stairs have been in the game they still don't have textures, the main gameplay loop of the game (the colonist) still doesn't have animations for anything besides walking. This game comes back around to its unwilling development team.

review: It wont stop running. Even after I restart steam.When steam restarts it still says its running. I cannot get into the game either.  Cannot not verify integrity of files becuase its running. Also when I try to uninstall it says there are errors and wont let me do that either. So I cant play it, can't verify files, and cant uninstall it. I look on task manager also and its not there. So I cannot recommend it. Game wasnt bad from the 2 hours or so that I played last night.
developer_response: Hi! This problem is probably caused because you opened the .PDF manual from within the game. Steam now considers your browser to be part of the game. This should be fixed when you close the browser (completely)! It's a bit weird that our 'tutorial' is a PDF and that it's buggy. We're aiming to fix that, and we hope the advice above helps you fix your issue in the meantime :)

review:
If you are after a relaxing survival game then you've found it. I really like this game and I cannot wait for more updates.

The only thing I could say as a complaint is that Travel between colonies is quite slow which can really hurt when one of your colonies gets breached and they need you to protect them from the on coming hoard.

Otherwise I'm eagerly waiting to see what new content is added, and will continue to expand my empire while I wait.

review:
В целом игра хорошая, но есть 1 недостаток, а именно очень очень маленький круг интереса. (пример): Ты про качался у тебя колония из примерно человек 30 и ты тупо не знаешь что тебе дальше делать стоять и тупо фармить colony points вообще не вызывает удовольствия и тем более я не понимаю вообще зачем нужны другие биомы смысл от торговли если ты по сути играешь 1 ну даже если с другом это всё ровно скучно. Мой вердикт игра прикольная, но как по мне интерактив прям ну уж очень занижен, а точнее его просто нет, это моё субъективное мнение.
6/10
Слишком быстро надоест + цена прям очень завышена.

author: {'steamid': '76561198947761584', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1681, 'last_played': 1671965095}
review: Советую поиграть в Colony survival  потому что:Потянет на любой пк,играть можно и одному и с другом,и приятно изучать науку и распределять правильно ресурсы что бы выжить,ну и даёт возможности построить своё королевство на любой местности, Но у такой прекрасной игры есть и свои недостатки и это косается мультиплера к примеру: Я думал что с другом можно соединить терретории и получить единое государство и ресурсы но когда ты присоединяешся(к королевству) то теретории остаются разными,2 минус когда ты берёшь оружие и стреляешь по зомби то пуля(стерала,камень) могут тупо пролететь хоть вроде и попал в лицо или в другую часть тела, В общем хорошая игра для мультиплеера и для одиночки :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197963334243', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 12495, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7578, 'last_played': 1708809185}
review:
There's a negative review with 1.5 hours on it. This review is to counter that. I don't normally recommend EA games, but this one is super-close to being a full game. It's already fun, it's at about 90% of the way to its systems and progression being in place, and the roadmap doesn't seem likely to change the fun aspects.

Devs have been really good about listening to the players, but not so much that it's a game-by-committee.

Don't be fooled by the minecraft-esque graphics. That's the only similarity - if you're expecting a MC clone, you're in the wrong place.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101451077', 'num_games_owned': 551, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 1365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1618700704}
review:
A very fun sandbox/survival game. It plays much like minecraft in the building regard, albeit a bit more limited due to a smaller block choice, however with much more ease of access to resources due to the emphasis on automation via colonists. The colonists themselves are fun to manage and make sure you have a good distribution of each job type, and the game does a great job at starting with only  a few simple jobs, but quickly expanding to have new job types constantly unlocking to give you access to better and better resources to grow your colony. It's also much easier to make really large builds in this game, since colonists can collect large amounts of blocks very quickly, and you can even have construction workers to help you build more simple or repetitive structures like walls, or clear out terrain.

Graphically, the game is quite unique. Some people may hate it, I know some people who really like it, personally I think it's ok. All the blocks have a nice 3D effect to them, and the textures are decently realistic. My biggest complaint graphically is the water, since it looks like a massive pool of cool whip. Overall though, it certainly isn't bad, and for an indie like this that is good enough for me. The world generation is actually pretty solid, and the game runs great with high render distances allowing you to see some pretty far off mountain ranges and forests. Unfortunately there isn't much incentive to explore the world beyond finding somewhere to initially start your colony and find a few different biomes later in the game, but the game isn't marketed on exploration, it's marketed on base building and colony management, which it does very well.

As a whole, it's a very fun game, especially with friends, and I look forward to seeing where this one goes in the future. The game is already really fun, but there is a whole lot of potential for it to be even more fun. It's still in early access as of writing this review, so only time will tell.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020809965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 8782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3177, 'last_played': 1682022042}
review:
This is a very enjoyable and calming game.
I think the game is perfect for two types of payers: The Artist and The Organizer.

The Artist will love the ability to build a beautiful town full of people. There are many materials with various looks in the game, giving a lot of aesthetic options. However, many of those materials can only be produced late in the game, so there is a bit of work to get there.

The Organizer will enjoy the challenge of optimizing the output of the town. Every time you recruit a colonist, the amount of stuff being consumed every day will increase, but you need to get colonists in order to produce anything. This creates an interesting situation where you should strive to get as much use out of every colonist as possible. However, there is a lack of detailed information about how much each colonist is working, making the optimization more about guesswork instead of analytics.

author: {'steamid': '76561198359509409', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 32084, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23390, 'last_played': 1710992624}
review:
I first got this game for my son, who enjoys Minecraft and similar building games. I got a copy for myself to play with him. Turns out I liked it more than him. My main beef with Minecraft was that I didn't feel like I had a purpose. Ok, I've gathered a zillion chests full of various resources and built a cool house to store them in. I don't find the combat in Minecraft enjoyable after playing too many MMORPG's with quality pvp and pve so now what? With Colony Survival, I have found that purpose. I have endless zombies to plan how to slaughter to defend my city!

Let's be honest, the graphics are not anything to write home about. It's a voxel game and the texture details are a bit below Minecraft. There's not as many blocks to chose from, but more are still being added and there's enough to build a nice city. You can always add in mods for more decorations, etc. quite easily with the full mod support and active modding community.

I love losing hour upon hour in this game. I've always been more of a technical and functional builder. I want to see how many colonists I can pack inside my walls and still keep them happy - while cranking the zombie daytime and nighttime numbers up higher and higher. The game lets me do that. It also allows you to turn down the quantity of zombies, and even turn them off entirely for day or night or both. It allows you to build beautiful, but not very functional structures as well.  I love micromanaging and checking up on my colonists to make sure they're producing enough of everything to keep things flowing smoothly - from farming wheat to sewing shirts to making ammo. That kinda thing is my jam. If it's not your jam, hey.. your colonists do it for you. You can ignore them and respond only if something runs out lol.

I love designing the best and most compact defense I can manage, so that the zombies don't get to my people. Whether that defense be a massive wall around my colony, or a maze, or a combination of both. I even don't mind getting overrun on the unlucky nights when my defenses failed and replanning and redoing it ever better.

The happiness system added some months ago threw me for a loop. Not gonna lie, I hated it. It added too much for no seemingly fun reason other than just adding more to deal with. The game suddenly felt less like tower defense, and more like "do I have enough people grabbing buckets of water to make this thing which is used to make this other thing which will keep 1 colonist happy for 0.5 seconds?" I could no longer build huge, happiness simply wouldn't allow it. This meant I could no longer push my limits with massive waves of zombies. I tried and failed to like it. I gave up eventually and set my game back to a previous version and didn't play on the current. I tried new versions as they came out, but the fundamental happiness system was always a problem for me. 

Yesterday they released a simplified and streamlined version of the happiness system, using "colony points" instead. It's better. Much better. I'm back on the new versions again and enjoying the game again. I"ll update this if something changes once I get huge (or find I can't lol).  

The devs are responsive and good dudes. There's a large community on Discord, come check it out if you're on the fence about trying the game. The devs are there and will respond to questions if the community doesn't beat them to it. They listen to players, but not so much that they wreck their own game by listening to players... if you know what I mean. Overall, despite my few complaints in this review, I LOVE this game. I recommend this game. I will still play the heck out of this game, despite the version.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990494580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1367, 'last_played': 1607154238}
review:
Although the game is still in Early Release/Development, it is a full game with an interesting take on a 'minecraftian' world. Solo play is satisfying, and I initially enjoyed building up a village to a strong castle, even though 'Zeke' got inside the wire a few times. Multiplayer also exists, though more development is planned. It has a decent Steam Workshop as well. Graphics are better than M-craft-standard, and work more than well enough on basic Intel graphics. 

Don't read too many guides, other than a short quick-start, or tip-sheet, or even that much, since PLAYING it and figuring out how to build your defenses, feed and maintain your colony, and survive the tougher waves of enemies is half the fun. The other half is building Minas Tiroth in the process.

author: {'steamid': '76561199101821111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1607709651}
review:
This game is fantastic. It is a nice, almost calming experience. Since School has been full online since COVID I've been playing during school hours and its amazing. I don't have to put too much focus on the game so I can pay attetion to the teacher at the same time.
Gameplay wise: It's pretty simple. Give colonists jobs, make sure they are fed, and advance in a science tree while gaining more and more colonist. The monsters at night are also a nice touch as it makes the game just a little harder but not too much.
Overall I'd rate it an 8/10. It is early access so there are some bugs here and there but considering I can play this on my Apple Macbook from 2011, it is a fantastic game and I hope others can enjoy it too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005734887', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 5475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1250, 'last_played': 1704236660}
review:
It's like playing Minecraft but with automation and tower defense. Zombies don't attack until you actually recruit colonists, so when you first start you have all the time you need to get prepared. Build a wall or moat around the base perimeter and a hedge maze at the main entrance. Create jobs for guards, farmers, miners, etc. and then recruit colonists to fill all jobs. Farmers plant, harvest, and replant crops automatically. Miners harvest the same node indefinitely; it never depletes. As the player you can manually craft a handful of things, but most items are crafted by a colonist at the work bench (as long as the raw materials are available, which are provided by miners, farmers, etc.). You can select how many of each craftable item he should maintain in the stockpile, and select its priority (e.g. keep 400 ammo on-hand and make that the top priority; keep 5 beds on hand but make them lower priority, etc.). If done right, you can have a fully-automated and self-sustaining colony where your only responsibility is deciding when and how to expand, redesign, etc. What a blast!

They recently added a "flat world" option which I love. My OCD insists on having a flat base to work with and this option cuts out a lot of initial digging.

(EDIT: The following paragraph is inaccurate; there's a Statistics tab that shows all of this information): [strike]Probably my main issue with the game is that it's difficult to tell if your food production is ample, adequate, or on the brink. It tells you how much food is in your stockpile, and how much food is consumed per day, but not how much food is produced per day (at least not directly). So expand slowly and watch your stockpile of food; if it starts decreasing from day to day then you need more food production.[/strike]

I had some frustrations with colonists choosing beds on the other side of the base instead of near their own job, until I realized it was because they were stopping at the Banner for groceries and then finding the closest bed from there. Adding a Grocery Store near their job site fixed that problem. User error, but it's easy to be misled by this and believe that the pathfinding isn't working correctly.

In the end, if playing Minecraft with automation and tower defense sound appealing to you, this game is a no brainer.

Ti fa passare parecchie ore. Cioè, voglio dire, consente all'uomo comune di vivere il sogno di essere un dittatore comunista. Gente stipata nelle baracche, morti per fame, gestione arbitraria delle risorse... mancano però gli abusi da parte della polizia, ma fa lo stesso dai...

author: {'steamid': '76561198034305987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 90, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1605391930}
review:
It pains me to give this game a thumbs down, but it just doesn't hold to the promise the video and screenshots made. I expected what most likely most people expect from the looks - a mix between Minecraft and Dwarf Fortress. And of course I didn't expect it to eclipse or come close to either, such an expectation would be unfair and unrealistic.

But it turned out the truth was severely behind even my lowest expectations.

The Minecraft-lookalike world seems purely window dressing. There is no real reason to walk around in the world, nothing to explore, no real reason to prefer one place over another. And the world itself is lacking diversity to a shocking extreme. Again, I didn't expect this game to rival Minecraft in its content, but it doesn't even compare with Minecraft Alpha/Indev. There is just zero variety with the exception of the official 'expansion areas'. No need to climb any mountain because what's behind the mountain is the same thing as anywhere else.

The Dwarf-Fortress-like aspect is, if anything, even worse. I didn't expect my colonists to have genetically relevant eye colors and write diaries of dreams about past events, but come on, I could write more exciting AI with an Excel macro. All they do is sleep, walk from bed to their job, and then stand lifelessly at their position until it's time to bed. Even when they are attacked, they just stand there until they fall over.

Lastly, I have to point out the graphics. I know, I know, you'll say it's not really fair to complain about the graphics of an indi game like this, and normally, I would absolutely agree. But my complaint here isn't that the graphics aren't up to triple A standard, but that they just look unbelievably careless and like someone put absolutely no effort into them. Some items literally have no textures at all! And many of the textures that do exist are all over the place and look like someone just downloaded a bunch of random and mismatching free textures from a webpage. And there are so few items to build or craft that just redoing all graphics shouldn't take a starving art student more than a day or two, and surely, the Steam sales should be able to cover that. 

I am honestly disappointed, and it seems like the game has been in this state for years. I didn't give this game more than two hours of my life, and after writing this review I will attempt for a refund, so it is possible I missed something that only happens later in the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999949774', 'num_games_owned': 228, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 240, 'last_played': 1605423140}

review:
Es Minecraft con un mod de city building (Incluso puedes poner texturas de minecraft en la workshop), pareciera que no tiene mucho contenido pero realmente puedes hacer bastantes cosas dentro del juego como granjas, defender tu colonia, contruccion e incluso explorar un poco el mundo y establecer nuevas colonias en otros biomas.
Como gameplay es minecraft pero peor, no hay muchas animaciones y no va mas alla de lo basico, podria haber mas interactividad con los aldeanos e incluso con los zombies pero es un early access tengo fe en que arreglara estos problemas.

Hasta ahora es uno de los early access que juegue que mas me han dado horas incluso sin muchos mods en la workshop.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094589087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 8304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7615, 'last_played': 1673737352}
review:
I used to play this game. A LOT. I honestly thought I had more than the 100 hours steam tells me, but i digress. So I recently came back to this game, after replying to a couple comments/posts on the game's subreddit, thinking heck, I might as well since I already owned it. I was not disappointed. The basics of the game haven't changed. You walk around, build a colony in whatever place you please (yes you can do it on a mountain, would not recommend for beginners, was a pain in the arse). You build it up, get better jobs going, give your colonists better food, better protection Etc. Being early access, that was where the progression ended... Or at least used to.

In it's aforementioned state, I would say the game gave me about... 15 hours of playtime from basic colony, up to around the best you could get (best food Etc, certainly not most efficient and/or biggest), and then I was just going around messing around, making a new world, building Etc. But there wasn't much replay value to those other than building your base differently, or trying to speedrun getting 100 colonists or something.

However, since then, I could say the playtime now is....IDK really, probably easily 100 hours. In fact almost certainly more than that, but I'm not there yet. There's a tech tree, multiplayer, proper progression (the science system/tech tree), early modding support (either implemented or coming soon, can't remember), an extremely active dev team, A FLYING MACHINE (looking forward to unlocking that one), new biomes to discover using said flying machine, countless new jobs, building blocks and crafting station thingies... The list is quite long on what has been added, and what is still being worked on. 

All I can say, is if you enjoy Minecraft, tower defence games, sandbox games, voxel games Etc, in any combination or just one, this will be up you ally to some extent. The main feature I honestly wish they would add, is a demo and a slightly imporved tutorial (maybe like the old minecraft intro level, with the castle and the big staircase or something I can't remember that well). There's nothing wrong with the current one, it just could do a better job. 

Tl:Dr. Minecraft meets tower defence. Early access but constantly improving with a ~3 year history of a very active dev team. Decent replayability and very good progression system. Well balanced (again always changing and improving imho).

11/10 would play another 100 hours (and recommend) :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198206181037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1604833333}
review:
Bought this game a couple of days ago, and returned after playing just under 2 hours. The controls felt too confusing, no walkthrough or control guide to be found. I've seen and read good things about this game, but a game that starts off without at least a tutorial on how to move around is just a no go for me. I lack the time to dive into settings and youtube tutorials to figure out how to play.

That said, it would be a game i'd like to play, it seems like fun. I commend anyone to give it an honest try and see for yourself, it's just a no for me :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198030656662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 11079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1357, 'last_played': 1667450130}
review: Fantastic game so far. about 26 hours in an still have a long way to go. If you like tower defense games (zombie hordes going to a focal point that you have to defend against then this game is great. Do you like minecraft and the freedom to build free form then you will like this game. Doesn't have glass options yet but you have many of the other building style materials even with colored lighting. Also do you like colony style games where you get to manage and regulate resources, well this game has that too. Put it together and well, like i said 26 hours in and i will probably put in a few hundred more creating my world, managing my colonists, gathering resources and building my empire. Did i mention there is are multiple types of landscapes to gather resources from? So you can build additional supporting colonies to create even more items. I haven't tried the multiplayer aspect yet but i plan on seeing if a few friends i know that like minecraft will want to try the game out. Worth the $20 bucks it cost easy. Great strategy, time killer while building my empire. Also a bit more rewarding personally compared to Minecraft.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006043165', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 113010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51841, 'last_played': 1707904279}
review:
I've played almost 900 hr and have found the game fun and relaxing. It's nice to have villagers do lots of work while I build them a town to live and work in. The challenge comes in trying to increase population while balancing happiness and defense against the ever increasing horde. The creative building is a bit of challenge to keep it a size that isn't overly large or too cramped. Making it look good and have it efficient. I'm trying to not overproduce and add new jobs as needed.

   I recommend this game if you like to build without overwhelming odds, but still have a challenge by keeping balance as you grow.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037971005', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1649, 'last_played': 1698858875}
review: I really like the game but there are a few things that need to be done. TOP PRIORITY should be to make turning OFF zones or workstations a thing so that the worker will just go find another job and so that you don't have to break stuff to stop a worker from being assigned. COME ON DEVS this is a freaking no brainer and i've been playing the game all of 3 hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031407664', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 357, 'last_played': 1606063050}
review:
Has a big time minecraft feel. You can build structures using resources you gather. Also you have colonists. You use them to make really everything from farm the land to mining and defending your colony. If set right, you can have monsters attack all day and night and the more colonist you have the harder they are. These aren't like Minecraft monsters. They come to you.

After five hours of play I would recommend to friends. I think it has lots of replay value.
