author: {'steamid': '76561198154451453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 358, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1603162352}
review:
Ive read many other reviews prior to buying this game, and ive noticed that a lot of them compare the game to minecraft, after playing the game for about 6 hours, i would agree that this game is similar to minecraft in many ways, although vanilla minecraft has much more content than Colony Survival. At the moment, Minecraft would be the better option in my opinion, due to the possibilites, content, and community. 

After all the years of me following this game, it seems that not much has been added/changed. There's been new biomes, new ores, and some AI changes, although they don't add much in the way of gameplay, build a colony, survive against zombies with garbage AI, build a bigger colony, survive against different colored zombies. It gets repetitive after the first 30 minutes - an hour. I would like to see new enemy's added or add new features to spice up gameplay. I do like how the developers actually respond to community feedback, but the additions seem to take a long time. Granted i know little to nothing about coding and developing a game, i would think that new content shouldn't take as long. The community seems to add more content than the developers have, although that could be said about almost any other game

 Another one of my nit-picking, is that the base game textures need improved, wooden logs looks almost identical to dirt, and a lot of the building blocks are ugly to look at, which leads to (depending on your building style) unappealing structures. Structures is one of the main points of the game, and if they are ugly to look at, then that detracts to the gameplay, all be it that asthetics differ from person to person, the textures need to be changed for any player you ask 

 The AI is a whole new ball game in my opinion, when a zombie is attacking one of your colonists, they just sit there and die, the zombies seem to take the path of least resistance (which isn't a bad thing) but half the time their path choice makes little to no sense, why would a zombie go all the way around a wall, to go through water, to get to a colonist, when it could go through a giant gap in your defenses? The AI on the zombies seem to be better than the colonist's in most aspects, the zombies don't all follow a straight cookie cutter path, clipping through each other (most of the time). The AI is also life less, go work, go to bed, follow the same path day in and out, i wish the colonists were to switch up paths, wear different clothes, look different, or just add some variety, it gets... bland and boring to look at.

The spawning of the zombies is another feature that i'm not a fan of, they can spawn right at the brink of your view, by the time they do get to your base its daytime, and your night guards have gone off to do whatever night guards do, so the zombies invade your base and kill everyone of your colonists, or they just sit at the bases flag and kill them that way. I would like to see if you have night zombies set on and day set off, that they would die when day comes, or vice versa. or there's no nighttime guards and daytime guards, just guards.

    there's more points of the game that i could nit-pick, but i'm sure if you've read this far, you're about done and wanting to move onto another review. In conclusion, I enjoy Colony survival in some parts, and i dislike it in others. I would reccomend that you wait to buy this game until new features are added. Its not a bad game, just not my cup of tea.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062813911', 'num_games_owned': 1958, 'num_reviews': 2050, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1705713159}
review:
[h1] DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review [/h1]

[quote] PLEASE NOTE: This review is/was written when this game was in/is still in Early Access. Think twice before buying/playing this game [/quote]

Colony Survival is a game developed and published by Pipliz, which apparently is two person development team, so well done for creating a solid enough Early Access game

The game offers some nice graphics, although some ugly glitches here and there, it is pleasant all the same

Colony Survival overall, however, is a fun game to play, and it does get boring if being played for a long time, but is a good colony sim survival game and to play in short bursts but still needs a lot of work and fine tuning to make it a really great game! 

[h1] RECOMMENDED :) [/h1]

[b] REVIEW SOURCES: [/b]

review: Colony Survival is a game that I recommend for messing around with friends or time killing. It is fairly addicting and its fun to watch your friends go from a little barracks to a full on castle surrounded by walls and farms. The devs put out updates regularly and they listen to community complaints. For $20 this is a pretty good game. I enjoyed the times I played this on stream with friends. 8/10

review: 1300+ hours played so far.  Think of this as Minecraft with delegated duties.  You do a little digging and setup at the beginning, then after some tech research you can designate more and more tasks such as food gathering, crafting, digging, and building.  Zombies are optional, I like playing with and without them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198453350184', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2692, 'last_played': 1703054582}
review:
This is a very fun game. It is a lot for people who enjoy creative building games, such as Minecraft, or management games. You can create a awesome looking colony that is completely self-sufficient. This allows you to focus on the construction of your colony, rather than gathering resources. This means that even a mediocre builder like me can create an absolute beauty of a colony.

While the game is fantastic, nothing is without flaw. The main issues I found in this game is somewhat bad-looking texures (wood logs looks really bad) and a lack of complex decoration blocks (ie. slabs, stairs, etc.). Nevertheless, I love this game.

developer_response: Hi! We just released an update that had some bugs (0.7.5.0). By now we have released multiple patches to fix these issues (0.7.5.5 at time of writing). Hopefully the issue you ran into has been fixed as well. Sorry for any inconvenience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198269360370', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 15608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5118, 'last_played': 1704141917}
review: Been playing this game for years, really enjoy it. The updates are slow and usually pretty small because the team is like 3 people I think. I obviously have put a lot of hours into this and if you like colony management type games, like old school virtual villagers, this is a very complex version that has a learning curve. Plus it is multiplayer, but I've never played the multiplayer. I really liked the updates with new regions and new crops that would only grow in specific regions because it added a lot of life to the game and I'm still working on those newer colonies. Solid game if you don't mind slow management gameplay, but  not for a fast--paced crowd.

review: I have watched and played this game a lot and can say it is fun and rewarding. Being able to make colonies with over a thousand people is so cool and the monsters that spawn are outrageous and makes me laugh when i see a train of monster just back to back. I highly recommend this game to anyone that is on the edge of getting it and to anyone that still doesn't know you have two hours of game time and if you don't like it return it but just playing this relaxing but exiting game made a huge difference in my thinking of it.

review:
hmmm another cube game that is gonna try to be like minecra- 
well that`s a welcome change 
good things and bad things this game has going for it

good things:
automation [always a plus in my book]
simple enemies that get more evil as you go to not become trivial later on
freedom to build wherever you want and whatever you want
devs who didnt abandon the game after 1 year

bad things:
simple graphics [hard to look past the blocky aesthetic]
still early access after 3 years [games in early access can turn a few people off]

author: {'steamid': '76561198013459633', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 488, 'last_played': 1601712700}
review:
This game has been going since 2017 and it's still a joke.

Any reasonable person would immediately compare this to Minecraft, and as soon as you do, you realize the release for this title is way too soon. The graphics are terrible; there is a single mob that looks like a computer programming project on physics from a freshman in college; there are no animations for building or destroying other than a progress bar that is not affected by tools (same speed with hands, tools, block of dirt); the GUI for assigning and building is not intuitive; any time you create something the view repositions straight up... I understand it's in development, but asking for money for a release that is nowhere close to production is scammy. This title is awful in its current state. It's going to be a long time before this is playable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198406654220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 12812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12743, 'last_played': 1601991701}
review:
めちゃくちゃ面白いです。
150人くらいの規模で生産と消費が噛み合ってきて落ち着いてきたあたりが一番まったりできて好き。
コロニーを増やして交易させるのが楽しいです。
現段階では建築にハマるほどブロックの種類はまだ豊富じゃないですね。ブロックはもうちょっとマイクラみたいに増えてほしいな…とくにハーフブロックがほしい。アーリーにMOD使う気になれないので、今後のバージョンアップに超期待してます。
あとバイオームももうちょっと特色あったらなぁって思います。サバンナでは動物が狩れるとか。
とにかく期待しかないです。気が付くと何時間でも溶けちゃう。
以下、コロニー建築直後のこと。
[spoiler]バナーを建てたあと、村人を呼ばずに壁やゾンビ迷路、採掘場、水場を全部作っちゃうと楽。というか楽すぎてダメな方法か。 [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197975903337', 'num_games_owned': 869, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1576200027}
review:
Over-moderation in the community and I'll downvote. Shame you can't refund after owning the game for a few weeks. 

Edit: Developer response: Yup, I did. But you forgot to include the context and the rest of the sentence. You dishonest prick. Here's the context:

I said I would delve more into the game once it has a proper official/ingame tutorial. 

Someone said "Just watch a tutorial on youtube, it's not that hard".

I responded "Just go slit your wrists, it's not that hard".

[paraphrasing what I remember because I literally don't have access to the comments anymore] 

It's CLEARLY a direct response to his message format. Not actually telling someone to go slit their wrists in real life, but poking fun at how stupid it is to throw the addendum "It's not that hard" as if it means anything. It's like how when someone says they just did what someone else told them to do, you tell them "ok so go jump out the window" to illustrate how that's a dumb excuse. Slitting your wrists isn't hard either, but that doesn't mean you should do it. And after I left that comment I even joked around with another guy about it clearly reinforcing that it wasn't an instruction to literally go end your life. Go back to your safe space. 

You're also lying when you say "memberS". I didn't go around telling random people to kill themselves. As demonstrated above it was a specific in-context comment. This was not a ban based on toxic behavior, but a knee jerk reaction ban because you felt offended. I bet you want to ban comedians too. What you're doing is like claiming Monty Python are Nazis just because they imitate a certain person in a sketch.

I also notice I left comments disabled as a default setting. So go on, bring your rabid fanboys. It's what your kind usually does.

Edit2: Apparantly when you're banned from a discussion, you can no longer leave comments on your own review (I simply get "An error has occurred while trying to post your comment", it does not go away. I'm able to leave comments on my other reviews just fine). Since I cannot respond to comments, I will disable them again. However, I won't hide anything, so I will be leaving a link here to the comment that was left here, as well as my reply: https://pastebin.com/08nsbPGC
developer_response:
We've rarely had to ban people, but Xartax told other community members to "go slit your wrists". We do not and will not allow this.

This happened here (comments deleted, certain privileges are needed to view them):
https://steamcommunity.com/app/366090/eventcomments/2838914020265192791

author: {'steamid': '76561198115272916', 'num_games_owned': 589, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 856, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1703541297}
review:
This is a fun game but not a game for everyone in the current state. [Review has been edited on 10/2/20 due to the recent updates] 
TLDR: Colony Survival is a fun game with potential. I have had this game for several years and I had assumed said potential could have been achieved by now. After giving it a good amount of time,.. that potential has not been reached. How much longer does it need?


Pros:
1. Unique... Kind of?
There are not a lot of similar games on the market [Ignoring Minecraft], that I know of, that do what Colony Survival does. You have games like Rimworld where you build a colony from a topdown view point but Colony Survival does it in first person. You build up your defenses by hand, instead of commanding someone else to do it for you. 

Neutrals

1. Defense
There are a variety of ways to defend your base...or so it would seem. At the end of the day your base [if above ground] will end up with a wall and multiple buildings within said wall, with a 'kill box' leading the zombies in. You will likely have guards posted up on the walls to shoot downwards or have little windows for them to shoot through. That is...basically it. In the early game when all you have are slingers, defense will be boring. 

2. Variety of jobs 
Crafters, farmers, foresters, guards, science people, etc etc. There are a lot of different colonists. However, due to the lack of animations and personality...all of the colonists are really the same thing. They do their job and they go to sleep. 

Cons

1. Building
Want to make a pretty base? What could you use at the ----> start <---- of the game?
Stone bricks, wood, log, grass [+variations], leaves [+variations], sand, and maybe a few more. I assume block variety will come later on in the game but it is really limiting. At least at the start of the game, I know more blocks come later on but you should have more options when building the start of your colony. 
Like...there aren't even stairs! [Though their latest blog post said they will be coming soon]

2. Enemy 
Zombie. Zombie. Zombie. Zombie. Eye colour = their strength. Boring. 
Add some variety. Something that shoots, something that climbs, something that can fly, something that can dig, etc etc. This would make base defense more fun to plan around. Add bosses. 

3. Alerts [Lack of]
No warning is given when your banner or a colonist is being attacked. You might be building your mine and not notice the time, only to realize a swarm of zombies invaded and killed everyone. 

4. Depth
No player animations, simple crafting [E.G. mining stone gives you stone bricks. No smelting of the raw stone], pathfinding is robotic and not fluid, no motives to explore due to basic world gen, ore veins are infinite, farms are in theory infinite, foresters can just plant trees and farm anywhere, etc. 

5. Robotic. 
Colonists wake up, walk to their job, do their job, go to bed, wake up, etc. It's robotic, lifeless, computerized. There is no personality, no feelings, no emotions... You can make your base look super pretty but the NPCs won't 'stop to look'. They won't explore, relax, or hang out even. This is a con for me because it discourages unique building styles and different pathways.

Last Thoughts:
You could spend money on this game. Or...you could download the Ancient Warfare 2 mod for Minecraft with the Hostile Worlds invasion mod and basically play this style of game in Minecraft. 

If you do give Colony Survival a shot, use Pandaro's mod in the workshop.
developer_response:
Hi! Thanks for the extensive feedback and the kind words :)

A lot of the points you make are fair criticism. Some issues have already been (partly) resolved though, and others will be in the near future! These issues are: 

1.) Stairs. We've got a very close equivalent in-game called "quarter blocks". They will look and function like stairs when used. You mentioned reading they will be coming soon in our latest blog post, which leads us to believe you've been confused by older blogs? 

2.) Pausing. This will be released within a couple of weeks, and it's already functional in our internal dev-build.

3.) Just like the block variety, motives to explore appear later in the game. The central biome might look pretty 'basic', but outside of it there are other continents with diverse biomes. 

We hope you'll give the game another shot, now that you know how to build stairs in CS and perhaps with the ability to pause (if you wait a couple of weeks). Some of the things you feel are lacking, do get better closer to the endgame. In regards to some of the other criticism, like the lack of alerts and monster variety: we're striving to improve these things! But they probably won't be fixed within the next 1-2 months - unlike the lack of pausing ;)

review: this game was quite fun but almost every time they update it youre save gets deleted. theres also way to many things in this game now. there used to just be simple research and defend your colony but now theres going other places keeping youre colony happy and a bunch of other things i just cant play it anymore
developer_response:
Hi! Since June 2017, we've released two updates that break older savegames: 0.4.0 and 0.7.0. All the other updates are compatible with pre-existing worlds. "Broken" worlds can be accessed by switching back to the older branches - all major older versions are available. 

It's indeed true that some new features are complex and not very intuitive. We're working to make them more accessible!

author: {'steamid': '76561198182979213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 3532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3203, 'last_played': 1600627379}
review: It's Minecraft, but you have colonists to manage who take away a lot of the grind!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027070577', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 1982, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 972, 'last_played': 1660037657}
review:
Colony Survival is fantastic. It's like Minecraft only in the sense that there are blocks to mine and place and limitless things to do. Other than that, it plays like a pseudo-tower defense with heavy emphasis on base management, almost like a feudal version of Satisfactory, except instead of machines and conveyor belts, everything is manually done by your colonists. It's great multiplayer, and while I haven't tried single player myself, I'd imagine the experience is much the same, minus the fact that it would take much longer to build large structures or excavate blocks. 

Perhaps with the increase to colonist speed (move speed, work speed scaling with day cycle speed), we could see a linear scaling increase in block excavation speed. 

I'd love to see more careers added for colonists (melee guards would be great), more minerals to mine, maybe a variety of enemies. The sky is the limit, and this game has a lot of promise. For $22 CAD, you can't really go wrong. Highly recommended, and can't wait to see where the future takes this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989212961', 'num_games_owned': 599, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 23449, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11158, 'last_played': 1710456653}
review:
A nice game where one builds out several colonies and keeps them safe from the zombies at night in 3D in a voxel based world where one can dig and build.

Runs really well and is good fun in multiplayer as well with several colonies of other people close together.

So far the developers have added several quality of life updates and gaming tweaks that all work really well.

A nice game to play, dig, set up the colony and it's defenses and just enjoy, monitor and expand where need be trying to attain 100% satisfaction for the colonists and production.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047796063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 10971, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2321, 'last_played': 1629462406}
review:
The game was okay, I expect it to continue adding on.
Once you start creating new colonies it gets a little interesting, but the game overall still requires some balancing.
I had fun building a colony to 180 people and then my wood supply tanked... Killing all of my colonists because I didn't have wood for arrows.  I had to resort to a policy of playing on safe mode if I wanted to expand my colony by more than 5 colonists at a time and turning monsters back on after the new economy of my colony stabilized again.
To really play well, you need to do some serious linear algebra to plan your colony... which is kinda cool and kinda messed up at the same time.  That or rely upon someone who has iterated the wheels off this game.
All that said, as the game expands and is iteratively balanced, I expect it to only get better and better.

review:
This one is a very addictive game! Progression and mechanics are easily 8/10, if not more.

If graphics scales from 1 to 10, and 1 is considered ASCII art, then this game is around 2/10. 
I really wish there would be high resolution graphics option with better looking zombies similar to 7 Days 2 Die.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075208537', 'num_games_owned': 50, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 4418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1687337155}
review:
Firstly, I have to expose myself. Even though I only have 1.7 hours played (at the time of writing this review), I have already played way more than that. Yep, I have downloaded the game illegaly, via Torrent. That is because I thought that why would I pay 20€ for a game that I would end up playing for a few hours and then never play it again. Oh boy, I was so wrong. I don't know the exact hours spent in this game, as the pirated game doesn't count it, but it was a lot. I am ashamed of myself that I did it this way, but I didn't know how exactly express how good this game is. It is worth every cent. And the fact that this is early access so the devs are adding more and more content? I am more than pleased to support them by buying this game. 

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198006990420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1597064391}
review:
2020년에 있는 게임이라곤 ... 어이가 없는게임.. 이거 할바에 마인크 하러가는게 이득인듯.
상점페이지의, 스크린샷과 게임성 설명해주는게 있는데 진짜 마인크 초기상태 보는듯한 느낌임.
업데이트 안하는거 같음.
(주기적으로 업뎃은 하는데. 개선이 안되잖아 ?)

현재 한글패치 안하고 겜속에서 한글로 바꾸면됨.
게다가 게임이 겁나 불친절함. 
여태껏 불친절한 게임을 많이 했지만 이건 트레쉬 수준임.

이거 할빠엔 내가 모드 쳐 만들어서 마인크에  모드 넣고 하는게 존나 수월할듯.

author: {'steamid': '76561198997886214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 698, 'last_played': 1617317968}
review:
Love this game. even in early access it's very playable. if you're looking for a colony builder and a survival game, you won't regret buying this. 
if you've played minecraft, don't go into this game expecting that experience. Yes, there are many similarities, but at it's core this game is about managing your colony, not collecting and building things. you will craft at first, but once you start getting colonists they'll do most of the crafting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027538810', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 26466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 483, 'playtime_at_review': 5958, 'last_played': 1712330397}
review:
Colony Survival isn't Minecraft. It's a whole lot more.  Start out with a fledgling colony, but beware the nighttime, when the Zombies come out to play.  This is a great game mixing all the building and mining fun you'd get out of Minecraft, but adds in the challenge of managing the development and growth of your colonists, while protecting them from the nightly swarms of zombies that want to kill them.  Once your colony is self-sustaining, and you've worked your way through the tech tree, you can get the Glider which lets you fly and explore beyond the reaches of your humble home.  With the colony starter kit, you can expand your empire into the New World, Tropics and the Far East.  Each has their own landscape, tech tree and rewards.
A thoroughly enjoyable game.

review: Vom Style her wie Minecraft, allerdings mit einigen wirklich coolen Möglichkeiten: Im Laufe der Zeit baut man sich eine richtige Kolonie auf, in der die Kolonisten durch ihre eigenständige Tagesabläufe echt ein Gefühl von produktiver Gemeinschaft kreieren. Alles in allem absolute Kaufempfehlung für Leute, die gerne Aufbauen und kreativ ihre eigene Festung/Siedlung/Burg etc errichten.

review: A unique combination of a minecraft style world and strategy/management type gameplay. Explore the world, build a nice colony. Or, even better, have your colonists build the colony for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198076803652', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 8136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4855, 'last_played': 1673846331}
review: I started from nothing and turned a flat field into a sprawling fortress with thousands of people living inside, and working together to keep the place going. But then at night I'd go on my tower and take potshots at my own guards to see if I could hit them. I also made a giant cube of my spare hay.

review: Id like to say I really like this game. BUT I would not have currently bought it and got a full running village if i had known that once your stock pile inventory is maxed there is no way to get more space. Only your stock pile and hot bar exist inventory wise. Chest do not exist and even if you take the item out of the stock pile into your hot bar it doesnt open that slot, it changes from a 1 to 0 and leaves the slot filled with the item that isnt there.....for me it breaks the game i cant get further it is MAJOR ISSUE AND NEEDS TO BE FIXED!
developer_response: Hey! Your colony's stockpile is unlimited. You or your colonists can put new item types into the stockpile and it'll just generate some extra slots. We hope you can try again and see if the issue is truly there. If you literally cannot put new items into the stockpile, you've encountered a truly rare bug and we'll investigate further!

review:
There is no blaring problems with this game, but its definitely an early access game. Not saying you won't get your moneys worth right now, just that it has lots of untapped potential. It does what it says on the box and almost nothing more.
I like it a lot, and it blows my mind its made by a two man team. I, but a single man, couldn't make something half as good. That thing being a game mind you.
So if your interested, and can do so responsible, get it. However I'm just some random guy on the internet so I hold little authority and less credibility, so yeah do what you want and then rationalize about the decision based on the outcome to best aid your ego. Won't hurt me none.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011330740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 2533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2532, 'last_played': 1627843086}
review:
I know what you're probably thinking looking at this game. "Oh, look, another minecraft clone." And you're partially right. This cube based dig/craft game is thematically pretty similar to minecraft. The big difference is the ability to get other people to do your digging, crafting, and building, for you. You essentially play as a founding city mayor as you build an initial village and work your way into a fort city.

The gameplay is simple and easy to pick up. You gather resources, hire villagers, get the villagers to farm/dig/log/mine/craft, use the new resources to get more villagers, use the new villagers to do more complex crafting and building. Oh, and also protect your town from the hordes of undead trying to kill everyone. That too. The game is still being updated, so it will likely expand and improve, but as is the major thing is building your settlement with defense usually being handled without too much issue mid-late game.

Overall I'd give the game a 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198081327503', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6016, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3325, 'last_played': 1696411023}
review:
Eigentlich ein schönes Spiel, aber es gibt es Problem mit dem Wasser!!! Ich habe aus versehen einen Wasserblock mit meinem Höhleneingang verbunden und nun steht die gesamte Höhle unter Wasser. Ich versuche seit 20 Minuten das Problem zu lösen aber es ist einfach nervig, weil das Wasser nicht nach nur nach unten fließt sondern jeden freien Block auf der gleichen Ebene einnimmt auch wenn dieser freie Block sich in der Luft befindet. 
Das Problem gibt es schon länger und viele Leute haben sich darüber beschwert, aber es wird nichts dagegen gemacht. Also bekommt ihr erst eine gute Bewertung wenn ihr euch mal um die Probleme die eure Community anspricht kümmert

author: {'steamid': '76561198068963350', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8626, 'last_played': 1675394254}
review: Ever wanted to play Minecraft and have your own village to manage and fend off constant hordes of zombies!? This is the game for you. Textures are amazing for a block based game and the A.I. is fairly smart compared to games similar to it *cough* Minecraft *cough*. Build castles and mazes to defend your colony from the horde or just build a 2 block tall wall around the border of your colony or even better forget the wall entirely. It does not matter how you choose to play so long as your Colony Survives.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009295685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1701053434}
review:
!!! Before Reading this review please keep in mind that it is an opinion and if you disagree that is perfectly ok !!!

        Colony Survival is a spin-off of Minecraft in which you (the player) must raise a colony that will thrive and survive in a world filled with monsters and starvation. Colonists can take various jobs such as farming, mining, fighting and even exploring the ways of science. In order to properly keep your colonists healthy and safe, buildings and defensive contraptions must be built and farms kept alive and growing. Colonists eat several calories a day that can be from berries, wheat, flax and other food items. After a day of hard work your colonists will go to sleep for the night. During the night while your colonists are sleeping, monsters will arrive at your colony to attempt to eat your colonists and even eat you! In summary, Colony Survival is a great game where a player raises a colony to grow large and prosperous through the land, facing deadly monsters, starvation, and even death...

Colony Survival Rating: 9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198123561378', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 7007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 907, 'last_played': 1711838415}
review:
A great management and base defense game. Theres lots to research and later in the game you can build more colonys and have them trade with each other. The games the best when playing with friends but theres no problem with doing it solo. 8/10
Still needs more blocks for decoration/building and I would like to see more defense options like: spike traps, catapults, swords men, spear men.  A few other ideas that could work are  different monsters, Armor for me and my colonists, generated structures, flags/banners and the ability to change colony colors.

review: Do yourself a favor and get this one. It's minecraft with a focus on teching, tower defense, logistics and things like that. It's one of those games you buy, play a bunch, forget about, and then remember it exists and when you come back it's better than before. The developers definitely care about the community, with weekly blogs, and doing their best to explain the state of their office, their plans, thoughts and ideas, and reaching out to the community for input on how they should proceed

author: {'steamid': '76561198074730539', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 437, 'last_played': 1593443763}
review:
Survival-crafting TD 

u start by building up your colony with just a few emotionless maniacs that rather die doing their job than fighting off these zombs. (i guess these guys are germans, cuz they are efficient as hell). however... you need to think quite a lot while building up, every craftingstation, field or block of ore/dark stone needs 1 communist... ahemmmm... i meant colonist ofc.

so while you start building up your perfect slave colony. your colonists do most of the work for, just keep the count of calories in mind when recruiting new colonists and you will be perfectly fine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079788216', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4893, 'last_played': 1654078895}
review:
I dont usually bother adding my recommendation to games I play, but I just love this game so it definitely deserves one. 
Currently, I have logged 81 hours of my life into this game and I regret nothing. Colony Survival I have previously described to others is a colony management game (of course) with a tower defence element to it. The game difficulty progresses in a similar state to that of your growing colony and the game devs are doing a great job at looking to improve what is already a great game. 
10/10 highly recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064276278', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 12477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8922, 'last_played': 1686398389}
review:
Expérience très positive mais à nuancer encore.

À l'époque le jeu était un tower defense patrébô dont on avait vite fait le tour. Depuis lors ils ont musclé l'aspect gestion et la construction et ça donne effectivement quelque chose d'assez fun et varié. Tout ce sur quoi on râlait à l'époque a été réglé et ça j'avoue c'est fort.

Mais ça reste patrébô. Un jeu assez abouti où les colons sont des briques et euh... patrébô.

author: {'steamid': '76561198149159113', 'num_games_owned': 225, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 4936, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4115, 'last_played': 1688536816}
review:
This is a very fun minecraft styled Colony management game, you play in first person, starting by chopping trees and mining ores to feed your colony until it can be self sufficient. There's research, tiers, day/night cycle and enemies to accompany it too! I think this is really fun, unlocking better tiers of guards and such, defending the colony from enemy waves, exploring the different biomes. A downside is that it's very barebones right now, only colonists need/use tools of any kind, there's no propper "creative mode" system, and there are som missing features, these are all things that intend on getting solved by the active devs.
Overall, I love it, but it's maybe a little too expensive for what it offers, get it on sale if possible, otherwise just buy it normally.

review: Alright, this game is pretty dang awesome. Just an FYI, through this game it is a lot of micro managing... which personally makes it more fun. When you start you have no idea where to begin even if you've already played a few times already. Once you get started it is SO much fun endlessly building and upgrading. I feel a constant feeling of accomplishment when I fix the food shortage, I create a bigger castle or extend out the walls, I create more science, and especially when I get to recruit some more colonist! I highly suggest this game to anyone, it is a perfect single player game. Haven't played online yet but I bet the trading system will be fun!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197962811212', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 772, 'last_played': 1591264832}
review:
Not much to say, as there is little in the way of a game here. All the positive reviews seem to focus on what the game could be, and gloss over what the game is. It does have potential, and the concept is neat. But as of right now, your choices matter little, there isn't a reason to explore or really expand, the game play is boring and doesn't reward you for your time. There is no strategy to combat, and almost no replay value.

I know what I'm in for when buying early access games, so I accept the risks and live with it. But this game is one of the few I feel is completely misleading in what it offers, and regret buying. Maybe they can use my money to help turn it around.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116848953', 'num_games_owned': 787, 'num_reviews': 161, 'playtime_forever': 15129, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2377, 'last_played': 1681378598}
review:
Its overpriced. £5-10 at most in its current state.

Its not "like Minecraft but with automation" that was what I thought it was, but its not. 
Its got its own mechanics that you will have to learn to progress. 

I would reccomend it, but I have not even tried multiplayer. No one would want to play coop with me as I want everything setup in my own style, and I have not chosen to put friends through that trauma.

There has been a "revanp" its still worth only the price above, but there is a system that forces you hand, slows down your expansion and .... well it helped me not jump too fast into it, but now its just a slog, its like 3 irl hours to get the "points" you need to make changes and expand your colony, its been done like this to "bloat" the game, buuuuuuut it did slow my game down enough that I am making the biggest colony I have ever made, however I dont think there is enough depth in this game yet, for it to warrent the hours I have in it, I only play this because I am watching a movie/series at the same time this is not a "wow lets play this game for hours on end" this is more a simple distraction, while you pretend to be doing other more constructive things. 

4/10

This rework on the colony points is a fucking joke I've idled the game for the entire day and only got 1-3 upgrades our of 30 or something. 
Yea it was good to slow down and make progress but the last few upgrades force you to grind the points system and its slow as frick, i know I could make all my homies eat bread to make it faster but I brought those noobs up on berries and thats what they gonna eat god dammit! 

1/10 Would not reccomend to friends as its impossible to "win"

27/12/2023 - Updated to reccomend, review stays the same though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113099873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2888, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2583, 'last_played': 1660702341}
review:
The game is fun and is an awesome city building game where instead of being a all-powerful God overlooking your city at all times, you're a citizen as well which allows for a closer relationship with your workers. I had a lot of fun playing this and the multiplayer is fantastic for a city-builder with friends and I had a lot of fun times playing this with my boyfriend. While the graphics leave something to be desired, the lighting is some of the best I've ever seen in a game and I love it <3.

However be aware the gameplay is somewhat shallow at the moment due to the game being in early access and feels more akin to a tech demo than a fleshed-out game, and the happiness mechanic currently makes the game very unjoyable (if that's a word) as the second you run out of a resource your approval rating plummets drastically and makes growing the city a nightmare simply because you're out of cakes or something and your citizens will instantly begin starving themselves to death. So if you play I would recommend turning happiness OFF.

review:
This game Is strangely fun. 
Similar to Minecraft, and yet completely its own thing. 

When i started this game my friend and I were completely clueless about how anything worked, but after a bit of trial and error, we got it nailed down. 

The game is still in early access at the time of my writing this so things are almost guaranteed to change, but at present, its very enjoyable and gives the player plenty of things to keep on top of.

Imagine Minecraft with slaves and you're sorta getting there

author: {'steamid': '76561198345757453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 2071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1014, 'last_played': 1672632274}
review: Colony Survival is very fun once you understand what you're doing and how to play. It looks like minecraft, but totally different if you were thinking they are similar. you basically just create jobs for colonist and the more colonist you get the more zombies come at night. that is the easiest way to explain but the game is way more indepth than just that. i wish the days were maybe just an extra minute or two longer but other than that i have no complaints.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147035781', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 55812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1170, 'playtime_at_review': 3510, 'last_played': 1712321021}
review:
I've played for about 58hrs now and honestly, i like it a lot. I love the colony aspect, it's not just a sandbox builder, you have to manage the colony (which gives it more of a goal to work towards).
I know it's still in early access but still feels a lot more polished than other games similar to this.

I would totally recommend this to anyone that has played and enjoy voxel games.
The only downside to me is the small variety of enemies (again still in development, so maybe?).

Overall I have been enjoying it for a while now.

Cheers to the great developers, hope this game becomes a massive success.

review: At first it doesn't look all that interesting well that's what I thought when I was watching a YT play it in the very early day of development but I watched about 10 ep's then bought it and sat down played it and I lost track of time for about 4-5 hours and with more on the way for updating the game I can't wait to see what happens to this very strange addicting game.

review:
Secretly sabotage your friend's empire by building a small hole under their walls to allow zombies to bypass their defenses and watch it crumble.

Make a staircase from their wall to the outside at an obscure angle and watch it crumble again.

Wall off their miners and watch them die of starvation in the chat log.

Watch as they murder your peasants with their bare hands (or with a flintlock pistol).

Offer them various carpets and fancy planks as an apology.

10/10 would destroy their kingdom(s) again. ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198001914453', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 1681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1066, 'last_played': 1695069437}
review:
This game is an extremely addictive tower-defense set in a familiar package. 

Colony Survival looks like a well-known game where you mine and craft stuff, but for the most part that is where the similarities ends. It looks great in terms of graphics, though it is an early access, and many features still feel bare bones. You won't be building furniture, creating paintings, or adding plucky flowers to your colony to make it seem like home. Your colonist look flat and your guards stand statue still at their posts. But as you build your ultimate fortress against the nightly zombie attacks you will find yourself agreeing to just 'one more' hour in no time. 

The gameplay revolves around you preparing your colony for the zombie attacks that occur every night (or day). You will farm, create beds, black smiths, and constantly be on the lookout for arable land you can fortify and defend for the next level of researchable technologies. More land means more colonists, more colonists mean more guards, and this leads to more zombies that you need to build technology to defend. Its a simple mechanic, but you will have to balance it all out. 

There are a few bad aspects of the game, but these may and probably will be corrected in future updates. As I said before the game feels very bare bones. Your castle is literally blocks and beds, with small stalls for building scattered around it. The zombies i've encountered in 17 hours are two types: easy to kill and slightly harder to kill - there are no others and they march forward with limited AI. There is no physics system and you can build blocks in any way you wish (floating in the air even) and they will not react. Arrows and slings are straight line shots and your guards don't miss. 

But this game is early access and I can only recommend it from what I have played. In it's current form it is a blast and I only see it getting better.

review: I recommend any body whose bored in quarintine or just wants to have a good time. While many might relate this to Minecraft or other blocky games, it is completely different. In this game you have to manage a colony of people and build their homes by hand, while keeping the pesky zombies out at night. Your first couple of games will probably end horribly, with either no food or a dead population. This game is like a big trial and error. It took me a good 4 hours before I got a game that lasted more than a couple days. Just make sure to watch your food, and don't hire too many colonists at once!

author: {'steamid': '76561197978187921', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 75155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36070, 'last_played': 1705828641}
review:
It's Blocks (Voxels) like Minecraft but it Isn't Minecraft. It's a Colony Strategy Sim that happens to occur in a 3D First Person world. Most of the game is managing your colonists and what jobs they do to assist and grow your colonies and building and shaping their environment to your desire. You have to balance food production, security (guards), morale (happiness level, good food, luxury items), and raw production of necessary goods (mining, smithing, tailoring, weapons and ammunition for your guards and tools for your workers.)

The bigger your colony grows, the more monsters attack so the more important managing your guards and the entrances to the colony becomes.

The Dev team is very active on updating the game and adding new features.  It was originally just one colony, they added more tech trees, gliders for long distance travel, different regions with different resources and inter-colony trade so now you are encouraged to make multiple colonies in different regions and have them support each other.  

Coming out soon (as of this writing, tomorrow) is the new update which will let you see the statistics of your production as currently managing over runs or shortages and having some colonists that can't keep up while other ones are idle waiting on the materials they need to do their jobs. At the time of this writing the only way to do that was to visibly watch the stockpile in real time to get a sense if it was dwindling or not realizing that there may be huge lags and surges (wheat harvest and planting cycles vs relatively constant milling time, etc.) and there are a lot of opportunities for production bottlenecks so you had to walk around your colonists and check up on them as they worked to see if any of them needed anything. This made larger colonies much more difficult to manage  and the process very reactionary. For instance, at some point in the growth of my colony, My guards were using up their ammunition nightly at a faster rate than my workers could replenish it during the day... Before that, I had built up a huge surplus but I didn't notice that the number was getting smaller each day until one night they ran out and were completely overran by monsters and I lost half of my colonists. I'm looking forward to the insights and quality of life that this next update will enable.

Surprisingly fun game.  I suggest higher difficulties because it'll stretch your economy in needing more guards per population.  The audio design is extremely jarring.

Try it with Pandaros Settlers mod.  It adds a huge amount of aesthetic blocks and content!

review:
First off, this is entirely dissimilar to Minecraft, so if that is what you are after, move on. It is, however, a competent colony-builder with its own unique vibe. Programmer art, yes, but also fun.

[i]Please follow my curator page,[/i] [b][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/6856591-Designer-Plays/]Designer Plays[/url][/b],[i] for a truly massive number of concise and honest reviews from a 25-year veteran Game Designer.[/i]

review: Balanced game that requires the player to ration resources as well as develop effective ways to put down the monster hordes. Colonists make items that other colonists requires to make better and more advanced items. The "Science" advancement tree keeps track of new technologies and guides the player forward. The is no playable tutorial, but there is an included guide on how to start the game and begin moving forward.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003993373', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 185, 'last_played': 1708194911}
review:
I don't have a recommendation really one way or the other, however, where you see the game is advertised as "Online PvP", there is no Online PvP.

Here's a piece of a conversation I had with one of the dev's so you can determine for yourself if the PvP aspect is what attracted you to the game.

From Zun: "yeah it's a bit vague whether it's online PvP or not
it is not exclusively co-op, but it's not "real" pvp either
you can mess up your friends colonies if desired
but you can't actually punch them, or use your colony to attack them"

There isn't anything in the design of this game up to this point that seems intentional for the purposes of PvP to rationally qualify this game as having "online pvp". The ability to "dig" a block up, isn't inherently an action that was designed in order to "do battle" with another player, just a happy byproduct for someone wanting to claim that you can pvp in this game. In no way, can I as a player (who is defined as the king of a colony) do battle with another king. I consider it a misleading stretch to claim this game has "online pvp".

review:
Colony Survival is only suitable for those who intent to build castles for asthetic reasons.
As it is now every game (colony) plays exactly the same since the game lacks challenges.

If colonists would not be able occupy the same spot,
traffic would be a challenge that requires more strategic planing.

If ressources in one crate would not be shared with all other crates,
there would be a logistic challenge that requires more strategic planing.

If mining ressources would not be so close just a few blocks below,
there would be additional challenges and a reason for exploration.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039276457', 'num_games_owned': 541, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1276, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 993, 'last_played': 1697334032}
review:
Brief Description:
Game has potential. Very fun, but very little to be able to do. As expected for an early access game. Issue in point being the fact the creators barely update the game. There are only two of them so I can understand how it takes time to make updates. But progress they make with every blog post they post on fridays is so sad its like they only worked on the game for a few hours. 

Long Description:

Game has good features and a very good solid base. But it does not have that much to do. Playable game time is well infinite. But playtime to pretty much finish anything you can do could be even a few hours.

Pros:
Minecraft building style
Little to no bugs
Good basic features
Fairly good graphics

Cons:
Very long time in between tiny updates
Very little features
World generation is fairly bland
Biomes are hard to get to
Interface is very ugly
Most of the blog updates consist of them playing other games.

My biggest issue with this game is the fact that with every blog post they promise to make on fridays. It's supposed to be an update to what they are working on for the next update. Pretty much every post is just them talking about games they played and places they traveled to. Barely any actual progress is actual made any week. If I worked on this game in Unity just by myself I could make tons more progress than they do. It's frustrating cause the game has so little to offer yet with every blog post they talk more about games they play then the game they are working on.

In my own opinion the game is fun, but it has too little features and by this rate it will takes years before this game has more to offer. I do not think for the graphics, features, lack of updates, and interface that the game is worth $20. 

Wait till it is on a big sale, or find a way better deal somewhere else. Games probably worth a $5 game you could get anywhere at the moment.

Thanks,
SirStig

author: {'steamid': '76561198037759980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 695, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1594819967}
review:
Absolutley amazing game, never ending tasks to do, i.e. build your own settlement, village, city, network of cities, a whole empire, make everything automated and independent from player-needed decisions or hand-build / do all on your own, the possibilities and the creativity in terms of building are endless (done with a whole empire consisting of multiple mega-cities connected to each other? why not start building underworld dungeons that focus on mining and supplying the rest of the world with precious ore ? Rebuild Moria and dwarvish kingdoms beneath your megacities and top it with some giant trees that are villages itself, rooting in the underworld, growing through the cities and reach into the highest skies to serve as foundations for giant, unraidable fortresses so high up that the cities below are barely noticable.
Whatever empire or creation you ever imagined, build it here :-)

author: {'steamid': '76561198065135840', 'num_games_owned': 155, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1878, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1590540607}
review:
Pros:
- Game Guide is VERY helpful and always on hand
- Game looks amazing
- You always feel like there is something to do
- What the Colonists use for homes, shops and mine shafts is COMPLETELY up to you. They can look anyway you want them to.
-Game difficulty progression is very gradual, if your defenses are made right you almost never notice the change in monster difficulty.
 
Cons:
- If you don't read the guide you're screwed (Take it from me, took me DAYS to figure the game out without reading the guide)
- The AI's pathfinding is a little jank ( they cannot walk in diagonals)
- The game has a steep learning curve, that guide tells a lot but whatever it does not tell you you must figure out on your own or google it, and sometimes it can be VERY hard to find out.
- Your AI will craft whatever they feel the group needs, you can set priorities (scale of 1 - 3) but sometimes they wont listen.
- There is no way to speed up how fast YOU can dig.

Over all this game is a great game to play, I'd recommend playing this game with friends as the task would be much faster to complete with another person. However, the game is still a blast alone, so if you have $20 to spare or its on sale i'd recommend you grab it!

review:
This game is a masterpiece. It has been a long time since I truly lost myself in a game, but this completely held my attention. 
I absolutely loved MineCraft, really enjoy tower defense games, and managing a town/economy has always been fun. This games fills all those spots perfectly. Could not recommend higher.

author: {'steamid': '76561198366114259', 'num_games_owned': 448, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 55821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5451, 'last_played': 1710250862}
review: 非常好的一款游戏，看着像Minecraft却完全不是Minecraft，画质做的非常逼真（尽管我的电脑实在是带不动），从0.6.0开始玩的，我steam库两款时长上80h的其中一款。玩法很丰富，每次开局食物的问题总是让我很头疼（刚开始玩的时候总是用指令），不缺食物后就以杀那些“屁民”（中文翻译）们为乐趣。来来回回玩了5个存档了，却还是没有玩腻。玩法比MC原版丰富价格却比他低，我非常推荐喜欢殖民模拟和像素风的玩家入手。（万一大更新后又涨价就亏了）

author: {'steamid': '76561198399571307', 'num_games_owned': 53, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1696519722}
review:
游戏好玩，初次接触是0.2.2，觉得很有发展潜力。
0.7后入正，爱不释手。加了很多新的元素，世界也变得更多样了。

如果你玩过我的世界的话，这游戏就和它差不多——但是Colony Survival将其中殖民的元素扩大，发展，竟意外地好玩。看着殖民地一点一点发展起来，也是蛮有成就感的。


（创意工坊中有完全汉化！！！）

author: {'steamid': '76561198079000751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 19980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4481, 'last_played': 1697322289}
review:
Great combination between colony builder and tower defense. The game has a nice pace and is well balanced.

Be aware that the game is constantly being developed. It is a little different every time I come back. Kind of annoying sometimes after you work out the math of your supply lines, but the changes are almost always better. As a simulation fan, it's one of my all time favorites. 

Also, after coming back from not playing for a couple months, water is annoying. I would prefer if there were better ways to control it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198347826218', 'num_games_owned': 94, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1370, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1162, 'last_played': 1598367702}
review: Polecam świetna, wciągająca gra na zabicie czasu. Wyglądem otoczenia w oczywisty sposób nawiązuje do gry Minecraft, jednak ma świetne shadery i tekstury niektórych bloków. Polecam jeśli: lubisz city buildery, strategie, lub Minecraft. Jeśli uważasz, że podane powyżej gatunki są dla ciebie po prostu nudne nie kupuj tej gry. Jeśli planujesz kupić tą grę jako twoją pierwszą grę z tego gatunku-świetny wybór.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004858750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1583703139}
review:
Very, very bland.  It's not bad per se, it's just not that great.  It clearly takes after Minecraft's older Thaumcraft golem mods, but with fewer capabilities.  It's lacking in personality and comes off as lacking alot of finesse that a well-made Minecraft mod would have you expecting.

I went into this wanting a straightforward Minecraft colony sim, and what I got was somewhat less.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086608915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1583179117}
review: i REALLY love the idea but it just seems so.. unfinished like its the same production quality as a couple browser games i have played and worse quality than the best browser games i have played. if it was like 2 euro then sure you could just play it for a couple hours then probably forget about it or maybe love it and get great value. but its just too clunky. destroying and placing blocks felt uninvolving at the best of times and the npcs are pretty dumb but thats fair because its dynamic in what they can do. but the whole command/banner tool is just the worst possible way to make a game like this, its not user friendly and most things in the game is pretty much guesswork beside some very basic instructions. i have only played it for 34 minutes and these points were already a dealbreaker for me, but i think that for a very niche group of people this game would be quite enjoyable i normally love these kinds of games but im just sad to see that after almost 3 years it still feels and plays like an early tech demo. all in all buy it and refund it if you dont like it but you thought you would. overall i would describe the game as a well hidden cash grab and or just not made with any kind of passion or love for the craft.

author: {'steamid': '76561198196031145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1187, 'last_played': 1582807132}
review:
[h1]おすすめですがアーリーアクセスだけあって内容は薄いです[/h1]
独自要素である村人に指示をだして整地させたりアイテムの生産をさせる点は素晴らしいです。
しかし敵からコロニーを守るという点は安定したら全くゲーム性が無いのでやることは結局自分の家だったり城を作るくらいです。
そしてここまでくるとマイクラとかドラクエビルダーズでよくね？って感想が出てきます。
アーリーアクセスなのでこれからコンテンツが追加されるという希望も持てますが逆に現状ではコンテンツ不足は否めません。
もし購入するのなら以上のことを踏まえてあくまで将来性に期待という気持ちで行った方がいいと思います。

[h1]以下プレイ感想[/h1]
[b]グラフィックがすごくキレイです。[/b]
ボクセルゲームでグラフィックがキレイだとほめるのもなんだか変ですがまずプレイしての一番に思ったのはキレイな世界だなーと、スクショ通りの感じです。
[b]村人に整地させられるのはすごい便利[/b]
範囲を設定して後は別の作業している間に整地が終わっている。だるい整地作業がMOD無しで簡略化できるのでMODの更新とか気にせずに楽に整地できるのはすごくいいと思いました。

[b]村人がいっぱい[/b]
食糧確保する人、植林する人、アイテム加工する人、研究する人、等とにかく村人が増えます。ジャンルでさらに細分化されて増えるのでとりあえずアイテム揃えようとしたらモリモリ増えます。自分の環境では50人時点でも特に重くなったりはしませんでした。ただゲーム内での研究条件で村人100人、150人などがあるのでそこまで増える事前提のゲームなのでその時は多少影響あるかも？ぐらいです。
ただ村人はかなり無機質です。ストーンハースのようなかわいらしさ、生活感は全くないので注意。朝になって自分の作った住居区(ベット密集地)から仕事場へぞろぞろ出勤する姿は軽くホラーです。

[b]MODがすでにある[/b]
アーリーアクセスなのにすでにMODがあるので不便だなと思ったところにはすでに手が入ってたりします。(各ジョブに従事させる人数の割り振りとか）
逆にないと不便なので入れましょう。一部のMODは新規ワールドにする必要あるから作りこむ前に目を通しておくといいと思います。
[spoiler]アーリーアクセスなので今作りこんでも読み込めなくなる可能性大だけど[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198419268493', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6422, 'last_played': 1698022210}
review: This game is pretty fun. Take Civilization, make it first person and mix it with Minecraft and this is basically Colony Survival. The early game is pretty simple and fun, with enough to do to keep you going. Mid game is also pretty fun as this is when you're steadily increasing your colony's size and getting new jobs and looking to the future as you watch your resources and grow your colony with new people to compensate for lack of a certain resource and plan out what you'll do with those resources. Late game is interesting and new, at this point you're having multiple colonies in multiple regions and you get to have a multicolony kingdom and all the trading and resource gathering that comes with it. And throughout all of this its a sandbox game, so you can design your colony however you want which really makes you feel like a Leader for your kingdom. Overall would recommend if you like Minecraft but you also like to have a working, resource producing kingdom.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055641372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 43902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3269, 'last_played': 1690775883}
review:
I've spent many hours playing minecraft.  This game plays like minecraft plus.  I love the mechanics of having the NPCs do the grunt work, leaving me to the creative side.  The science tree makes sense as does the build up of the various levels of happiness and food/luxury needs of the NPCs.  The look of the world is cool.  I do miss the exploration of mines, but you can dig your own and I like that the same patch of iron etc can be mined forever, eliminating that resource scarcity issue.  

The zombies could be harder, maybe they try and smash down defences or something at higher levels. (maybe that's still coming??) I've love if they shot back, creating a need for more elaborate defences/armour.  I'd love a map function or compass, as I'm already worried about finding my way back to my main colony.  

I'd highly recommend this game overall and I look forward to seeing how it develops

author: {'steamid': '76561198209262921', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3167, 'last_played': 1661079061}
review:
I can't stop playing this game!

You start with nothing and slowly automate everything from food to luxury items to weapons to defend your base from zombies. There's always this panic when you look in your inventory and find out that a certain resource is running out and you try to fix it and ending up running out of another resource. It's a vicious but fun cycle.

It's a game where you design and make some poor plebs do all the work. 10/10

review: Excellent game; had a lot of fun with my little brother on this one, and it fairly simple in dynamic however very challenging as a game itself. It can be a fair challenge to build a successful sustaining kingdom without having to touch any zombies yourself. Very fun would play it more as updates progress.

review:
This game is great, but it needs fixing. Here are my requirements:
1: Add more late game tech. Cannons, muskets, etc.
2: A multiplayer mod where you can raid and pillage other's castles.
3: Add map features
4: Add more zombies, and please add sword and spear guards.
Thank you to whoever read this. Hear me out please

review: I like to disable monsters and just see how many colonists I can get into my city. They do the collecting for you, and you are free to explore and build as you please. I can't really say I found any serious issues with the game. I have had a great experience from the moment I got it, to the moment I wrote this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976209168', 'num_games_owned': 1033, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 3880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3280, 'last_played': 1705033529}
review:
I've owned this for quite a while, and to be honest, I didn't enjoy it much when I first picked it up.  The folks that make this put a lot of love into it between then and now, and my opinion has completely changed.

It has the block building/creative ability of minecraft without redstone, the input/output balancing of Factorio, as well as the tower defense of, well any of them.  The game loop is mostly spending time being creative, while trying to balance everything.  You will want more people to produce more, but they require more food to eat, more things to be happy, and spawn more baddies, so it can be quite hard to get right.  On that note, I'd like to see a graph/info block of some sort that helps determine in/out a little better, as currently it's kind of a try and see approach.

IE: I seem to have thousands of wheat, but not enough flour, need more grindstones...let's try 2, wait a few days, now I'm out of wheat and need to build more farms, but now I have more people and more zombies and my guards are failing, and why don't I have arrows, oh not enough copper...etc.  Even something simple stating daily estimates would be immensely useful to the numbers person in me.

On the whole though, I struggle through that part because the underlying game is a gem.  Excellent work folks, keep it up!

author: {'steamid': '76561197996021658', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 6419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3516, 'last_played': 1700421496}
review:
A few quick suggestions.

Players can see Each Other's farm borders when placing down new farms (in case of colony overlap)

PvP allowed as one colony management option. If both Colonies select 'PvP allowed' and set each other to enemy, then and only then can they PvP each other (but this does introduce the feature at least).

Some servers could be PvP only servers, where the default is everyone setting everyone else to enemy unless two players agree to team up.

Mobile Forces. Basically the Player would become the 'grocer' and the soldiers would go to the Player once per day to get 'food' or you could have a mobile unit called like "baggage train/ mobile hq", and the soldiers follow this.

If you have a mobile army, they would follow either you, or the baggage train/mobile HQ. You then give orders to the Mobile HQ on where to move, and in this way you can have mobile forces. This could work nicely both for coop and for pvp.

review: I've had this game for a while now and at first it was definitely a weird buy. My preferred genres are "rich story" and "strategy" and at the time many people overlooked Colony Survival as a Minecraft clone. To my surprise this game offered more strategy than I could have imagined. At it's basic level its a game about survival of your colony with some zombies out to get them. However the more you play it the more expansive this game gets. Colony Survival heavily depends on the colonists doing the work as you learn how to rule to the most efficient way. The need to rely on your colonists for growth really makes the zombies that much more of a threat especially since they grow in numbers as your colonists do. If you were planning on buying this game to lay down and stop thinking, then you're in for a rude awakening, rule well fellows kings.

review: This is a great game. Its actually something I've always wanted, a Minecraft style game where you run a colony and build the world around you first hand for your settlers to live in. Building a castle in Minecraft was fun but ultimately pointless, but building a castle in this is both fun and functional. It take a bit of time to learn the ins and outs but once you get going the time really flies.

review: Only 25 hours into this so far but over all I am loving it. If you like RTS or City planner games and you like minecraft then you will love this as is strikes a good balance of both. Textures and lighting are great so far in this game wish is not usual for a voxel game. Devs are extremely active and you can tell they are still passionate over this game consulting with the community before any changes and very honest and upfront in everything from their road map to even how they can keep funding this. Highly recommend this game.

review:
Do you enjoy resource management games?
Have you played Minecraft and were not entirely turned off by the graphic style?

Then just buy this game because you're going to love it - and it keeps getting better as it updates.

If you HATE the overall look - and are not typically a fan of resource management, then I'm not sure this is right for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198417380007', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 87, 'last_played': 1613065046}
review: Takes a little bit of time to get into the game but once you do get into the game and start to learn how to play its super fun. One of my favorite games on steam for sure. On the surface it looks like another minecraft clone, but here is completely differerent, you have to build a base to protect your flag and colonists, you have to get food by hiring farmer colonists, defend your base with guards, mine ores with miners, blacksmiths make those ores into tools, and scientists research things so you can craft them. it's a lot more in-depth than i ever would have expected. Just a small thing that i love is how smooth walking up stairs is. it reminds me of minecraft in the sense where the building is relaxed but not in a boring way, and PvE can get tense at times. Only bad parts are some textures look strange close up but look amazing when you back up a bit, also, the water, sand, and sun are blindingly bright. The zombies get quite overwhelming at some point even with guards, the day/night should also be longer. overall this is a very worthy purchase to anyone that likes minecraft, terraria  or other building/voxel based survival gameplay. but it does need some patches here and there.

review: This is a blast!  I can definitely see areas for improvement, but that's why it's in early access!  I am really enjoying building different colonies and figuring out everything.  I also highly recommend the mods, as they add additional layers to how you play.  I could see myself playing this for hundreds [if not thousands] of hours.  Highly recommended for those that like city builders and games like Gnomoria and Minecraft.

review:
First-person city builder. Resource management. Tower defense, once you got the walls up and can funnel zombies through the rootin'-tootin' maze o' shootin'. Lovely textures and lighting.
What I'd Like to See:
- Better pathfinding
- ability to designate bedrooms for certain jobs. Miners, use beds near mines. Farmers, use beds near farm.
- I know you don't see them, but an interaction to pet the aminals. Please, I must pet bees.

review: This game is actually really fun to play, it requires thorough city planning so your colony wont get wiped later on. Though if your settlements got wiped you can always start over and unlike the older version, the zombie's strength follows the amount of colonists you have (so if you got wiped, the zombies goes back on being the weakest and fewer, and the first few, i believe the first 3-4 colonists will be free but keep in mind their food upkeep)

author: {'steamid': '76561198060622753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 5531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3120, 'last_played': 1640065386}
review:
このゲームを一言でいうと「指示がメインとなるマインクラフト」です。

自分ができる事は少なく、細かい作業になるとほとんど村人の出番でプレイヤーは見守る事しかできません。
ですからプレイヤーは村人が働きやすい環境をつくるハード部分の建設を受け持ち、食料や道具などのソフト部分は村人に受け取ってもらうのがコツになります。

村人にお願いする部分が多いのでマイクラ等になれているプレイヤーにとってはもどかしいでしょうが、自分の方針に忠実な村人にはそれなりに愛着がわいてきて、頑張ってやろうと思う楽しさもあります。
時間泥棒の要素はライバル作品にも負けない楽しいゲームです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198059290308', 'num_games_owned': 180, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2824, 'last_played': 1601376071}
review:
Developers care a lot about this game. They are responsive to the community in its continued development and are constantly working to make the game more diverse, longer, and more fun.

Looks like a Minecraft clone but functions a lot more closely to a Minecraft mod with its own unique touches. A lot of focus is spent into caring for colonists and growing your own personal kingdom, all while defending it from invading mobs.

In a future release of the game, I would love to see more varied mobs. Currently, all zombies are pretty much the same. They walk similar paths to the flag and vary only in terms of health and damage dealt. I would love to see zombies that fly, move quickly, take diagonals, climb walls, use bow & arrows, etc. in future releases.

Overall, fun game with plenty of potential. Devs are working hard to make it better everyday, and I look forward to seeing what they can do in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049211996', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 3552, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2619, 'last_played': 1692242294}
review: With most city builder games you just can't lose after a certain point. If you play it right in the beginning you just get too big to fail. That is not a problem you will have with this game as the difficulty scaling keeps you on your toes if you aren't always on top of your borders. The game is still "getting there" with the block variety and appearance but there is still more than enough to make cool buildings for your colonists. When better colony management tools are released (which probably won't take long given the modding community and the hardworking devs), This game will become a great purchase for anybody coming from any factorio or city building games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971054351', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 14065, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5455, 'last_played': 1695244835}
review:
It's a really really fun game, with a lot of potential for being even more fun with future updates! It really is a perfect mix between sandbox voxel survival game, tower defense, and production chain/resource management-games. If you like any or all of these genres I would recommend the game as long as you understand that it is in development; after a while (quite a while!) it will lack in meaningful things to do and some of the UI interface might be a bit under-developed.

For now I have "completed" all the to-do-content for me (in about 50 hours in the latest update) - all that is left is to expand in numbers and area but i feel i need more motivation than that. 

Maybe I will try the workshop-addons next, to get more science and production content.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977724100', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 12067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7060, 'last_played': 1694683864}
review:
I found this game frustrating until I played co-op with a friend, and discovered that you didn't get attacked until you recruited your first colonist. Later I found out you can turn off zombies until your ready. And they added the ability (through research) to assign colonists to dig out areas, or build them (I use them to put dirt in for fields). And you can build a glider now to explore for new colony sites. No more running all over the map!
With those issues out of the way, I was able to settle down and design/build up my colony. Which I found to be a lot of fun now. You can research things, like expanding the area around the flag (that zombies won't spawn in) therefore expanding your area for planting crops, etc.
I give it a 6.5 out of 10 right now. I have over 110 hours of play time out of it (single player) . I would like to revisit co-op again. And I am looking forward to seeing what else they add. Oh and hardly any glitches encountered. Very smooth even with over 500 colonists working.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057879084', 'num_games_owned': 264, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 1078, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1078, 'last_played': 1570946415}
review:
I played the game a little and it kinda reminded me of minecraft modes like minecolony and millenaire. I went back and tried them out and realized that this game has one thing that those mods didnt. It is polish. I put in way more hours into this than those mods.

One thing this game desperately needs is capitalism. When you have around 250-500 villagers, finding the optimal ratio of miners, to smelters, to nail makers, to bed makers is a massive headache. Juggling multiple production chains in the head at this scale is too difficult. Maybe the devs can add a research that allows for floating jobs that optimize themselves.
