author: {'steamid': '76561197961054434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 7003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2432, 'last_played': 1698165549}
review:
So I have now played this game for 40+ hours and feel like its time for a verdict.

I would describe this game as taking the game series Anno 19** and sprinkle it with a dash of Minecraft. And I LOVE it!

Pros:
* Awesome graphics with bumpmapping and lightning+shadows.
* Interesting gameplay with city management, building with blocks and a bit of tower defense to protect your colonies.
* Full? modsupport with steam workshop! <3
* Still only a handfull of mods, but they do bring ALOT of new interesting stuff!
* Multiplayer / Coop / Singleplayer 
* You can punch your settlers in the face
* A update post from the devs every friday / Active devs
* Superstable, have not have a single crash even with almost all current available mods installed.

Cons: ( Atleast at the time of writing, I mean it is early access and there is alot of stuff the devs are planing to add. A few of these are things I personaly wish they did add)
* Still only a handfull of mods, but they do bring ALOT of new interesting stuff! (Mod support were released 1ish week ago at the time of writing)
* You are not able to force assign beds for each settler wich beaks immersion a bit ( Not yeat atleast, I mean it is early access)
* No native "melee" soldiers. ( Not yeat atleast, I mean it is early access)
* No native doors or windows, mods can add both and for windows that is just awesome. But as for doors you have 2 mods that kind off solves it. First modd adds real doors that you can open and close BUT the npc's are not able to open/close them. The other mod adds doors you can open and close but NPCs just walk straight trough them.
* No real water dynamics / flowing so forget building ponds unless you use cheat commands / want to risk your world drowning.

So final verdict? Do I recommend this game? Hell yea! 10/10!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042368392', 'num_games_owned': 693, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 423, 'last_played': 1576439142}
review:
[h1][b]Hopefully someone reads this review before buying and possibly having second thoughts on this game[/b][/h1]

I'm going to make this quick and to the point. This game is a colony simulator and tower defence. You start with nothing, not even any colonists, and you build these epicly large colonies that take over a map. 

You eventually don't craft anything as your [strike]minions[/strike] colonists do it all. 

Graphics are sub par and could use some work, but with the shader the game uses it actually makes your builds look pretty damn great.

Check out the screenshots and artwork for this game. People have built amazing colonies, and you can too.

Disclaimer: It took me about 2 hours to actually get into this game, but I learned more by starting and fucking up than actually reading the guide. However, the guides in this game are pretty good, as is the community behind it.

Edit: Played a little bit more and they just keep continue to make this game better!

author: {'steamid': '76561198952607619', 'num_games_owned': 58, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1958, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1494, 'last_played': 1630151423}
review: This game is incredible as it combines survival and defense with colony management and industrialization. This results in a multitasking approach were you have to supply your colonists with items as well as producing items to keep them happy while defending against hordes of undead and starvation. Personally love this game as you also get to explore a multitude of biomes with friends as well as constructing engineering masterpieces to house and protect your colonist, the 2 man developer team has done an amzing job in creating this as well as somehow fitting it all in a 100 MB game size.

author: {'steamid': '76561198945323265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 10016, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1517, 'last_played': 1705460246}
review:
so far i've enjoyed the game, it gives a lot of creative freedom while keeping strategy important. i'll admit that starting up isn't easy, but once you progress it becomes easier.
you can build, mine and automate almost everything, but you'll need to make sure your defence is also functional. food and defence are main priorities at all times, so resources are not as important at first.

overall a great game to be as simple or complicated, but mostly as fun as you desire.
definitely recommend playing this

author: {'steamid': '76561198294096945', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1608788767}
review:
I like everything about it, except that you can't damage other players; the other players can just ransack your base with impunity.

It would be waaay better if you could:

1) At minimum, damage other players and have an alliance toggle that could be switched off to allow your guards to defend your place; But

2) Better yet, if there was an additional type of units for soldiers and you could have them follow you (with basic formations/fighting styles) to allow you to assault your friends/other players.

That would be grand. Please message me if you ever add this. I'll invite all my friends to get it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198044044078', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 889, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 426, 'last_played': 1575619604}
review: Overall this game has come a long was and is now alot of fun. I love the premise of setting up your main base and then getting to go out and make other colonies connected to your original base. Its like a minecraft mixed with Banished and i love it so far. I am only 7 hours in but can tell im not that far into the game yet. I hope the fun continues for dozens of hours to come.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113977866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7035, 'last_played': 1684593244}
review: A very relaxed game to play with friends and just have a good time. The sort of tower defence mode it has leads to some interesting designs of colonies and adds something for those more focused on the game to worry about. It may not be a game for everyone, but for the right person, it's outstanding.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006212023', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 14919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 307, 'playtime_at_review': 5971, 'last_played': 1712350956}
review:
If you like building games (like minecraft), and resource management games, this is for you. Its very much a 'build a town you like' rather than a 'build the perfect base' and is very relaxed. I find this is the perfect game to unwind after a long day when you're exhausted from adult world things and don't want to sink hours and hours into little progress. It lets you zone out and enjoy building your tiny empire as your minions gather resources around you. 

Plus, the visuals are stunning. 

Yes its early access, but the devs seem to regularly update the game and there are plenty of mods to change things up yourself. Nothing is horribly broken, although some graphics are in as place savers and you can't achieve them - but there's plenty of other things to do and 'completion' isn't really the aim of this game.

review:
According to all known laws
of aviation,

  
there is no way a bee
should be able to fly.

  
Its wings are too small to get
its fat little body off the ground.

  
The bee, of course, flies anyway

  
because bees don't care
what humans think is impossible.

  
Yellow, black. Yellow, black.
Yellow, black. Yellow, black.

  
Ooh, black and yellow!
Let's shake it up a little.

author: {'steamid': '76561198343470560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1680051859}
review: This game is way to much money to play together with friends. Colony survival is a game where you build a shelter and survive at night. This game uses no guns till you get to the end of the game. you start off by placing a flag that is where you recruit people to join you but you need a bed for them to sleep in and food so the first thing to do is build a small house to get started then get a berry farmer. But watch out zombies lurk in the night the more people you have the more zombies there are. if you have no people there are no zombies you could play where you just sit in a tree for hours but that's no fun so make sure to have a balanced colony with food a good defense and don't block the zombies from coming in or they will go into siege mode and destroy everything.

review:
The lack of tutorial, other than a PDF file that my computer couldn't open, made the game hard to understand. I couldn't even recruit a single colonist. I uninstalled and forgot this game completely. Months later I finally looked up a youtube video and realized what I was doing wrong.
Now I am really enjoying the game. I can only hope others don't fall into the same trap I did.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080564545', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 2709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1674213388}
review:
10 hours in and i've barely scratched the surface of this game! ITS SO DAMN FUN! I've ran into no bugs so far I love that building your base actually matters I also love that you can in a way direct the zombies path which is fun because I can build my base around it!

NOT TO MENTION! there is basically a "skill tree" or science tree which lets you unlock new things to help you advance your castle (or whatever you decide to make) so there is plenty of content!

AND AND AND..! You don't have to micromanage your people because you can make guys who just micromanage for you! GENIUS! these dev's are legendary!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005382194', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 42677, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12626, 'last_played': 1699545133}
review:
Summary checklist of what this game i think is.

City Management :   Check (not a simcity)
- Food Production
- Goods Distribution (between player colonies)
- Tech Research (Medieval Age currently:  statement might be missleading) 

Base Defense : Check
- Zombies (mindless dumb A.I.)
- Archers , Matchlock Gun Defenders (not varied but effective )

Creation: Half a check
- Limited or basic block availability (more soon hopefully)
- Community Mods Available to compensate

- Am i a creator ?   No. Full Check.
- Am i lazy ?   Yes. 
- Can colonists dig and harvest and build for me?    Yes !!!
- Glider for travel?    Yes !!!

Multiplayer things to note: 
- this is not a pvp area like minecraft
- look for anti-grief multiplayer servers
- colonists die if they run out of food (hassle to repopulate)

review: Imagine playing survival and building and terraforming all by yourself...not here in Colony Survival. This game has a new happiness system so not only are you tasked with repelling zombie swarms you also have to keep the populace happy or they revolt and become a free democratic country or they just get mad at you and not let you research. Very good game love the mechanics and excellent shading/textures. Overall fantastic cant wait till it is a full game.

review: It is very similar to Minecraft, but is different in the way that it is enjoyable, unlike a lot of minecraft variations. I have been playing it since it being played on Youtube, which was a while ago. I like how the game has automated NPC's which do a lot of work for you, which gives you the opprotunity to continue working on your society.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056737746', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2238, 'last_played': 1647270876}
review: For an Early access game the depth of development into the systems of automation that the colonists use is astounding. The game is a fun city building (sorta thing) if a little difficult at times but if you read the tutorial you should be fine instead of winging it like I did the first time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198273651219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 5715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1749, 'last_played': 1709668385}
review:
This is my new review for the latest pre outpost update
its a great game whilst a little grind'y is well worth the effort especially when you put time and effort into your designs 
i recommend this game to people who like chill gameplay with little threat unless you have zombies on
most of the multiplayer servers are bad and have little to no community but there are servers that have a positive community where you can relax even more 
the modding community for this game is also unique in the way that they mod in the flow of the game 
overall 9/10 game definitely recommend to a broad variety of players alike

author: {'steamid': '76561198371708507', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1326, 'last_played': 1708389262}
review: A mix of Minecraft and Simcity, this game is quite a unique specimen. I love the advancement, and the overall feel of a playthrough. My only complaint is a lack of micromanaging ability. For instance, I can't control which beds are occupied, and it can be difficult to predict the paths used by colonists. I'd also like some variety in food production options, defensive implements, and building materials. All in all, the game is off to a wonderful start, and I look forward to future updates.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069511993', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 18020, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12197, 'last_played': 1704048905}
review:
I enjoy Colony Survival because it allows me to build cool things similar to Minecraft but doesn't require me to gather all the resources myself.  You hire workers to mine/craft/farm resources and they just do it.  The only downside is you have to feed them but you can hire workers to make the food too. Then you can get on with whatever you were wanting to build.  Eventually you have to provide other items to your workers to keep them happy: which provides a nice puzzle of what to give them and how many workers you need to make whatever happiness items you are providing.

The developers are also very responsive to bug reports and questions on Discord and they are working to add new interesting content to the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075521847', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4447, 'last_played': 1687692841}
review:
Wow! What a great game. In my top 10 of all time.

I completed all achievements in 74 hours of casual gaming. The way in which you grow your colony is very rewarding and watching your army of colonists work has something very statisfying. I highly recommend the game for people who like tower defence/minecraft/city builder games. The achievements are a cool goal to reach but even after I expect to enjoy the game for many, many hours after. 
Bedankt mannen!

author: {'steamid': '76561198038133480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1489, 'last_played': 1640895048}
review:
If you like a crappy game with absolutely no interface, no explanations of anything, no way to track anything, no way to check what parts are required, no warnings of any type. 

If you enjoy playing a game for 20 hours just to have all of your villagers wiped out because they cant make arrows, because they need feathers, which is made in a chicken coop, which you are not able to even see in the chicken coop menu let alone control. 

If you enjoy a ripoff game that is not as good as any of the originals its based on, while simultaneously making every aspect of the game frustrating. Then LOOK NO FURTHER. 

THIS IS THE STEAMING PILE OF GARBAGE OF YOU. 

This is a good game for casual players who put in 1 to 1.5 hours into a game and then never go back to it again. You will definitely enjoy the 15 minutes of exploring before you realize how crappy the game is. 

THEY ADDED THE ABILITY TO GO TO OTHER LANDS AND MAKE NEW COLONIES.. but NO INTERFACE TO SHOW YOU WHAT COLONISTS YOUR ALREADY HAVE AND WHAT JOBS THEY DO.

Think about that for a minute. They literally DO NOT CARE at all about the actual gameplay. They just want to add crappy features to add to their game description. 

I WOULDNT RECOMMEND THIS GAME FOR FREE

author: {'steamid': '76561198049238857', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 7704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3458, 'last_played': 1691749359}
review:
It's a playable game that isn't a masterpiece, but it has potential.
Solid core gameplay, Decent graphics, Active developers and achievable achievements.

Some things like GUI, IE: more obvious HUD elements that respond faster such as Siege mode, not enough colonists to fill up jobs spam etc. the chat window just does not cut it and is very clutter-y
Tech tree could be smart, Copy pasting structured was a killer for me last time i tried this.
earlier digger/builder research, I'd like to manage the colony rather then dig in the mud for a year before i can focus on management/actual construction efforts.
The new food joy mechanics are confusing and unintuitive, why can't i just put the sliders to max and let them figure themselves out?
Maybe claimed beds and personal chests for colonists that are filled with their ration of food/joy items by a nighttime job who goes around filling them. and set times for collecting the items would also be awesome.
Escape pausing time in singleplayer?

TL;DR
This game is a glorious diamond in the rough. 
7/10 Would play again (after another few updates and new achievements)

author: {'steamid': '76561198072825401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3224, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3224, 'last_played': 1572064376}
review:
The initial instinct in this game is that since it looks like the leading voxel based creation game is to do everything yourself.  What I love about this game is that key difference.  Here, you're the head of this little colony, you're in charge of setting people to do the small tasks like growing and harvesting food, building tools and keeping them in the stockpile, even defending your colony from the walking dead in the night.  You aren't meant to be digging everything, collecting everything, but instead to plan out where you'll put things, how you'll build a working infrastructure to make this colony work the most efficiently you can.

There are only a handful of things I can honestly say that I would add to improve this game.  There is no compass or map, though (as far as I've seen) there are directions as the "arctic" biome is definitely in the opposite direction of the "tropic" biome, and the "east" and "new world" biomes are clearly on an eastern/western direction from those two.  Having a compass, having a map, these two things would definitely help in what is arguably the 2nd stage of this game:  expansion.

At some point you're going to be expected to strike out and set up a NEW colony, ideally in one of these other biomes so that you can benefit from the special materials or tasks within those locations.  I understand why it might not have been added prior to this change, but at this point I feel like it is something that should be added in as an ease of life change.

All things considered, I would fully recommend this game to anyone who enjoys resource management, survival, and building based games.  It's very easy to lose yourself for a few hours in it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026907270', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 50091, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38996, 'last_played': 1709960517}
review: This game received MAJOR updates at the end of 2022 as it left Early Access and entered its final release.  While most of the basic mechanics of the game haven't changes, it is absolutely worth another play if you played it before and enjoyed it.  I love the technology tree changes but also the way some of the resources exist only in certain regions so strongly encourage exploration and creating outposts for your colony which share stockpile inventory.  If you've never played this game before, it is a wonderful blend of tower defense base building, colony simulation and real time strategy.  its pacing keeps you busy planning, building and managing resource gathering, production & defenses .  It's very easy to lose track of time while playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090368653', 'num_games_owned': 797, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 8725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8644, 'last_played': 1633749397}
review:
Many compare this game to Minecraft, but that's largely inaccurate. The thing that makes a game what it is happens to be the systems of which it operates. Minecraft is a game that operates on block mechanics. Colony Survival is a game that operates on colony builder aspects. Saying the two games are similar is like saying the original Final Fantasy and Zelda games are similar. They look the same, and you move the same, but passed that they have nothing in common. The only linkage from them both being a voxel type game is that if you enjoy building creatively in Minecraft, then you will enjoy building creatively here.

The things that make this game unique and what would interest you is if you want to play a colony builder game in which you are a physical part of your colony. It's a complex and advanced resource managing colony game where you are playing first person in the middle of your colony and utilizes voxel mechanics to allow you to give everything your own personal touch. You can see each individual colonist stare at you with their lifeless eyes as they move to their jobs like drones and you construct their world around them.

This game was very fun but pretty bare-bones prior to the last large update, but 0.7 changed a lot. It added another metric of colony wide resource management at the macroscopic level (There is lots of micromanagement in the form of x resources go into y resources which are needed for z task).

I personally have gotten several hundred hours of enjoyment out of this game (I played a lot offline) and I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys colony builders and has always wanted them to be a little more interactive. 

Additionally: The developers have a very nice community that is fairly active on Discord, and the developers are very interactive and love feedback there. From their attitude and work ethic I can tell that this game is only going to grow in a positive direction, and I look forward to playing it every step of the way. 

Fully worth at full price.

review:
I've been watching this game for a long time and finally decided to get it.  I'm glad I did because I've really enjoyed the game and love how active the developers (only two guys) are with the game's community.  It's fun to manage the different colonies and I plan to get a copy for my wife so we can play together.  My niece also likes this game and tends to take over when she sees me playing, so giving a copy to my wife would allow my niece to play without me having to give up my own free-time.

Anyway, I don't normally get games that cost more than $10, but I made an exception here and I'm glad I did.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989280282', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 31313, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14988, 'last_played': 1631456933}
review:
Richtig gutes Aufbauspiel, dass einen schnell in seinen Bann ziehen kann.
Da das Spiel noch im Early-Access ist, werden einige Mechaniken nicht gut erklärt. Die Grundzüge bei Spielstart und darüber hinaus sowie einige Kniffe bei der Bedienung habe ich in einem Guide zusammengefasst.

Darum geht es in dem Spiel:
Abseits der Block-Optik bzw. -Mechanik hat es wenig mit Minecraft gemeinsam. Der Spieler gründet eine Kolonie und rekrutiert Kolonisten, die Rohstoffe sammeln und weiterverarbeiten. Der Spieler ist mehr ein Architekt für Gebäude und Verteidigungen. Je nach Einstellung (Standard ist nachts) greifen Zombies die Kolonie an. Auch hier übernehmen die Kolonisten die Arbeit.
Während eine schöne Kolonie gebaut wird, Munition für die Verteidiger produziert wird, müssen die stetig wachsenden Bedürfnisse der Kolonisten nach abwechslungsreicher Nahrung und Luxus-Produkten gestillt werden. Später reist man mit einem selbstgebauten Gleiter zu anderen Kontinenten, wo weitere Kolonien gegründet werden können. Seltene Rohstoffe gibt es nur außerhalb der "alten Welt".

review: Don't know about you but i find this game a fun small game to spent time in. If you don't know what this game is about the best way I can tell you about it is. Think of MineCraft and Tower Defense have a baby together that the best way i can place it. The core of the game is like Minecraft because it all blocks just like minecraft but here is where it change unlike Minecraft where you just build and mine in this game when you start your own Colony you got to protect your colonies that you get when you place your flag down , the zombie will then spawn 75 to 80 blocks away and will try to kill your people or get to the flag with is why you got to keep then zombie away from at all cost. Your colonies have all kind of jobs from unlock new thing to build with to growing food to feed all of your colonies with . I may only 9 hour in this game but i am dreaming big of what i can build on the inside of my Colony , and hoping to make a small city out of it

author: {'steamid': '76561197970635329', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 3794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1455, 'last_played': 1674339019}
review:
This is a wonderful mix of Minecraft and a true colony management simulator.  It also acts in part as a tower defense game, as you learn to cleverly place your slingers, archers, crossbowmen, and musketeers to murder the zombies that will attack your village at night.  

The game has a technology system that is conducted by your colonists, which provides good pacing and colony progression.  

Colony Survival is also perfectly stable (at least for me) as of alpha .7.  I look forward to see what the developers add in the future, but as it stands, the game is in a great state to buy and play now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046998085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 16362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9122, 'last_played': 1710228465}
review:
This game had a LOT of potential. I was very enthusiastic about it a year ago. Sort of like a Minecraft not tied to the Java VM and therefor much better performance and without the pixelated blockynesss of Minecraft. The landscape is almost photorealistic with beaches, lakes, forests, meadows, mountains and you can have the view distance set to high without performance loss so you always have scenery in the background. The sky is realistic looking with clouds and atmospheric scattering effects that make for realistic looking red sunrises. Night has realistic looking starfield. It feels like you are really outside.

This would have been a GREAT chassis for a game creator set for Minecraft style building games if the devs had made it fully moddable and if you could control everything with user scripts.

Unfortunately, this is not the case and you are limited to the gameplay created by the devs. That gameplay feels like a demo game included with a game creator programs. If this was actually a game creator, I would recommend it even if it was $50-$100, and I would be enthuastically writing my own scripts and mods just like many people do in Minecraft. This could have been an improved Minecraft. 

The game can actually be modded, but you don't have full control, and you can just make custom recipes and not really change the gameplay provided by the devs. You actually need to install Visual Studio to even make a mod.


The gameplay was tolerable a year ago because there was hope it would be improved later. But now, instead of fixing problems with the prototype, they just added new kinds of foods and luxury goods,and left the problems unfixed.

What gameplay is like. You want bread, so you designate 5 wheat plots, put a miller station, and a baker station. Then you recruit a villager. You want him to farm the wheat plot, but you have no control over about who goes where. Odd in a game with multi-tier supply chains. He may very well go to the baker station and do nothing as there is no flour, then starve. You must delete miller and baker stations to insure he goes to farm. When there is enough wheat, you can not deactivate the farm, you must delete it. Then put down the miller station. Miller will happily mill forever until he starves as there is no bread. When there is enough flour, delete the miller station and put down the baker station to finally get bread and not starve. When the flour is used up, baker will be idle and eat the bread and starve. So rebuild the wheat plot on the same place you deleted it and delete the baker station and start the process anew. 

With the upgrade they added more complexity to the bread change. Now bread needs water from a water gatherer and buckets. This added complexity made it unplayable.

If you could make user scripts, it would be trivial to write a script to allocate jobs automatically. But you can't, so you have to micromanage.

The zombies have 1 rule. They can only climbe up one block, two blocs high blocks their path. Build a 2 block high wood fence around your town and they can't get in. Build a maze for zombies to move back and forth in, and elevated platforms for guards to shoot down on them. If it was scriptable, zombies could be modified to try and break down walls, climb over walls. But it is not scriptable.

Adequate as a game creator demo game, but not a real one. But it is not a game creator.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003585036', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 3746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3567, 'last_played': 1567328046}
review:
Great game!

I started playing after the regions update and its awesome. You build your colony, feed colonists and defend against zombies. The more people you have, the more zombies will spawn. People also need happiness, every new colonist makes the happiness go down. Managing happiness is a nice feature, so it's not too easy to grow later on.

There's tons of research and different crafting benches. Safe zone around the banner increases with research. Starts with 30 block radius and ends with 100. Building new walls and claiming more farmland is pretty cool.

At some point you unlock builders/diggers. Bigger projects can be done by colonists, no more manual labor!

Once your first colony is big enough, you can go exploring and build more colonies in other regions. Far east, New world and Tropics. Each region has their own unique resources and science (along with a lot of common resources). You can trade between colonies.

Worth checking out!

author: {'steamid': '76561198085934381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 13002, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3261, 'last_played': 1677563175}
review: Most survival and building games lack what this game offers, a reason for the various shops, homes, and workplaces other than aesthetics. Here, you build them out of necessity, but it never seems like an annoying chore. I always get more excited when I have to build something new. Even when not in full release, this game is more than worth it's purchase price. Now, graphics are a little hit and miss compared to other block based games, especially the water, but it truly doesn't matter compared to what else is here. The control and the feeling of growth truly shines. This game is a must have for people who love survival and base building. And for the cherry on top, the devs are completely open about what's going on and they make their priorities and changes based on the community. A lot of other companies and developers could learn a thing or 2 from these guys!

author: {'steamid': '76561198272074087', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5549, 'last_played': 1705206588}
review: Played a ton of hours with my buddy and we loved every bit of the game. Great content and great writing..... Then the game broke. Were messing with some settings and game crashed. A little disappointing for that night. But here is the best part; we contacted the devs and a very rapid response occurred. The developer got our information and then guided my friend step by step to fix the problem. Worked immediately after that. That to me is more important than a lot of other "problems" the game may have (which is next to none). All in all, Colony Survival is a great solid game with days of creativeness and days of expanding but the main selling point are the thoughtful Developers who go above and beyond to satisfy their player base.                        THANK YOU DEVS FROM DYLANPABLO AND BABYDOOGEYHOWZER

author: {'steamid': '76561198130420155', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 779, 'last_played': 1660243982}
review:
This game used to be really fun because of its simplicity back when it was first released and youtubers like oompaville were just starting to make videos on it. But now, after coming back to the game after so long, there are just way too many things to learn and keep track of and the little help menu thing has a pitifully small amount of helpful information. This game needs a proper in-depth tutorial besides a little handbook that teaches you very little about  the actual gameplay. Right now, the game is just a chore to get through because you'll have no idea what you're doing for the first few hours and by the time you do know what you're doing, you'll realize that it's just more work than fun. I really wish I could go back to when the game was just, farms, guards, and a few mines. The game is so complex now that getting into it can seem like a daunting task to newcommers and a chore for most long-time fans, and I used to be one of them.

long story short, don't buy this game if you're not willing to put some hours into learning the ropes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018651108', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2225, 'last_played': 1639247207}
review:
This game is for people who:
1. Like simulator/city builder games
2. Enjoyed Minecraft's style of gameplay but wanted more direction
3. Can appreciate a simple elegance in game design

This game is not for people who:
1. Want to fight challenging zombies (their AI is not complex)
2. Want an engaging storyline
3. Want 100% realistic graphics
4. Someone who needs inherent controller support (as of this writing anyway, may become irrelevant in the future)

This game is simple but elegant in its execution. At first glance it's a block style, first-person game like Minecraft. But you plant a banner to erect a safe area, mine/excavate just enough to hire a little drone citizen to go do it for you, and suddenly the possibilities open up before you. You can have underground farms next to your miners, you can keep your guards as slingshot guards forever for a challenge and just keep hiring more instead of upgrading them, you can build your safe space on a bridge and try to build a sky colony, whatever. And the graphics are strikingly detailed in texture, but simple in structure. It's hard to explain. The stones look like real hewn stone. The snozzberries look like snozzberries, etc. :P The citizens are very...smooth, in contrast. Their simplicity fits the game though, I'm just not doing it justice here.

But the game's unlock system does railroad you in some ways. You can't move miner blocks to more convenient locations. You have to have a forever increasing quantity of farms/cooks to sustain your citizens. You have to produce certain products to be able to unlock things you want. The late game progression is still a significant work in progress.

Speaking of progress, in the past year they've made SO many good updates, and if you come into it with the right mindset it'll be a great, mostly relaxing experience for you (fully relaxing if you turn off zombies entirely, haha). If you're expecting a fully finished game, come back in a year or so and check in again to see if it's closer to what you want.

I play this game at least once a week after each patch so I can test out the changes. And I love it. it's a great addition to my weekends--just chilling on my sofa with my cat, running around wondering how to place 6 100sq farms in my 1000 sq safe space without disrupting my other production systems, so I can get enough resources to increase the size of my safe area. etc.

review:
Surprisingly very good. A lot of necessary features are not yet implemented but even in this state the game delivers both as a sandbox and as a single player town development game. 

With that being said, please add the abilty to increase speed of the game (without it Colony Survival feels quite tedious, especially at nights), and detailed statistics (especially on the production and consumption of food). Also bread is OP.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046328344', 'num_games_owned': 247, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 374, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 374, 'last_played': 1565621505}
review:
Imagine Minecraft, but the website version from 2010, where decorating and placing blocks is the only thing to do, now add in AI that will replant and harvest crops. You dont need food, or armor or weapons, so the food is just to keep them "alive". you left click to break and right click to place, and just try to do all the achievements like "get 50 villagers" or "break a snow block". The whole point of the game is to "research" new things, like olive farming and traders, you can buy dirt from traders, woohoo!. and build a roleplay castle. (obvious time-sink to evade refunds)

there are "zombies", but they are pointless, you dont gain anything from having them on, so you might aswell just disable them in the settings.

for 20$, buy minecraft, or banished, or any game other than his heap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219712477', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 180, 'last_played': 1667053207}

author: {'steamid': '76561198104203209', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 7395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1427, 'last_played': 1698000726}
review:
It's a solid colony sim with very reasonable performance.
It's light on micro management. You can flip wheat farmers between 2 plots to fully utilize their work time, but that's tedious and not the intended way. You're supposed to place them far away from your center since they take so much space and don't benefit from short travel distance. There are few other micro managements like flipping night guards to day guards, but it's the same idea. Too tedious and not worth your time investment.
The game allows you to be very efficient with your setup. You can dig out a whole new floor underneath your base or build up and build a bed skyscraper. You can also be creative and build something cool, like a medieval castle or an underground hideout. I tend to go for efficiency because I find it tedious to build huge impressive structures.
It's multiplayer which immediately gives it a step above most other colony sims. It does wonders being able to cooperate with friends in such a game.
The development is a bit slow, but it's a passion project, not an industrial product. It's to be expected.

The game has developed nicely since I first played it and it's in a good spot right now. You can see how it looks. If you think you'll like it, you'll like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056680191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1272, 'last_played': 1661301957}
review: Don't let the graphics deceive, the game has a lot of depth and is not your typical Minecraft clone. It is a block based game, but is about managing your own colony (or colonies now?). You have to balance jobs to ensure you have enough resources and food at all times. You must also ensure the zombies can't get to your colony, so the game is kind of like a tower defense in the way that you have to run the zombies through a certain path and ensure you have the guards to cut down their numbers as they move. The developers are very active and listen to community feedback, taking polls and actively responding to player concerns.

author: {'steamid': '76561198975637292', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1136, 'last_played': 1566778436}
review:
バージョンが変わったらワールドがひらけなくなった
ゲーム自は面白いけど、長い間やってきたワールドが開けなくなったのは悲しい
developer_response:
Hi, older worlds can be accessed by switching the game to an older version. Go to the Steam Library, right-click Colony Survival, properties > betas > 0.6.3.
Nearly all new updates allow players to continue playing in their old worlds. The most recent update, 0.7.0, was a gigantic update and it's the exception to the rule. The coming updates don't require you to start a new world again :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197984547082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 4097, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3122, 'last_played': 1595956532}
review:
This game is very deceiving by its very simple and dated looks, if the triple A games are big as an ocean and shallow as a puddle of piss, Colony Survival is like Tardis, doesnt look like much buts its very deep and complex inside. Perfect game to relax, put on an audio book or a podcast and express your creativity, while managing production lines and food/ammo supply.

author: {'steamid': '76561198252480270', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3586, 'last_played': 1616803280}
review:
This game is like a brilliant hybrid of Minecraft and Factorio in a medieval time frame. Update 0.7.0 brought a boat load of content that the game desperately needed and transformed the game into something i cannot recommend enough!

A long with a huge host of new roles and items, the new update brought the happiness system which you must manage on top of the defences and food production that was already present. This has added much more depth and difficulty to growing your colony and requires more thought and logistics than before.

Another brilliant part of the new update is the ability to create colonies in different regions, which unlock unique luxury items and jobs. This is great as it gives you a reason to make multiple colonies, gives you a chance to make themed colonies and adds lots more potential play time to each playthrough.

Definitely worth the price tag, and the Devs are awesome people and have great communication with the community 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198095941198', 'num_games_owned': 49, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1498753278}
review:
I want to play this game but last time I bought the game I couldn't even jump high enough to get over a single block and made the game un-playable.

wish I had more confidence but it seemed to play fine for everyone else but me and I still don't know why. I had to get a refund and get rid of the game, I was so mad that I payed for something that was literally almost Impossible to play. 

I suppose it was possible to play as long as you didn't want to go up at all so clearing out an area on the same level plain you spawn on and try filling in the lower areas without dropping down would be the only way it would be playable then you need to make sure you have enough resources on the plain you spawn on to get wood and stuff and be able to make a tree farm so you could play it to some degree.

Keep in mind this was a while ago. I did record the issue and sent the video when I requested a refund.
developer_response:
Hey! 

The "not being able to jump"-bug was a problem for players with low FPS in the first months after release. It has been fixed for a while now. We can pretty much guarantee that you will not encounter that problem again! 

I don't think Steam will have issues with a second refund if you don't exceed a total playtime of two hours. If the problem persists ánd Steam won't allow a refund, than I think we can do a manual override and still grant the refund!

author: {'steamid': '76561198247356110', 'num_games_owned': 437, 'num_reviews': 123, 'playtime_forever': 1881, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1672, 'last_played': 1684473420}
review:
I love my city building games! and when i purchased this i was thinking it would be RTS but minecraft. imagine my suprise, at first i was like Oh..... OHHHHHHHH!! 
ya your right there with your broslaves creating this city with the idea of imminant zombie invasion! So far i have turned zombies and happiness off, so i can freely create a strong base THEN activate zomz. and i keep pushing it off like, just a little more economy, maybe some big walls, oh my guys need a house! ya i just keep pushing it off haha. and the idea that there is even more coming into this game due to the early access makes me even more excited! the devs have put in a lot of thought, and it shows! i feel minecraft and others will try to absorb and implement some of there ideas. I thank you devs for bringing me peacefull times, playing your game has brought me so much joy, i bought my bro a copy....cuse ya.

There is freaking multiplayer!!!!   XD

Notes to devs:  Please add some backround music! i usually just goto youtube and look up medieval music. it fits pretty well!

author: {'steamid': '76561197970672727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 120770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66316, 'last_played': 1672336651}
review:
OK. WOW!

I've played this for a while, but it always kind of got stale because of the limited mechanics. However, the 0.70 update has modified the mechanics to make this an actual colony management survival game. Happiness of your people directly impacts the success of your game play. It is a well done and balanced addition to the game that almost makes it a new game. If you played prior to 7/25/19, give it another play through, it is SO much better now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198404253990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 895, 'last_played': 1693523052}
review:
What Minecraft wishes it was and what it should have been.
I came across this game a little over a year ago watch Drae(gast) play it on youtube. I enjoyed watching game play so I bought a copy of it and have not regret it one bit. I love everything about it. Starting from nothing and build until you are as big as you want to be. Place your flag,claim your ground,build your castle,recruit colonist,start farms,hire fishermen,raise chickens,and fight off bigger and bigger hoards of zombies every night (and day if you choose). The graphics are beautiful and the lighting is perfect. I cant say enough about how much I love Colony Survival so I'd suggest this to any kind of gamer Casual,Hardcore young or old. It's a great and even relaxing way to spend a few hours of your time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000088094', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 293, 'playtime_forever': 1883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1677117762}
review:
Updated review - 1/22/2023
The game seems to be transforming into something greater like a work of art in development. 
Just amazing!!! 

A special message to the devs: thank you so much for all your work and dedication. i did not think I would be sending this message but the game is getting mad updates all the time. 

It's like a programmable minecraft and much more. All future updates are very welcome and I am sure I will be amazed where this game goes in the future.


----------------------------------
Original review:
It's a good game but the updates are kinda slow


All good intentions are there but I'm kinda getting tired of the game as it is. It could be great but so many details hold it back due to slow updates. Time passes fast in the game world, new games are released. I have doubts that this game will keep up. It's cool but only for a limited time.

Update 1/16/2020 : So much time has passed. So many improvements could have been done but NO. It could have been so good.

Update 3/5/2021: more than a year has passed since my last update. The devs are still talking about logistics and pathfinding. 

I'm about to change my review to negative.

author: {'steamid': '76561198343012875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3385, 'last_played': 1565286391}
review:
Amazing game, amazing concept, amazing Devs. 

First person, voxel, sandbox game, where you start almost from scratch by manually cutting trees & digging to ores and go up to automated multiple colonies with thousands of people and hundreds of construction workers that could terraform and build millions of blocks.

Blueprints mechanics (so we can make blueprints from any already existing structures in our colony and construction workers can build according to them, or downloaded workshop blueprints) would be insane for this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198026801404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 20911, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6765, 'last_played': 1683590925}
review:
This is a really fun game. A great management/survival/sandbox game that can be really addictive, as you can see from my hours played.  

Build colonies that can have over 1000 guys in them, and you can even build multiple colonies and trade between them in the same world.  Survive hordes of monsters/zombies and build castles/mazes and hire guards to defend against them.

It's voxel based, so the game isn't super gorgeous, but it does allow a lot of creativity in how you build you colony (or how you order you colonists to build it).  It's also well optimized, so the game can run 1000+ colonists with no stuttering in frames.

For $20 it's a steal, and with more content planned for the future this game could make rimworld look like a joke.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068951842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 165, 'playtime_forever': 960, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 687, 'last_played': 1566056269}
review:
Let's compare this to Minecraft since that's probably why you're reading this.

Imagine Minecraft with Factorio-like crafting handled by pawns instead of conveyor belts. The pawns need food, beds and happiness. The more pawns, the more and better quality you need to provide. Throughout the day your dudes will work and gather for you, while at night your guards will defend your dudes from the zombies. It's a simple formula, but I find it fun having a sense of direction when making building, and it's rewarding to see the pawns use the space that I created for them. 

The devs are extremely responsive and helpful, and they're not afraid to let you know what they're working on. Highly recommended if the type of game interests you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010386277', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 7328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 829, 'last_played': 1645480219}
review:
what can i say about this game...

i guess, dont trust the pictures. And i mean that like, they make the game look a lot worse than it is. seriously, i had this game sitting in my wishlist for MONTHS thinking "if someone gifts it to me, fine, but im not spending money on it". because the pictures and video make it look so bad. the concept is great, but the pics look, bad.

so how is the game actually? really, really, fuckin fun. 
its clearly missing things, its Early access of course, but its good. its like minecraft, it takes obvious design inspiration from it, and a tower defense.

once your colony gets started, enemies spawn. their amount and strength depend on how many colonists you have. focus heavily on food to start with. food is your main resource. build it up high. your secondary resource for much of the early game, is ammo. but these tend to flip later on.

the pictures make the game seem like this poorly made, soulless factory farm simulator. with a touch of building thrown in. and i was determined to play the game how i wanted. as soon as i started, i knew what i wanted to build and how. i turned myself to the direction of the nearest mountain, and ran for it. i built a multi-tiered colony on the side of the mountain, building new terraces for space as i went on. i take pictures of it every day i finish playing. and the view, is, beautiful. 

ive always wanted to control a village in minecraft. and this game feels as close to that as it gets for the time being. i cant wait for more updates. i plan to make my next colony, built on one of the islands off the coast and have a Big long bridge to the mainland as the only entrance. sounds like a fun time, like this game.


i will say, there are plenty of "oh shit" moments ive had. enemies cant climb over 2 blocks high. but while building my colony, such as it is, ive missed spots before while adding new areas. missed 1 block i didnt add to, and next thing i know, im dead and a flood of enemies are coming through the gap. watch your ass, check your blocks. lol 
you also lose everything on your toolbar when you die. you CANNOT get them back. so if youre going to be in danger, slot only what you can afford to lose. 
i accidentally died with a full stack of 200 planks. i had not realized those were the last ones i had. the next 10 minutes was frantic to say the least. rushing to grab enough wood to make enough planks fast enough to prevent myself from running out of arrows before nightfall.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086522114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 700, 'last_played': 1569779657}
review:
Colony Survival 101

Day 1: 
Colony is started, but our food stock is soon to run out. we need to secure a food source... fast.

Day 7: 
We Finally got a baker! We've got Bread Production up and Running, Atleast we won't go Hungry.

Day 25: 
Always eating bread is growing a bit tiring now, wish we had some Berries...

Day 63: 
I don't know. The baker seems a bit Suspisous. He's stopped sleeping and barely drinks anymore, Should keep an eye on him...

Day 263:
It doesn't stop! The baker! He's gone mad! Always makin bread, never enough. It DOESN'T END!!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198246188050', 'num_games_owned': 112, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4730, 'last_played': 1674627119}
review: This game is extremely addictive with the base building aspects of Minecraft along with the resource management aspect of other colonist games. what makes this game so great is yous have that 3d aspect allowing you to make what ever you like and see how people would interact with that creation. my only problem with the game is that the colonist AI is quite buggy and they sometimes cant find a path to their work or bed even though there is a clear path to that said thing. Although the AI does have trouble some times it is most the time an easy fix like making a walk way wider or a cave/entrance taller. all together this game is extremely fun and I recommend it to any one that enjoys strategy or Minecraft. p.s. I enjoy this game more than Minecraft (don't tell Mojang)

author: {'steamid': '76561198075464384', 'num_games_owned': 919, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 19769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2925, 'last_played': 1704648120}
review:
Extremely enjoyable game, the devs are great and i'm not having any regrets about this purchase. After you initially set up a self sustaining colony the game becomes extremely relaxing, watching your colonists (slaves) rise out of their beds in the morning to get out on the fields is truly heartwarming. Observing their struggle against the unending zomebie hordes is mildly amusing.
Building feels satisfying and relaxing. You can just go about your day/night building things while the slave population takes care of business!

author: {'steamid': '76561198001394422', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1149, 'last_played': 1563257876}
review: Game is pretty fun. Haven't played too much of the base 0.6 version. I jumped onto the 0.7 beta right away with a friend and have been having a blast. There's mods and texture packs out, too, so the potential of this game is pretty amazing already. The Discord is pretty active and friendly. Great community. Would definitely recommend if a combination of minecraft, colony/worker management, and simple tower defense sounds neat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001372944', 'num_games_owned': 858, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 544, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1603384590}
review: I haven't come across many more active developers than this. This is the kind of developer where you can have a one on one chat on discord about issues and features. The game has a long way to go but I have full confidence that it will go far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054758017', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 3143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 692, 'last_played': 1620446961}
review:
I'd say the game is essentially an overpriced Minecraft Clone with mods and very finicky/odd pathfinding. 

It's fun I guess but it's missing huge huge things that would make it even better such as Colonist happiness, water, specific crafters (priority carries over so you either have everyone doing the same thing like craft ammo or no one craft ammo), lack of weapon animations, and you're essentially a god that can punch his way through stone and any block but dies to zombies with ease. 
Would honestly be better if they did take it 1 step further for the god mechanic to separate it from Minecraft (not sure how).

0.7 looks like it'll make the game significantly better as well. Sadly it requires doing rather annoying things to get into so i'll have to wait until the release to try it out.

Overall though as it stands it looks semi-promising and i'd say as of now if it goes on sale for $10 or $15 it'd be worth buying. As it stands currently you should be able to especially if you're playing the very finicky MP with coop mods get 10 hours of enjoyment. Maybe not much more though?

I don't often rate game but this one really deserves it for starters i love the simple yet detailed blocks and the idea behind it is great! all of this with the tech tree is great way to play a nice relaxing game my only request for this is to have the option to always have the blocks your aiming at be outlined other then that this game is fantastic

author: {'steamid': '76561198045771730', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 978, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 929, 'last_played': 1616982226}
review:
Very enjoyable game. My only complaint is that is a bit to basic in every area. Production lines are mostly distant from each other so production is somewhat streamlined. It only gets near factorio level complexity near the end of the research tree. The research tree doesnt offer much. Most of the interesting things are basic level and after that its mostly just more of the same be it bigger build area, better guards ect. There is only one monster type and the only variance is just different speeds and hp bars. I like the tower defense aspect, but since there is only zombies, it boils down to stacking guards at your entrance and building 2 block moats that snake the enemies in front of your base. I would like to see a larger variety in enemy types to shake this up. Maybe some that can fly, bridge gaps, shoot arrows, climb walls, or sap walls for example. That would certainly make night more fun to design around. 
Also the safe zone is personally a tad small. Id love to bust out some crazy cool castle and building designs but the small safe zone ends up making me go for geometric space efficient buildings. I also wish that there was more block types with more colors and textures. Most of my buildings end up looking similar due to the last two points. Lastly, id love to see some kind of logistic system. Currently, all you need to do is just make a ton of chests and plop them next to work areas since all of the chests inventories are all linked. I think that this game would benefit from implementing some kind of logistics system.

Reading over this review again, I realize that it may seem like i dont enjoy this game, but i do like it and i cant wait to see where it goes from here. I just want to see the game reach its full potential and i think addressing the points above would take it from good to great.

review:
This is an Early Access Game, so unsurprising the networking issues still need some work.

I was unable to get this game to work due to network issues.  Unfortunately errors would result in being sent back to the home-screen with no visible error, making it hard to debug what went wrong.
Attempted to go through the discussion boards on how to fix the issues for quite some time, but was unsuccessful.

Hoping error feedback is improved / general network issues resolved.

It seems other people are able to connect fine, so maybe you'll be fine to.

Update: With the recent patch network connectivity seems to have improved

author: {'steamid': '76561197961802333', 'num_games_owned': 575, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 7708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6532, 'last_played': 1670764151}
review:
From top to bottom this game is extremely crude. From the art assets that look like something from a child's art portfolio to the less than player friendly game mechanics that feel like they came straight from that one custom Warcraft 3 map you downloaded that one afternoon.

If you can get past how ugly the game is, though, you will find something I think is wonderful and unique. It's like Minecraft but you have a village of people that all need food and, beds and, to not die from zombie attacks. While you can forage, construct beds and, fight zombies all on your own you simply can't keep up with it forever. So, before long, you have berry foragers, builders and, fighters who all need their own food, beds and not dying. Oh my. Such a game.

Basically if you loved Minecraft and thought it would be vastly improved with a tycoon element and bloom lighting then this is the game for you.  :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198161934621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1562247101}
review:
Was auf den ersten Blick interessant aussieht, ist nach 1h effektiver Spielzeit langweilig.
Eine kleine Mauer rundum mit einem Eingang, ein paar Guards davor positionieren und selbst mit Mods, die die Monster viel stärker machen ist keine Herausforderung mehr da. Man hat quasi keine Probleme mehr. Es wird nicht schwerer. Für mich überhaupt kein Anreiz mehr etwas zu machen, das Dorf versorgt und beschützt sich selbst. 
Keine anderen Mobtypen, keine größeren Wellen. Keine Krankheiten, Brände oder Anderes worum man sich Kümmern müsste.

20 Euro für dieses Spiel:
- immer gleiche Laufanimation, egal ob Rückwärts, Vorwärts oder Seitwärts
- Sprinten kaum Spürbar, nur durch vergleich im Multiplayer mit einem Freund überhaupt herausgefunden
- Kopf dreht sich nicht, starrer Körper
- Texturen sind teilweise kaum unterscheidbar
- Texturen sehen furchtbar aus (Sand, Wasser, Baumstamm, Grass, Quasi gesamte Umgebung)
- Charakter Aussehen
+ einige wenige Texturen haben einen 3D-Effekt, der sogar gut aussieht
+ Licht(-Effekte)
+ Himmel
- Pathfinding der NPC's nur in X-, Y und Z-Richtung
  keine direkten Wegpfade/keine Bewegung zeitgleich in 2 Achsen 
***Cut***
schon zuviel Zeit verschwendet. 

Fazit: Kauft euch lieber ein Anderes Spiel mit Blöcken, da hab ihr eine viel größere Community und mehr Möglichkeiten, wenn ihr etwas bauen wollt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065834834', 'num_games_owned': 125, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 396, 'last_played': 1566958072}
review: This is a fun tower defense survival game, the only thing I will say is that there needs to be an added level of complexity soon or else the gameplay will begin to get stale. And this goes without saying, but it is much more fun with friends

author: {'steamid': '76561198071078534', 'num_games_owned': 285, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6806, 'last_played': 1685729386}
review: I'm sure that everyone compares this game to minecraft and they would be right to a point. You collect wood, mine stone, craft stuff and make block houses. However as soon as you get a colony up and running it becomes less tedious. Your colonists can mine stone, ores, chop trees, harvest fields and lots more. The great part about this game is the fact that they are constantly updating it. I am currently running the 0.7 Beta and the amount of stuff and changes mean that you can keep coming back to it

author: {'steamid': '76561198187835859', 'num_games_owned': 245, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 6058, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3002, 'last_played': 1690182587}
review:
How to describe Colony survival?
I wouldn’t describe it like Minecraft. More like Factorio with a design trying to copy Minecraft with a medium optifine filter with tower defense elements. It’s a very bad description since it factorio is about machines you need to fuel and this is about people you need to feed and defend but I personally can’t think of a shorter TL:DR Summery.

This is going to be ‘spoiler heavy’. There isn’t anything like story spoilers but potential gameplay spoilers since it has a slight flow to each game.


The main goal in CS (I’ll call it that) is to make your entire game Automated which is actually pretty easy to do in the early game; berry farmers, miners mining stone, slingers and someone crafting a butt ton of slings and stones with a wall around your base to channel zombies into a line for example. You could end the game there; no upgrading or anything and you’d be safe forever. However, who is going to stop there? It becomes a secondary goal to turn this humble village you’ve made into something greater.

So you start to expand; research wheat but you realize it takes time to make bread so you employ more people to help make bread but now there are more monsters so you upgrade to bows but to make bows you need bronze so you go into the mine and find some copper and tin, get your new crafting bench to make the copper bench and a new guy to help make the arrows needed but oh no; your wheat farms have run out of seeds since you only have so many till you can get the store and because of this you’re slowly running out of food. You start losing your colonists because of starvation and you just pray no one essential to the defense of your village dies, so that’d be your miners, crafters and defenders. You luck out and none of them die: instead all your berry farmers die; literally the only people making food. Your village starves to death. The end.

Of course, this won’t always happen. The thing I love about CS is that while its main goal is to automate everything you have multiple hurdles to jump past if you want to make a successful colony. And as you progress through the game you actually have to become incredibly reliant on your colonists and planning farms as such as you can’t actually craft half the stuff you can obtain but colonists can, and once you have at least 75 colonists the zombies will become too numerous to hold out against by yourself. 

It’s a game of either great but well worth it risks or a slow but safe build up.
Also, I knew the Unity engine could be used for some pretty impressive and stunning games (like Cities Skylines) but holy s**t, I couldn’t even tell this was Unity.

If there was something, I could add… probably more verity in zombies rather than just increasing health and random speed… maybe one that can create ladders to scale walls and a colonist job that could counter it? Basically, I personally find the defense quite lacking since you can just make a maze trail for the zombies to walk through while being whittled down by defenders on walls surrounding the maze.
Also, another thing: This game can be corrupted easily. 3 of the 5 games I’ve played was struck by corruption to the save file; not saving parts properly and such. Usually happened when I crashed, of course. I’d assume it could be fixed by having the game autosave in the morning rather when you exit the game.

Final score: I’d give it an 9/10. I personally lacking combat wise since there are only 4 tiers of ranged weapons to use and 3 types of zombies, but I love the satisfaction of fixing your colony from the brink of a great disaster and seeing just how you expand it (I personally like trying to go for efficiency over aesthetic and even then it still looks pretty cool). Honestly, get this game even if it’s not on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994335554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 2860, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2860, 'last_played': 1526474857}

author: {'steamid': '76561198116121168', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 537, 'last_played': 1564186216}
review:
To be honest, it's sorta fun for the first few hours. Afterwards, it really does turn into just a grind-fest. So let's just delve into it:

Cons:

-The colony size limit.
You'll be given a limit to where you can build until much later on, meaning you can't really build anything too interesting if you still wish to be efficient with your farming and crafting. This land limit happens to be a bland square too, meaning it heavily restricts your building styles early on as well, as it really isn't beneficial to build on a coast, or anything other than a plains. It's just benificial to build a square wall, with everything else being squares.

-Technology/research & the useless items
The technology tree is just such a grind at the moment. Most of the items in the game have no other use than to be used to craft more useless items in the hopes of eventually down the line getting something of use. In other words: it's just a load of unnecesary artificial difficulty. When researching something in a game, you should feel a sense of accomplishment when you finish researching it. Not a sense of "ugh finally.. what's next then..?". There's so much missed potential here too, like for example how swords are literally used for nothing but crafting, instead of being able to maybe make melee soldiers or even melee better yourself. 

-Poor production interface.
I find that it's also more of a hassle to automate the production of something with these useless items as well, due to the fact that you need a dozen in order to make one actually useful item. Because of this, if your production of one thing falls apart, quite literally your whole colony will too. It's very hard to keep track of whether or not you have a surplus of anything later on due to the sheer amount of random useless crap you have to produce. It would be greatly appreciated if there was a production interface of sorts to help players manage what their deficits and surpluses are. 

-Minor things yet to be implemented.
The game has alot of very minor things that are yet to be implemented, that i believe would be nice to have in the game. Small things that make you constantly go "why isn't that in the game". Such as how there are only 1 type of planks you can craft at the start, despite there being two types of logs. The previously mentioned lack of melee. Stuff like that. Trust me, when you play the game, you'll find alot of minor things that'll bug you.
---
Now for the pros:

-The concept
The concept itself is rather cool. To build up a city of dudes is interesting, as you have to divert your attention to not only making the city, but defending it from zombies. Think of it like if sanctum, age of empires and minecraft had a child.. The concept would be this. In all honesty though, I can't think of any other pros that distinguish this game other than the concept itself. 

---

TLDR:
The game has a huge amount of potential, and given some time, I believe it'll be very much worth the 20$ price tag. For the time being though, the artificial difficulty, the lack of content and the general grind (which can be attributed partly to the artificial difficulty and lack of content) really does not make it feel worth it. I personally feel like the game should be worth 10$ in its current state, but I do eagerly look forward to potential updates that can remedy my issues with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140731976', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3619, 'last_played': 1642043214}

author: {'steamid': '76561198097676913', 'num_games_owned': 2040, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 925, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 925, 'last_played': 1561338950}
review:
--- GAMEPLAY ---
I really enjoy the base building in this game. There are a great amount of options to build with and all textures work well with eachother. For the most part I tried to make all the building I did tied in with a practical side of things to defend against the zombies. This gave a pretty fun twist for building games. Speaking of the base defence I do think the game scales really well. From helping your defence with a sling shot to have rows on rows of  NPCs day and night.

If I would have to bring up any major problems with the game I would say I found it pretty difficult to learn it at first. I had some knowledge through watching gameplay online but even in-game I did have some issues learning some of the mechanics and getting used to the menus.

--- Worth The Price ---
At the time of review the price is:£15.49
Worth the price? Yes

--- SCORE ---
7 / 10

TLDR

Pros:
Great building
Beautiful game

Cons:
Mechanics hard to learn

author: {'steamid': '76561198153007251', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1562152153}
review:
After some time I thought they would rework the UI and add animations to the villager, they did not! The UI isn't well designed, the "villagers" or townfolks are badly animated, the graphics are "OK", I really don't like the block skins and the first person view is also a bit strange.
For 19,99€ I wouldn't recommend buying this game, a price of 9,99€ or 12,99€ would fit better.
This game will probably be very good, when it leaves Early-Acces until then you should wait.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171920401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9639, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 122, 'playtime_at_review': 3919, 'last_played': 1712191809}
review: Colony Survival is a very good game, mainly in the fact that it feels very familiar to people who have played games like Minecraft or Terraria, although it is not a copy of either of these. Its main attraction is the way colonist NPCs can be recruited and automate basic and complex functions better than one or a small group of real players could. Colony Survival supports multiplayer and can be used to make a single colony with friends or others. Colonies can become large and there's a large amount of content in game, and it's constantly being updated. I would definitely recommend this game to anyone who is on the fence or considering purchasing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198372200920', 'num_games_owned': 88, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1587990420}

author: {'steamid': '76561198126113039', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2778, 'last_played': 1635887718}
review: Loved the game and earning all the achievements, it was a really peaceful experience and I can't wait for more. I just recently started playing the 0.7.0 beta version. It's somewhat more difficult than the game was in the previous patch due to the happiness mechanic, but the difficulty needed to be worked on. Previously, it was way too easy to get thousands of colonists, the hardest part was just manually placing the beds. Now, the colony actually takes some planning. The game is still peaceful (haven't really gotten that far into it yet), but with some added difficulty which I have mixed feelings about. Regardless, it's great to see more content being produced for this game and I look forward to more content being released.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041548439', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 438, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1561932065}
review: Colony Survival is a very potential giving game at is core that in the future could become a force to be reckon with in the city/civilization building genre. The game currently is rocking a $20 price tag but in my opinion it isn't worth it at the time, there just isn't enough content and balancing down yet, which could be fixed by modding and developer's future work. But don't get it confused the game is rising and the developers are looking out, taking notes, and have upcoming patches that will sooner or later be worth its price tag maybe even become a game worth $40 in the years to come.
