author: {'steamid': '76561198136075101', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 6612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3731, 'last_played': 1673633467}
review:
When i first played it was very easy, just build a maze and wait till day and all the zombies die instantly
Then they made it so that they don't die, so you have to have guards.
Then they made it so you can have more space, which meant a bigger colony which also meant more zombies but you could still kill them all easily

I started playing the beta and now recruiting colonists grows exponentially, this makes the early game much much harder

author: {'steamid': '76561198033820657', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7319, 'last_played': 1614233653}

review: Having played this for 109 hours, there remains new things to be done, places to explore and set up your colony. The devs are always introducing new updates to the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086947554', 'num_games_owned': 324, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 9147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2333, 'last_played': 1697386640}
review: Great game! Could be a little more complex, allowing players to place 2 workbenches down and specify each bench to make specific items e.g. one bench makes planks, another bench makes sling rocks. Also adding something which makes night time more productive. I've reached the point where the colony runs itself, I don't need to worry about anything anymore, having something which people need to check or change every now and then would make this more interesting. Adding something which showed you your daily production on the items would be a nice feature as you would be able to see where your problems lie and what you can cut down on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044510915', 'num_games_owned': 484, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 15450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6649, 'last_played': 1682857172}
review:
Bon jeu indé très relaxant. Je recommande si vous aimez les city builders et les jeux de constructions. 
Malgré le style du jeu qui fait penser à Minecraft, mais il ne s'agit pas ici d'un clone, mais bien d'un jeu différent.
L'élément de tower defence est plutôt simpliste mais il reste très appréciable.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994856008', 'num_games_owned': 707, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2122, 'last_played': 1579954407}
review: The game has some potention, but in it's current state, it is a bit of a waiting game, and given how the safe zone system works, you will be locked to one small location from the start of  the game to the very end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026383113', 'num_games_owned': 1217, 'num_reviews': 262, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 168, 'last_played': 1561246302}
review:
A great game with lots of potential for the future, Colony Survival is a management game with tower defence aspects & played in a minecraft-style interface.

Everything is about automating the process, but you need to ensure you have enough defences, food & other resources to be able to maintain your colony.

I think with more co-op options in the base game & a few more updates to smooth out the gameplay & add more technology I would recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992441765', 'num_games_owned': 389, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2989, 'last_played': 1669229241}

author: {'steamid': '76561198046457923', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 8135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3907, 'last_played': 1683144194}
review:
Colony survival is surprisingly beautiful considering it's square graphics.

Colony survival is incredibly relaxing to play.

Colony survival can grab your attention for hours upon hours as you manage you settlement, with who gets me iron, who farms my wheat field, who makes my bread and who will guard my colony from the zombies.

Colony survival is mazebuilder at times.

Colony survival can be a catastrophe at times ( Be it the overwhelming zombies, you forgetting to make your guards ammo, you or a builder accidently making a hole in the wall)

Colony survival is fun.

And Colony survival has fantastic developers who build the game along with it's players, so we ALWAYS have a chance to help or get a wish fulfilled.

Even with how minimalistic the game is now, it is a fantastic play. And at the time of writing this review, the developers are working at mach speed to release a MASSIVE new update they have been working on for months upon months, that will be adding many quality of life fixes, as well so much more content.

If you're on the fence, just do it, it's so cheap, or you can watch some youtubers called The Yogscast play it, they convinced me at least.

It's a lovely game, and i love it, easily spent 60 hours in it, and can't wait to spend 60 more on the next update. 

9.2 / 10

I hope i could be of help

author: {'steamid': '76561198066770043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 7, 'playtime_at_review': 1813, 'last_played': 1711581036}
review:
This is, an amazing game! Lots of people complain about the lack of updates, but if you do some searching on the internet, The devs are more than happy to accept you into the 0.7 beta which get updated about once every day if not every other day. 

Time for some comments about the game.
Amazing colony building game! You can take it as slow or as fast as you want. It forces you to keep track of resources and in the new 0.7 update, keep track of happiness. It is a fantastic couples game. I have been playing it with my SO as soon as I got the game and we have been both having a very good time since. It steals our thoughts at work, which IMO makes the game very good if its distracting you when you aren't currently playing it. You can be as creative as you want with buildings or just do the bare minimum if you can't bother yourself to build. 

Should you get this game? In short, if you enjoy colony building games, Yes. The content in the game right now is a little low, but they are currently working on adding more and more things to play with. 

Hope this helped and I left comments open in case anybody has more questions about the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113647670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5698, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3577, 'last_played': 1677557982}
review:
I was mistaken. They responded to my review with: "The update is available to all :) A couple of weeks ago, we started an open beta. Everybody can join it. Here are the instructions on how to do so:" It was within a day of my review and to have Devs respond that quickly makes it this much better. I cannot wait to update my review with all the new updates on the game.

My Original Review:
"This is a really tough one for me. On the one hand I have really enjoyed this game. With about 60 hours on record I have for sure gotten some enjoyment out of it. HOWEVER, it has been nearly a year since this game was last updated. The Developers post updates every week, WHICH I LOVE. But unfortunately it has not made its way in any shape or form to players. I've noticed the Yogscast are playing the updated version of the game, but it is not available to all? All in all a good game and worth a buy, but I cannot recommend buying until we see at least some sort of timetable for release of the next update, or the update itself."
developer_response:
The update is available to all :) A couple of weeks ago, we started an open beta. Everybody can join it. Here are the instructions on how to do so: 
https://steamcommunity.com/games/366090/announcements/detail/1597002662747833265

author: {'steamid': '76561198165025934', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 88646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61674, 'last_played': 1683754139}
review:
This game is just great. Kinda like minecraft crossed with a tower defence game and a sort of simplified, medieval-themed factorio :D The devs are great too, really involved with the community; there has been a massive gap between updates but the new one is coming very soon and looking well worth waiting a year for. Already a bunch of mods too which have mostly kept us going in the meantime (although the new version will likely break every single one as it's a complete overhaul of almost everything XD)

Definitely well worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985913697', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 4231, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1808, 'last_played': 1671708585}
review:
Hey just wanted to update my review ( I'm leaving what i said earlier below as i still stand by that at the time) but yes the new update is finally hear and yes its fun and have been very much enjoying it good job Devs keep it up. I haven't even found a bug yet. maybe a few changes in the order of the research but besides that loving it. Oh and maybe a direct way to trade (without having to do the IF, IF, This trade option) just a here this person give 200 bread for example. But we manage with the IF , IF Trade this much at the moment.

Oh and yeah its back to a Recommendation from me 

 
**

THIS GAME IS NOT BEING UPDATED.

The developers , i believe 2 dutch guys, post every single week. Yet the game itself has not received a single full update since June 2018. I played all of my hours in this game in May 2018, and loading the game now its exactly the same beside a minor UI change. As you load the game press info and the most recent changelog is from June 2018. Don't buy this game if you think it will be released at any point this century. 

That being said it is a fun game in its current state for about 10-20 hours with a couple of friends.

But the Store Page is complete BS making it look like the game is being updated regularly it is not. As far as i know they are testing new things but none of that has made it to an actual Patch in the last 12 months. I really don't understand the reason for them posting updates every 7 days yet never update the game.

**
developer_response:
You're right! The frequency of updates has gone down a lot in the past year. Instead of working on small incremental changes, we've decided to focus on a complete overhaul of some fundamental systems. 

A couple of weeks ago, we've decided to launch an open beta. Anyone can join and try all of the new features. Here's how you can sign up: 

https://steamcommunity.com/games/366090/announcements/detail/1597002662747833265

The update will be released in a couple of weeks!

author: {'steamid': '76561198362831556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1503, 'last_played': 1596146060}
review:
This game used to be a Minecraft clone.  The only thing different was the fact that you could give colonists a bed and a specific job in order for your village to function.

Now the turntables:  Minecraft is now a Colony Survival clone.  Since Notch's departure, Mojang's self-congratulatory environment (this is my creative way of saying that they sniff their own farts) led them to suffer creatively and steal ideas from the modding community to implement them in their base game.  But the latest Minecraft 1.14 update (as of May 2019) shows Mojang's true lack of originality:  They had to go and STEAL Colony Survival's villager job mechanics in order to give their own game "new life".  Even the mechanics for reassigning a villager to a different crafting table are similar!

Oh, and that update also broke Minecraft for a lot of people with older computers.  Something about VBOs breaking integrated graphics cards.  Meanwhile, Colony Survival's system requirements has remained pleasantly constant throughout its lifetime.  Anytime Pipliz releases a patch or an update, it doesn't require more RAM or a better video card.  They really care about their playerbase.

Colony Survival's multi-player servers never kicks me or my friends off, and never seems to be "down for maintenance", which are the two most common issues with Mojang's Realms service, in which they charge you A MONTHLY FEE OF $7.99 ON TOP OF your Minecraft purchase JUST to play with other people.  Multiplayer on Colony Survival is INCLUDED with your $19.99 game purchase.

And to think that this game was developed by two Dutch brothers!  I'm very happy that my purchase of this game goes towards original forward-thinking innovators who believes in family values and has the common sense to write professional, down-to-earth development blogs, unlike their cucked socially inept Swedish numale counterparts who posts in embarrassing memespeak about the latest wallet-gouging skin/map/texture pack DLCs so they can pay their polygamous girlfriends' phone bills.

So are you a spontaneous, sloppy person or are you a meticulous planner of such success that others will want to rip off and imitate poorly?

author: {'steamid': '76561198024339362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 27382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6248, 'last_played': 1688537344}
review:
At this point in time, I'm at 105 hours of play time. This game offers exactly what I've been searching for throughout my life, a game that allows me to create my own village/kingdom and micromanage the lives of my colonists in a 3D format. I specifically love that my colonists are able to work by themselves without me having to constantly hover over them to make sure that they're doing their job. It makes you feel like you're actually a ruler, not having to be bothered with most of the hard work after a few hours of gameplay. Heck, all this game needs now is the ability to create blueprints that allow the player to basically copy and paste their structures for builders to construct for you. Increased banner radius or multiple banners for multiple colonies would be lovely as well but that is more of a hope than a recommendation.

My only complaint is that it would be nice to see variation in enemy type and maybe introduce neutral entities. Perhaps wild animals, the classic spider or skeleton, or mystical creatures like ogres. Biomes, crops, and air travel are being worked on at the time of writing this so there is a chance that something like this could be implemented one day.

Other than that. it's worth the money in my opinion for an early access game. It somewhat reminds me of another blocky game that I shall not name but instead of searching for mods to achieve a kingdom feel, it's base game content. However, if you're not a fan of sitting back, observing and want action, this may not be the game for you at this point in time. I'd say keep up with the development blogs to make your purchasing decision.

Uitstekend spel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198190650590', 'num_games_owned': 323, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 5178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3134, 'last_played': 1624655501}
review:
This is my updated review of the game. Last time i wrote about the game was before science was released as a feature. Now the game has a whole tech tree of sorts, there is some emphasis on exploring the still very empty environment to find the different biomes. All the biomes have certain jobs unique to them and adds a nice bit exploration emphasis. The managing of the colony has become more complex and there are more steps needed to progress, this adds a nice bit of progression and challenge. The core of the game is still to manage a colony and you still cant really micromanage allot. Even though the game still is lacking on a few aspects, the game has gotten so much new content and the devs are contiously working on it. This game is definitively reccomended.

ps: Please add a feature where you can select what jobs are assigned to what beds so people dont have to walk so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198159093356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 9111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2752, 'last_played': 1641723587}
review:
0.7.0 的版本更新讓這個遊戲更有深度，建議老玩家們一起享受整塊地圖的寬闊視野。
換句話說，某種程度上來說是個有點容易找不到回家路又沒有地圖的世界!?

評論時間: 2019/08/10
遊戲時數: 80 hr + 
總體來說: 9/10 
優缺點如下:

<本遊戲的優點>
#自動化( x 奴役 o慣老闆模擬器)。
#龐大的科技樹(不開作弊全解鎖粗估80~100小時)，不過後期都是解鎖比較不必要的生存要素，比較像是簡單建立生產線，控制生產要素與配比的遊戲。
#熟悉後容易上手的精神時光屋(可以看看我的遊戲時數)。
#Co-op功能讓你一鍵開服與朋友同樂。
#內建精美的光影效果，不用插外掛就很漂亮。
#探索新世界的動力在0.7.0出現了。

<本遊戲的缺點>
#當你的人口上升到一定量時(800-1200人)左右時，會因為你電腦資源逐漸有一點lag的情形，不過必須說這樣的優化程度已經是相當了不起的了。這也是扣分的主因，仍希望開發人員能更進一步推進優化的極限。
(i5 3xxx、8G RAM、GPU:710M  在1200人左右以，電腦效能會漸漸追不上，co-op連線的玩家會逐漸出現lag的情形)
#床的動線問題，常常會有人跑去非常遠的床，找床睡的先後順序有點不優。
#新增的快樂程度關閉後，仍會有熱量分配問題，和預想的不一樣。

=====================
以下為遊戲提示，若喜歡自己摸索的請結束閱讀 !













#在0.7.0版本中，你若希望能使用大量奴隸，首先你會把快樂程度 (happiness)關閉，並將快樂程度選單中的所有食物調整到只剩一個"食物"需求量最低容許，這樣能讓你在與快樂程度的拉鋸戰中，需要的卡路里降至極低的程度，讓你能儲存更多的食物下來應付人口上升後帶來的不穩定性。
#在0.7.0版本中，你會看到王冠下有幾個選單，舊世界、新世界、熱帶、遠東，這些是需要走到(飛到)地圖中的特定地區，建立旗幟後才能使用的特殊作物，例如茶、馬鈴薯等，而尋找這些地方的方式建議以太陽與月亮的軌跡來建立你的方向感，並且以系統提示為依據，探索地圖。
#吃東西是必須的，這也是為什麼你不能將所有食物都關閉，他們會餓死。
#回到床上睡覺並不是必須的 (0.7.0版本，若有問題會在留言處提醒)，你可以將床的路徑封起，讓奴隸們可以待在工作崗位上直到早上，省去他們走動的時間消耗。
#你可將早晚生怪的設定關閉，讓你有個非常廣闊的發展空間。
#離旗幟過遠，你將無法對奴隸下指令。

author: {'steamid': '76561198009091535', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1509, 'last_played': 1584146755}
review:
Will probably be a worth $20 someday, but there's really only enough game for two hours or so. There's no element of chance or randomness. You just keep scaling up, adding new jobs, making more food. There's some escalation in the tiers of monsters, and that's about as much progression as the game has. You need to tech to bows, then crossbows, then guns to keep up with the monsters with higher-HP pools... except, these monsters only appear when your colony reaches a certain size. There's no urgency. 

All that said, probably might still be worth the $20 if it was being updated semi-frequently. There's some cool ideas on the dev's blog, but it's been a year since there's been any meaningful update.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054643113', 'num_games_owned': 487, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 18729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18056, 'last_played': 1676595265}
review:
Alright, let me start of by saying this, the game is fun. Limited, but fun. 

Now, let me get down tot he facts. This game is nothing more than a poorly ripped off mine craft imitation. It holds no real creativity or innovation so far as it's design or play style is concerned. This also fails to mention the incredible lack of anti grief or hacking tolls with in the un-modded game. I'm not sure how any game developer could be proud of such a poor imitation of a popular game. 

There is little to note about game play, it's pretty easy to figure out, so I imagine even a child could do so with no issues unless they have an iq lower than 50. Given some of the people on multiplayer, that may indeed be the case with some of these people. 

There is nothing special about the limited graphics, or blocks, or anything along that line. In fact, as stated, it's severely limited. 
Progression and research is painfully slow. 
Colonists just do what ever they want some times and get lost. 
The monsters are over powered when compared to the crappy colonist defense. 
Your colonists magically die when there is a "monster" (just a colonist undead or some horse crap) at your banner.
There are no real monsters, or animals, or anything of that sort. 
Tree's if you plant them are reserved to the short versions of the temperate trees, and remain small and short no matter how much time passes. 
There is no real challenge rating for this game other than pitiful or just give up. 
Honestly there could have been a great deal more creativity with something of this level, but, I guess that the idea of just copying something pitifully and selling it to a bunch of people to take their money was more the point than making something which honestly is just a piece of trash imitation. 

Save your money, go buy minecraft instead.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970350359', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2187, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2135, 'last_played': 1699689874}
review:
There is no point to this game. It's not a survival game. When you start, build one berry farmer and one sling shot defender and you've won. No reason to expand. You now have enough food to survive, and since the monsters only get stronger the larger you grow (aka: rimworld) there's no point in growing.

I ended up with a colony of 1000+. There was no point in doing that though. It was completely pointless and I didn't need to do that.

Also, this game has no AI in it. Monsters and colonists move in fixed directions, perform tasks in a fixed order, and that's it. There's not even random elements. As a programming assignment in game design done by one person, this deserve a high distinction if it were a 4th year thesis project. Excellently done. As a commercial mass-market game released on Steam that is 9/10 stars, that is an absolute joke. That's all I have to say.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983542504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 6588, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 353, 'last_played': 1700662697}
review:
Ничего лишнего писать не буду, все и так хорошо видно из скриншотов. Это ОЧЕРЕДНОЙ КЛОН MINECRAFT (основоположник жанра ) !!!! НО это достойный клон, пусть не на уровне ECO ( также доступно в STEAM ) , но тем не менее есть интересные моменты. Например ни в одной из вышеперечисленных игр нельзя заселить свою колонию , а здесь можно ( при условии наличия достаточного количества пищи ) нанять дополнительных колонистов ( НПС ) которые будут выполнять заданную работу.  Все предметы такие же "квадратные" как в Minecraft , но текстуры на среднем уровне между Minecraft-ом и ECO (ближе к последней ). Так что любителям жанра для разнообразия "от нечего делать" можно поиграть.

Пы.Сы. (P.S.) Надеюсь разработчик не забросит свою игру и привнесет в неё еще какие-либо ПОЛЕЗНЫЕ новшества ( например В НЕСКОЛЬКО РАЗ увеличит размер общего инвентаря (склада)).

review: Pretty fun for a while till you realise that its almost 1 year since there have been any actual updates to the game. The Devs are really good at releasing their blog updates talking about content that is NOT in the actual game and its honestly getting really tiring. Wake up its been 355 days since any meaningful update. Spending a year making promises is just far too long. You actually have to show something. The actual game will keep you entertained for a few hours before its just more of the same shit. I reached my 99 hour playtime through Pandaros Settlers Mods and the Rise of the New Colonies API and Mods so thank god for them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043928151', 'num_games_owned': 231, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 6763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4255, 'last_played': 1651177051}
review:
Anfürsich mag ich das Spiel, 

es erinnert stark an Minecraft, nur das es hier deutlich weniger Vielfalt im Bezug auf Block-Arten und Möglichkeiten gibt.
Grafik ist ansich sehr hübsch für ein Block-Game. Cool finde ich auch die Möglichkeit Colonists einzusetzen die einem Quasi die ganze Arbeit abnehmen können und sogar müssen. 

Mir fehlt aktuell etwas Content, das letzte Update welches neuen Content gebracht hat ist schon ewig her. Demnach kommt irgendwann etwas Langeweile auf. Ich persönlich Baue gerne Große ausgefallene Gebäude, jedoch lässt die scheinbar defekte Speicherfunktion ordentlich Frust aufkommen. Nach einem Server Restart verschwinden massig Blöcke oder lassen in der Vergangenheit entfernte Blöcke wieder auftauchen. Demnach ist man quasi Täglich damit beschäftigt seine mit müh aufgebauten Objekte zu flicken... Leider sind auch die meisten wenn nicht sogar alle Großen Modder abgesprungen. 

Ich warte jetzt erstmal auf die Version 0.7, sollte es dann besser werden mit der verbuggten Speicherfunktion gebe ich evtl. eine Kaufempfehlung. Bis dahin rate ich euch ab das Spiel nur mit bedacht zu kaufen

author: {'steamid': '76561198018663683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 415, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 224, 'last_played': 1630766655}
review:
I must say this game certainly has potential, but for me it's not good enough at the moment for me to play more than the six hours I have done at the moment. I have gotten bored already. This is my constructive criticism:

Issue nr 1: The game is inspired by Minecraft but doesn't use the best part of that game: the player's own creativity.
The game doesn't reward or even inspire me to be creative and build anything but the necessary structures for survival. I have started two worlds and both times I end up building a small box without roof, just enough to defend the flag and the beds. For me the time is key. I don't have time to do anything else but run around and assign work to the colonists, set up the different workshops and recruit new colonists. It's too much time spent on the "puzzle"-part of the game. I like it being a puzzle of managing resources, it's just that I also want time to build something nice, to play around.

SUGGESTIONS
- Maybe the days should be longer and you can have the colonists to gather resources/create things slower? I need to feel that there is nothing else to do than build something fun, to not feel in a hurry all the time because the night is coming and I haven't used the resources efficiently enough. I don't think that it's me, that I'm just bad at this, I feel I get the game quiet fast, so I think it's a bit too heavy on fast management.

Issue nr 2: No adventure!
Just give me a stick, a sword or something to fight with! The second day I want to get out into the wild and explore, find something valuable and fight my way back home feeling I have had a lucky hunt. Just sitting around looking at my colonists and the harvest grow becomes boring after a few nights.

SUGGESTION
- Give us the freedom and incentive early on to leave the known for the unknown, maybe to hunt some wild animals for skin, food or a mount to ride on?

CLOSING WORDS
- As I said I really think this game has potential and these are the changes that I would like to see in order to want to play this game. At the moment I don't get the satisfaction I'm looking for. When I bought it I was looking for a game with the mix of Minecraft and Kingdoms: Two crowns. You could look at that idea.

Wish you good luck with the development and I look forward to see what you do :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198869629155', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 11132, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 904, 'playtime_at_review': 2808, 'last_played': 1711532499}
review:
This game is a good game, overall. It's general concept of defending the civilians is a good one, but it needs more. Expanding upon many elements of the game could make it far more enjoyable. Such as adding on more weapons, spears, swords, etc, and the incorporation of such elements as: a higher frame-per-second average, monster villages and castles to attack, being able to command non-stationary guards to attack or defend certain positions, making a non-stationary guard (see prior statement), smarter, armed monsters, enemy and allied siege weapons, and an increased variety of (and uses for) ores.
The game is enjoyable, but the frames-per-second problem needs to be addressed because it makes it hard to play for more than a few hours at a time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034455157', 'num_games_owned': 551, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 692, 'last_played': 1550865015}
review:
First off, i didn´t have that much time in 
but from what i´ve seen its a neat little game
that gives you a good amount of assets and
interesting gameplay mechanics to play around with,
that all in the blocky looks of minecraft. 
___________________________________________

You start with a little bit of resources and a open world 
where you can pretty much destroy every block to get 
the block itself or the resources inside of it.
The twist is that you can spawn npc´s. You can assign 
those workers to do everything you are to lazy for,
 like mine for resources, get food for your settlement 
or guard it, you´re going to find out why. 
You can craft, build and get yourself a flourishing city 
filled with people. If you have the creativity you can probably 
sink hundreds of hours into the game, it even has a multiplayer. 
___________________________________________

But creativity is also its biggest weakness. If you dont have
that you probably wont get much out of this game. 
Besides that the world feels empty, there is no wildlife, 
even though you can sometimes hear some birds.
There is no real interaction with your workers, 
they dont talk, dont even make some kind of noise.
There are enemys for you and your settlement,
but even when they´re dying no ones even coughing.
That all is a huge letdown compared to its actual gameplay.
____________________________________________
____________________________________________

In conclusion, Colony Survival is a huge grindfest where you can 
let your creativity, to an extend, let loose mixed with a good RTS system.
But its empty world is especially for singleplayer people a huge problem.
And i think it is not worth its asking price of 20 bucks, despite its good amount of content.
But still, i´ll give it a thumbs up for the creativ freedom it provides.
For everyone whose interested in this game, wait until its on sale for 10$,
15$ at max if you really like this kind of game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011062208', 'num_games_owned': 711, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1681077169}
review:
This game has grown so much in the past year.  Sometimes it feels overwhelming with everything that has been added but I get used to it through watching others play on YouTube and experimenting on my own. My favorite addition is the stair like block that goes between other blocks making the blocks look and act like stairs.  This has been a welcome addition.

The game is in depth and by far one of my favorite strategy building survival games.

It says I only have 1.3 hours on record, but I have far more hours into the game before I bought it on steam when I played it through a friend's account.  I was hooked instantly and love this game.  The only reason I haven't played it as much as before is because I am hooked on another game as well atm and it's eating up my time lol.

This game is worth the buy, you won't regret it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198379286189', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 5513, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1423, 'last_played': 1675673083}
review: Extremely fun casual game. Its almost exactly like minecraft, with the difference being is that you hire colonists with the food you produce and give them jobs ranging from guards, to farmers, to miners, and even builders. Its a very enjoyable game.

review: Addictive beyond belief. Its as if Minecraft and Banished had a baby, but skipped the punishing difficulty Banished presented you with from day 1. Throw a tower defense aspect in the form of nightly (or daily if you should elect) zombie raids and you've got a great start that is well worth $20, even in early access status. To top it all off the developers are very active and friendly. You won't be disappointed!

author: {'steamid': '76561198858149319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 957, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 687, 'last_played': 1571615945}
review:
I work from home doing tech support.  My phone can ring at any time and I have to answer it immediately.  The ability to pause a game for me is a REQUIREMENT and not a luxury.  This is a huge deal breaker for me as the majority of time I have available to play games is between work calls.  These calls can last anywhere from 1 minute to 3 hours and during that time my focus is on my job and not monitoring a game running in the background.

This makes me very sad because I've been very excited about finally getting this game after watching loads of Let's Plays on YouTube.  None of those vids mentioned lack of pausability.

Going to need to be very careful here not to go over my 2 hours while I decide if it's worth it to keep such an involved game that requires so much time that now I'll only be able to play on Saturdays.

I mean, I guess I could play without zombies but where is the fun in that?


For those of you who have more flexibility in your game time and don't need to be able to pause, dont let my review deter you from the game.  Aside from the pausing it's a fun game and worth the $20 price tag.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008258569', 'num_games_owned': 1396, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 5206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2644, 'last_played': 1695778620}
review:
Colony survival is a great city building and management game with the allure of minecraft style gameplay as well. As this is early access the game is a little short to "complete" and by complete I mean achieve all that can be obtained in the game at the moment. This is unfortunate because I really want to play more and start over in their next update.

I should also mention that the developers are very active with their players. Every Friday a new update post is put out outlining the current updates, statistics, and gameplay future enhancements and design changes. 

So if you want a fun colony building and management game, and like survival games similar to minecraft, than you'll love this game. With it's active developers you need not worry about updates, the next one is looking great!

author: {'steamid': '76561198297694161', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 51906, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48083, 'last_played': 1588269967}
review:
This is an excellent game.  While many compare it to Minecraft simply due to the aesthetics of the world, it is completely different.  The addictive game play and research component, while limited in it's current state, brings exciting progression to the game.  Future documented additions, coming in 0.7.0, will take this game tot he next level.

Having over 800 hours of active game play, I have to give this game a huge thumbs up.  Please keep the development flowing.  

A couple things that need to be further developed in my opinion:

1. The lack of core game content.     You can research and max out the research very quickly.  The use of Settlers! mod helps to prolong this immensely.  For me, once you cap out your research progression, it turns into a building game.  I hope future updates helps resolve this issue for me.
2. Zombie AI.  While I deliberately do NOT do mazes or hedge paths, that make the game way too easy.  I would suggest adding zombie bosses or elite ones that have better AI or possibly that can walk on water, lay down blocks to get over pits or moats, maybe explode or drill through walls, or something to break up the standard tower defense pathing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198261169508', 'num_games_owned': 74, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 32598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7736, 'last_played': 1698259122}
review: Colony survival has to be one of my favourite games of all time

author: {'steamid': '76561198027586200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 167, 'last_played': 1588054580}
review:
I feel like this game has a huge potential to be an amazing colony builder mixed with a tower defense strategy esk first person voxel game. It needs work. 

It needs a rolling tutorial to get me started on the research progression. Break the tutorial into multiple stages that are activated through research milestones. When i research wheat farming give me the tutorial for making bread. When i research flax give me a tutorial on what that new crop field will do for me. The research progression is in no way intuitive to a new player. The PDF provided is outdated. 

When they circle back and iron out the early game learning curve this will be a very unique experience. Until then I wouldn't recomend picking this game up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107697811', 'num_games_owned': 889, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 1836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1673, 'last_played': 1548656541}
review: This game is a lot of fun and a good time. It may be simple, but that is what makes this so great. It is a very pretty game. People talk about it being a Minecraft clone, but I have never gotten a village to work as well as this game. The mechanics work well, especially with all the monsters and colonists on the screen at once during certain points. I built a huge tower, level after level of food production, or beds, or item production. The best part is your imagination is the limit for your creations (within reason of course), and the replay-ability is infinite. You really get to see how artistic you can be or other players. Some of the screenshots from people creating castles or boats or statues are insane. There may be other games like this out there, but this game runs amazingly well. Don't think I ran into any bugs either, which is really impressive. I cannot wait for everything they are going to add in! Highly recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198115538976', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2041, 'last_played': 1610313386}

review:
EDIT down below the line ---

The game became trash.

They added beewax and whatnot, shit we didn't need and that only made the game more complex.

Entire bucket of water for 2 bread, now it's more efficient to just stick with fu ck i n berries.

Also added a not-needed happiness system which I happily disabled.

The game WAS good. not anymore.

I wanted a casual building experience, but got a needlessly complex management simulator.

--------------

Ok I still don't like this game too much, but after changing my STRATS and TACTICS it's not too bad.

The beginning is pretty hard. but its fine midgame so far anyways

author: {'steamid': '76561198113144159', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 6453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2132, 'last_played': 1678774745}
review:
For the Player- This game is very good and a decent time waster for being an early access game and from what i have seen so far it has alot of potential but early game is kind of bland and boring things really start to ramp up pace when have your first bread production then that allows your colony to grow ridiculously fast so if you want you should give this game a little bit longer to get used to there is a very low but moderate learning curve to the game                                                                                                                                
                                                                                                                                                                                                        
         For the Devs- i recommend to the devs to make there a bigger incentive to explore the world because the average player will just stay confined in the little space they have in their safe zone maybe make it so you can make multiple seperate colonies you can make so certian biomes have certain valuable resources so players will have the greater incentive of exploring these cool areas and lands they are doing amazing inside the colony once they finish the update for the chickens cabage and stuff i think its time to start expanding off the safe zone a bit

review: I think a lot of people would think it would be amazing if you made a gamemode (or something else) in multiplayer where you can train soldiers that you can command to attack other colonies. I don't think I'm the first to think of this idea but I came up with it when my friend and I were killing each other's colonist and he I wondered if there would be a more effective way of doing so. Also, with the new updates coming up, I expect this game to become very big!

author: {'steamid': '76561198019343341', 'num_games_owned': 118, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1546849819}
review: After and hour of play time I have to say that I was very unimpressed with this game. unfortunately if I had played any longer then steam would not let me return the game. Perhaps if steam had a better return policy I could discover more about this game before deciding if I liked it or not. But from what I played and experienced I wouldn't reccomend this game due to these reasons. Figuring out the science system and how to advance "technologies" is much harder than it should be and there is no system or tuttorial to aide you. Monsters spawn in your base so forget walls if you are playing on solo and just produce gaurds. There is no option to see the amount of production or at least nothing I could find. And other minor issues such as the day cycle times being very short. Anyways not a game I reccomend for various other reasons and the lack of game time spent, which I blame on steams poor choice of return policy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114558690', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1683172975}
review: I'm a huge fan of these town-builder type games like Banished or Forest Village so seeing this sandbox RTS town-builder game made me super excited and I was quick to buy it when I had the money. However, I was very disappointed with my first impressions of playing the game. The laughable graphics and lack of a proper tutorial that really shows you the fundementals really disappointed me. It took me a few hours of playing before I realised that your citizens can actually work outside of the banners safe-zone because the game just doesn't give you enough information. It just didn't play the way I thought it would from the videos and pictures so I ended up refunding it. However I had this itch I just couldn't satisfy, so I ended up cracking the game and played it for a few hours that way. And the simplist way I can express my thoughts on this game after giving it a lot of time ... ITS SO GOOD! I went right back here and re-bought the game and am now continuing the world I started in the cracked version and I've been enjoying every moment of it so far. This game is still very clearly in its early access stages as many aspects of the game are so underdeveloped, but its just so rich with fun gameplay already it's unreal! If you like town-builder games as much as I do, you will love this game! Don't let the graphics and lack of a helping hand/proper tutorial sway you like it did with me, give this game some time and you'll grow to love it as much as I have. It is absolutely worth the buy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198173468114', 'num_games_owned': 109, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 640, 'last_played': 1676549320}
review: The cost might be a bit high for where the development currently is on the game, it can get boring since there are few things to actually do other than build. The collonists like to walk in straight lines of hundreds of people which doesn't look good, the building asspects are nice, and can be fun for months if you like building. I look forward to seeing where the development goes, and I'd like to see paths, or different routes for collonists so there won't be 50 collonists in a single line, and I'd also like to see some more building materials, like tinted glass, different colors of brick, etc. I would also really like to see different biomes in the world, and a reason to explore.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987670189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 1701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1701, 'last_played': 1606560589}
review:
I own this game since early 2018 and once wrote a positive review, but sadly I now feel like I have to change my opinion to negative.

I want to point out: I still like the concept and the underlying idea of this game. However, I feel like the development slowed down significantly over the past year or so, to the point wher eI'm not longer sure this game is udner active development.

Maybe it's because the devs spent a lot of time on revamping 'under to hood' internal mechanics (like colony points) or reworking the user interface (like the statistics window). But it feels like only minor changes are being made and no really meaningful new content is being added to the game. What I mean is: Nothing obviously new has been added to the game in ages: no new types of enemies, no new blocks to build, no new jobs for your colonists, no changes in world generation, no new endgame mechanics, no new crafting options. Despite their discord being full of cool ideas and them promising how they want to add more content and more mechanics over and over.

They recently even stopped writing regular devblogs.

I hate to say this but it feels like the devs lost their passion about this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045774472', 'num_games_owned': 702, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 1837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1707158250}
review:
I think that Colony Survival is a good game, in my opinion it fills in the holes in a little game called minecraft. Why do everything yourself when you can bring in colonists to do the boring stuf for you? This is one area where it wins. 

The dev team, a team of 2, are brilliant at letting us know what is going on in the development and it seems to me that their goals are totally possible. The game has developed nicely over time and things are being brought in a a good pace.

Obviosly this is not a game with AAA graphics but then I have rarely wanted graphics to be more important than gameplay, andf in this respect, I am not disappointed. The gameplay has improved over time and I am looking forward to things moving on.

Some bits took me a while to get my head round; make sure you plan your ecomomy, it is important that you get stuff running in a sensible order but once you have that sorted it works smoothly. 

Looking forward to the happiness feature that is upcoming and I think I will be playing this quite a bit in the future.

I reckon that I would give it 7 out of 10 at the moment with an expectation of this going up in the near future, it is still in early access and I would be amazed if it doesn't come out of ea sooner rather than later, unlike so maky steam early access games.

developer_response:
Hi, devs here, 100% alive and highly motivated! There have been lots of updates since we released the game in the middle of 2017. Our YouTube channel summarizes the progress pretty well: 
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCpOC2zqOsw_oNdTrka5TKsQ/videos

It's true that we haven't released an update in ~5 months, and that's because we're working on a very major update. We release a weekly Friday Blog detailing our progress, feel free to check them out on our storepage!

author: {'steamid': '76561198195944046', 'num_games_owned': 221, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 12297, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9717, 'last_played': 1669754527}
review:
TL;DR: 
Kauft das Spiel nicht, es ist im Momentanen Zustand eine reine Abzocke.

Unten ist das ausführliche, lange Review welches aber schon sehr alt ist.

Mittlerweile kann ich nur noch vom Kauf des Spiels abraten!
Seit es das "Feature" Happines gibt, ist das Spiel unspielbar geworden... 
Mehr als 300 Kolonisten in einer Kolonie sind nicht mehr möglich, das denke nicht nur ich so, dazu veröffentlichen die Entwickler sogar Blogposts.
Man bracht 500 Kolonisten um 400 zu versorgen und nein das sind nicht 500 Kolonisten um 400 zur freien verfügung zu haben, ich brauche mehr Kolonisten um weniger Kolonisten zu versorgen, kling kompliziert und dumm? Ist es auch.
Es gibt zwar jetzt ein neues System, welches ich mir aber noch nicht weiter angeschaut habe, da ich gesehen habe, dass man maximal 25!!! Kolonisten einstellen kann und dann mehr Plätze erforschen muss, wobei die Forschung exponentiell teurer wird.
Um mal einen Vergleich zu setzen, wie viel Kolonisten eine große Basis hat: die größte Basis die ich gebaut habe hatte mehr als 100.000 Kolonisten, da kommen mir jegliche Art von Begrenzung wie ein schlechter Witz vor.

Weiter geht es mit dem Umgang der Community:
Wie ich unten im alten Review schreibe, habe ich mit ein Paar Freunden SEHR viel Zeit in dieses Spiel gesteckt und dementsprechend viele Bugs gefunden, dies ist eigentlich ja kein Problem bei Indie spielen, schreibt man den Entwickler an und der kümmert sich drum, so ist es bei guten Indie Spielen.
Nicht so bei Colony Survival.
Da schreibt man die Entwickler auf Discord an (ich benutze Discord kaum, war also schon froh deren Account zu finden) schickt ihnen die gefunden Bugs mit Bilder und der Dokumentation wie man diesen Bug reproduzieren kann.
Ein Traum für jeden Entwickler.
Denkste, kannst dir erstmal anhören, wieso du deren Zeit so verschwendest, und wenn du Bugs findest sollst du sie in den richtigen Kanal im Discord Server senden, achso und Bugs, wie u.a. das Fliegen durch Böden und Wände ist ja nix schlimmes; ja klar. (Die Bugs sind immer noch alle im Spiel auch nachdem ich sie in den Discord Kanal geschickt habe...)

Das sind jetzt nur die großen Sachen, mit mehreren Wochen Urlaub, welche auch im Blog geteilt werden, kaum fortschreitender Entwicklung, sowie der Überlegung DLCs oder einen Zweiten Teil raus zu bringen, obwohl das spiel ein EA Titel ist, fange ich gar nicht erst an, ich meine mehr als 1.5 Mio Euro nach dem Steam Cut sind hat auch mal schnell in 2.5 Jahren aufgebraucht. Wie ich auf die Zahl komme? Naja, das Spiel hat sich mehr als 100k mal verkauft und der Preis ist 20€ bei einem Steam Cut von 30% bleibt da schon noch gut was über ;). 

Da ich das Zeichenlimit jetzt schon mehrmals überschritten habe, werde ich das Review jetzt hier Beenden, die gekürzten Teile werde ich nochmal unten kommentieren.




Erstmal muss ich sagen, dass ich dieses Spiel schon seit ein paar Wochen nicht mehr gespielt habe.
Die meiste Zeit habe ich im Multiplayer mit Mods verbracht.
(Fazit für die, die nicht viel lesen wollen, ganz unten.)

[u]Vorwort:[/u]
Viele werden sich beim Lesen des Reviews wundern, warum ich das Spiel trotzdem empfehle:
Ich finde Spiele wie diese gut, und ich muss sagen, dass mir Colony Survival für gut 100 Stunden sehr viel Spaß gemacht hat. Durch Mods und das Spielen mit Freunden hat das Spiel noch zusätzlich viel Spaß gemacht. 
Das Spiel sieht auf den ersten Blick sehr minecraftähnlich aus. Auch auf den zweiten Blick behält man diesen Eindruck. Man muss aber sagen, dass lediglich das Bausystem mit Blöcken vergleichbar zu Minecraft ist, was mich nicht stört.
Außerdem arbeiten die Entwickler dieses Spiels konstant an diesem weiter, und bringen auch immer wieder große und gute Neuerungen raus!

[u]Das Spiel:[/u]
In Colony Survival startet man alleine in einer Welt. Die Anfänge bestehen erstmal aus Ressourcensammeln und die ersten Sachen bauen. Relativ schnell stellt man aber fest, dass man mit Kolonisten sehr viel besser dran ist, da diese erst einfache Jobs übernehmen können und später für alles verantwortlich sind. Sobald die Nacht nahrt, sieht man die ersten Zombies, welche sich auch noch gut von Hand besiegen lassen, später aber zu einer echten Gefahr werden.
Hat man sich also mit einer Basis eine sichere Grundlage geschafft, geht es an die Erweiterung der Produktion, des Essens und den Bau einer größeren Basis. Ein Ende, so, wie man es kennt, gibt es noch nicht.



[u]Schlecht umgesetzte Sachen:[/u]
Durch das Spielen mit sechs Spielern sind uns viele verbesserbare Sachen aufgefallen:
(Teilweise unter "Mods" Verbesserungen)
[list]
    [*]Das Essen: Das Prinzip mit dem Essen ist eigentlich gut, doch braucht man einfach extrem viele Felder, sodass sich riesige "Plantagentürme" irgendwann nicht mehr vermeiden lassen.
    [*]Verteidigung: Ja, man kann die Zombies deaktivieren, was wir aber nicht gemacht haben. Auf Standardeinstellungen braucht man ca. 10-20% seiner Kolonisten als Verteidiger, wozu dann zusätzlich Munitionsproduzenten und Minenarbeiter kommen und einen sehr großen Teil der Kolonisten beanspruchen.
    [*]Die Erweiterung der Basis: Man kann maximal 100 Blöcke in jede RIchtung vom Banner aus bauen, wodurch ein Großteil der Expansionen in die Höhe stattfindet.
    [*]Die Betten: Viele Leute werden sich denken, dass es nur realistisch ist, dass man pro Kolonist ein Bett braucht, uns ist aber bei Teilweise 15k Kolonisten aufgefallen, dass das Bettenaufbauen und Häuserbauen einen Großteil der Zeit frisst. Teilweise wurden bei uns dann Betten einfach auf Mauern oder irgendwo, wo noch Platz war, hinplatziert.
    [*]Produktion: Für Leute wie mich, die so differenzierte Produktionen mögen, ist die Produktion hier gut, aber für den Rest.. Die Produktion ist schlecht umgesetzt, man hat an die 15 verschiedene Produktionsstätten. Will man z.B. eine Forschungstasche herstellen, so müssen erstmal ~5 andere Produktionsstätten abgegangen werden. Zusätzlich muss man dann noch überlegen, wie viele man von welcher Produktionsstätte braucht.
    [*]Bauen: Das Bauen macht erst Spaß, es wird aber später zu einem Albtraum, riesige Gebäude von Hand bauen. Man kann zwar das einfache Bauen von Kolonisten übernehmen lassen, aber dann sieht das Gebäude halt hässlich aus. Produktionsstätten muss man trotzdem von Hand platzieren.
    [*]Forschung: Die ganze Produktion ist auf Forschung oder Munition ausgelegt: ist man mit der Forschung durch, so hat man das Spiel eigentlich "beendet": Eigentlich die gesamte Produktion ist nun nutzlos, da die Munition und die paar Items, die man so noch braucht, nur 3-4 verschiedene Produktionsstätten benötigen.
    [*]Erkunden: Mir war es nicht so wichtig, aber ein paar Mitspieler wünschten sich mehr Erkundbares, aus seiner Basis kommt man eigentlich nicht raus und zu erkunden gibt es auch nichts.  
[/list]

[u]Spieltiefe / Story:[/u]
Eine Story existiert nicht, braucht das Spiel aber auch nicht!
Der Wiederspielwert ist aber sehr gering, da man immer dasselbe macht... Nach der 3. Welt gibt es keine "neuen" Sachen, die man noch nie gemacht hat.

[u]Modding:[/u]
Gekürzt weil Zeichengrenze und nicht mehr aktuell

[u]Performance:[/u]
Das Spiel läuft erst gut, bis man dann ca.3000 Kolonisten erreicht hat, hat man dann nämlich, so wie ich, eine große Produktionshalle gebaut, laggt das Spiel tagsüber EXTREM! 
Wo ich in der Nacht, wenn alle Colonisten schlafen, noch 120 FPS (limitiert) auf höchsten Grafikeinstellungen habe, habe ich tagsüber gerade ein mal 10 FPS auf mittleren Grafikeinstellungen. (Dies sollte durch eine Option zum Deaktivieren der Anzeige der momentanen Aufgabe über dem Kopf des Kolonisten zu fixen sein)
Wenn ich schon bei Einstellungen bin... 
Wenn man keine 100% GPU-Auslastung und trotzdem Lags haben will, muss man Vsync anmachen!

[u]Multiplayer:[/u]
Gekürzt weil Zeichengrenze und nicht mehr aktuell

[u]Fazit:[/u]
Gekürzt weil Zeichengrenze und nicht mehr aktuell

author: {'steamid': '76561198355519549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 587, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 421, 'last_played': 1607030127}
review:
I had fun when this game was first coming out. I played it for a few hours. I just can't get myself to play it though because when ever there is an update, you lose half of your items and your world sometimes doesn't work. I lost all my progress just when my colony started to thrive. But then there was an update and I had to replace all my tools, items, ect. Then I found out that my world doesn't have the materials to make everything that came out in the update. I was annoyed by this and never played the game again. But it is a fun game if you have patients after an update. I don't really want to check no but I'm going to have to because I wasted 7 hours on this game for no reward at all.
 


But it is fun

review: I found this game late. And its one of the few games that I want to get every achivement in. The game is easy and basic, I wish it were easy to play hard to master but thats simply not the case. Its Easy to play and Easy to master. It has so much room for potential but I'm afraid the devlopers have stoped with this. Saddens me because its still great. Theres really NO reason to adventure away from your base except to find Snow. I wish you could give your people adventure tasks, to bring back stuff. and see if they survive. I wish you could have guards patrol. Again so much stuff that could be made to make this game amazing, but for now, the game is good. Worth the money, and worth playing if you like to automate stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065489650', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 2248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2081, 'last_played': 1671363674}
review:
Acheté il y a quelques mois de cela, le jeu s'améliore à vue d'oeil.

Le contenu y est de plus en plus intéressant et maintient l'intérêt.

Travailler continuellement à la construction de sa colonie, la développer et veiller à son équilibre de production / défense en fait un excellent challenge face à des hordes de zombies qui ne rêvent que de vous détruire.
La possibilité d'extension de sa colonie ajoute également une vaste gamme de choix pour votre colonie mais attention aux ressources qui y sont consacrées !
Pour ce qui est du Solo / Multijoueur, jouer avec un ami me semble bien plus amusant du fait de s'associer pour survivre même si des mises à jour pour renforcer la coopération devraient être ajoutées.

En conclusion, il n'y a aucun doute sur la qualité du jeu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040744687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 14251, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5900, 'last_played': 1673224278}
review:
This is a good game and I personally sincerely believe you should buy it and give it a try.
At $20, this game is a steal for the amount of enjoyable time you can get from it.
Read my review, and then go buy it and play it.
If you don't love this game as much as I do after 2 hours, you can just refund it.
No risk. :)

The Minecraft comparison is inevitable, and is what I will primarily address.
How is this NOT just another MC clone? They're everywhere, total rip-offs and a waste of my time!
This game plays entirely differently.

In MC, you do everything yourself by hand for better or worse.
This leads to probably the most annoying problems in Minecraft, that Colony Survival solves:
MC Problem: Massive time investments are REQUIRED, for annoyingly small payoffs.

- Want to clear a big area to make your SUPER PALACE?
Well I hope you're willing to dump 10-20 hours to mining out every single block of this this massive area by hand, and repairing your super enchanted diamond tools over and over again.
- Want to add another floor in your ENORMOUS EPIC CASTLE? Well, if the floor dimensions are 100x200 that means you'll be placing 20,000 blocks one by one. By hand. By yourself.
After you have acquired those 312.5 stacks of that material of course, here's hoping you didn't pick anything too nice looking or expensive otherwise it'll actually be impossible, not to mention boring as hell to even try.

But then comes Colony Survival, with the gift of automation.
Reasonable automation though, that you still have to work for and expand.
Additionally, comes the challenge of nightly waves of zombie tower defense, that you need to control and put systems in place to take care of.
- Your efforts are still always extremely valuable. You can do pretty much everything the NPC's can except faster...but is that really worth your time? You're smarter than that...you can set things up to make them do all the boring repeatable work, freeing you to focus on design and all of your other plans instead of just getting bogged down in mining ten million stone for a wall etc.
- It's more about resource management than exploration.
- The rewards you get are based on your designs and plans rather than your ability to sink in endless hours in exchange for extremely underwhelming payoffs.
- The challenge or managing your resources and systems well can be increased with the Happiness mechanic, or by adding more monsters. Or it can be reduced by disabling Happiness, and lessening the amount of monsters.
- It's way way easier to build massive beautiful structures in this game than MC, and it also looks way better too, in my opinion. Not only that, but because the NPC's have needs and jobs and routines, AND you're fighting against the constant Zombie threat, the structures you build aren't just beautiful, they also have purpose!

If you have any questions, hit up the CS discord. Amazing community and response devs.
These 2 guys are doing incredible work and are very receptive to good feedback.
If you have good ideas, you might even see them implemented!

When it comes down to it, this game is just fun.
There's so much joy and satisfaction to be had in hitting those exponential growth curves and watching your colony of guys work things out, There's so much charm in the artwork for this game.
This game hits my addiction receptors hard and it's a joy to build and make your dudes do more and more things for you!

I highly encourage you to give this game a try.
I'm already looking forward to my next 100 hours :p

author: {'steamid': '76561198045916659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2331, 'last_played': 1650054475}
review: I bought this game around a year ago, when it initially came out. I have been very dissapointed by tons of early access games, and let me start this by saying this game has incredibly developers. They have been reliably releasing updates, and keeping their purchasers up to date on their plans/taking input as to where to go with updates. I recently came back after not playing for a few months and the game has taken on whole new mechanics that are equally refreshing and complicated. The visuals are beautiful for a block game, with amazing lighting mechanics etc. This game is without a doubt worth the 20 dollars (going by my personal 1 dollar/hour of gameplay rule). I have watched the developers improve the game since its release and continue to do so, hop on board and come build some colonies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036021750', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1585771085}
review: Terrible client setup. Why can't you be like most other games, and just create a solo server internally? I can't connect to any games, all games come up as incompatible. I can't host a single player game either, I get the same crap other people do. I've allowed every TCP / UDP possible, I've allowed the .exe through my firewall, and literally nothing works. Even after repetatively reinstalling the game to try and fix it. I definitely don't recommend this title until the apparently "TWO PEOPLE" figure out how to setup proper networking with their title. I understand wanting to try something new with the game play, but don't mess around with the networking, just make it run the same way ALL other titles do. You'll find your player base grow, if 40% of the people who purchase the game are infernally pissed off at how the game just doesn't respond to networking. Fix it please. Cause I may never return to this game again, and I never even got to play it. Great waste of money...
developer_response:
We're sorry to hear you're experiencing so many problems. 

If the game crashes and you've got FaceIt anticheat installed, you can try uninstalling that, it's a known incompatibility (it might be fixed in the next update). 
The connection problems and all servers showing up as incompatible sounds like the client has no access to networking at all. That's most likely antivirus or firewall blocking the game. You say you've already tweaked your firewall, so I'd try making an exception in, or disabling, your antivirus software. 

If these solutions don't work, we'd love to have some more info about your system specs and the exact way in which the game misbehaves. You could share it either here or in #bug-reports on Discord! (discord.gg/colonysurvival)

author: {'steamid': '76561198037022014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 43929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2454, 'last_played': 1705666581}
review:
I started out the ruler of a modest wooden box filled to the brim with beds in true soviet fashion. My humble berry farmers bringing in the days rations for my poor worker bees. On the roof stands two miserable guards half heartedly throwing rocks at the undead.

Fast forward a few hours.

Today I rule from my penthouse watching with a sly grin on my face as my underlings farm the land with mechanical efficiency. The magnificent skyscrapers block out the sun and my perimiter wall is filled to the brim with brutes carrying muskets keeping both the undead at bay and the workers in check. In the mines my "comrades" toil tirelessly to fuel the birth of a true empire.

8/10 A dictators approval

author: {'steamid': '76561197995337090', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 6036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3569, 'last_played': 1651519273}
review:
Super jeu, tres addictif !!

Colonny survival est un mixte entre un defense tower, un city builder, et un minecraft (pour l'aspect visuel). 
Le jeu devient encore plus interressant avec le mod settlers! et le mod coop shareteam quand on connait les bases. 
Les develloppeurs facilitent le modding, ils comptent rajouter un coté anno1404 dans les futurs maj en obligeant la creation de plusieurs colonny dans des biomes differents afin d'obtenir les ressources necessaires pour evoluer. 

Bref un super jeu avec normalement un soutien des dev jusque 2020

author: {'steamid': '76561198002553595', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 5223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2920, 'last_played': 1672343512}
review:
Sure on the surface it looks like another MC clone, but dig deeper and you'll find a really fun 'colony' builder. With a big update (.70) hitting around the end of year, now is a great time to find out what Colony Survival is about and where it is headed. The devs are very active on Discord so it is very easy to ask questions to learn more about the game. 

As a side note, their weekly blogs show you they are true thinkers (as gamers and developers among other things) who look at the bigger picture  when adding to or changing the game. A trait other reactionary developers could take a cue from and should allow them much success going forward. 

Recommended even as an EA game as it's very good now and will only improve!

author: {'steamid': '76561198080245800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 13096, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2848, 'last_played': 1710556849}
review:
마크에서 건축모드를 좋아하지만 건축만으로는 먼가 아쉽다는분들한데 추천할만한 게임.
기본 시스템은 마인크래프트와 거의 동일하다고 보시면 됩니다.

차이점이라면 밤이되면 좀비들이 마을로 쳐들어오는거고

NPC들을 생성해서 방어 하거나 농장일을 시키거나 자원을 채취할수가 있습니다.

초반에는 방어도하고 식량도 모아야하고 자원도 모자라고해서 힘든감이 있지만
기본인프라 갖추고 안정적으로 자원생산되는 중반부 부터는
사실상 마크 건축모드 처럼 연구해서 확장하고 건설하는거 말고는 없습니다.
걍 마크에서 건축한뒤 밋밋한 내부와 외부에 무언가 바쁘게 일할 NPC를 배치한다는 느낌에 더 가깝습니다.


이게임의 단점들을 뽑아본다면...

1. 우선 안정적으로 돌아가기 시작한 시점에서 게임이 너무 밋밋해집니다.
무언가 돌발적인 요소가 있어서 흐름을 깨트릴만한 무언가가 있었으면 좋겠습니다.

2. 사망 혹은 좀비 저지 실패했을때의 패널티가 너무 약합니다.
이러한 점은 무언가 필살적으로 생존하기 보다는 대충대충 막고 식량만 안정적이면 대충 좀비들한데 몰살당해도 별생각이 안듭니다.

3. 블럭의 형태가 너무 부족합니다.
건축러로서 놀기에는 문이나 유리 그외 응용가능한 반블럭형태의 블럭들이 존재하지 않기에 솔직히 건축도 만족 못합니다.

4. 타격감이 제로입니다.
애초에 높은 타격감을 필요로한게임은 아니지만.....진짜 '0' 인것은 너무한거 아닌가요?
최소한 내가 때리는지 맞는지 정도는 알수있었으면 좋겠습니다.
덤으로 경비병NPC들도 병과에 따른 무기정도는 손에 쥐어주고요. 걍 주먹으로 화살 던지는것도 아니고...


아직 개발중인 게임이라 언급한 단점들만 개선되어도 충분히 갓겜으로 상승가능한 가능성이 높은게임인듯 합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198327027582', 'num_games_owned': 41, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 5419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4887, 'last_played': 1607674727}
review: Игра классная. Очень интересный геймплей с развитиием собственной колонии. Конечно есть куда расти. В первую очередь надо поработать над зомби. Чтобы на большом развити могли как-нибудь пробираться на твою колонию при помощи обходных путей (перелесть через стены, прокапаться под землёй и др.). Также можно добавить генерацую других колоний с которыми можно взаимодействоть. Воевать или торговать. Но повторюсь, игра класс. Надеюсь разрабы продолжать её улучшать, ибо потенциал у игры есть.

author: {'steamid': '76561198113093163', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 11456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3997, 'last_played': 1667575297}
review:
Bisher ein echt cooles Spiel, vor allem wenn man mit freunden zusammen baut und Aufbaustrategie mit Towerdefense Elementen mag.
Was leider kolossal stört ist das Speichern auf den Servern. Wenn man Große Mengen Blöcke abbaut werden zwischendurch nach Serverspeichern chunks wieder rein geladen oder neu gebaute Blöcke verschwinden einfach chunk weise.

Fazit: 67 Stunden spielzeit. Kleine Bases super cool spielbar. Riesenprojekte sind auf Grund der Speicherprobleme leider unmöglich. Nach Update des Speichervorgangs spiele ich sehr gerne wieder, aber im Moment baut sich zu viel Frustration auf.

author: {'steamid': '76561198821086902', 'num_games_owned': 164, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5294, 'last_played': 1607410078}
review: Game was awesome to play. Butttt now it wont even load single player. this problem has been in the game since like june and still has not been fixed.
developer_response:
If you've been able to play the game in the past, the problem ought to fixable. Here are some common solutions: 

1.) If you've installed mods, remove them 
2.) Verify the integrity of the game cache 
3.) If that doesn't work, reinstall the game 

If that doesn't work, we'd love to have more info. 
1.) You say SP doesn't work. Does MP work? 
2.) Have you tried making a new world? 
3.) What happens, exactly? Crash to desktop, infinite loading screen, something else?

author: {'steamid': '76561198042135862', 'num_games_owned': 413, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 1238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1131, 'last_played': 1564796484}
review: Keep an eye on this one, it has potential to be a great one. Colony Survival is pretty heavily in early access, from placeholder art to a limited amount of content to explore, but one thing is for sure, the dev team is working hard on the game. I've watched quite a bit of content be added to this game over this year and soon it could be a really great "Minecrafty - Tower defense" game. It almost has a factorio vibe to it, where you need to keep up your production ratios to keep your colony efficient. I played this game on a multiplayer server with my friends and I had a great time just building structures and watching my dudes complete their tasks. The game is playable in it's current state, but it has a strong feel of lack of content and polish, to be expected for an alpha version of the game. I'm putting my trust in the dev team to deliver a great game and I think I made a good choice in that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992690466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 3087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3060, 'last_played': 1605451794}
review:
Est-ce qu'il est bien ?
Oui.

Colony Survival ( Disons "CS" ) est un bon petit jeu. Ici, je l'ai testé en binome avec madame, on a fait des bases voisines, collées et nos colons s'appellaient Jacqui.

CS, on pourrait le comparer a MineCraft et Factorio.

Pour le coté Minecraft, il est vachement bien réalisé. On a pas mal de bricolage a faire, le minage est agréable, on a de nombreux block de constructions etc ... Et surtout, "le truc" qui fait vraiment du bien et qu'on aurait voulu dans minecraft : Les chantiers !
Tu cliques a un endroit, tu clique a un autre, ça te fait un cube et tu demandes aux colons d'enlever tout le merdier qu'il y a dedans. En quelques jours IG, les colons font un ménage énorme pendant que toi, tu bosses sur autre chose. Je sais pas vous, mais moi sur les jeux comme Minecraft quand je veux un jardin PLAT, il est putain de PLAT parceque j'y ai passé des heures a L'APPLATIR ! Ici, tu peux envoyer tes colons le faire. Tu peux te servir d'eux pour faire des routes, des murs, des trou, des mines bla bla bla ... Parfait, merci.

Pour le cotés Factorio, y'a encore du taf mais toutes les bases sont là. C'est à dire qu'il manque certains outils, c'est difficile, au début, d'évaluer correctement notre production bien que notre consomation soit affichée. On ne sait pas quel taux de minerai on extrait, quel bois on consomme etc .. On ne connait que la bouffe, ça manque de stats ! Autrement, les méchaniques sont sympa et c'est satifaisant de reussir un équilibre dans la chaine de production de tout et n'importe quoi. Là ou CS rejoins Facotorio, c'est sur les automatismes. Si tu veux t'en sortir dans CS, faut tout automatiser, faut que les colons bossent pour toi et que tu n'ais qu'à donner des directives et effectuer des ajustements. Ce cotés là est assez bien réalisé.

Et pour finir, ce qu'il manque a CS c'est ce que les devs ont prévu de faire dans leur "To Do List" que vous pouvez voir sur le site officiel. C'est 2 mecs qui font ça, et c'est un boulot monstrueux mais ce qu'ils font, il le font bien. Pas de vrai bug rencontré apart les erreur de Pathfinding des zombie qui me mettent en mode Siège la nuit, mais un reboot serveur suffit à tout remettre en place. Pas de lag, pas de soucis d'une manière générale ... Le jeu est stable, il est jolie et a un bon potentiel.

Amusez vous bien ! =)

author: {'steamid': '76561198052775066', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 770, 'last_played': 1599960386}
review:
This is the second time I buy this game, the first time I didn’t have the patience to figure out how everything worked so I got overwhelmed and refunded it. The second time I bought it again I started it up and it had a tutorial which helped me get started and from there I figured out my own way thru the game.

The game in its state is playable it has a ton of research and things to build with also it seems to run smooth on my gaming laptop, this being said the game is fun especially if you like building without restrictions and embrace your creativity.

A few cons I found are the colonist which are your workers and objects are rater lifeless that move around to their job site and back to their bed when the sun goes down and so are the zombies that show up at night or day depending on your settings which doesn’t bother me as I know those things will be addressed in a later update.

Overall it’s a great game hopefully it keeps getting better as the time passes, the dev team seems to be involved in the forums and listening to the player base which is important in the games development.

Keep it up Pipliz team.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138066897', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 7530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4265, 'last_played': 1707339937}
review:
Rád kupuju hry v předběžném přístupu. Je někdy dost zajímavé sledovat jak se hry časem postupně mění. Někdy k lepšímu a jindy to tam dobrý není. Colony Survival ale tak někde mězi. Hru jsem si koupil loni na podzim (podzim 2017) a hrá cca 20 hodin. Hra mě dokázala snadno pohltit protože mám rád tyhle typy sandboxových her s otevřeným světem ve stylu Minecraftu. Bohužel ale nadšení z hry netrvalo dlouho a začala být po těch pár desítkách hodin lehce repetetivní. 
Ke hře jsem se tak vrátil až teď po roce a hra dostala pár nových vylepšení a opět dokázala na pár dní zabavit. Musím ale přiznat, že po roce bych čekal, že tvůrci přidají více obsahu než kolik ho bylo před rokem. Přesto je to ale velmi zábavná, která mi bude dělat společnost pár dalších podzimních večerů.
+ příjemná grafika bloků
+ najímaní kolonistů a obrana základny proti zombíkům

author: {'steamid': '76561198006124165', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 12245, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4987, 'last_played': 1655939625}
review:
#Recommended! 

EA games that get recommended from me are rare breed. 
However this game qualifies! 

Note that the game is still under heavy development and far from complete. It isn't especially hard nor are there many things to do (except building, with a rather limited selection of blocks) but the game delivers well so far. I haven't encountered any game breaking bugs, in fact, so far only 1 bug, where I glitch a little through the ground but its easily fixed by jumping or moving around a little. The colony management makes it very interesting along with all those jobs for colonists to take. 

I don't have a very high end gaming rig but I can easily run this game on max settings and I haven't noticed any lag spikes as of yet, although my colony is just shy of 500 at the time of writing. 

I have just recently purchased this game with a friend for MP and while it didn't work as we expected, it worked well enough to play together. With expected I mean; we figured it would be co-op or something close to it, but it turns out you are basically playing single player on a multiplayer server. But that doesn't mean you can't build one giant base together, you simply need to keep your safe zone (from your Banner) in mind along with the upgrades. 

Regarding development speed; It's too soon for me to talk from own experience, but from what I gather the Devs are rather taking more time for bigger updates rather than feeding us "minor" updates all the time. 

Conclusion; 
If you can live with a game that is still under development and shows a lot of promise and are looking for an rather easy going, sanbox building, first person "city sim" with waves of zombies crawling outside you walls, looking for a way in, this is the game for you! 

If you want a more complete experience I suggest you wishlist this game and keep an eye on it, as of there are too few blocks as of now (no stairs, windows, fences etc). The Zombie waves really aren't hard to deal with, I even tried it on highest possible with both day and night, but even that was easy. And a lot of other aspects still need tweaking.
