author: {'steamid': '76561198832204491', 'num_games_owned': 1, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1951, 'last_played': 1552330529}
review: Игра хорошая, графика прекрассная, а игра не требовательная, даже на моём ноутбуке тянет на средних настройках 40-70FPS. Когда играешь первый раз и не смотришь гайды, то реально интересно, особенно когда начинается произвотство различных ламп, стрел, луков. но потом наскучивает. можно пойти в мультиплеер (но у меня нет друзей, так что про мультиплеер промолчу). минусы это то что на всей карте вы один, нет других колоний (в одиночной игре). Игра в принцепе тот же майнкрафт но без модов (если они есть то я их не нашёл и не знаю где искать) и с крутой графикой. играть или не играть спорный вопрос, вот если бы можно было обьявлять войны колониям и в игру добавили бы времена года с выбором климата мягкий, средний, суровый то было бы жеание играть сильное.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080688575', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 6323, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1933, 'last_played': 1601475582}
review:
15000원 정도로 할인하면 제값인 게임
취향이 맞다면 할인할 때 사두면 10시간쯤은 재미있게 즐길 수 있음

총점 : 8/10

단점
- 게임이 아직 미완성이라는 느낌이 많이 듬
- 현재까진 딱 마인크래프트의 모드 중 하나라고 해도 믿을만한 수준
- 마인크래프트 느낌의 샌드박스 + 디펜스 라서 취향을 탐
- 7~8시간쯤 플레이하면 더이상 디펜스는 의미가 없고 샌드박스만 남음
- 보스라던가 빅웨이브라던가 하는 특별한 컨텐츠가 없어 게임이 지루함
- 맵이 넓기만 하고 탐험이랄만한 컨텐츠가 없음 (자원고갈이라는 개념이 없음)

장점
- 업데이트 속도와 내용을 보면 충분히 기대해 볼 만한 게임
- 취향이 맞는다면 굉장히 재미있게 즐길 수 있음
- 기지가 안정기에 접어들 때 까지는 공략하는 맛이 있음
- 게임 도중 몬스터의 낮/밤별 출현여부와 수량을 조절하는 난이도 조절이 가능함
- 게임이 가벼워서 플레이타임이 길어져도 큰 부담이 없음
- 멀티플레이가 원활하게 잘 됨


개인적으로 본인은 취향이 맞아서 정말 재미있게 했음
최종업그레이드까지 끝내고 일꾼들 시켜서 산을 통째로 없애는 작업이 진행되는 것을 보면
뭔가 굉장히 재미있음

author: {'steamid': '76561198321492477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1675311760}
review:
I've made a good deal of progress in the game get started.

But first Sept. 7th they released news on the next update. What you see now is basic but what's coming up looks beautiful and makes the game more worth it. It's great to see that this game is getting updated.

Pros:
- game play is simple
- you can do all of the actions of your colonists
-the progress is determined by you and by what you can do

Cons:
- it's a little too simple I think since all you kill are zombies. Hopefully they'll add more monsters soon.
- the block variety is pretty small( but like I said, an update is coming out )
- it's gets pretty repetative

All in all It's a good game. Simple, fun, and watching your kingdom thrive is great. All you're really missing are better graphics and variety. To me it's well worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198200668319', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 68998, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7954, 'last_played': 1647056576}
review:
8th Dec 2019 update, I have now played over 1112 hours. It is a good game and I even have a server but having a mod give protection is hard work especially as there is some sort of update so I'm trying a hosted server with a simple Pandora Anti Grief so be interesting to see if I can run my own server from a laptop. It has been developed so well done on that score and I'm trying to see if I can create a protected server for multi-play which is better but at times when I refresh like now after a few months with Angry-Guards as protection so I would recommend this game for playing, it can be hard getting it sorted for Multi-play but sometimes I can set and forget and come back and its still running pretty well. 
Setting it up is a pain but worth it and most players coming on are either Griefers or Good players that just want to build, I trade only with those that play it for the long term, no banners set by player means no trade !! Anyway, this game works so hopefully see you in game.
*
Awesome game which is being updated but as it is with 101 hours I have to say worth buying & once you get through the starting up then its easy to build a large colony - sometimes I have lost and had to restart and then a couple of times I got over a hundred and then messed up my defence, once I opened a wall wrong time and got over run by Zombies - a couple of worlds and at 101 hours I have a better colony better defence etc and with 165 villagers I'm looking to get through my first 200 head count - upgrades are worth it, I like digging and making underground base for growing wheat etc - but this its simple but works - this game is best I've bought & played, I like minecraft, minetest and ftb but this is a great solo game and I've played Multi which is OK but I recommend this game - who ever made this has made my day, love it :) Buy it now...

author: {'steamid': '76561198136678367', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 3062, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2432, 'last_played': 1583801222}
review:
やることが同じなので何回かやると飽きる。
自分もプレイヤーとして参加できるのがメリットと感じていらっしゃる方も多いようだが、私はマイナス評価。
ひたすら石を削って、ひたすら木を削る作業が超ストレス。

人の動きもロボットみたいだし、同じ顔同じ服同じ動きで愛着も沸かない。広い床と天井を作ってベッドを１００個でも置いておけばベッドを踏みつぶし人の頭を踏んでいくのに文句も言わない様を見るのはなんだかせつなくなる。
２０人に一人くらいでも「エリート」みたいな人がいて能力も高くて名前がある人とか出てくると面白いかも。

あと広げられるスペースの限りがあるので上に伸ばすしかなく、上下の行き来が非常に面倒だし、毎ゲーム同じ事の繰り返しになるのでストレスを感じる。

とにかく、最初はひたすら５００個も１０００個も永遠と石を削り木を削り、人口が多くなるとやる事が無い（ホントになーんにもない）。
それが分かると、「さて、もう一回あそぼ」とはならないし、ゲームを立ち上げる気にもならない。

スマホの無料ゲームでバスを待っている間にポチポチと遊ぶっていうレベルのゲーム並みかな。

author: {'steamid': '76561198090522944', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 22591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4191, 'last_played': 1680570312}

author: {'steamid': '76561198032046845', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 930, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 712, 'last_played': 1633882975}
review: This game is addicting and fun, however one big thing that limits its enjoyablity for me is the restrictions on how far you can build without zombies spawning inside your fortress. I built mine up in the mountains and as I expanded I thought my greenzone would too, instead I have zombies spawning in my castle and have to limit the size of it or risk getting zombie spawned on my guards. I think as you build the non zombie spawn zone or green zone should follow or else you are stuck with a stagneting small castle and cant build huge empires with castles spanning the mountain ranges.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077230041', 'num_games_owned': 296, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 41208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 74, 'playtime_at_review': 12856, 'last_played': 1712274107}
review:
Muchos pensarán que este juego es como Minecraft y que para este precio os compráis el Minecraft y listo, pero os equivocáis.


Este juego está orientado a crear tu ciudad, hacerla crecer y gestionarla (es más parecido a un juego de gestionar una ciudad que a minecraft), pero con la característica de que es en primera persona y que el mundo está hecho por cubos.


Además de esto, este juego también tiene un toque de defensa de torres (Tower Defense) para defenderse de los zombies que atacan.


Quiero hacer una mención especial a los desarrolladores (Zun & Pipliz) porque trabajan junto con la comunidad para el desarrollo del juego, ya sea preguntando directamente a los usuarios qué quieren o mediante el uso de encuestas para saber qué debería añadir al juego. También mencionar que es de mucho agrado que todos los viernes sin falta hagan un anuncio de en qué han estado trabajando, mostrando como siguen trabajando en este juego y no se han olvidado de él.


PS: Espero que Pipliz no lea esto :P

author: {'steamid': '76561198000330774', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 9505, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5876, 'last_played': 1659888648}
review:
Spiel war mal Toll aber jetzt haben sie es kaput gepatsch man kann kein Zinn abauen und ohne Zin kann man kein Offen herstelen aber für Zinn das zu verarbeiten muss man ein offen haben also sag gasse -.-
Hoffe das sie es wieder ganz patschen dann kann man es wieder spielen.
developer_response:
Hello! Our German isn't perfect, but you seem to describe the following problem. You need a furnace to smelt tin, but you need smelted tin to build a furnace. This paradox prevents you from progressing further. 
Before 0.4.0, it was indeed true that you needed to smelt ores before you could use them. But since that update, the first new ores (copper and tin) don't require smelting before you can use them. You should be able to directly use the tin that you've mined, without a furnace! 
We hope this fixes your issue :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198033532492', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 941, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1623359225}
review:
Ну чтож, написав десяток обзоров на другие игры, напишу и на эту. Для начала сразу скажу что игра разрабатывается 2 людьми, а значит обновлления выходят редко, и у них узкая специализация - поэтому ни графона, ни оптимизации.
Люди пишущие о том что игра схожа с маинкрафтом - не знают что говорят, если и чем она похожа, то интелектом зом... кхм монстров.
Хотя зная людей, надо рассказать по подробне... А стоп ещё и стоунхерт.
Во первых - графика: Чего чего а это не маинкрафт с пикселями (а тут воксели и я скажу это разные вещи) и не стоунхерт с полностью закрашеными одним цветом блоками. Здесь графика приятна и не режет глаз, в отличие от маинкрафта... Хотя это уже другая тема.
ИИ-AI: Что такое ИИ? В понимании некоторых ИИ это интелект умеющий думать - НЕТ. Искуственный Интелект не всегда предпологает это. Он может просто сказать - я пойду туда, ой тут стена, поменяю я маршрут к ближайшому колонисту...
Хотя в маинкрафте и стоунхерте боты используют тоже самое.
Строительство (или колонистами или сам): Вот-больная для игры тема. ЭТО НЕ ЧЁРТОВ МАИНКРАФТ, это самый простой и эффективный способ строительства.
Нет, я не могу вас переубедить с 1.4 часами - НО ЭТО очевидно.

review: This game was fun for maybe the first thirty minutes. What you can actually do is extremely liniar and limited, there isn't a whole lot past telling your colonists what to do. There's hardly any variety, and it becomes the same boring cycle each day and night after the first few days. The ui is funky and overall the entire game just doesn't feel complete yet. I'd recommend waiting or getting this while it's on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041364771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 10825, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4341, 'last_played': 1626910949}
review: This is the best colony builder game I've ever played, and it's not even out of Early Access. The devs give constant updates with new content and bugfixes, and inbetween updates they give weekly blog posts where they tell you exactly what they're working on, and give their thoughts and ideas for future development. The early game can be slow, but after your colony gets past about 50 people and you unlock some of the science, the game picks up and becomes really excellent. There's constantly new things to do and new ways to expand the colony. Once you get to the endgame, you can use all your resources to build giant structures of whatever you want, by ordering builders to fill in regions that you define. It's like minecraft, but all the boring digging and placing blocks in rows is done for you by workers: all you have to do is plan everything out and watch it come together.

author: {'steamid': '76561198344574438', 'num_games_owned': 737, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1286, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 764, 'last_played': 1675215659}
review:
Since this games only in early access, I have decided to write a review on it. 

TL;DR: This game is on no level bad. It is a fantastic concept. however, there isn't that much to do. You build, and set up what you want your colonists to do. 


In this game, you build your base, and you come up with areas for farms and mines. Once you find all the resources in the mines that you need, you tell your colonists to sit there and dig on them. The ores that they dig do not go away, ever, like you would expect them to. When farming, it is important that you have more than plenty food, as your food acts as a currency; each of your colonists eat 5 a day, and hiring new colonists costs 50 food.

After you get so far into the game, it almost seems like theres nothing else to be done. There is only 4 kinds or workers (farmers, guards, miners, and construction) and once you build so much and have so many of each you have to ask yourself, "what else can I do here?" 

I love this game. I can't wait for more things to be added. There absolutely needs to be more: mobs (only 4 different kinds, I only made it to first 3), more jobs for colonists, and more things for the player(s) to do. Make the player(s) leave the fort, and find new stuff. Make me leave my comfort zone. Make me wonder what might happen once I'm doing something completely different. 

This game is not worth $20 right now. Once there's more things in the game however, would I believe it's worth that much. Right now, I think the game should be worth $7.50-$10. No higher.

Great game. Add more. 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198295865234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 679, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 679, 'last_played': 1533163303}
review: Overall, I'd honestly rate this game 4/10 or 5/10 at the moment. The game is fun, and I enjoyed it; however, currently it's still in early access and it is fairly noticable. The game gets repitiive and old rather quickly. After about four hours, I found myself kind of wondering what would be next for me to do, and the answer was simply either just build or stand there and do nothing. And, while building is fun, if I wanted a game with monsters and building alone- I'd play something along the lines of minecraft. What makes this game different is having the colonists, defending them in a tower defense style, and then continuing to expand and make new things. The issue is with so little mobs, it's very simple to make a small winding path, create a couple guards, and then you never worry about the mobs again. The tower defense style just doesn't work with such simple AI and easy to make defenses. In my opinion, the game isn't really worth the price. I'd make it somewhere along 10$ at the most and 7.50$ at the least. I do think people should try this game and see if they like it because it does seem like the game could be great and the developers care about how it turns out and how everything works- it just isn't there at the moment. Overall, I'd say give this game a try if you think you'd like to build and not do much else. But, if you're looking for a good tower defense with good enemies, or something along the lines of a base defense game with loads for you to do, then it isn't for you. Often times, you'll find yourself doing other things while you wait for something to be researched, only to unlock the research, place a block coorelating to that research, making a new colonist, and then repeating. I wouldn't reccomend this game personally- at least -not right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041636869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 187, 'playtime_forever': 11061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1633, 'last_played': 1675702116}
review: Never buy a game in Early Access for the potential. Only buy a game if it already has enough content to be worth the asking price. Colony Survival is already at that level and then some. I managed to put in well over 20 hours building up a colony and researching technology to the end game level. The Devs are very active with weekly blogs and interact with the community a lot, so that’s an added bonus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055780740', 'num_games_owned': 5600, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 1409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1409, 'last_played': 1532786197}
review:
[quote][url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/7871885/]Follow our curator page:[b] OCG-Curations[/b] if you like and want to see more reviews like this one.[/url][/quote]

[u]Rating[/u]
[b]6.5/10[/b] 

[u]Pros:[/u]  
Excellent Optimization
Simple, Minecraft-esque Building System
First Person Perspective in a colony management sim
Interesting Tower Defense Style Gameplay

[u]Cons:[/u] 
Block Textures Don’t Connect
Low Enemy Variation
No reason to care about colonists besides the fact that they collect resources
Needs More Content
No Ability to Pause

[h1]Overview[/h1] 
Colony Survival is a basic, but solid, colony sim. Unfortunately, it is lacking in deep content and it is difficult to create meaningful stories from the gameplay. The graphics are fine, but a little flawed. One of the more agitating features that isn’t present is the ability to pause. The player runs a small kingdom where the colonists perform complex tasks and it is up to player to make sure they are able to perform tasks, such as farming, safely. A day and night cycle is present. Slow zombies appear at night time and the player or guards can attack these monster who are trying to attack the kingdom. I enjoyed the Tower Defense aspects mixed into the game and it creates the combined Tower Defense and Colony Sim genre. The monster gameplay component is disappointing as there are only zombies and the only differentiator from one zombie type to another is the fact that one has more health than the other. The engine works beautifully, which makes the game run quite well. 

[h1]Game Breakdown[/h1]

[u]Gameplay:[/u] 
 
[b]Resource Collection[/b]
One of the most important mechanics in a Colony Sim is resource collection. Initially, the player must collect resources themselves in a Minecraft-esque, block breaking mechanic. This is the way that the player clears out the dirt and trees so that there is enough space to create a camp. A player will have enough beds to start a colony, as each colonist requires their own bed. I was hoping that once I had a few colonists, they would be able to assist me in clearing out the space around my camp. Unfortunately, they are only able to do complex jobs such as farming, and aren’t able to cut down wood unless they are a forester and it is in a predetermined area. While this mechanic is initially nice as it allows a player to have something to do while food and other resources are being generated, it quickly becomes a chore. Food is the most important resource in the entire game. Without it, the entire colony will starve and die. Initially, the only way to generate food is to create berry farmers. These farms are highly inefficient, and to continue to grow one’s colony, bread must be researched.

[b]Research[/b]
There is a research tree in this title, though the end of it is mainly comprised of only speed upgrades. During the beginning of the tech tree, new, interesting research can be conducted. To perform this research, a colonist must spend time working at the research table. After a technology is chosen, the researcher will get to work and will consume the required resources each “cycle. A “cycle” is a certain amount of time the researcher takes to perform one single research cycle. Once all of the cycles are completed. A research is unlocked. The way that research is organized into tiers is through the use of science bags and new research requiring products from previous technologies. These new resources may only be unlocked through a previous technology, which creates a sense of progression. Science bags are reusable and expensive resources that are required in recipes with which they are associated. For example, the Life Science Bag is used to research technologies related to health and life. Research can also lead to new blocks and weaponry. 

[b]Construction and Defense[/b]
At night, zombies will attack the player’s colony in an attempt to destroy the flag at the center of the colony. Zombies are the only enemy type and their varities simply have more health. I was hoping for new mechanics to arise from longer survival, but it didn’t happen. A player alone won’t be able to defeat these zombies. Day and Night guards can be placed in a single position. When they see an enemy, they will attack them. The first weapon available to guards is the sling. It defeats basic zombies in two hits. After tankier zombies appear, bows and other newer weaponry must be unlocked to defeat them. While there are some flaws with this system, it was the system I enjoyed the most. It creates a unique genre which combines tower defense and colony sim. I hope the tower defense mechanics are expanded upon more as I think the developer has a really unique genre emerging from this game.

[b]Overall:[/b] 
This is a fun game with some solid basics, and not much else. The first person perspective helps to make the player feel like they are more a part of the game, but it isn’t enough to connect me to my kingdom. The developer, Pipliz, seems to really care about their game so I hope they will end up with an excellent title. As it is right now though, this is not the best colony sim on the market. 


[u]Story:[/u] 
Creating one’s own story in a colony sim is one of the best parts, which is why I was so disappointed that there no elements to this game that allowed such a story to be created. Most colony sims will attach a name to a colonist so that the player has a basic emotional attachment to them. Unfortunately, Colony Survival doesn’t do this, which makes all of my faceless peons no different from one another. This is especially frustrating because colonists are so easy to recruit and don’t require training to do jobs, so they are all expendable.

[u]Sound:[/u] 
The sound design is decent, but there are some annoyances with it. The sound effects are fine and it is quite pleasing to hear the colonists working, but hearing the wheat farmers replanting constantly and loudly when the crops are ready is frustrating. Especially since it is just as loud as every other sound effect. Besides that, the other sounds are quite nice and are often varied enough to not become annoying. There isn’t much in the way of music though. 

 [u]Graphics:[/u] 
The graphics in this title are quite nice except for one aspect. The great details are the models, lighting, and textures. For example, the dirt models are all full of nodules that give the models a more realistic look. The lighting on the world also looks quite realistic. There is quite a bit of lens flare in the evening and the world starts looking like it has an orange tint to it. The final decent element is the textures. All of the different items in the world are easily distinguishable thanks to their wonderful textures that help bring the more realistic art style together. The element of the graphics that could really be improved is that the blocks in the worlds have visible seams between each other. The textures and models don’t seamlessly blend together. This might have been a design choice to make it easier to tell single blocks apart from one another, but I think it is unnecessary with the blue selection cube that the game already uses. 

[u]Performance:[/u] 
The performance of this title is impressively good. Even though there were many zombies on the screen alongside my colonists, I never noticed any slowdown or stuttering. The game never slowed down and was consistently performing well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198186224333', 'num_games_owned': 254, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1673346437}
review:
Яиграл в эту игру очень долго , Не только в стиме  , Тут не видно колво часов , я играл в автономном режиме , вообщем хочу сказать , что игра мне очень нравится приколько, создавать деревню , где твои люди и ты не один , да в ней покачто нет особых трудностей и разнообразного геймплея , но мать вашу это же  ранний доступ , вам просто дали возможность посмотреть как игра будет развиваться а вы можете играть в нее , и как бы разработчики карячатся над этой игрой днями , смешно слышать от тех кто поиграл немного , то что тут всё просто , пф ты сколько играл? У тебя враги с одной стрелы умирают?
ТЫ что дядя , ты хотябы до 200 колонистов дойди там жопа полная , там за всем следить Надо . Колонисты кстати много косячат , я только отхожу в деревне уже полный пиздец, 
В дискорде разрабы выкладывают то над чем работают ,
Очень смешат те кто говорит что это чудо это копия майнкрафта
ТЫ СЕРЬЕЗНО?
ТЫ ИГРАЛ ХОТЬ В МАЙНКРАФТ ? 
Ну как бы она ничем не похожа на майнкрафт . она в  разы интересней как мне кажеться
Графика тут очень приятная , оптимизация нормальная , но можно и лучше 
Вообщем всем советую , ладно не всем , тупой школоте я не советую .идите в свой майнкрафт , а разработчику респект . надеюсь увидить шедевр
И да. грядет очень крупное обновление оно очень разнообразит и усложнит игру , конечно это и сделает ее в разы  интересней , аж нетерпится

author: {'steamid': '76561198034783111', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5302, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4803, 'last_played': 1545171709}
review: Extremely interesting concept that gives you more goals and activities to keep in mind versus other block based games. Every day you have to ensure you are able to survive the night, making small adjustments constantly, but with plenty of time to build along if you have the time. I absolutely love this game. By far one of my favorites to play for hours and zone out on after a long stressful day. Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137460946', 'num_games_owned': 153, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 523, 'playtime_at_review': 729, 'last_played': 1712385825}
review: I'll start this review by getting one thing out of the way. This game is in early access, so if you buy it, be prepared for bugs and stuff. Anyway, Colony Survival is about, well, it's name and it holds up to it. I love the Colonist system, the building creativity, and the 'wave defense' that takes place during the night. This game combines aspects from minecraft and your typical colony survival game as well as tower defense. Although, I do have to complain about the Zombie spawning system. I do hate the spawning system underground, as they can spawn on you if your not in your safe zone, and it has almost ruined me multiple times when a sneaky one will try to break my flag by coming through my mines.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036241399', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 6708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6660, 'last_played': 1549137991}
review:
If you are like me you have probably had some pretty incredible builds in Minecraft. But after the build is complete and you view your creation in its awesome splendor you can't help but be a little disappointed because there is really nobody around that is going to live in it. This game fills that void. Not only can you recruit colonists to live in it but you can also give them jobs to help with the productivity and the survival of the colony. You have your colonists take on tasks such as growing food, mining, and guarding the settlement which leaves you free to do what you like to do best. 
The game is stable, the graphics are decent, the shaders incredible. Even on older PCs it still works pretty good. The game has research, multi-player capability and adjustible difficulty. It also has some elements of a tower defence game.
The dev's are actively involved in the games evolution and development. Even at it's current price point you are still getting your money's worth for a game. I am excited to see where this game goes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048056458', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 29606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11415, 'last_played': 1710990571}
review:
The minecraft vibes  can put many people off or keep them from taking it seriously, but this game packs a punch and requires a lot of planning. It's a perfect hybrid between tower defense and resource management. A lot of content has been added that forces you to keep grinding to unlock the next best thing. Build your fortress, and defend it. 

I began playing this game when there were only bows & arrows and 2 or 3 different ores to be mined. Now there are several mineable resources, all at different depths. You manage your people making sure you have enough archers to defend you, workers to reduce the amount of work you do personally, all while making sure you have enough farmers to feed everyone. Easily worth the money, especially with the multiplayer mechanics coming in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198118796956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 19870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6718, 'last_played': 1602448793}
review: Take the open world building possibilities of Minecraft, and add a bunch of dudes to help you build, but they need food and tools and guards to defend them from the hordes of zombies at night.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079192394', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9042, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3982, 'last_played': 1620192808}
review:
When I first saw this game I immediately skipped past it because of the voxel based graphics and how many boring old minecraft lookalikes I see on steam but I was completely wrong and heres a pros and cons list of why.

---PROS---
.The AI you hire to do jobs for you, work perfectly. There are heaps of different jobs for colonists (AI) to do and in my experience each and every single works amazingly well for a game in early access.

.CONTENT. One of the largest issues with modern gaming is a lack of content but in this  game as a casual player you can spend weeks getting to the end game and even when you do reach that point you still feel like you are not done because in Colony Survival you always feel like you can do something. Eg: I could set up more miners to get more resources to build more ammo so I can hire more guards so that I dont have to worry about my defenses for a while while I work on numerous other things.

.This game lets your creative juices flow. There are so many different variations in how you build your colony from the ground up and how you decide to organise everything.  Do you want to build a sprawling city on flat ground. Then do it. Do you want to build a huge tree house colony, or have an underground city, do you want to have specific buildings for each job or do you want to build a single skyscraper that houses your entire colony. All of this and more is possible.

.Potential. Colony Survival shows amazing potential. When it first released in June 2017 the game kept you happily occupied for a couple weeks with its simple mechanics and a handful of colonist jobs but it is still growing and since its release heaps of new features and items have come along just to prove the  games potential. I am excited to try the ideas that the Colony Survival devs have mentiond is on their roadmap.

.The game is very easy to learn. While there is so much to do and think about in this game it is still very simple to get your head around and can still be relaxing.

---Cons---
.At the time I am writing this review, there is extremely little multiplayer interaction. Other than seeing other players character models and colonies there is nothing. I played coop with a friend and we had both our colonies next to eachother which was fun at first but you  cant do anything else together rather than place your guards  together and help eachother out against enemies. It would be great to see joint colonies where 2 or more players can effect the same colony. Kind of like ARK's tribe feature.

.The procedurally generated world is fairly basic. you will most commonly spawn near grasslands, forest and ocean but there are numerous other biomes out there. I only discovered these other biomes by flying around the map after I was finished with my first colony. Even with the addition of these biomes the world is still just ok. Nothing amazing but nothing horrible about it.

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

Overall I thoroughly enjoy Colony Survival and I would highly recommend it to anyone if theyre willing to give the voxel graphics a chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198381996374', 'num_games_owned': 11, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7597, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1808, 'last_played': 1680439059}

author: {'steamid': '76561198292371922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2791, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2297, 'last_played': 1629491267}
review:
Colony Survival is truly a very promising game.
What it might not have now, it certainly will have in the future, as the developers are constantly on the discord, you can talk to either of them personally at virtually any time of day. Not only are they easy to contact, but they are also extremely transparent about what they plan on adding, and also the roadmap. Heck, some of the features on the 0.7.0 roadmap are community suggested!
Aside from what the game could be, let’s talk about what it is.
In it’s current state, Colony Survival is definitely a game worth getting for twenty dollars. I’m not going to lie, the total variety of building blocks is somewhat lacking, but this can easily be fixed by one of the multiple mods out there. However, the colony management aspect of the game is already good, and will be much better in 0.7.0 (Check out the Friday Blog, it has a progress meter for all the features to be added) Although the defense aspect of the game is, yes, rather simple and sometimes boring, balancing all the aspects of the game, such as farming, research, crafting, and defending, is quite rewarding. 
I think I’ve rambled enough about this game, so the only advice o can give is: If you liked playing the factions mini game on Minecraft servers, you will probably like this game. 
If you only want to build cool structures, then I recommend that you get this game and install mods, as the lighting in this game is absolutely beautiful.
Lastly, if you are on the fence about getting this game, then go watch some YouTube videos.
Update: 0.7 update coming soon, watch the discord for news.
Thanks

author: {'steamid': '76561197965820698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 184, 'playtime_forever': 2085, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2085, 'last_played': 1531562171}
review: Oddly compelling. It's like building your own ants nest. It's fun to set up and it's fun to watch it ticking away. It's interesting trying to keep everything running smoothly as you grow in size and hectic trying to resolve things if it goes wrong and you either run out of some resource or have to deal with zombies breaking into your settlement. Right now you mostly play for the fun of playing but it looks like there will be some interesting stuff coming in future updates. If you aren't into Early Access then keep an eye on this. I think it's going to be a lot of fun once it gets a final release. If you are OK with Early Access then there is already enough game here to get your money's worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138652738', 'num_games_owned': 472, 'num_reviews': 176, 'playtime_forever': 673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1692265351}
review:
我觉得这是个哲学游戏
因为你可以学习到非常多的人生哲理：

1.领导者未必有什么特殊技能，也许只是会立flag
2.能力越大，责任就越大，国王是没有资格睡觉的
3.只有走路顺拐的傻子才会给你不辞劳苦的干活
4.计划生育是很重要的，生的越多，越容易死光
5.吃饭，没什么比吃饭更重要的事
6.所有的工作岗位都会养闲人，但是你还不能开除他们

音乐      0/10 你听不到BGM不是因为你聋了
画面    10/10 自带光影mod优化贼好的MC了解一下
操作      7/10 鼠标左右键反转，起手的时候感觉非常反人类，习惯了又觉得合情合理
剧情      0/10 唯一的剧情大概就是看你的屁民们用脚“踩”矿，用眼神杀人以及顺拐走路
耐玩度   5/10 科技树长到飞起，但是恕我直言，当你的人民达到120人左右的时候，已经不再需要增加人口和训练科技了，安心造 
                     房子好了
沉迷度 10/10 砍树种地盖房子生孩子永远都玩不够！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198030751487', 'num_games_owned': 544, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 25283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3338, 'last_played': 1696724883}
review:
I'm havinbg a blast.

It feels like a cross between Minecraft and a standard Tower Defense game.  It's also fairly Dwarfy, in that good way some of you are familiar with.  Depending on your setting you can 'beat' the game fairly easily, as each night the same monsters will attack in more or less the same way.  My current game has four equidistant entrances and each night the attacks vary in intensity by entrance, but overall it's much the same.  Still, I'm rearranging the inside of my base, making it look cool and all.

You can build very large structures.  My base, not the largest possible, takes a good two minutes to run around the perimeter wall.  I started on a hill but moved to a nearby plain to build the base.  next time, I'll go to the top and build a mountain fortress.  You get all the time in the world to start, as no monsters spawn until you drop the Banner.  Highly recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198416898443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 32232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8380, 'last_played': 1701007383}

author: {'steamid': '76561198146141710', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2889, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2739, 'last_played': 1602543277}
review:
このゲームは下記の考えをお持ちの方にお勧めです。

建築がしたいけど、鉱石、建築資材とかを集めるのが面倒！
自分の建てた陣地の堅牢さを確かめたい！

敵の行動はまだまだ単純なので物足りないと感じる方もいるかもしれませんが、
今後のアップデートで特殊、ボスモンスターなどの計画があるらしいのでそこは待ちましょう。

ただ、（個人的な）欠点を言えばモンスターを倒す楽しみが欲しいです。
例えばレアな鉱石やアイテムを落とすなどですかね。

小さな開発現場なのでゆっくりとアップデートを見守りましょう。

author: {'steamid': '76561198108117223', 'num_games_owned': 349, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1018, 'last_played': 1529220566}
review:
Colony Survival is something like Minecraft with a tower defense mode. In the day you gather resources, at night you have to defend your base from zombies. So far, the only monsters at night are just zombies, but they come in different colours corresponding to their toughness. Grey is the squishest, followed by green, and then red.

One crucial resource in this game is food. You need food to hire more colonists and feed them, but if it goes in a deficit, your base is going down. Hired colonists can be assigned to take certain jobs, such as farmer, a guard, miner or digger. As your colony grows bigger and becomes bustling with activity, more and more zombies will spawn during the night, accentuating the need to have more guards and equip better weapons.

However, this game is still in Early Access, and many things may change. I feel that in its current state, Colony Survival is not worth 20 SGD. The gameplay gets boring and repetitive after a while, as you're simply just doing the same thing over and over again. Make more farms. Build bigger bases to accomodate more colonists. Defend it during the night, rinse and repeat. Colony Survival has potential, but it lacks depth. Make the game more immersive and engaging. Add a weather system that may have ramifications on your crops, base, colonists or health. Add more kinds of food, blocks, plants, biomes, and equipment. Add animations for the colonists working on their jobs, especially for the guards.

Early Access games are still in their infant stage. Think and evaluate carefully about buying one, and read up more on the developers. There are awesome early access games that have been released, like Subnautica, but there are also ones like DayZ or PUBG, where everything is in a complete mess or being in Early Access for years (you know who!).

5/10

6 July 2018

author: {'steamid': '76561198043462821', 'num_games_owned': 670, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 13356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1732, 'last_played': 1706990675}
review:
So, a couple of days ago (by the time of this review i have 22 hours), i got this game while it was on sale. I have basically played nothing else since. its addictive, because everything you do is solve problems. only about an hour or two is needed for your colony to become self-sustaining, but then you have to expand and defend. and the defence can be quite tough the more colonists you have. 

its very casual i think, but will ramp up in difficulty as you go. 

the only points i can really make are these: it would be nice if i could micro manage my production more. have specific smiths focus on making arrows, while others make plates, and so on, istead of just waiting for *ALL* the arrows to be made, before moving on to the plates. 

i definitely recommend it, if you like making autonomous cities.

author: {'steamid': '76561198280064112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5858, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5296, 'last_played': 1658826350}
review:
Игра просто супер, даже несмотря на то, что сыровата. Эта сырость объясняется тем, что в самой игре как раз не хватает тех деталей о которых написал разрабодчик : животных, фракций, заданий, новых монстров, различных биомов (в которых, хотелось что бы было, как и плодородная почва так и неплодородная).
- Насчёт животных, хотелось бы что бы были реализованы "вороны", они обьяснилибы тот факт как появляются зомби в близи самой колонии, а так же исчезновения их после смерти (все-таки падалью полакомиться могут)
- По поводу фракций хотелось бы по больше разнообразия(в религии, военной мощи и торговой силы) , военных действий и политических интригах. Так же, хотелось что бы были добавлены такие вещи как, торговые дороги(которые можно будет прогладывать самому, и защищать), нельзя и обделять бандитские группировки (ведь не в сежи выбирают честную жизнь в колонии).
- Насчёт заданий нечего сказать, но хотелось бы, что бы за них что-то можно было получить по круче каких либо ресурсов, к примеру: получение уважение от местных знакомых лордов, сильного оружия, признания колонистов и пополнения своих рядов (что может заменить немного банальное и не объяснимое появления их из банера)
- Монстров по больше и по круче, а то эти:
1) Зомби (обычный) 100 H,
2) Зомби (зелёненький) 300 H,
3) Зомби (покрасневший) 500H,
как то слабоваты для такой игры.
- А так же хотелось что бы были улучшены кирки, топоры и мечи, а то что рукой что киркой или топором разницы не какой.
А мечи хотелось бы подточить, ведь урон в 50 H слаб даже для первого вида зомби.

Игра просто класс, надеюсь со временем станет только лучше)))

author: {'steamid': '76561198819490926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 16885, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3865, 'last_played': 1677629879}
review: A surprisingly unique gameplay style with the first person strategy element and great progression in the science tree, although i would always ask for more in the science table. the amount of items is already superb, giving variety and encouaging creativity. for an early access title, i'm very impressed. my main criticism would be that there is some major performance issues from lighting overlapping, or being too dense in an area, despite the game running superb on high settings generally. am very exited to see what is added in future! As always with a game of this type, I would just say more of every thing - progression, items, world gen details is a good way forward to keep people invested.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116682082', 'num_games_owned': 129, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 3379, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 535, 'last_played': 1668744479}
review: Man I really do like this game. I've got this game on sale for 15 bucks, and I think thats a 15 bucks well spent. I even got my friend in copy, and he likes this game very much indeed. It's early access, but that's not an excuse for the devs to slack off, and from what I've noticed, they definetly are from being lazy. The devs really do care about the game and their community, and have a tight-knit relation ship with them. The game is about starting your own kingdom, and while it seems slow at first, it starts to pickup the pace with more colonists and science researched, a game mechanic put in the game to advance your colony from a meager peasant shanty-town to a sprawling empire. This game is limited by the features the devs put out, which at some point, will most likely be integrated. The features could come from the devs or the mods, which the devs are, from what I've seen, extremely happy to help and stay in close contact with aspiring mod developers. I am very eager for the future for the game, and the current state is quite fun by itself. Honestly, this game is worth the money but if you can get it on sale for early access there's even more reason to get it. The devs, imo, have earned the respect the community and deserve every penny they can get. However, some things I think devs should add: better multiplayer support (which from what I can see is being implemented int 0.7), diverse mobs, and perhaps neutral enemy npc castles and trading, sieges, armies, colony minigames like cards, a similar to chess game, etc which I know would take ages to implement and quite hard to realize but would make the game something more than just a tower defense. That's just what I, personally would like to see in the game. Anyways, my gamer entitlement aside, I really like what the guys over at Pipliz games are doing. I highly recommend this game, and encourage yourself try this game out!

author: {'steamid': '76561198066039304', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2032, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 230, 'last_played': 1691348551}

author: {'steamid': '76561198022260057', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5364, 'last_played': 1638143920}
review:
I'm 25 hours into this game and still enjoying it. If that was all I got out of it I would consider my 15 bucks well spent. However, I see a lot of promise here and I always appreciate indie developers so I would like to offer some feedback.

1. Its frustrating that colonists will put on the clothes of a particular trade and be stuck there until I take their work away from them. I hate finding 5 guys standing in front of kilns with check marks over their heads, not doing anything. I would like a menu to prioritize occupations so that if I place a workbench and I value that more than flax production, a flax farmer will automatically change jobs. I would also like them to change jobs if their work is complete. I imagine there could be a problem with colonists leaving a job because they reached the firewood cap, then someone uses firewood so they go back and you have people walking in circles. Maybe to prevent that, they could determine whether or not to quit their job in the morning?

2. Clearing grass is super time consuming. Having a colonists clear all the grass and trees off of a plot would be a major luxury.

3. I dont know if its intended but I have zombies leftover from the night and I have to place day guards because the night guards will just walk away and let them in.  Would you consider implementing a feature where zombies burn up in the sunlight? 

I really like the idea of a more dynamic multiplayer with the possibility for attacking each others' colonies. I would also like to see more types of weapons, agriculture, rare items, tech, etc. I know this game is in the very early stages but I'm very excited about the potential.

author: {'steamid': '76561198287503694', 'num_games_owned': 116, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 529, 'last_played': 1711160320}
review:
8/10. When I play new games I try to avoid tutorials and youtube videos so I can figure out game mechanics and such on my own and this game, while doable, did take a little longer but definitely worth it towards understanding the game concept. You start out by plotting a base, farming, recruiting new colonist, and expanding by researching. I do recommend heavily focusing on farming and don't underestimate how much food you will need for new colonists. v0.7 is coming out soon which is suppose to be the biggest update since release which is nice but as long as the developers continue developing then this will turn into a very nice little relax-put on music- and chill game.

Pros:
-Basic but pleasant/appealing graphics.
-Satisfying progression of automation of your 'empire'
-Wide variety of biomes and places to establish a base

Cons:
-Little enemy diversity (the threat of monsters at this point in development is nonexistent)
-Sometimes confusing on research, science, etc.
-Very basic animations for NPCs

author: {'steamid': '76561198377871866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6725, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 493, 'last_played': 1684986459}
review:
I personally really enjoy the game. The main argument is that it is knock-off minecraft due to the art style but in all honesty the things that the games focus is nothing like minecrafts. Instead of going to gather stone in the mines you are micro-managing your miners so that they can reach a bed and food before night fall gets to late. And instead of going to hunt some night monsters you are setting up colonists to defend your colony in proper shooting positions. Instead of farming some sheep you are trying to optimise your farms so that each colonist can eat a proper meal. But the thing that I love the most about this game is the devs, just look at the number of dev diaries, thats all you need to see. 

Ngl great game to play with friends and it leads to some great rivalries

author: {'steamid': '76561198147816572', 'num_games_owned': 184, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1658801539}
review:
This game is a good game. While it has a couple bugs, it is fully playable. The developers are working on it, providing updates and content. There is even a budding modding community that can provide content if and when you tire of building ocean cities and castles.

And the commands allow you to enter a state of true sandbox if you tire of having to gather the resources. A tool for the builders. One of my favorite things to do is build up a massive population, and then set the horde upon them, and see how long it takes for the defenses to be overrun.

I only have a single qualm with the game. Well, two, but mostly just one. There is no creative mode, and The AI pathing is extremely linear, and they will path througha  maze the most effective way possible. And thye enemies will form single file lines towards your base. While this makes it easy to tell where to place towers and guards, I find it a bit mechanical. The eneimes in my opinion should have a bit of randomness in their movements, move aimlessly towards the base, rather than look like they are drawn along a conveyor belt.

You will undoubtedly think of many ways this game can be improved, and this is the beauty of a sandbox. I personally think a "remove all jobs" button would be fantastic, and a command that toggles creative mode? Maybe some building tols that can help expansion be less tedious at times, epecially wen your building involves repetitive motions. But regardless, the game has a good base, a good build, a good progression, and a fair, albeit semi-difficult scaling.

I personally love the game, and hpe that it recieves more and more attention. The larger the community, the larger the project, we can expect excellence from this developer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198411254554', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 6087, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1707577007}

author: {'steamid': '76561198336245300', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1529818460}
review:
I will not play this game again until the tutorial is more player-friendly and does not assume that I have photographic memory. The tutorial was literally a few pop-up windows of pure information and does not actually walk you through the basics step by step in-game. A pdf link to the game's manual was provided in the game menu. 

My berry farmer was removing berry bushes that I planted and not harvesting anything at all. The farmer had a flying bee icon above his head, but the manual doesn't even explain the different icons that pop up above the colonists' head. I wasted one hour reading the manual, trying to understand the game, and refunded it. I still don't understand the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147547133', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 20564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2366, 'last_played': 1600187839}
review:
Honestly I will say I was put off at the beginning for the feeling of minecraft-like features, I didn't have a very good feeling with that game nor did I particulary enjoy it.

That being said below are is my current opinion of the game.

      Im a RTS FANDOM this is by far one of the most interesting RTS builders I've had the priveledge of playing, I will say the beginning is quite a slow start as you are really bottle-necked with food and general resources.
But once you actually achieve +50 colonist I honestly haven't enjoyed myself this much in a long time, I'm really into building a tower of babylon. I love what the Devs have done and I do certainly enjoy the content that they have put fourth.

I have not been playing since release back in the day but I happenend to pick it up recently as I heard a lot of hype about it in the office, now that being said I want YOU the reader to understand if your looking for a fast paced RTS this might not be your jibe until you reach the later game when your pushing 150 colonists. At that point your going to struggle to fend off the zombies at night and let me tell you then can be brutal even on normal mode.

Farming resources for inhouse items such as arrows can be difficult as they must be crafted for 1 and for 2 requires a dense amount of copper arrows.

A suggestion for the devs: please make harvesting resources for projectiles less diminishing on the stockpile or so your workers can craft those items quicker like in bundles of 50 or something. That would be greatly appreciated because the need for forges and workshops can be a bit dificult to keep in steady heavy supply...

As for what I rate this game I overall give it a 8.2 and its probably the best RTS i've played since WC3 or BFME...

Thank you for taking the time to read this, I hope it was helpful.
And to all you new comers goodluck and enjoy!!!

review: 这游戏的经营类似于要塞，就是招募人口，然后分配工作，接着各种职业的人口把收获的各种物品像交税一样放到附近的仓库里，这些人口终日劳动只需要一张床和每天一点食物就是给他们的工资，然后晚上又像七日杀和Minecraft一样晚上会出现怪物来攻击，前期粮食不够只能自己守夜，后期就能招募士兵了。反正是一款不错的模拟经营游戏类似于Minecraft的方块风格，第一人称，可建造，画质大概就像是Minecraft打了凹凸高清材质和光影mod。唯一不足就是目前内容有点少，并且人物没有手臂和手臂动作

author: {'steamid': '76561198087151946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3875, 'last_played': 1683043510}
review:
If you want a fully finished game, this isn't the game for you. 

If you want a game that is fully in development and has active devs, an increasingly active modding community, people who genuinely love the game and want to help newcomers, has replayability, has multiplayer and all for a decent price (especially on sale) that pays for the devolopers' rent and bills as they develop their lovechild, this game is for you!

The devs for Colony Survival are great. They have a vision for what they want to game to look like, both month to month and an idea for what they want the end product to be. They listen to their community, and take suggestions - both smart and less smart ones - seriously. The last update that dropped yesterday (June 21) gave us a bunch of UI and quality of life changes, many of which were suggested by the community. 

As for the nitty gritty of the game:
Does it get repetitive? Yes.
Does it have an end goal? No.
Is there a limit to what you can accomplish or build? No.
Is it like a lot of voxel games that are basically a shell of a game? Absolutely not.
Multiplayer? Yep.
Can you run your own servers for friends? Yes. 
Is there a steep learning curve? Yeah. For first couple hours. Then you get the hang of it and it becomes second nature, just like every other game.
Is the game unique from the plethora of other voxel games out there? Yes. 
Is it a Minecraft clone? No.
Bugs? A couple, but nothing game-breaking that I've found yet @ ~65 hours of play time. Which is incredible, considering most Early Access games are basically more faulty code and bug nets than actual game these days.

So at the end of the day, it can get repetitive, sure. But it also has replayability, especially since they consistently add quality new content. Got to 1000 dudes on one file, but feel like you could do it faster, or more efficiently, or more erratically, or without walls, or without grain foods. with harder zombies, with mods, with zombies spawning during the day AND night? You can try all of those and countless others that I could never come up with. 
Multiplayer is where the game really shines, even as it stands now. Hop on Discord and just chat with friends as you casually build up an empire of 1000's of colonists to cater to your every wish and whim. Multiple colonies and trade are all planned for the (very near) future. Mods already exist to share your stockpiles between players, to increase the playing-with-friends feel, which I believe is something they are looking at adding into the game itself as toggleable feature when they finish with a couple content updates.

Early Access scare you? Fair. Don't buy it. I believe it's worth it now anyway, but it will only get more worth it. So if you wait six months to a year to see what becomes of it, I wouldn't hold that against you. 

Do I recommend this game? Yeah. Is it for everyone? No. But I think that anyone can come to love and enjoy the game, if they give it a fair chance.

P.S. This review isn't including mods. With mods, this game is 140% worth it. There are mods that add buildable teleportation, turrets, more blocks, jobs, machines, roaming settlers looking to join your colony, bosses that can be stupid difficult, and more. It's one of the simplest games to mod I've ever played to date. Devs also love the modding community and do their best to make modders' lives easier.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041353132', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 2485, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1885, 'last_played': 1636774436}
review:
Let me tell you what this game is NOT

It's NOT a browser game masquerading as a worth-money product.  
It's NOT a weekend project hiding its lack of content behind timesinks.  
It's NOT a sadomassochism simulator screwing you with a rigged RNG.  
It's NOT a game with fake reviews.  
It's NOT a game with paid trolls shouting down players in the forum.  
It's NOT a content-starved asset flip.  

It's NOT a Unity splash screen, followed by a dot on a solid background (I have seen that from something on the Steam store, no joke)

Now, let me tell you what it IS.  

It IS an actual, honest-to-goodness indie game that doesn't prevent itself from being played.  These days, that's all it takes to stand head and shoulders above the vast majority of indie games on Steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109926115', 'num_games_owned': 399, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1457, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 661, 'last_played': 1652942955}
review:
Игра явно имеет какой-то потенциал, вот и все. Если объяснять кратко и ясно, то это Minecraft, которому в рот запихнули огромный кусок Tower Defense и сверху присыпали немного стратегии. В общем и целом, играть интересно. Правда, иногда, если вы решились строить свой замок на каком-нибудь сервере, происходят лютые вещи, когда все твои домработницы внезапно куда-то исчезают, притом и еда, и стрелы, да и камни тоже в порядке. Что, спрашивается, вызвало этот геноцид твоего народа? Ответа нет. Поэтому готовьтесь к тому, что однажды утром, проснувшись, вы увидите печальную статистику: "Bed:77", "Ammo: 11000/2000", "Eat:2000", "Colonists:0", "Unemployed: -77"(хотя ворота в замок охраняло около 10-ти лучнико и еще больше пращиков). В сингле таких проблем быть не должно, но разработчикам стоит с этим что-то сделать. Или хотя бы добавить расширенную систему управления колонией. Представьте, что вы, попавши в вышеозначенную ситуацию, решили восстановить попугаяляцию и собираетесь, крадя у своего соседа сено, собирать 50 еды для нового наемника. Ну вот собрали вы эти 50 еды и что дальше? Нанимаете его, он идет работать над изучением новых технологий. Зачем? То есть, новые колонисты автоматически выбирают вакансию, которая была заявлена ранее, и нельзя назначить какого-то отдельного колониста на конкретную работу, что ,конечно же, печалит, ведь никому не хочется ломать 40 верстаков, прежде, чем этот дятел додумается идти собирать пшеницу. Кстати, о локализации - она есть, но завершена всего на 92 процента, все включается в настройках, скачивать ничего не нужно.
Проект любопытный, но слегка недоработанный. Ожидаем новых обновлении и надеемся на лучшее.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997986395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1529169663}
review:
To preface this, I feel it's important that early access games are bought for the state they are in, not for their possibilities. The handful of smash successes in this model do not make up for the vast amount of under-delivered or abandonned games. Yes, this game might improve vastly over time, but that doesn't justify buying it now. I've heard that said about so many games that ended up as abandonware that I just can't support the concept anymore.

Review:

Colony Survival is a game that combines minecraft voxel style world with colony management. For the voxel world side of things, the game has approximately as much content as minecraft did when it first released in survival mode, some 8-9 years ago. Graphically it's a bit better, but not enough so to make it a huge selling point.

The colony management side of the game is unfortunately extremely shallow. Colonists have no needs other than food existing within the colony's pocket dimension storage and a bed to sleep in. There are no logistics, colonists simply need access to a crate to withdraw and deposit items into said pocket dimension. Colony defense is extremely simplistic tower defense which basically boils down to abusing the incredibly simple enemy AI and making sure you have a correct % of your colony's production put into researching better weapons and making ammo. The ai is incapable of damaging anything you create, which while nice from a creative standpoint makes any attempt at making colony defense interesting impossible for the devs.

While the game is somewhat fun at first, quickly it becomes apparent that it's fun for basically being a clone of minecraft creative mode and little else. The colony management gives you a space you need to wall, which leads to some basic castle building and maybe slapping some house structures around your beds. The reality in today's market though is that it just isn't enough for 20$. There are vastly better colony/automation games to play with similar pricepoints, and the voxel side of things obviously can't put a dent into minecraft even if we ignore the vast array of additional content from mods.

It just doesn't offer enough for the pricepoint, and the aspect I was hoping would be the core content (colony management and defense) is basically non-existant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047588172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1528803805}
review:
Kinda an unfinished Minecraft. It has potential to be fun, but until some bug fixes for a lot of the issues are added, i cannot recommend this.

You start the construction of your settlement and after a little bit of time you run out of food, and your citizens start leaving / dying. And how to research bread creation isn't "Clear" i suppose? I mean i had two or three berry bushes going and they weren't creating anything. 

At this point you may as well just have a follower mod for minecraft and see how you go.
developer_response:
Hi! 

The UI isn't very clear at the moment. We're working on an update that should improve the situation. In the meantime...

1.) Your berry gatherers should be gathering berries during the day 
2.) Berries will also be consumed as food by your colonists. You can check the total food / food consumption stats in the top right of the screen. 
3.) You can unlock bread by placing the science lab in your stockpile in the world and right-clicking it. In the menu, look for the "unlock bread" research and make sure your scientist has the ingredients required to start his research. 

We hope this will help you solve the problem!

Even though the game is still in beta, it's already pollished.
I didn't found a sinlge bug (yet).

At first look it looks a lot like Minecraft ( since its also voxal based )
What it makes diffrend is the Colonists you can Hire.  You can't make all items yourself, and need them to craft those items for you. They can also be hired to build / remove blocks  or to farm food ( you will need ALLOT food )

you start with a small safe zone, and a few possibilities . But you research / upgrade untill you can use everything.
The sky is the limit.

At night there will be "monsters " attacking your flag, and your colonists, so you will have to protect them with walls, gaurds and good enough funnels.
You can make underground (safe) farms and mines. 

oke, it's not perfect yet, the graffics are not that great.
The collonists eat ALLOT, but dont got a mouth ... ( dont want to know where they put all the breads )

And you don't got the oppertunity to save your game in game ( it does automatic, so last logout = last safe )
And that with the possibility to get overrun at night ...  is kinda hardcore ( but you could turn monster spawn off at any moment, or make them spawn more often , so not a real big deal )

All with all its a great game for a beta game, it will need allot more content.
But if they develop the game as they already do ( fix the bugs before launch a upgrade ) it got huge protentional.
though €20,- is a bit much for the game as it is. €10 - €15 would fit better, since its still in beta.

If you like minecraft, and want to be creative, while be the dictator over hunderts or thousends of kinda useless persons.
then this is the game fot you :D 


Recoment:
☐ = No ☑ = Yes

review:
Gráficos

Normal para o seu tipo de engine. Nada de mais e nem nada tão ruim. Deveria ser mais otimizado, pois em um dos pcs que jogo com uma gt 520 não rodou ele. Sei que 520 é lixo mas esses graficos são praticamente de minecraft (um pouco melhores)

Sons

Bons dão pro gasto! Musica meia estranha mas nada que encomode

Jogabilidade

Esta aceitavel. Muito similar ao minecraft.

Experiencia

Achei a ideia bem legal. Pra mim que gosto de rimworld e outros do genero, gostei um pouco dele. Falta muita coisa... Portas e um sistema de gestão de trabalho mais inteligente... Tipo se o cara ta na pesquisa e acaba as pesquisas, ele deveria sair de la e ir fazer outro serviço... Ou seila deveria dar pra mandar neles... Viva o acesso antecipado ^^

review:
I have never played a game with a consistent level of updates that bring new features to the game. The devs are great and listen to the community (this is a great feature for a game like this). After playing Minecraft (which I am dead board of now), I thought I wouldn't be able to play a game like this; I'm addicted (However, its a controlled addiction (as you can see by my game play hours)).

If you like being in charge, this game is for you! - Watch your sheep follow your commands and gain, one of the, ultimate management experineces - that isn't an online course or a conference!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042300367', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1968, 'last_played': 1549336675}
review:
This is a fun game, and it definitely scratches my city builder itch. However, one of my favourite parts of it is the developers.

I do not think I have ever seen developers that listen to their players so much. Most early access games include the phrase "we want to involve our community in the development of the game," but these guys actually do. Several times someone has suggested a gameplay feature or an adjustment to the UI and the devs implement it within a week or two.

Keep up the great work!

author: {'steamid': '76561198065789522', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 14607, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13144, 'last_played': 1576417944}
review:
To those who say it gets boring after a while, it does. After you think you're ready, go into C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Colony Survival\gamedata\savegames, then your own save, and go into the settings notepad. You can then toggle the "doublemonsters" and "daytime spawns" true or false, turning the game into more of a tower defence sorta thing with massive mazes of blocks. Pretty much, just try to get your colony as big as possible (especially with these new miners and builders, just select a stupidly big underground box and set about 60 people to it) as an endgame. 

It works as a pretty good idle game, provided you have a positive food growth and are sure that you won't get overrun by zombies. This is mostly how I managed to dig out an underground box to the maximum lvl V size (100,000 blocks), and build up a healthy storage of food and materials.
Oh yeah, and make sure you won't run out of the materials needed to make ammunition. With stuff like lead bullets, the production chain can reach all the way back to not having enough foresters to make firewood to make charcoal, to smelt Galena into lead and lead into lead bullets.

I would highly advise turning flight on after your colony gets big enough, as it gets very tiring running through the corridors underground and bridges above ground, even getting a proper view of things is pretty tricky. Sure, it negates all fall damage and most of the health regeneration stuff, but the noclip and speed makes things so much quicker and easier.

I find the way the pathfinding works extremely fun to mess around with, making loops of blocks around a firing squad of guards, surrounding the "safe zone" of your colony with a wall and having the only entrance leading to a network of floating blocks (with more guards on towers nearby). Just so long you keep all your colonists within the surprisingly big safe zone, you don't have to worry about the furthest away farmers getting killed. And the earlier mentioned miners mean that you can still dig both within and outside the safe zone whilst underground (provided your colonists can still reach it).

Overall, I would advise players to start treating the game less as something to completely devote your attention to after you reach around 500 colonists, and more as something to regularly check up on whilst it runs in the background. I mean sure, I still spend around half hour to an hour periods trying to build a new network or sort out some material deficiency, but you get the idea. The updates always make the game better (though I wouldn't advise letting yourself get too attached to a world, the big mineral re-haul completely rendered my old world useless). I guess the last thing I can say it to just play the game as you want, as opposed to exclusively as a survival game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022149086', 'num_games_owned': 208, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 6817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2826, 'last_played': 1688724621}

author: {'steamid': '76561198239858186', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1444, 'last_played': 1583670501}
review:
At the time of writing this review, I have spent 19 hours playing Colony Survival, and I will say that those hours were very entertaining. Colony survival is a game with a great foundation and core idea, and currently, it is very enjoyable. In Colony Survival, you act as a colony builder who manages and expands your little kingdom of NPCs. Visually it is very similar to Minecraft (But IMO it looks superior) however I think that the core idea of this game allows for more interesting scenarios than Minecraft. Every building you build feels like it actually means something whereas in Minecraft I often feel like I wasted my time building something as I won't go into it ever again. And that is why this game is so great, it allows you to be creative and build awesome buildings and other things while at the same time it gives that creativity some significance in the game world. 


Another reason why I like this game so much is that it is very casual and I find that I can play it while listening to a video or talking to my friends without being pressured by the game. I find this to be a great benefit as so many other games I play don't let me converse with my friends as we are all focused on the game due to the competitiveness (CS:GO for example). Because of this, the game is a perfect way to cool down and relax while having an enjoyable experience, after doing something stressful.

In conclusion, this game has great potential and currently, it is very enjoyable if you like building things in games or city building. It is a great way to pass the time and I hope it improves in the future.

Ideas for developers: I think it would be nice to see more features from city building games such as assigning roads and possibly in the future adding places where colonists eat. However, I am very pleased with the direction this game is going in.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061136397', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 3007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2105, 'last_played': 1530478284}
review:
This game is a solid Recommend

If you like voxel games, but prefer to have minions to the work for you, this is the game for you.
Build a castle, villiage, or cave fortress and recruit colonists to man the workshops, fields, and guard posts.
At night (or daytime if youve so chosen) zombies come to kill your peasants!

Most of the items that can be crafted must be crafted by villiagers at various workshops, so there is a clear progression through the technology.

I've had such fun building a small villiage and slowly upgrading it to a castle with hundreds of villiagers.

I give it a 10/10 and cant wait to see what new features they come up with in the near future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086277840', 'num_games_owned': 393, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 17537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3364, 'last_played': 1684184796}
review:
Not much content to the game, but it is a lovley colony building game. Brilliant developers and support though, very quick responses on the discord. If you are not sure about the game now then I would wait a bit as the are planning on adding new content including:
[list]
Mulltiple Colonies
Trading Between Colonies
Ships
[/list]

But overall I love this game!

*Update*

Played a few hours since the new open beta came out adding a Co-op mode multiple colonies and gliders. Absolutely loved it. It still needs polishing off and parts of the interface could be optimised but it is well worth the price. I would say it is a steal.

The developers team very dedicated and interactive with the community and I can bet on the fact they will not ditch this game half built. Could not recommend this more if you want a colony building game with a new 3D tower defence style system to defend your colonies.
