author: {'steamid': '76561198183363874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 3945, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1665632310}
review:
New Review
----
Great game I frequently come back to. Just got some buddies on it, and it added so much life to game. 

Mods are fun - add guns, new roles, castle gates etc. 
Animations are better but still janky in a fine way
*The bread will run out if you don't get a grindstone*


Original Review
---
Good game so far, definitely shows promise. Just keep updating and you guys might have yourselves a decent one. Things to fix: 
-Mob Pathing
-Mob Variety
-Mob Drops

-NPC Animations (guards throwing rocks, zombies punching people, farmers planting wheat, etc)
-Single player sustainable farming (what happens if a player runs out of their bread and hasn't made a grindstone?)

author: {'steamid': '76561197960559434', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1465, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1133, 'last_played': 1697996904}
review:
My son heard of this game from a friend at school.  He bagged me to download it.  First i thought it was a game for his tablet cause that is his current gaming platform.  Found out it was on PC,  and it was $20 for a "early access game."  I told him "son, people put these type of game just to make money and never finish them (DayZ)."  Then he told me that he would earn the $20 by doing his chores around the house.  I said "buddy spend that money on something else, I don't think that this is a good game."  Like normal he didn't listen to me.  With the help of asking grandparents for some money and doing somethings around the house he got the money.  So I bought the game for him and he was super happy.  He is 7 years old so I need to help him learn the basics of the game.  While figuring out the game I started to like it.  I started to play the game at night for hours building, protecting, and  mining.  Just couldn't put it down.  I showed him what I built and how I did it.  I would just sit next to him watching him play and just be amazed how fast he picked it up.  

So thank you for making this game.  We both love it very much,  keep up the good work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198168849665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3468, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1642, 'last_played': 1650493006}
review:
It's a great game, some people do say there is a lack of content, but personally I have gotten plenty of hours out of it and intend to get even more. With research you're able to progress over time and with the new builder/digger jobs you can try out some really fun designs, and it makes building your colony so much more impressive.

For the size of the development team, it's an amazing game and I am very excited for their planned updates, they seem to have loads of great ideas and they take on community feedback.

Overall, I would certainly recommend this game, I think it's definitely worth the price and it can be loads of fun, especially if you play it with your friends, but singleplayer can also be entertaining.

In the game itself, you build a colony and have to manage it to defeat all the tasks in your way, you need to ensure you have steady supply of materials, make sure your people are being fed, keep up an efficient industry and keep your people safe from the tides of zombies that will try to defeat you. I also think some people do not fully appreciate the size of the world, right now there is no real reason to go out exploring, but if you do, you can see some really beautiful landscapes, I would thoroughly recommend buying the game, and exploring the world itself.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971075438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 4685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4165, 'last_played': 1573249148}
review:
The game is all the best parts of the original minecraft experience with all the tedious crap removed.
You're given focus throughout the game.
You eventually get to a point where you've finished all of the research (you'll have ~300 colonists). 
It's at that point that you really get to push limits of your creativity and ambition by expanding as far as you can.
It's a thrilling experience as you're always just one slip up away from everything falling apart.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017613937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 86521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6774, 'last_played': 1689939544}
review:
I'm 30 hours in and having an absolute blast.  I've gotten my money's worth and I've barely scratched the surface.  If you like building (like minecraft/rust/Ark), tower defense, RTS, or civilization building games, you will love this.

That said, you have to go into this game understanding that it is in early access still. I've yet to encounter any bugs, but the graphics are a bit rough, you can't see projectiles from guards or other players.  This will bother some people, but the devs are concentrating on the content and functionality first, which is the right way to go imo.

Also, there is a bit of a learning curve early on. It isn't anything excessive, but it takes an hour or two to really understand it. Once you get there the game gets a lot more fun.  To the devs - a standalone tutorial would probably go a long way towards player retention. You don't need something long and drawn out...just something to demonstrate the job system and how zombies work.

Great work though!

author: {'steamid': '76561198302335596', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 2548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2415, 'last_played': 1589611556}
review:
A bit of a tower defense and management game mixed with minecraft blocks. Think of minecraft or block fortress mixed in with a manager like rimworld, and simplified a bit.
Pros:
+Plenty of blocks and colors
+Graphics: it's blocky but the textures are great and there's even realistic sun glare and focus blur. Beautiful on max settings.
+Contains multiplayer, with some people hosting dedicated servers, overall stable.
+Very limited bugs
+Active developers who are easy to find on discord
Cons:
-No trading on multiplayer yet
-Limited enemy diversity (only 3 zombie types at the moment)
-Limited troop diversity (only 4 troop types at the moment)
-No background music
Overall recommended, limited content but still addicting, with good development team.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005912813', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 10275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8159, 'last_played': 1553728639}
review: This is a fantastic start to a game that has massive potential. Content is limited - but it's still a great deal of fun once you get the hang of the basics. Like Banished there is a serene beauty to the game - I'd love to have a good reason to explore over a mountain, or ocean - some way to profitably tie together a network of multiplayer (or single players/AI) colonies. I wish surviving the night was more of a challenge - or required more innovation. How about vehicles, invasions from other kingdoms, a reason to horde gold bars...  I'm looking forward to further development because this could be Rim World meets Dwarf Fortress meets Minecraft. Development seems to move along though it is SLOW. However- great work thus far, hoping to see more content and more challenge added regularly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016565467', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1391, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1376, 'last_played': 1564874140}
review:
While Colony Survival at first appears to be an ugly Minecraft clone, it is actually a charming colony management and tower defense game.

There is something extremely satisfying about watching your colony grow, and eventually automating the menial tasks such as mining, farming and even building.

Pipliz is a small team, I believe they are only two people, but they put out regular updates and are very much engaged with their game's community and open to new ideas. 

Colony Survival is certainly a little rough around the edges, but I thoroughly enjoy it and look forward to seeing what else is to come in its development.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029421733', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 3424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1641605064}
review:
Content is very limited at this time i would wait until version 0.8 Release
if you are interested in getting Colony Survival wait until the game goes on sale. $10-15 

Please note, this is not a bad title and can be lots of fun Just the lack of Content is evident throughout.

No presence of colony Animals to serve your colony, Some basic Colony props such as a chair, table, rug
& Basic animations "like sitting" are all missing and very much needed 

I Cant Recommend the game at this time, because of its lack of Content and the price asked is not relevant to the limited content in game at this point in time...


UPDATE 26/07/2019   Colony Survival Finally released version 7.0 its still lacks some much needed content but it is a beautiful update making this now a meaty title. With the hard work the Devs are putting into this game & keeping the community informed i Recommend, however i would encourage you wait to get it on a $20 & under sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025619953', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 25618, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12614, 'last_played': 1697212687}
review:
A good game for building cities and planning them out so that the zombies do not reach your colonists. Most of the difficulty will be self imposed as the enemies only become more difficult or more numerous as you increase your colonist number. If you want a game you can either build a small city or a large castle and have both be defensible and populated, 
 or just build a boat in the sky, then this is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125110905', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1459, 'last_played': 1675485535}
review: Great game so far, about 20 hours into it. I would love to see different kinds of zombies, maybe some that move faster? or maybe some that are bigger but slower? Would also love to see more stuff added but im definitely liking the direction the game is going in. Its like what i always tried to find a mod for on minecraft haha. Being able to trade resourses with friends or sell items in shops would also be another great addition to form a real kind of a marketplace and economy system into the game where you can rely on others or make more money off of them. Overall i am loving the game so far. Certainly going to keep playing and excited to see what the devs keep putting out there for everyone!

author: {'steamid': '76561198051170260', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 34484, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2719, 'last_played': 1682950846}
review:
Alles was mir bei Minecraft fehlt....

Ich fand es immer toll bei Minecraft eine Burg zu bauen aber ich fragte mich immer warum tue ich das ? die Paar Zombis die da kommen sind ja langweilig und bei Tageseinbruch verschwinden sie wieder.
Auch musste ich immer alleine meine Burg verteidigen.

Hier aber kann ich Wächte aufstellen. Muss sie mit Munition versorgen und Essen, damit sie für mich die heranstürmenden Zombis beseitigen.
Achja man kann übrigens auch selber schießen, ich muss sagen ich habe eine lange Zeit gebraucht das herauszufinden.

Was mir noch fehlt sind etwas mehr Blöcke um Gestalterisch tätig zu werden.
Den das ist es ja was ein Block Spiel ausmacht.

Wenn man es richtig anstellt dann ist die Verteidigung nicht schwer.
Einige haben geschrieben es gibt zuwenig Bewegung im Spiel.
Nun die Leute gehen Arbeiten und Schlafen naja mehr ist aber auch nicht nötig.

Man kann Leute zum planieren/abbauen rausschicken und auch zum aufziehen von Mauern und Flächen.

Was jetzt noch echt Toll wäre, wenn man bei diesen Bauaufträgen auch direkt Mauern von der Burg hochziehen könnt oder fertig Häuser also je nachdem wie groß man das Projekt auslegt könnte sich das Haus / die Mauer breit und groß sein.

Das würde die Bauarbeiter so richtig ausreizen.


Noch eins: Deutsch ist zu ca 85% fertig und spielbar

author: {'steamid': '76561198046625546', 'num_games_owned': 529, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2333, 'last_played': 1679003422}

author: {'steamid': '76561198313078477', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 6584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4012, 'last_played': 1656819387}
review: I enjoy building like minecraft while also having units and resources to manage like a strategy rpg, and having flexibility in playstyles and modes. You can choose when you want monsters (none, at night, or day and night,) you can challenge your resource management skills by going into seige mode, you can enable flight and other codes to make building and exploring easier, you can run around fighting monsters yourself or let your guards do it, and you can play alone or with a friend. Keep in mind, it's still in development, so it can feel a tad limited sometimes, but with what's in it the gameplay can already change drastically from stage to stage and it's all up to you, there's potential, and they've *added* so much more since I got it (thank you for the Diggers! They're a lifesaver!) and they're working on more to come! They also do regular weekly news to keep us in the loop, rather than just doing whatever while you wait for an update, which is nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198798914775', 'num_games_owned': 35, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 31649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9386, 'last_played': 1699931649}
review:
I definitely think that Colony Survival is a game you should get. It has lots of features, nice devs and also gets free updates. I also think that there is a lot of potential for this game. :D

OK, let's completely redo this

Let's get this out of the way: Colony Survival is my favorite game of all time. The graphics are amazing for a game with blocks. The gameplay is the best of all management games, and a plus is that it is first person. I feel like the micromanaging is the best part, and I would love to see more of it :D. I can't wait to see the overhauled science system, as well as new mobs and farming. The progress of 0.7.x is amazing! The game has so much potential, and I just can't wait for the  0.7.0 beta (please make it open I would love to play multiplayer with other people in the Overhaul Update). The developers are the nicest I 'know' (I nominated them for 2018), and the game is amazing overall!

Happy holidays, and happy developing! 
/Roadblk

author: {'steamid': '76561198032994780', 'num_games_owned': 353, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1976, 'last_played': 1526072503}
review:
I like this game alot. Well i love MineCraft alot aswell. So here are my Pros and Cons
Ended up wih more Cons then Pros. But it is Early Access, and the main reason for most of the Cons.
Developer is wokring on the game and hoping most of my Cons will be better.

I do Like the game and positive to it.
And cant wait for more content.

Pros:
-Easy to play
-Easy to use slaves
-Good and easy build system.
-Better graphics then MC (with no HD recource pack). But based on same block block.
-Lots of fun (About 20Hours)

Cons:
-Early access. This game is not complete.
-No end game. There is nothing todo when the base is built, other then "make it nice".
-Limited quest/achievments (took me 30ish Hours to do 100%)
-Limited controle over "slaves" (Colonists, but you force them to work and sleep, so slaves). They will take the first job in que. And will make as much as the workstation is set up for.
-Limited to none AI. They only move the "shortest" way to flag or closest player/slave. They do not jump. Easy to out run. Only spawns around flag/main base. Can be "herded"/Mazed
-Limited tech upgrade. (Early Access). If you need more of something make more of the workstation. Or assign more workers as miners. 
-Limited ores. (Early Access?)
-No user tools/equipment for increased speed/mining/cutting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060949286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 4236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3537, 'last_played': 1609176215}
review:
Très bon jeu avec beaucoup de potentiel. Le jeu est simple à comprendre et c'est facile de perdre la notion du temps en jouant. Le seul problème que je vois est la quantité de contenu et quelques racourcis qui pourraient être ajouté, mais il y a un blog à tout les semaines où le développeur parle du développement du jeu et il y a des mise à jour assez fréquemment.

Je le recommande.

author: {'steamid': '76561198177056590', 'num_games_owned': 149, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 5191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 52, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1711262683}
review: Great Potential; however, it's too easy even with double zombies and daytime zombies turned on.  For me adding zombies that fire bows, zombies that can blow holes in walls, and most importantly doors and ladders would make this game great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016291424', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 1816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1792, 'last_played': 1526338636}
review:
Zombies can spawn inside your village and even inside your houses and they will murder your people, night after night after night.

If you put a couple of guards in towers all around town, you can take care of the zombies that spawn outside the houses...

And no, torches will not prevent zombies from spawning.
developer_response:
Hi! 

In Colony Survival, it's the banner that makes an area safe, not torches. Select your banner tool and the safe area will be highlighted in green, while the area where monsters spawn will be marked red. You can use the science lab to upgrade your banner and extend the safe area. 

We hope this will solve your issues!

author: {'steamid': '76561198370378750', 'num_games_owned': 206, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 709, 'last_played': 1684191569}

author: {'steamid': '76561197979206366', 'num_games_owned': 416, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 205, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1525922123}
review:
This game... I got it in hopes of it being a mix between minecraft, and AoE. It isn't. It's more like minecraft with bots that automate certain resources. I played to long to get a refund so I'll leave this so people don't make the same mistake I did. 

Combat isn't fun. 
     All you have to do is build a wall around the town with a funnel point to make a killing field. 

I really thought it was going to be a livelier town. It isn't. They're literally dolls that don't move unless it's a farmer. There's no interaction between them. 

Nothing really to micromanage. 

The research is cool... But the game can't hold my attention long enough for me to care... 

I really wanted to like this game since the city building, survival is what I like. 

At this time I can not recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004710683', 'num_games_owned': 3203, 'num_reviews': 358, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 832, 'last_played': 1526070314}

author: {'steamid': '76561198008561127', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1525920827}
review:
I mostly like the game.  Early Access, so I hope to see more additions in the future.

What I'd like to see:

- Ability to set timer on Day/Night cycle.  As it is, I barely have time to do much during the day before it's time to man the defenses again to make sure we survive.  Option for longer day compared to night would be nice.

- Allow zombies to attack more than just beds & flag.  Have them attack walls and improvements.  Otherwise, why build stone walls when wooden walls are just as good?  And I can leave my farms, etc, unprotected because the zombies leave them alone.

- There are no doors to build, so you have to have an open doorway into your fort/castle.  This seems very strange.  Allow us to build doors, but let zombies attack them and the walls.  This would make the defense much more interesting and engrossing.

The open door defense leads to players building mazes of pits winding their way to the open doorway, while archers pick them off from nearby walls.  There's not much variety to this.

My rating: 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198053068181', 'num_games_owned': 192, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1525853543}
review:
Completely unintuitive, UI is a frakking mess, and I couldn't even equip a weapon.


How is this game considered an RTS again?/10
developer_response:
Sorry to hear you didn't enjoy yourself! The game can be pretty overwhelming during the first moments, and we hope to add a better tutorial in the future. 

If you want to use the sling, you should drag both a sling and sling bullets from your stockpile to your inventory (the items slots at the bottom). That should work! 

We hope you're willing to retry the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198144877791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 1542, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 481, 'last_played': 1650334019}
review: I think this game has a wonderful foundation for something great. I think the overall aspect of the game at this currect time is very linear. I think the colony building needs a lot of work for this game to have this pricetag (although I bought the game  to support development at mo). I think a possible aspect of the game could be to quickly expand a colony in almost a civilisation style. Keeping the defense aspect the zombie attacks would continue and possibly bandit attacks. As your empire grows and the longing for adventure comes. I think a way to introduce organised travel would be another good feature (adding fertile land in different areas such as rivers or plains to expand empire). This style of gameplay would be perfect for medium paced online play. 8 players, 8 colonies, you raise an army, you can plunder other colonies or work with them to organise against another player. Devs if this idea seems fathomable to you in developing your game it'd be a really nice touch to see.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996569834', 'num_games_owned': 444, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 8193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1149, 'last_played': 1709502952}
review:
Still terrible, you need to build a 50 by 50 trench around your base and never build outside of it or else any expansion will lead to 1k zombies coming in at one block and wiping your colony, all because there's no indicator of what path the zombies will take. wait until the devs fix the problem and stop wasting time on the lighting engine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198283689115', 'num_games_owned': 56, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 9096, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3765, 'last_played': 1671878909}
review:
A decir verdad me lo compré al ver a otros youtubers jugarlo. Cuando lo compré pensé que sería un juego fácil de manejar, pero me encontre con una variedad de recursos impactante. Perdi mis primeras 15 partidas. A ver, no es un juego super complejo, pero tampoco te confíes xD. 
El juego es divertido en tus tres etapas de Juego: cuando empiezas, empiezas a crecer muy rapido y cando ya lo tienes todo.
Al principio es verdad que hay que estar pendiente de tu producción y demás, pero si lo llevas medianamente bien, irás directo a la segunda etapa, la de crecer muy rápido significa que tu base cada vez necesita menos tu supervisión de producción, ya notas que puedes micro gestionar tu base de una forma menos estresante e ir un poco más lento xd

Pero cuando produces de todo, ya puedes por ejemplo hacer cosas estéticas,rodear tu base con muralla, hacer un monumento del material que sea xd, poner luces de forma estética...es decir, tu base es autosuficiente, si que puedes ampliarla y demás pero ya no es necesario que se diga.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002536629', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 9630, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2622, 'last_played': 1526571673}
review:
マイクラにTD+RTSの要素を追加したような感じ

最初に木を切る必要がないくらいで操作周りはマイクラに似てます。

ゾンビはとても素直に移動するため、
沢山歩かせて攻撃時間を増やすといった如何にもTD的なことができます。

住人は個性がないため、いわゆるRTSのの農民のように定量的な仕事の割り当てができます。
※個人的には個性があると管理しないといけないことが多くなりすぎてやる気が持たないため、これはとてもありがたい。

ある程度行くとやることがなくなるのはこの手のゲームのお決まりなのでそこまでの工程を楽しみましょう。
時間は結構確保しないと持っていかれますよ。

オススメです。

author: {'steamid': '76561198092051480', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 37380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 492, 'playtime_at_review': 4959, 'last_played': 1712444800}
review:
Great game, devs are actively involved and I'm getting a lot of bang for my buck as I got it on steam sale (however, I do wish I would have paid full price to further support devs). 

I enjoy the mechanics of the game and the ability to create an empire from literally nothing. It's really addicting. I can see myself spending many more hours building and learning how to make systems like food and defense more efficient. I feel like Minecraft would be the basis of what this game is, but it's evolved beyond Minecraft and the simplicity of the game by taking the best components and making it more customizable by giving the player freedom to develop their own active society.

The only drawback I currently see is just the lack of cosemtic items/blocks to give more of a variety. I know these will be implemented in the future by the developors, but it has my full support. This can easily be a 1000 hour game once the next set of features will be added. 

By the way, this is a singleplayer review, I don't care too much for multiplayer, but I heard from other players that the components on servers are also regularly updated.

All in all the game is wholesome on its own, and I can't wait to see how the devs continue to develop and grow this game! Great work

author: {'steamid': '76561198083639858', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 22160, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5785, 'last_played': 1697410017}

author: {'steamid': '76561197960526199', 'num_games_owned': 687, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 820, 'last_played': 1524870137}
review:
Absolutely awful tutorial, movement, mouse, everything system. Absolute frustration to play. Couldn't even figure out how to turn my berry farmer into a guard on the first night while staring at zombies attacking my base.

There's no pause so whlie I'm sitting there watching my base get destroyed I can't even stop for a second to google what the hell I'm supposed to even be doing. Maybe it's great if you've played a lot of minecraft but I haven't so this control system is an absolute frustration.

Please add an option to pause for new players, or a tutorial mode or something where I can pause it. I played 20 minutes (my time on this is totally wrong I left it running) and won't be trying again without one and I won't recommend this game until there is one. Some of us have responsibilities outside of Steam games.
developer_response:
Hi Swozey, 

Sadly, it's very hard to add a pause function because of the way the game is structured. If you really need a break, going to the main menu and reloading your world should only take a couple of seconds. 

In the main menu, you can click "info" to find the quickstart guide. There you can read it without any time pressure. 

We hope this will help you!

author: {'steamid': '76561198232308236', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1128, 'last_played': 1588223818}
review:
After only 21 hours. I can already say that this is a great game. For any of you people out there that play Factorio, this is a good game for you. I personally really liked the part of Factorio where robots started doing your jobs for you. This game is all about people doing work for you. It seamlessly binds tower defense and automation together to make a game that is very enjoyable. This game is still in the works and will be getting new content all the time, so I recommend you buy this game before they bump up the price.

ALL HAIL PIPLIZ!

author: {'steamid': '76561198198408097', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 11150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2356, 'last_played': 1698709642}
review:
Here are my thoughts on the game so far:
 Pros: 
+Game Devs are super active in giving updates on what's happening and when and are constantly working on making the game better which is very commendable.
+ The Resource Managment aspect of the game is very well done, making sure you have what you need to keep your citizens from starving and the constant zombie attacks while also making sure you have the resources to expand and research new technologies keeps the game interesting for a good amount of time.
+ Game runs pretty smoothly with only a few bugs that I have noticed, most of which have been patched out or are already being worked on.
+ The first person voxel style of gameplay allows for players to craft every aspect of your village the way you wish to, whether it be an undergroud city, a village on the coast, or a castle in the sky YOU choose how you wish to design your city's layout and it gives the player a lot of freedom to be as creative as possible.
+ While some of the textures aren't anything to write home about, the shaders are really well done and bring a nice level of depth and beauty to the landscape.

Cons:
- For the price, there isn't a whole lot of content, after your initial startup there isn't a whole lot to do aside from research and expand, which can be stale at times. However, like I said, the game devs are very active and are constantly bringing new features to the game.
- The AI of the villagers at times can be a little wonky and its a little annoying at times but they eventually figure it out.
- The game doesn't allow you to save without leaving which can be frustrating when your city that you've worked so hard to get started falls because you misplaced one block to open the floodgates to the horde of zombies. But hey, trial and error is how you learn.

Overall, this game is very fun and I am very excited to see where the devs take it. Once more content is added the game will definetly be worth the price of admission and I reccomend you pick it up if you're a fan of voxel style and/or resource managment games.

TL:DR Great game, great devs, gr8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198017919938', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 26097, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4299, 'last_played': 1701471135}
review:
Per chi ama il genere il gioco e molto carino ma si vede molto che ancora in alpha. Spero che con i prossimi aggiornamenti il gioco diventi molto più interessante e bisogna aggiungere svariate cose al mondo che per adesso e davvero scarno. Le idee sono buone, vediamo dove ci porteranno fino alla versione definitiva. E secondo me bisogna implementare una sedia del "Re" dove alla seduta su di essa parta un menu per il building interno come ad esempio Stone Hearth. Penso che dopo aver implementato tutto questo si possa pensare hai dei villaggi generati automaticamente da usare per commerciare o altro.
Un ultima cosa e di dare più banner 1 nonnostante il terreno diventi di 201x201 alla fine se lo si vuole decorare con case e piantaggioni e davvero piccolo. Cioe il gioco ti costringe a far dormire tutti ammucchiati e falle coltivazioni una sul altra anche per la coltivazione e cio e brutto.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989168227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 771, 'last_played': 1700766010}
review:
First of all, very early in develpoment. But with great potential! I've seen their roadmap, and if they release the first steps in a couple of months this will be a game that you can play for hours and hours! Not very much to do atm, I have almost 13 hours of gameplay and feel like I've done everything you can do, except building a town in a massive scale. But since the survival isn't a problem yet in this game and the monster hordes (easy to kill right now because of the lack of stronger zombies) is scaled to your colony size I don't see any point doing that right now.

But they have everything in their roadmap that I want and what will make me come back to this game, so I am longing for the day that they release their next big update.

author: {'steamid': '76561198111757522', 'num_games_owned': 178, 'num_reviews': 122, 'playtime_forever': 5015, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2374, 'last_played': 1582479970}
review:
A very great game, which mixes up the simulation games and the open world survival genre and mashes them together, making one of the VERY FEW games in which you can manage NPCs and be in first person along with them!

My personal ending point was reaching 1000 'dudes', and it was very challenging, but enjoyable, to achieve. Learning the game at first is VERY confusing, as you can't personally craft everything in the game. Once you figure it out, either from trial and error constantly or by looking it up online, you grab the reigns of this bad boy and take it for a ride no problem. 

Just be sure to add guards to stave off the constant zombie hordes! Unless you play with that setting disabled. You can even make the zombies come with twice as many zoms, or even in the daytime!

6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198034936421', 'num_games_owned': 698, 'num_reviews': 381, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1672959624}
review:
-5/28/23 review-
As I'm going through my huge list of EA games on Steam I was culling games via looking at their update schedule and sadly this is making the cut - the last update for this game was December 2022 and prior to that sometime in 2020. I don't believe this game will ever release and is on the verge of being dropped forever. 


-2018 review-
I really want to recommend this game but I just can't. I've already witnessed all the content has to offer. Most of the research is just upgrades, there's few building blocks and just not enough content in general. It feels really bland and repetitive but I will highly recommend it once it gets some good content patches, more citizens + work types as well as monsters.
developer_response:
Thanks for the review! It sounds like there's probably still a lot of content, jobs and building blocks you haven't seen yet. You could use the technologist to produce science bags for the scientist, and unlock the stonemason and dyer to create new jobs that let your colonists craft all kinds of new building blocks. Unlocking the builder and digger jobs lets your colonists help you in construction.

We'd love to hear what you think of the remaining content!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032062390', 'num_games_owned': 147, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 501111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 46, 'playtime_at_review': 114133, 'last_played': 1712002324}
review:
If you like building games this is deffently worth a try. Your colonists can do pretty much everything for you if you want, you can plan out what you want them to do and they will do it for you if you are that way inclined. If you like to build then just build leaving your colonists to collect all the resources you need.

No need to dig giant holes yourself, let your colonists do that whilst you go off and build elsewhere. Just don't forget at night the zombies will come and if you haven't figured out a way to deal with them, then they are going to kill all your guys and wreak havoc among your colony.

If you just want a peaceful world where you can set your colonists to gather resources whilst you build away then sure just set your world to peaceful and do that. All around great game.

The Developers are active and constantly in contact with the community, always willing to help people out and squish those pesky bugs as they are caught. The game has been opened up for modding which has allowed the communtiy to produce different blocks, jobs and much more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022852196', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 8327, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 728, 'last_played': 1710272713}
review: At first glance, you might think "it's Minecraft". Let me assure you, it's not. This is a first-person survival game perfectly mixed with colony management. Not only do you build your own colony, you then have to recruit villagers to gather resources, farm, craft, whilst helping defend nightly (or constant) attacks. Sure you might be able to hold the line by yourself for a while, but you're going to need the colonist's help soon enough, just as they need you. And don't think you can just chuck up a 2 high dirt wall and call it done. You're not allowed to cut you're colony off from the outside world. You HAVE to leave a way in, so defences are a must. Definitly fun for those looking for colony management with a more military touch. Oh, almost forgot to say. GORGEOUS TEXTURES!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197990127367', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1972, 'last_played': 1710684770}
review:
The game has a lot of amazing potential and it's really fun to build wild and wacky structures and colonies in. The physics and basic mechanics of the game work well and provide some challenge in figuring out the order and scale of your production and research. The game is also quite pretty and it's possible to create really vibrant and exciting villages and communities that feel authentic and lived-in.

However, the game doesn't really incentivize the player to build or research or survive; it's far too easy to create a fully defensible colony right from the start without laying down a single brick as your defensive structure, as colonists don't require housing or heat - they just require beds and food, and it's so simple to just dig a moat around your zombie-no-spawn zone with zero materials or tools required, and defend a single point of entry to the area. Even with double zombies enabled, 4-6 archers are more than enough to keep the monsters at bay for a long long time, and with enough food production you could simply keep adding more archers and you're golden; no need to research higher level tech once you reach archery (right until one night the horde simply overwhelms your defenders).

I would like to see more immediate incentive to fully research the tree, like zombies attacking walls they can't climb so that different wall materials would provide different levels of protection and wall thickness would matter, monsters shooting projectiles so guards are forced to take cover and ground elevation would actually make a defensive difference in range and available cover, and that guards could miss shots all the easier the lower level tech they're using. (Ever tried slinging? It's REALLY difficult to hit anything.) It would be great if guards could move along a pre-determined route or area. This would force the player to think about their defensive layout more, and for example creating walls with ramparts and battlements would become more than just an aesthetic style. Also, how about a battlement brick that's thinner than a regular block? A next-level version of that could be machicolated, so guards could shoot down along the wall when a zombie is pounding away at your foundation.

I really want this game to succeed and the dev team is already doing a fantastic job. They've proven they can take a simple idea and reiterate on it to bring in more and more interesting mechanics that can really change the base game a lot! Recommended, this game is going places.

author: {'steamid': '76561198334145703', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1161, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 983, 'last_played': 1685887369}

author: {'steamid': '76561198032019241', 'num_games_owned': 625, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 417, 'last_played': 1521368557}
review:
Colony survival has potential. It's fun for a couple of hours.
I wouldn't recommend to buy it at its full price, if it's on a heavy sale then it just might be worth a try.
It feels so unfinished; ui looks horrible, gameplay feels repetitive after few hours, lack of animations, sound, music...
It just reminds me of an incomplete minecraft mod to be honest.
Yet they charge 20$ for this. I guess the price includes the promise of finished product, even though Steam Early access states it shouldn't.

Being that the game has been in development for a year or so and there hasn't been any clear improvement, it's safe to say that you probably should skip buying this product.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051140910', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3733, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2169, 'last_played': 1639956629}

author: {'steamid': '76561198110308725', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1052, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 643, 'last_played': 1573393932}
review:
Вот я, наиграв 8.3 часа, отстроив Ебеньград, пишу этот отзыв и... игра хороша!
Оптимизация... ну.. это больная тема, а в остальном - вполне ничего. Графика - копатель онлайн 2.0, оптимизация - тож, геймплей - майн с модами на исследование (научное) и феодальный строй с жителями, уровень удовольстивия - сначала весьма неплохо, а под конец (когда Ебеньград отстроен), когда пытаешься сделать скрин, но не помнишь, на какую кнопку и нажимаешь f9, f8 и f10... ну этот уровень я бы назвал "пьяный иисус". Теперь мне понятно, почему он так любил выпить вина. (основной алкоголь древности) 7/10 но на ~10 чясов - макс (в одиночку)

author: {'steamid': '76561197965540566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 99079, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3424, 'last_played': 1706471510}
review:
For a unfinished block based survival game it does have a some neat features and a lot of room to grow. It is fun right now, though a bit simple. And I hope the next updates continue that trend.

Will not run on a potato. Not sure if it will run on a toaster...

author: {'steamid': '76561198045745144', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 28418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2917, 'last_played': 1705876131}
review:
This game has given me many hours of playtime and I have only owned it for just over a week. It really brings out your creative side to make a proper colony for a whole bunch of colonists. Especially when designing your town and structures, there are nearly limitless possibilites. And the projects I wanna do will take nearly forever, but it will be worth it.

Edit - You will lose many hours of sleep trying to maintain several Outposts and hundreds of Colonists, trying to find the best way to get the right amount of resources for every tool, item and block you need. And then sit staring at your screen for hours on end to see where your resources are dipping...

I can't recommend it enough, awesome game, 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198034552112', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1329, 'last_played': 1645902031}
review:
PROS VS CONS and SUGGESTIONS 

CONS - 
- can become repetative
- besides keeping your colony safe from the zombies and food management, it feels empty, nothing much to strive for, not enough goals in the game.
- small glitches with the colonists

PROS
- very interesting concept
- if more creators took a look at this game, could alter a new franchise of gaming.
- almost as good a minecraft? it sure is getting there.
- ZOMBIES!
- first person
- be a king to your villagers!

SUGGESTIONS
- Make a villager that can build for you! Builder villager (concept: select area where you wish to put a wall and by how high or short, then select material, then accept or decline assignment.)

- Make a villager that fights with swords. Noble knight villager (concept: place sword in location that the job is needed, villager attacks zombies that are 7 blocks away from them by walking up to them and kicking them back 3-6 blocks depending on how strong the sword is)

- Make a villager that will create doors and locks them. Locksmith Villager (concept: place a door, gate, hatch where needed be and have Locksmith close the doors, gates, hatches when night arrises preventing zombies from coming in, zombies will attach doors, gates, hatches. locksmiths will guard doors with swords)


:D THANK YOU FOR THE GAME KEEP UP THE GREAT WORK!

author: {'steamid': '76561198101234890', 'num_games_owned': 356, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 849, 'last_played': 1697478883}
review:
I can't recommend it at its current state and full price. Right now 20€ are way too much for what it has to offer.

Game feels very plain an easy. You just need to build a tower of stone to place the beds and surround it with walls, putting a maze like structure on the entrance so the zombies have to walk a long way before your archers. Thats all.

Of course you need different kind of workshops to build the items you need but thats all. You just plant square workshops around and wait for them to build the items you need. Resources are also easy to get, wood is everywhere, for food you just need a few farms and you find minerals as soon as you dig a little (they are everywhere too).

Said that, I think all these problems are because game is in early access, and it will improve a lot in the future, just cannot recommend it right now.

They just need to add a better tech tree, make resources harder to find, so it is worthwhile to explore the map (right now there is no reason for it, you have everything you need in a radious of 100m from the start at most.) and add more challenges. Maybe make the zombies break the walls when they have to walk too much, maybe add more dangers like underground monsters that kill your miners, so you need to protect them, things like that.

On the other hand, the game is very promising and developers looks great, they are very active and answering to community. Right now, it is in very early development state so, as I said before, I think there is a great chance that all those problems will be solved in the future and they will make an amazing game.

I look forward to change this review to a positive one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198178437081', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 887, 'last_played': 1649049032}
review: like a mix between rimworld, minecraft, bloons tower, and terraria. beautiful looking game with one of the best dev teams ive seen. really well done!

author: {'steamid': '76561198106764907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 756, 'last_played': 1520322916}
review: Looks really pretty and using the bow was fun for a little while. This game will not ever be anything worthwile under it's current design. Voxel and tower defense do not mix well, it is extremely easy to force the enemies to take a long and mazelike route whilst having a single guard pick off massive hoards completely solo. And there isn't any content outside of "make a civilization. Make it bigger! AND BIGGER!". It just feels stupid to have a large open world, and then nothing to find in it, and a game design that forces you to stay in the one place. Given the strengths of this game engine (can have lots of entities moving around and interacting) it would be a better direction to have colonies that fight each other than the stupid zombie horde crap. They should be aiming more along the lines of catapults that tear down walls and knights whacking each other.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004579485', 'num_games_owned': 239, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 1583, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1153, 'last_played': 1554135210}
review:
2018/2/26時点のレビューです。

今後に期待したい作品です。いきなりこう言うと出落ち感あります。

まず、色々と言及されている「マイクラ＋StoneHearthである！」というのは一部誤りでした。
確かに基本的な構想はマイクラとStoneHearthをかけ合わせたものになると思いますが……

村人の戦闘は飛び道具のみのタワーディフェンスゲームであり、剣を持って戦うことができません。
なぜならば、基本システムとして兵士はその場で回転することしか出来ないからです。単純ですね。
これが歩行出来るようになれば、剣を持たせて距離を詰めたり、散兵操作ができたりとさらなる欲求が湧くはずです。

次に武器の数（兵士の種類）ですが、4つです。……言い間違えました。昼と夜で8つです。（プレイヤーオンリー装備除く

ブロックの数は少なすぎますし、炭鉱夫のためにプレイヤーが掘り下げていく必要があります。
ただし、一度鉱石ブロックを見つければ……（やったね○えちゃん！永遠に鉱石が採れるよ！

なお、他にも言及されている方がいますが、途中から食料が有り余るようになります。
安定した生活をしながらゆったりと村人のためのまちづくりをしたい……という方にはおすすめです。
なんたって中盤以降は採掘や木こり、わ○わくさんにならなくても良いので

本当にマイクラ＋StoneHearthなゲームをしたいのであれば待つか、お布施してあげてください。

author: {'steamid': '76561198446101667', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1526664107}
review: It's a game with Minecraft style building, and a tower defence element. I like this :>

author: {'steamid': '76561198300944284', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8924, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2183, 'last_played': 1678311804}
review:
First up, this review looks long, but please hear me out... please. And forgive me for its length as well whilst you are at it.

Its a really good, honest, fun game. I am playing it all the time its so good. Very reasonably priced and very visually attractive. Some would say "Its just minecraft". Well they have clearly NEVEr played this game, its VERY different. Positively different. It is stunningly beautiful compared to every other cube based game I have seen and/or played. It is a completely different concept, more about colony management, research and unlocking new things and, to some extent, tower defense.

Its like a brilliant combination of cube based games, first person open world games, tower defense games, logistics games and ,sort of, clicker games.

I fell in love with this game watching the Yogscast play it and I purchased it as soon as I had aquired the funds to do so and it has MORE than lived up to my expectations and I am extremely pleased with this purchase.

If you are yet to buy this game and you have got this far in my (rather long) review and you HAVEN'T watched the Yogscast's series (either their first or current one), I thoroughly recommend you do as it will help you understand how good this game is.

To conclude, WORTH EVERY PENNY, brilliant, brilliant game. I recommend 100%. A must buy in my opinion.

Enjoy!

У этой игры есть потенциал, купите игру, поддержите разработчиков.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117645556', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1312, 'last_played': 1627526617}
review: If you are someone who likes things like Minecraft, or some strategy and then add city planning, well I am that person and I love it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965794580', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1680205945}
review:
Ok, I believe this to be my first review on steam, hell my first review online period. Actually this review is more of a comment/potential request on my part. First, let me say this game is really well optimised and the lighting effets are done in  a nice vibrant and reactive way. The concept of the game is something I have been looking for for a long while. 

I like the idea of being in control of a base/village/fort and try to defend it from the inside. I like this kind of creepy feeling when you are inside and you know the monsters are trying to get through and you just pray they won't. 

As of right now, my only gripe with the game is the total lack of music. While the game mechanics and everything else are near perfect, the aural silence, aside from the sfx, is breaking the experience from an emotional standpoint. I do know this is a early access game so I will not complain one bit about this, BUT, I will say that I would love to compose music for this game.  ;)

I know, it may be blunt but it hit me when I played it and though I could try to reach out ! ahah !

At any rate, if you guys are unsure whether to buy or not, don't hesitate. It is worth every penny ! 

Can't wait so see the final product !

author: {'steamid': '76561197976350026', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 5608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1091, 'last_played': 1566498032}
review: Minecraft with a purpose! That's what I always wanted. When I play MC, I use realism mods to make it look awesome, and I've built awesome castles and stuff in the past. But there was really never a point other than just to stare at how pretty it was. In Colony Survival I can build large castles and actually employ people to work in them and guard them against zombies! There is a small learning curve, and I actually did look up some YouTube videos to see how people were doing things. But it wasn't really bad at all. It would be epic if someday they added enemy colonies too, taking it a step beyond just the casually strolling zombies. But for now, this is still really fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121017401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 10089, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4763, 'last_played': 1616368657}
review: I purchased this game months ago with a few friends, and we have all established that we love this game. It put a new twist on city management, now that you have your boots on the ground with all of your colonists, instead of looking at statistics for hours. The past few updates have drastically improved the game, to now having many different building blocks and zombie types, it has introduced more thought processes needed to advance. Some strong reccomendations for this game would be Weather Effects, More types of zombies/guard types (Perhaps swordsman guards that hold the zombies at bay, and zombies that may try to climb your walls slowly), but I'd absolutely love to see something that rewards players that explore away from their colony. This game has a lot of further potential, and it's been astonishing to see how far it has come.

author: {'steamid': '76561198261759299', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3904, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1033, 'last_played': 1684623529}
review:
Bonjours à tous. Je trouve que se jeux a une évaluation qu'il mérite largement! Ce jeux est super interressant. Il a des grafismes qui me laisse sans voie, des shaders qui sont époustouflants et qui en plus ne demande pas tant de ressource que sa mème au maximum! Les nouveaux zombie et armes ainsi que mode de difficulter rajouter réssament rende se jeux très tower défence et bien que le cerveau des zombie soit pas hyper développer, la difficulter resste présente avec un max de stratégie. Sa demande beaucoup d'organisation. Mais le problème que je rencontre c'est que le jeux rajoute du contenue, des craft, etc... Mais le stocage ne peut ètre agrandie! Du coup au bout de 8H de jeux dessue (oui j'ai bien farm) mon inventaire est full et en plus on ne peut pas enlever, dropper ou détruire des objets inutile! Pour l'instant c'est le seule déffaut notable selon moi. 

Conclusion: Beau graffisme, performent, difficile ou facile selon votre choix, stratégique, tower défence, besoin de bonus de stocage, besoin URGENT de possibilliter de drop d'objet.

Bonne journer et bon jeux!!

review:
This is a very fun game. It looks and feels a lot like minecraft, except now you manage your own colony. It adds depth to a formula that makes it feel new.

Currently there isnt enough content or variety to play more than once which will mean, in its current state, youll get about 10 hours out of it. However, I hope the devs will stick with it and add much more content to make this game even better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160493072', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 662, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 649, 'last_played': 1529150007}
review: 游戏还行吧，从来不晕3D的我玩这个游戏会恶心反胃。整体上就是我的世界版的亿万僵尸，屁民越多僵尸越多难度越大。特别是玩到科技基本开完的时候，不建房子的话完全没事做，白天攒资源晚上浪费资源。玩建造不如我的世界可以用指令，玩生存不如饥荒环世界这类有个性，玩塔防甚至不如war3体验好。价位相对于游戏性来说并不推荐，如果是资深宅男苦于没有人联机玩游戏可以买一个享受一下单机国王的感觉。

author: {'steamid': '76561197970043425', 'num_games_owned': 1028, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 3248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 836, 'last_played': 1540712889}
review:
Secreto: Coges tierra, te haces una mina subterranea amplia.  haces un piso de tierra subterraneo, lo petas de luces. Haces las granjas y te dedicas a ir construyendo con calma todo alrededor y tus aldeanos lo hacen todo menos ampliar terreno. eso lo haces tu y listo. 

Aburrido una vez sabes como esquivar los monstruos ya tengo investigadas todas las tecnologias y todo al maximo y mas de 10mil de todas las materias primas y comida en el almacen.

Esperemos que amplien las mecanicas y la jugabilidad.

(Si juegas de manera digamos sin esquivarlos es mas dificil, pero una vez echas las barreras lo mismo, solo que mas despacio por el desgaste de los guardias en comida. Un vez lo petas de granjas es facilisimo. (6 granjas de trigo y GG)).

De momento 1/10 le falta muchisimo contenido y los graficos no lo compensan, ademas con tan solo 40 colonos, el juego ya ha percibido tirones en un ordenador octacore 4GHZ con una 1070, SSD y 32GB de RAM)

No lo recomiendo y menos a este precio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096816842', 'num_games_owned': 122, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1160, 'last_played': 1576156221}
review:
Well Well Well, if it isn't Colony Survival, a game that ate my week once upon a time but faded quicly from my intrests, i still have my first world (that i aced because i used common sense) I haven't played the game in a while and i'm not gonna force myself too as it would be torture, mainly because of the lack of replayability, I don't know if the game still has it's inherant design flaws as the last time i played it was mid 2018.... for 20 minutes. The game has a great first experience but looses all value after. To the three people who view this review i hope this influences you to either buy or not buy the game.

The Question is:
Do you want an amazing one trick wonder or not?

author: {'steamid': '76561198133689408', 'num_games_owned': 128, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 5480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3018, 'last_played': 1678566555}
review:
I haven't reviewed a game for a very long time - but this is a very addictive game that does requires a lot of trial and error, because you have to choose very carefully what you build early on.

Kudos to Devs.

Will most likely add more to Review as i play more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004582704', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2448, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1099, 'last_played': 1702620051}
review:
Super fun concept.  Right now, UX needs some serious work.  Expert beginner syndrome.

The idea of the game is fantastic.  Voxel-meets-city-builder-meets-tower-defense.  Lots of potential.

I enjoyed the first few hours, learning how to progress and nurture my colony whilst staving off nightly assaults from ever-increasing hordes of undead.

However, after a bit, I put the game down to let it mature a bit.

The current early access version has some serious usability drawbacks.  Routine actions take what feel like too many steps and too much mouse dexterity, contextal actions (right-/left-click) get confusing if you forget to switch the action slot (especially in a hurry), and it just seems harder and more time consuming to do things when compared to other game UI's.  Its early access, so this isn't a surprise.

It also has an acute case of Expert Beginner syndrome.  As others have mentioned, intermediate-to-late game dynamics are lacking.  Once you figure out that all you have to do is wind zombies through a maze laced with missile guards, you can basically expand at will and bolster your entry point guards as needed.  There was no impetus to grow except to explore the higher tiers of research, but this would merely be an exercise in curiousity or vanity.  Or perhaps to build tall shiny buildings for their own sake.

All in all, fun idea, and I will watch with high hopes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171660525', 'num_games_owned': 77, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 8710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1889, 'last_played': 1693320977}
review: I am loving this game so far.  I dont make reviews to often for games unless they are games that I absolutely love or hate.  There is just something fun and relaxing about this game.  A large reason for why I love this game is how loyal the developers are.  They listen to community feedback and give quality upgrades.  My biggest complaint with the game is the lack of end game, it would be cool if they added some type of quest based story to go along with the gameplay.  Having players find a certain number of ores, adding raids to the game and giving cool rewards like for example a faster moving colonist or something like that.  I also think it would be cool if they added a melee weapon for the player to use.  I dont think there should be melee guards as it takes away from the colonists but maybe allowing the player to have a dagger or sword to upgrade their puch power would be cool.  Regardless I absolutely love this game and will continue to surpport it and grow my empire to the max!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198126710619', 'num_games_owned': 386, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 7028, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3936, 'last_played': 1650721340}
review:
After playing the game for a while, and thouroughly enjoying it, and also reading some of the reviews, I want to add my own review for the game.

Some of the negative reviews state that this game is bad quality because of the lack of content. While I can see that the amount content is equal to the quality of a game for some people, I would like to point out for those that want to look a little deeper than content: the game is not low quality. There may not be tons of stuff to do yet. But everything that gets added is well thought through, and well polished. Nothing gets added to this game that is half finished. Of course there are bugs here and there. It is early access for a reason. But most of them get solved within hours of reporting them to the devs. 

The developers of this game do actually care about the time people put into their worlds and make sure you don't have to restart over and over with a new update (unless you want to, of course). It's so well optimized that it runs smoothly on low end machines as well. The devs are explaining which content will get added, and which won't and provide reasoning behind it. They are highly interested in what people would like to see, and work on a lot of things to get added in future stages. I have been part of this community for about a month now, and within this month only, several things have been added to the game, and I do not know how many bugs have been reported and solved (it has been many many). Keep in mind, it's a team of 2 people developing Colony Survival.

I personally can well look over a temporary lack of content, if the game is polished and nice to look at in return AND runs almost bug free with very responsive developers. That is what my understanding of quality is about. In the end of the day, it's a building game, and you are the one that decides how far you want to push your builds and how much time you want to spend building them. 

With this in mind, I can safely recommend the game for people that enjoy building games, but always wanted their houses to be crowded. It is well worth every single penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198355843250', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 5646, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1007, 'last_played': 1704141658}

author: {'steamid': '76561198073319139', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 980, 'last_played': 1700543636}
review:
The game is fantastic. I love the way it works. 
For starters, this game is beautifully optimized. It looks fantastic but for my not-so-great laptop, I expected I would need to downgrade, and although true, I didn't actually have to lower much to get it running so perfectly. (60+ FPS) 
Not many games are loyal to people in this regard anymore  --even for these styles of games -- so I'm rather grateful.

It's a different take on the kind of games you'd expect when you see blocks and such. It's not so much personal survival as it is the colony you take care of so you don't have to worry about yourself as much as usual, although you still have a health bar. 
On top of that, the AI works in such a way that you could design different mazes for the enemies, and allows for all sorts of works. It's fun, it presents a fair challenge in management and the only thing anyone could ask for is some extra animations in some actions. 
I can't wait to see what the game will develop into.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066658374', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 796, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 794, 'last_played': 1553821120}
review: i truly enjoy the game, i thoroughly enjoy the mechanics to farm and mine and such and that you have control over how you want the colonist to work. i also very much enjoy the beautiful scenery and the amazing ammount of frames the game runs at. I do however wish that one could have an animation for obtaining materials and such as well as being able to name individual colonist to make the gameplay more immersive. It would also be neat to see progressive advancements in technology to a mild form of modernized weaponry and blocks however these are merely suggestions overall the game seems to be pretty good i just fear for the simplicity of it that it might be seen as something merely to expend time

author: {'steamid': '76561198165012039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 15840, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3338, 'last_played': 1709313118}
review:
I love this game, I was looking for something like Minecraft (of which I'm a huge fan and long term player) but with something more,a nd I've definitely found this. The colonists are amazingly useful, much more so than the villagers and golems of Minecraft.

I especially love the fact that once you've set up farming, mining, crafting, research and guards, they carry on with their lives and you are free to build and make sure everything runs smoothly.

I especially enjoy the feeling of progression, with the science research allowing more things of various kinds to open up.


A few things I have noticed that are absent and I'd appreciate adding at some point are:

1) Animals - I hear they are planning to at add farm animals, but I'd also like to see wild animals such as bears & birds.

2) A variety in monsters. zombies, zombies and more zombies gets repetitive and they all look quite similar.

3) A variety in colonist apprearance - such as skin tones, hair colour, names, height, gender, age to name a few.

4) More incentive to wander around, such as localised resources I'd have to go and collect, explorable ruins or towns?

5) A quicker way of travelling, perhaps research upgrades to speed, ridable horses, and perhaps portals?

6) Player (and guard?) armor

7) Melee guards

8) It would be great if colonists bred amongst themselves instead of magically being created from food when summoned

9) It would so amazing if you could designate beds, the number of times I lost a few colonists and struggled to get them to sleep where I wanted.

10) Last but not least some sort of recreation facilities for the colonists, so they do more than work and sleep!

author: {'steamid': '76561198021277265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 8369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2821, 'last_played': 1674174602}

author: {'steamid': '76561198313567118', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 2444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2209, 'last_played': 1705697585}
review:
Güzel bir oyun. Yani 33 yaşındayım beni bile sardı. Sorun şu ki saatlerce uğraşıp güzel bir koloni kurdum, her araştırmayı da açıyorum sondan birkaç tane kaldı yani ve 60-70 arası çalışanım var. Gece olunca zombiler akın ediyor. Her şey güzel ama...

Ya sonra?

İşte bu oyunda sonrası yok. Bir amaç yok. Amaç olmayınca da sıkılıyorsunuz. Mesela sizin gibi farklı bir bölgede koloni kuran bir yapay zeka olsa, sizinle rekabete girse, diplomasi olsa, ticaret olsa, ordu kurup bu koloniler ile savaşılsa veya dünya üzerinde çeşitli bölgelerde yaratıklar olsa Boss dediğimiz ve onları yok etmeye çalışsak yani düşününce insanın aklına pek çok güzel unsur geliyor.

Anlatmak istediğim herşeyiniz oluyor bir zaman sonra ama yapacak bir şeyiniz kalmıyor,bir amaç ve oyundan sıkılıyorsunuz. Bence bu olmamalı. Umarım anlatabilmişimdir.

Kısa da olsa bana keyifli zaman yaşattı. Şimdilik oynamaya ara vereceğim ve gelecek olan yenilikleri takip edeceğim. Bir kaç ay sonra tekrardan oynarım bakalım neler değişecek.

Bu oyun alınır mı? Evet alınır. Oyun kötü değil ama dünyanın en verimli en güzel kolonisini de kursanız sonuçta yapacak bir şey olmadığından yaptığınız şaheser ile baş başa kalıyorsunuz. Tek eksi yanı bu. Tabii kolonizinin resmini çekip bir fotoğrafçıda bunu büyük boy bastırıp evinizin bir duvarına asmayı planlıyorsanız orası ayrı :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198131679768', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 848, 'last_played': 1546206604}
review:
Very nice game.
Does what many other indie devs have failed to do. The gameplay feels amazing and improves with frequent updates.

If you love any of these things you will love this game:
+ Tech tree advancements
+ Minecraft like artistic freedom
+ Tower defence
+ Forgiving gameplay (you don't have to play starcraft)
+ playing with atleast one friend

Only con is the lack of commands to change the difficulty or something

while i do like the game i msut admit the multiplayer aspect is lacking altho its clear thats planed for the updates to come.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016349221', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 8598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 500, 'last_played': 1707551898}
review:
I enjoy this game and think it has a lot of potential. You play as a Mayor of sort that go around and assign jobs to your villagers and do what you can to prosper and not starve or get killed during night from the zombies.

People say this is a minecraft clone is wrong. Yes it is zombies charging at night but without them the game would not be as entertaining. If you swap out zombies for bandits or something else there would be nothing recembling minecraft in gameplay at all. It resembles "7 days to die" more then minecraft in game play and im not saying that as a bad thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198556730754', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 194, 'last_played': 1569107256}
review: I downloaded this game 4 years ago... and hated it. It sucked. The gameplay was lacking, the graphics were laughable, and the multiplayer was horrendous. It was a running joke among my friends and I for years. We tried it again here and there over the years and it was always the same mess. We would never play for longer than an hour. I am now here at this store page absolutely flabbergasted that this game is so positively reviewed. Maybe it abruptly becomes fantastic at a certain point, but I doubt it. I cannot imagine enjoying this game seriously, and so I recommend you avoid it at all costs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131698158', 'num_games_owned': 189, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 3368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3368, 'last_played': 1580323670}

author: {'steamid': '76561198200735983', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 719, 'last_played': 1574651894}
review:
ok i love this game, but i do have some problems with it,

You cant change the game difficultly, other than when you first create the game, i got this game a few weeks, after it came to steam, and got bored but once I saw how much it had been updated I had to come back so I set the game on peaceful so I could check out all of the new features without the zombies getting in the way. I now have a thriving colony one that could easily withstand an invasion, but there's one problem i cant make that happen. At the current date you can't change the difficultly once the world has been created, no zombies, which make most of the weapon, and military research pointless,. I hope that feature is soon added because I've seen some screen shots of newish monsters and want to see how my kingdom matches up against them. Next as far as I know there is no map and with the multiple colonies update around the corner this feature is going to be a must, at its current state you really have to stay close to your settlement or you may lose it, the map could possibly a craftible item which you then fill in minecraft style, but currently there's no map which sucks because I've heard some rumors that there is a pyramid somewhere in the game it may not be true but if it is I wouldn't know as my settlement is nowhere near the desert, and I mean once multiple colonies are availble wouldn't it be awsome to have one at the base of the pyramid. Last of my nit picks DEV PLEASE add in some noticable difference between lead and silver gallium, because at this time  yo just have to get lucky and place a miner on the silver varient as its much more rare than it lead counterpart 

But enough negative this is a positive review after all, First for a block game it looks amazing, and most blocks have textures that are uneven just like real stone walls from back then the stones are uneven sizes and lenghts. The sky effects are so nice they make for some really nice screen shots, and with the RTS element you have to really manage your resources more, because your not just feeding your self and more then once have i asked my self which was higher on my priorites list the miner or another wheat farmer. Well that's just my 2 cents on it I left a lot of other good stuff out because this thing already close to being an alminac. But don't let the Early access lable scare you off this game is on its way to become a gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198410491581', 'num_games_owned': 25, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1453, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1147, 'last_played': 1515934073}
