author: {'steamid': '76561198076369224', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 8500, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1674, 'last_played': 1626276934}
review:
over a year later this is a update to my review. This game is still a sad joke. If you are under 10 years old it might be a small challange but other wise any gamer who has played ark minecraft anything will have zero issue being bored in a hour or less. Sure you have to defend but thats is a joke. Yes you defend for zombie that are so childish my 10 year old daughter sat down and withen a few hours was bored with the game. ZERO progress what so ever has been made to improve this game they keep adding useless updates that makes me think a grade school class is deving this game. As a mater of fact ill quote my 10 year old daughter here after she played this. I asked her what was wrong "Well it has no challange daddy the monsters dont attack what you build They have no range attacks nothing its like someone just put them in and forgot about it. You have no reason to go any where and explore you dont have to think about your own protection at all after you set up a base and you can do that just by digging a trench around your area you dont even need a wall. We built a game sort of like that last year in computer class our monsters had range attacks and did a lot more and we had places to go explore and everything took us a whole six weeks of class to make it. " Really how long was class "it was a hour each day. If we had turned something like this in we would have got an F for sure it doesnt have much thought put into it"  That comes from the mind of a 10 year old who can see the glareing flaws in this. It has zero replay worth no reason what so ever to say It takes any management skill higher than a 3rd graders Nothing. I dont care what excuses these dev toss out this is one of the biggest jokes that call its self a survival game ive ever seen. It is not worth buying if it was a free game it might be amuseing but hell these days you can find much better games for free. 




As it stands this is nothing more than something my nine year old would build from a voxel engine. Or something you would see for free on Kong. It has zero managment what so ever needed other than putting a little guy on a job and forgetting it. It is hyped to be like a first person old school god game. It falls horrible short of that due to content as it stands. 

To get the only amuseing parts of the game done it takes a few hours max. Build a simple three block high wall dont matter what you use leaves grass wood around your safe zone one entrance make a killing path into that entrance I add a outer wall with one entrance other side so mobs are forced to travel one direction long way around the whole wall. Mount slingers ever so many blocks along inner wall like a tower defence game your done. Two miners gathering stone two crafters making nothing but stones for the slingers set at 1k storage research bread play it like farm vil with a baker and flour maker and your done. You can research all the other things if you want no point though nothing will ever bother you is only one mod with one slightly tougher varient. 

Sure you could build something nice and fancy if you want but you do better just picking up minecraft which is cheaper and doing it better. Get a few mods for it and you will have more content than this will have for years to come. These guys are trying ill give them that. But untill they start actually putting some core content into this to make it worth while dont waste you cash pick up minecraft because its cheap. And mods are free to do what ever you like.

author: {'steamid': '76561198198514503', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 10533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5399, 'last_played': 1697225370}
review:
There is something about a game like this which just invites restarting- whether it is the need to because of updates or the simple delight of starting anew- Colony is a game I can't stop playing (and starting again).  While 92 hours may not seem much, there hasn't been a week in which I've not played for perhaps 30 mins now and again.

The developer is very much active and does respond on the steam forum regularly.  The planned updates 0.7.0 sound incredibly detailed and amazing.  I can't wait for this game to develop.

Currently, it is well worth the £14.99 and I would happily buy this game again.  There is already a fair amount to do; science research, ensuring enough crops are grown, creating elaborate mazes of mines...the list does go on.

On ocassion I've had some lag which interrupts the flow and immersion but it isn't game-breaking and sorted with a little tinkering of settings (V-Sync).

9/10 as no game can truly be perfect!

author: {'steamid': '76561198330855668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 10881, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5957, 'last_played': 1698095775}
review:
Colony Survival je krásná záležitost, kterou vytáhnete jakmile vás omrzí hraní Minecraft SMP. Ač se dá řadit mezi klony mc, jedná se o naprosto svým vlastním kouzlem jedinečnou hru. Hra obsahuje mnoho možností, jak svoji kolonii zpestřit, ať už je to tuna workplaců a itemů, luxury itemy pro progress ve hře a obranná schémata, kterými noční vlny monster naprosto převálcujete a mnohem více. Pokud vás přestane vyšťavování jedné usedlosti na maximum bavit, stačí založit novou, nejlépe v regionech se specifickými zdrojemi a produkty nebo zkrátka na fotogeničtějším místě. Na to, že se hra drží v ea, je ve bravurním stavu.

Ze zkušenosti nicméně může některé hráče jejich imperialistická pouť omrzet už v polovině, kvůli právě již zmíněnému množství potřebných pozic a zakládat nové kolonie s radostí není opravdu záležitost navždy. Systematičtí a estetičtí jedinci také mohou během budování sídla uronit nejednu slzu, neboť v rámci efektivity a pokroku potřebujete své "zaměstnance" sardinkovat do ubytoven a jejich pracovní pozice častokrát vršit do výškových budov nebo hluboko do podzemního mraveniště. Pokud ale zvládnete tyto palčivé bolístky snést, plusy jen převládají.

Shrnutí: Pokud máte rádi budování systémů a měst, je pro vás (a vaše kamarády, pokud nějaké najdete) Colony Survival ideální volba přinášející zábavu z otročení lidských bytostí a vizualizace megalomanských snů.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028562664', 'num_games_owned': 1591, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 4308, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2150, 'last_played': 1624322830}
review:
Its like Minecraft creativemode with a little less invulnerability, but a lot more micromanagement.
You have to set up your own ressourcechains, production etc.
Once youve done the basics thats pretty much it so far though. There isnt a "lot" of content, but the same can be said for Minecraft. You can expand and increase your production and defenses and repeat.

So far in my 30h+ playtime I have tried everything but multiplayer and I imagine I could get atleast 20more hours out of that. If you are simply looking at €/H then this game is worth it fullprice.
(Oh and its getting pretty big contentupdates every so often)

author: {'steamid': '76561198103995513', 'num_games_owned': 137, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1603137140}
review:
Отграв в эту игру часов 20-30 ( не смотрите что в стиме 9 ч. раньше игра на пиратке ) я могу с увереностью сказать что игра затягивает.
В этой игре ты сам король, даже не король, а БОГ.
Плюсы игры:
- Динамичная, не даёт скучать
- Место для творчества ( можно строить как ты хочешь и как ты видишь )
- Есть мультиплеер ( не даст заскучать в одиночестве )
Минусы игры:
- Есть небольшие фризы ( для слабых пк может наступить ад когда поставите много факелов )
- Малое разнообразие строительных блоков ( но с обновления их добавляют, так что думаю скоро этот минус исчезнет )
Вердикт:
Игра на любителя, если ты любишь не спеша развиваться в играх, то эта игра тебе однозначно подходи. Но если ты хочешь все и сразу хорошо подумай перед покупкой. Я не пожалел что отдал за нее денег ( хотя и мог дальше играть на пиратке, но решил поддержать создателей этого шедевра )
Оценка: 10\10

author: {'steamid': '76561198130323445', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 3055, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1544, 'last_played': 1676158207}
review:
I'm writing this review for anyone who is planning on, or considering buying Colony Survival, but isn't quite sure what the game is like. I went into this game with almost no knowledge, expecting it to be just another cheesy Minecraft clone. However, I found my expectations being proven wrong almost instantly. Few games have captured my interest as quickly and as intently as has Colony Survival has, which is why I decided to give potential buyers an insight as to how awesome this game is .

Colony Survival is one of those game that, after peaking your interest, makes you want to create the most magnificent virtual kingdom that ever was. From food production to metal smelting, there's always something to automate and mass produce. You can hire colonists to make food, craft items, chop trees, and you're always pressed to get more colonists and expand your horizons. The whole premice of creating a flourishing, self-sustaining colony, and making bigger and better creations is what makes this wonderful game wonderful. You basically always have something to do, whether that be allocating bed space or making gigantic fields of wheat. Anyway, this isn't a complete review (since I got lazy), so I figured I would just share my opinion on the game in general and not get into to much detail about specific features. I would definatley say it is worth the buy for $20, and I hope anyone who plans to buy the game enjoys it as much as i do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007124691', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 363, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1515102091}
review:
Это пока схематический набросок к игре... Я люблю песочницы-выживалки-стратегии, этот жанр еще не освоен разработчиками и я хотел даже поставить лайк этой игре за жанр. Но уже 2 года назад как загнулась игра Timber & Stone, которая разрабатывалась одним(!) человеком и которая вышла раньше всяких там Stonehearth и т.п. И чем больше я сравниваю Timber & Stone с этой игрой, тем больше меня бесят разработчики Colony Survival. Вот что? Трудно было сделать анимацию персонажей!? Хоть какую-нибудь. Почему все уперлись в эти кубы? Это уже не ново, а просто примитивно. Сейчас уже компы позволяют обрабатывать реалистичные пейзажи, сгенерированные из вокселей (см. 7 Days to Die). Почему я должен запоминать, что кубик с кружком на боку – это печь, а с кружком сверху, это верстак или, если кружок серый, то жернова? Почему бы не сделать нормальные модельки верстаков, чтобы было видно, что где? Если у разрабов руки из одного места, то можно скачать бесплатные модельки. Нафига вообще воксельный мир, если он на столько убог, что это считай ровное поле. Тут тебе не подземелий, ни биомов, ни скал. Тот же старый майнкрафт в 100 раз интересней выглядит, при том, что там есть еще всякие кусты, животные и т.д. даже деревьев несколько видов. Зачем генерировать воксельный мир, если его не интересно исследовать, да и смотреть на него не интересно?! Сроительство тоже верх убожества – исключительно кубическое.
И это при том при всем, что несколько лет назад один человек уже сделал игру, где генерировался воксельный мир, который был намного краше Colony Survival, где у каждого жителя был набор навыков, которые можно было прокачивать, где жителей можно было одевать в разную броню, где строители строили а рудокопы копали по заданному плану, где для каждого товара требовался свой склад и надо было рассчитывать логистику, где для того чтобы приходили торговцы и новые жители надо было вывести дорогу из поселения, где было много различных с/х культур, таймление и разведение животных, ловля рыбы, тренинг лучников и пехотинцев, вторжения скелетов, гоблинов, некрамантов, гигантских пауков, где все было кубическое вмеру (станки, катапульты, орудия труда были нормальными моделями). По сравнению с Timber & Stone эта игра – просто какая-то поделка школьника на коленке. Надеюсь разрабы улучшат игру и предоставят что-то интересное, чтобы я смог изменить свое мнение.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145936253', 'num_games_owned': 217, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 8977, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2565, 'last_played': 1692480837}
review: [u] Mucho potencial [/u], al segundo día de haber comprado el juego ya tenía 24h jugadas, y si no entro tanto ahora es para no quemarlo. NO RECOMIENDDO COMPRAR C.S. (por lo menos hasta que salga del early acces) ya que uno nunca sabe si el juego va a ser terminado, y con tantos juegos completos más vale esperar. La cantidad de contenido no es poca, pero no me parece suficiente (Esto fue escrito en la actualización 0.5.0), me estuve informando de las ideas que tienen para las próximas actualizaciones y pinta todo muy bien. Tal vez una mejora en el rendimiento no estaría tan mal, esto lo digo porque al iniciar un mundo va todo muy bien, pero al tener más de 400 colonos ya se empiezan a perder frames (por lo menos en mi caso, gráficos casi al máximo con una 1070). Lo dicho, el juego está bien y pinta mejor, pero, o lo compran en una buena rebaja o esperan a que se termine el desarrollo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198272213721', 'num_games_owned': 124, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 31952, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11097, 'last_played': 1709540826}
review:
ฟังเรานะ
*รออัพเดตใหญ่เร็วๆนี้นะ เห็นข่าวจากผู้พัฒนาว่างั้น

เกมนี้ออกแนวมายคราฟ แต่ภาพสวยเว่อ ปรับ Low ยังสวยเว่ออะ อยากลดแลคทำได้ง่ายๆเลย อย่าติดไฟเยอะ ลดราคาเมื่อไรรีบซื้อ เกมสบายๆเหมาะกับสายวางแผนและสร้างเมือง

เกมเป็นอย่างไร? 
ไฟฉายกด G เลยคะคุณ อาชีพ NPC ตอนนี้มีนักปลูกเบอรี่ นักปลูกข้าว ชาวเหมือง นักปลูกดอกไม้ (4 ชนิด) ยาม(ในตอนนี้มีพลปาหิน พลธนู พลหน้าไม้ พลปืนยาว ในอนาคตจะมีพลใหม่ๆมาเพิ่มน่าจะยิงบาซูก้า) และอัปเดตล่าสุด เพิ่มชาวบ้านที่สามารถขุดทำลายชั้นดินต่างๆ รวมถึงช่วยเราก่อบล็อกกำแพงยักษ์ยังได้ ใช้งานง่ายละไฮโซ

ในอนาคตเกมมีแพลนอัพไบโอใหม่ๆอีกมายมายก่ายกองเลยละนะ!

เล่นเหอะ สบายกว่ามายคราฟ เราแค่วางผังเมือง ปกป้องชาวเมือง และดูแลให้ทรัพยากรเหลือใช้ตลอดก็แค่นั่น ดูง่ายแต่ใช้สมอง สวยแต่เรียบ ไฮแฟชั่น ใครอยากสร้างกำแพงไททันทำได้ง่ายๆใช้งาน NPC เลยคะคุณ ตอนนี้เกมขาดอย่างเดียว คือ กระจก ประตู หน้าต่าง

หลักๆของเกมนี้มีให้เลือกก็คือ ผีมาตอนกลางวัน กับ ผีมาตอนกลางคืน เล่นนานๆจนเมืองใหญ่ๆเราสามารถเปิดให้ซอบบี้มาทุกเวลา แบบ very hard ได้อย่างสบาย แต่ก็ต้องคอยดูนะ เรื่องกระสุนปืน อาหาร ล่าสุดมีชาวบ้าน 800 คน ปลูกข้าว 55 แปลงยังไม่ทัน เผลอๆแปปเดียวอาหารหมด คนตาย เมืองแตก อันนี้ต้องระวัง

NPC ปลูกต้นไม้ แรกๆใช้เยอะ หลังๆลดไปเลยเหลือแค่ 2-4 พอ
NPC ปลูกเบอรี่ แรกๆใช้เยอะ หลังๆก็ปลูกเก๋ๆสวยๆ อย่าเน้นเพราะไม่คุ้ม
NPC ปลูกข้าว ปลูกเยอะๆไปเลย ทำคอนโดปลูกข้าวก็ได้
NPC ยาม แรกๆปาหิน ยิงธนู หน้าไม้ไป หลังๆเน้นปืนโอลี่ล้วนๆ แต่ต้องมีทีมขุดแร่เยอะๆ
NPC ก่อสร้าง มีให้เลือก ทำลาย ทำลายเฉพาะอย่าง กับสร้าง ประยุกต์กันเอง
NPC ดอกไม้ ปลูกไว้แค่อย่างละอันพอ มีประโยชน์แค่เอามาย้อมสีกำแพงอิฐบล็อก อื่นๆนิดๆหน่อย

พูดถึงเรื่องแร่ แบ่งการขุดดังนี้ ชั้นแรก คอปเปอร์ ทิน , ชั้นสอง แร่ขาวๆ น้ำมัน ,ชั้นสาม ทอง กับอะไรดำๆ , ชั้นสี่ วัตถุดิบดินปืนบลาๆ

คะแนน 1000/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198096040495', 'num_games_owned': 412, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1561846454}
review:
I think this is the only Dwarf Fortress-like game that has a multiplayer mode so far. (if you don't count Dungeon Keeper and it's modern replica War for the Overworld)

It's very hard to implement multiplayer in games like Dwarf Fortress due to time control issues. commonly you have three approaches: first approach is that any player can control time whenever they want, (like Paradox Interactive's strategy series) which gives an incoherence among players who want to fast forward certain period of their economic development while someone else is trying to micromanage an ongoing battle. Second approach is to separate each player's individual time (like Simcity 5) so that they can control their own time, which means players also need separate maps to keep the game coherent, so interactions among players will  inevitably get reduced. Third approach is that putting everything under a same time lapse and a same map (just like an RTS) but reducing complexity to make everything manageable, and that gives you the model of Colony Survival.

Problem is, that the level of complexity deduction is so high that it fundamentally changes the feeling you get in other Dwarf Fortress-like games and it sometimes renders the game a little bit primitive and boring. And also for the very reason you know that they won't add too much stuff in future under the premise of not remaking the entire game. 

But after all, it's a Dwarf Fortress-like game that you can play with your friends, what more could one ask for?

author: {'steamid': '76561198039864799', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1067, 'last_played': 1516429947}
review:
It's great, just don't run a server until they have basic grief prevention in the game, I was soaring on a freinds server, left for a day, came back and some one had broken my wall in two places and gotten ALL my colonists killed by monsters, then I lost them a second time the next night when (because my colonists weren't there to make more ammo) zombies overran my city again because none of my bowmen had arrows. please add grief prevention into the base game multiplayer, like minecraft.
EDIT: oh whitelisting, you beatiful mechanic, thank you developers

review: 5 Hr Review: Great game, Enjoying so far. Plenty of content for first say ~20 hours then may get a little bit boring. Technology tree is amazing with many options. Decoratively, at the beginning there is not much but as you get further in there are carpets and other such items. The modding community is also ok. And will provide another ~20 hours of playtime easily. Highly Recommended if you liked Minecraft, Especially mods like Tales of Kingdom and such (Or just multiplayer in general)

author: {'steamid': '76561198202068413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 35402, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1500, 'last_played': 1695525694}
review:
A lot of people are calling this a Minecraft clone, but it at least adds something.

My biggest complaint is that it's a bit to easy. I created a colony that can perfectly sustain itself without me intervening in around 3 hours. There are some graphical bugs now and then but they usaully go away. If they don'y you just restart the game, which sounds bad but (at least for me) the game boots pretty quickly. I've also yet to have a crash, which is good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074855348', 'num_games_owned': 172, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 855, 'last_played': 1572304889}
review:
Points positifs :
- Environnement totalement personalisable
- PNJ intéligents
- Tableau des téchnologie cohérent et très diversifié
- Énnemis proportionnelles aux nombres de colons
- Possibilité de construction infinie
- Aucun bug (pour un jeu fraichement sortit)
- Graphisme minimaliste mais très beau
- Jeu immersif
- Multijoueurs

Points négatifs :
- Animations des personnages trop simple
- Les champs sont trop grand pour la zone où l'on peut construire sans que des monstres spawns
- Aucun indicateurs précis sur le nombres de ressources en circulations (nourritures produite par jours etc...)

Conclusion :

Colony surival est l'un des meilleurs jeu au quel j'ai touché pour ma part, il offre un gameplay individuel en plus de celui de gestion de village.
De plus, le jeu est très complet et des mises a jour fréquentes sont présente, et même après avoir fait le tour, un mode "hardcore" avec plus de monstres est également présent !
Enfin, le mode multijoueur rend ce jeu incroyable entre amies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006944802', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 1388, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1388, 'last_played': 1514711824}
review:
Pros:
+ Game mechanics are similar to Minecraft, only that you can have colonists in helping you manage your resources for you.
+ UI has a good feel, but it needs some time to get accustomed to
+ Graphics are really good (props to the lighting effects)
+ Very Addicting
+ Centralized Inventory (excluding your own inventory)
+ Crafting system is manageable

Cons:
- No quicker way to transfer colony resources to your own and vice-versa.
- Not much of a challenge once you make the colony sustainable.
- The variety of blocks are still limited.
- Exploration is hindered once you have a good colony.

I recommend this game with reservations, since there are some aspects of the game that feels missing but even without it, the game is still playable and fun. It's understandable since this is only in EA, but with the progess it has, the game has potential in becoming a really good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075200421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 4687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1218, 'last_played': 1579372601}
review: I enjoyed this game a lot more than I expected (no offense, devs).  It has the familiar mechanics of Minecraft but the colony aspect of recruiting villagers and giving them different jobs that automates how your people live and work is really satisfying.  I wish they would bring back zombies dying in the daylight though, I have had it happen a couple times where the zombies came and wiped out most of my village and respawning doesn't really help me so I  have to just start a new game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198306891891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2078, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 782, 'last_played': 1557513678}

author: {'steamid': '76561198072988356', 'num_games_owned': 322, 'num_reviews': 150, 'playtime_forever': 3625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2131, 'last_played': 1624961253}
review:
If it had more exploration elements and the monster AI was beefed up a bit, this would be everything that was missing from Minecraft for me. Finally, a game where your massive constructions have a point even after they become large enough to fit one of each crafting block. A game where you can build anything as long as it doesn't make your castle easier to attack. A game where you only have to find resources once or twice to get everything you need, but things are still expensive. A game where you actually have to think about construction without it being tedious structural concerns. A game where your absurd megafortresses and moleperson tunnel complexes actually have a point. A game where you can express yourself through your building style without hundreds of hours of experience. It is restrictive enough that you can't just do whatever you want, but not so much that you can't do whatever you want.

If there was more content, it would be perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072459147', 'num_games_owned': 388, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 5510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2840, 'last_played': 1707053105}
review:
Now before jumping on the assumption this game is bad let me explain, I Do not dislike this game, I enjoyed playing this game very much, And that's more of personal taste to these kinds of games than the actual game itself, 

The Game Itself Is very basic at the current stage, If im correct its in (0.5.0) Pre-Build, And in its early stages of developement, Even with the early stages there are things to do. The game starts off as a your average Wild Survival game, Collect Resources and build up, with the added bonus of being able to adopt workers to do your (Nearly) Every Will.

The game has a long way before the end, Which means a lot of playtime. In a logical sense that would be good, But once you past the first few parts of this game, The pace of it Slows Drastically, and there isn't much of a filler between the gaps of these time scales that can be filled. That i personally find is the biggest problem at the current time of this game.

Another minor nit pick i have is that the Map (Correct me if im Wrong.) Appears to be a single item, Its un randomized and Theres 3-4 Set Locations where you spawn from what I've Found so far, Though thats just being Picky in a personal View.

Though i've only talked about the Negatives here are the Positives. Besides being simplistic, Its Well Done. On my Current time of Play I've had no Problems with AI Bugs or World Errors, The Game Runs Smoothly and Everything that's Current Implemented (From What I've Seen so Far') Has Worked perfect.

Continued, I Also find that this game isn't hard to learn, Games like this usually have a learning curve, But with the simple tutorial that shows up when you first log in and some common sense, you'll swiftly learn to do what you need to do to survive your time on the map.

The Work System for the 'Colanists' you assign is Basic but efficient, Though theres always room for improvement and i feel that in that area theres pieces missing that will hopefully come in the Future releases.

Overall. Personally I Feel this game is a Great Game and Definatly worth the Try.
On a Level Note though The game is still in early Developement and has Much, Much More Need for more stuff to do to fill  time bewteen researches, And just in General have more Content, But thats what we expect to see in future releases of the game.

I Hope my Review Helped Everyone in there Choice for this Game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198798956097', 'num_games_owned': 57, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9141, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1691, 'last_played': 1633579129}
review: If your into controling people while trying to survive whats actually a hard game then I highly recommend this to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198251612814', 'num_games_owned': 254, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1250, 'last_played': 1703971327}
review:
HOLY CRAP IS THIS A GOOD GAME!

No, seriously, for the price I expected a lot more for a lot less.

PROS: 
-Devoloper is very active
-Never starved for content
-No microtransactions
-Great graphics
-Lots of achevements

CONS:
-For a voxel game you need to have a beefy computer if you want good graphics + a huge colony later in the game
-Very minimalstic environment (at the moment, more updates to come) Basic flat land, couple hills here and there, tress, sand, water, and thats it
-With the new update, starting off takes a little while, up to about an hour to have a semi established colony

Take aways:
-Good graphics
-Landscape could use a little work
-Devoloper is very active and actually listenes to players

Overall: Its a great game and I reccomend, but it is far from a finished game and could use a little sanding around the edges.

author: {'steamid': '76561198211661503', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1514674851}

author: {'steamid': '76561198161801770', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 4139, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1319, 'last_played': 1706123381}
review:
Hra může působit jako automatizovaný minecraft a je to pravda. Hra má opravdu hezkou grafiku a je i celkem dobře optimalizovaná vzhledem ke grafice. Ve hře budujete velké království a to nejduležitější. Rekrutujete si svoje občany a těm zadáváte jim práci. Zadáváte práci, zkoumáte nové technologie, ochraňujete svoje občany a budujete. Když vytváříte svět, tak si můžete nastavit spawnování nepřátel ve dne. Zkoumáním technologií nebudete jenom zkoumat nové bloky s interakcí: pece atd...., ale i zbraně. Jsou, ale jenom čtyři, ale to nevadí. Dále si můžete u každého jednotlivého strážce nastavit jestli budou chránit ve dne nebo v noci. Samozřejmě pokud nemáte zapnuté spawnování ve dne, tak je to k ničemu pokud si nastavíte chránění ve dne. Hru bych doporučil pro volné chvilky.

+ Grafika 

+ Strategická hra

+ Zatím jsem nenašel žádné bugy

author: {'steamid': '76561198153670985', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1765, 'last_played': 1641275280}
review:
This is a great game and I like seeing it continue to be developed. Many early access games stop being developed but not this one, it is the complete opposite. Of all recent early access survival games this one seems to have the most work put into it and is always getting updates. The best part about this is that the developers are really trying to listen to the community, and they are doing a great job. If you are considering buying this game, stop thinking about it, go ahead and get it. You'll know within the first 10 minutes of playing if you won't like the game, not that you will want to refund it anyway.
-Keep up the great work devs! Thanks for the work you have continued to put into this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198146538963', 'num_games_owned': 364, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1282, 'last_played': 1594817205}
review:
게임 그래픽이 보면 볼 수록 마인크래프트를 생각나게 한다.
차이점이라고 하면 초반 이외에는 자신이 자원을 직접 캐러 돌아다닐 필요가 없어진다는 점이다.
처음에는 자원 관리하고 마을 지킬 사람들 세우고 하면 조금씩 재미를 느껴볼 수 있지만
후반에 들어서면 몬스터는 경비병이 알아서 때려잡고 그들이 사용하는 총알이나 무기는 전부 다른 주민들이 채워 넣어준다.
몬스터가 나오는 한계점으로 표시되는 부분까지 벽을 쌓아 올려 놓으면 몬스터의 위협으로부터도 벗어날 수 있기 때문에 난이도는 비교적 낮은 편이라 할 수 있다.
밤 뿐만 아니라 낮에도 몬스터가 나오도록 하면 조금 힘들어지긴 하지만 할 일이 없어지는 것은 사실이다.
NPC들이 열불나게 일하고 있는데 혼자서 할 일 없이 어슬렁 거리고 있으면 왠지 모를 외로움과 덧없음을 느껴볼 수 있다.
(그래도 재미는 있는걸. 헿

author: {'steamid': '76561198122994424', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2996, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 809, 'last_played': 1583701112}
review: If you look past the Minecraft graphics, dolled up with bloom, lighting effects, and slightly 3D textures, you'll find a deceptively simple game resembling a clicker. Let me explain, start with a couple dudes getting berries, slowly build up to support more dudes, research wheat and it gets exponentially more dudes that you can create and maintain to build things, defend your stuff, and everything else in between. Its singleplayer is similar to minecraft, but not as lonely if you see your dudes as people. I've found that listening to podcasts in the background is perfect. There also seems to be a lot to do depending on what kind of kingdom you want. For me, that's building tall and behind walls so, there's always improvements, new buildings, and research.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198141680770', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 738, 'last_played': 1516753796}
review:
I dont give perfect reviews, but this is an exeption.

Although i dont have many hours in game, ive realized how great it is. My first and current colony has ~40 people and this game is simple yet complex at the same time. On the surface this game may seem simple, but once you get into it there is a whole system of crafting/researching to progress. Managing your colony is also a major aspect of this game, from farming, mining, and guarding. Totally would reccomend especially if you are to play with a friend, (once yuou set up the server and decide who will host)

9/10 - for an indie sandbox title, so far i havent noticed many map generation differences.

10/10 - Has BEAUTIFUL graphics for an indie title, and even more impressive for a 2-person team!

10/10 - satisfyingly complex progression system, and very tedious to balance colony jobs at first.

Overall: 10/10 - This is a gem in the indie world, something that deserves all the support possible.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970804764', 'num_games_owned': 267, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 3697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 918, 'last_played': 1630263644}
review:
The devs did a great job with the logistics/management aspect. I love how each time you place a new crafting station, it is already configured to maintain a small inventory of every item it can make, including as new items are researched. Beyond that, the recipe prioritization system alone shows how well designed the gameplay is. You could rely on the defaults completely and never touch the crafting settings if you really wanted, but you also have the tools to deal with crises.

I also love how this game just says "No" to tedious inventory management and gives you an essentially unlimited inventory shared with all your dudes. Tower defense is a satisfying form of combat, if a bit same-y after a while, and the bump mapping on the blocks is really cute and clever.

Overall really well designed and implemented.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069948002', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1033, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 697, 'last_played': 1602912708}

author: {'steamid': '76561198058400779', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 168, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1514327510}
review:
Really tried to get into it but had no fun whatsoever. 
Looks good on the store page. Looks kinda pretty too. But that's about it.
It is still in early access though, maybe I'll buy it again once it's finnished. Right now I don't want it and it's not worth having.

Destroying blocks and building an initial base is quite the shore. Recruiting colonists is a great idea but feels like it needs work. Setting an area for them to farm is okay, but having a lumberjack to clear the surrounding forest isn't possible. Similar problem with mining. I was expecting to get a miner so he could start digging underground, I even dug a hole for him to start. But apparently you need to find an orevein to have a miner. Where the hell do I find an ore vein? Do I have to dig around to find it? Isn't that the miners job?
I also started looking for a lake initially so I could put a couple of fishermen to get food, but there are no fishermen in game, not in early game at least.

Furthermore the map feels lifeless: no flowers or grass and no animals of any kind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143604157', 'num_games_owned': 223, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1514295189}
review:
Please stop recommending this game and understand that this game is not complete! 

Don't get me wrong, this game was fun for the first 50 minutes but it is simply not complete. After being released for 7 months nothing has changed and 20 USD is a hefty price for game that will easily dissapoint you. I enjoyed it but it is definetly not 20 dollars worth. (Note I bought this game in the winter sale so it was 14.99) so still not worth it in my opinion.

I don't know if you Creator has placed this game on the market with a hefty price tag, whether he's expecting it be a much greater game over time or he is just trying to make easy money BUT please WAIT to see if this game can actually be classed as a GAME. 

PS. The server hosting is terrible and the Depth Of Field is so crap that it makes me feel sick.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042132110', 'num_games_owned': 349, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1127, 'last_played': 1686259942}
review:
We were six hours into our game when the wall fell. The two of us battled as hard as we could but we soon focused our efforts on minimising casualties across our hundred colonists.  I suffered moderate casualties, resorting to entering siege mode by blocking off my castle, but he was not so lucky.

The people never forgot his determination. They still sing songs of 'The Great Berry Plantations' that fed the few who remained to rebuild, to reassemble the great colony (but-it-would-actually-make-arrows-this-time).

Fantastic, especially with friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012451592', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 21070, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 776, 'last_played': 1705269033}
review:
"Minecraft-Klon" ist wohl das Erste, was einem in den Sinn kommt. Das ist jedoch nur sehr eingeschränkt richtig, oder soll man besser sagen: Colony Survival ist in etwa so sehr Minecraft-Klon wie Call Of Duty ein HalfLife-Klon ist.

Der Fokus bei Colony Survival liegt beim Management. Man steuert eine Kolonie, die man bauen kann, wie man möchte. Block für Block, wie man es aus Minecraft kennt. Doch eine Kolonie benötigt Nahrung, Verteidigung (die Nacht gehört den Zombies), Verbrauchsgegenstände und Baumaterial. Diese alle selbst an- und abzubauen ist uferlos und wird nicht zum Erfolg führen. Stattdessen setzt man Aufgabenmarker, und jeder Aufgabenmarker wird von einem Kolonisten besetzt, der diese Aufgabe wahr nimmt. So hat man bald zig Farmer, Beerensammler, Handwerker, Schmiede, Schmelzer, Kräutergärtner, Holzfäller, Wachen, Bergleute und viele mehr, die alle mit ihrer Hände Arbeit die Kolonie mit verschiedensten Ressourcen und Materialien versorgen. Dass dabei die Aufgaben nicht aus gehen, dafür sorgt ein Forschungssystem, das in höheren Stufen mehr und komplexere Materialien verschlingt, und eine dynamisch wachsende Feindbedrohung. Jeder einzelne Kolonist führt dazu, dass mehr und später auch gefährlichere Gegner die Nacht heimsuchen, und zielgerichtet die Kolonie ins Visier nehmen. Wo anfangs noch zwei Schleuderkämpfer für ausreichende Verteidigung sorgen, sind später Dutzende Bogen-, Armbrust- oder Musketenschützen (sowie eine Produktionskette für die jeweilige Munition) nötig, um die Horden der Zombies zu erledigen. Allerdings, und das muss man den Entwicklern noch ankreiden, sind diese aktuell noch mindestens genauso dumm wie die eigenen Kolonisten: Bewegungen sind nur entlang der Achsen (X/Y) möglich, nicht quer, und auch wenn sie neben den Kolonisten auch die eigene Figur zum Ziel nehmen, dauert es mindestens eine Sekunde, bis sie auf eine veränderte Zielposition oder versperrte Wege reagieren. Dem ist jedoch entgegen zu halten, dass es sich um ein Early-Access-Spiel handelt, das bei Weitem noch nicht ausgereift ist. 

Pros:
- Dynamische Bedrohungslage (an Kolonistenanzahl gekoppelt)
- Unzählige Items
- Semi-automatische Arbeiterverwaltung mittels Aufgaben
- Forschungsbaum mit vielen Freiheiten
- sehr schöne Voxel-Welt mit dynamischem Licht, Spiegelungen etc.
- sehr kompakt (nur 200-300 MB Speicherplatz nötig)
- schneller Start (<1 Sekunde, von HDD, Spielstand laden: ca. 8-10 Sekunden)

Weder-noch:
- sehr einfaches Lagermanagement (unendlich, von überall zugreifbar)
- unendliche Ressourcen (wenn von Kolonisten bewirtschaftet)
- Fokus-Kamera (nicht fokussierte Objekte unscharf mit verzögerter Schärfeanpassung beim nah/fern-Wechsel)

Cons:
- sehr rudimentäres Pathfinding
- neu gekaufte Kolonisten "entstehen" einfach
- Geringe Auswahl an Baumaterialien und -Objekten (keine Treppen, Zäune, Türen, Fenster...)
- 100% Last auf der GraKa (getestet mit einer GeForce 970 GTX Phantom mit max Details und 1920x1080)
- sehr rudimentäre Ausgestaltung von Feinden/Kolonisten (keine Waffen/Werkzeuge, sehr eckig, schwebender Kopf)
- Rohstoff-Ebenen (für Erze, ähnlich wie Minecraft) sehr konzentriert (3-4 Höhenmeter) und damit schnell in Z-Richtung durchstoßen
- (derzeit) nur eine Feind-Klasse mit mehreren Subspezies (normal, schnell, robust, sehr robust...)
- (noch) keine Tiere und Landschaftsausgestaltung
- (derzeit) nur eine Kolonie möglich

Eigene Meinung:
Für Minecraft-Burgen- und Städtebauer, die gerne eine echt belebte Siedlung gebaut hätten, ist dieses Spiel goldrichtig. Die Kolonisten sind nicht reine Statisten, wie die Dorfbewohner in Minecraft, sondern aktive Mitglieder der Kolonie, welche ihren Teil zum Fortbestand und Wachstum derselben beitragen. Liest man die Roadmap der Entwickler, hat das Spiel noch einen langen Weg vor sich, bis es zum ersten mal ein volles Release wird. Auf den Tag freue ich mich aber schon!

author: {'steamid': '76561198170598771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 98, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1514073251}
review:
I don't want to give this game a negative review, but I have to. This game is basically a Minecraft mod that they charge $20 for (or $15 if on sale). That being said, I can almost guarantee that in a year or so, this game will be an absolute gem. Also, the developers ACTUALLY CARE ABOUT THE PEOPLE AND GIVE WEEKLY UPDATES. No devs do that anymore, especially with early acess games.

Why can't there be a 'meh' option in recommendations?

Pros- 
Unique crafting system
South Park Canadians as colonists (win)
Faster crafting than in minecraft
The materials that colonists harvest don't dissapear (to my knowledge)
Actually really nice shaders
Will keep you busy until you realize the repetition is crazy
There's a pyramid in the world. Pretty neato

Cons- 
Mediocre compared to a free Minecraft addon (again, give it time)
You need sunglasses to look at the blocks in the daytime. Wayyyy too bright
The only smart AI in this game are the scientists
More bugs than a 1998 Pixar movie
Upgrades for colony very basic and limited
Not enough blocks.
And the list goes on....

In conclusion, if you don't have Minecraft, this is a good alternative. If you do, give this a year and it will probably be your best friend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004977582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1812, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1755, 'last_played': 1622978439}
review:
使えるブロックの種類がマインクラフトが開発された当初レベルで村MODを100分の１に薄味にした物
プレイヤーが参加できてゾンビが出てきて１０0０分の1に薄味にしたBanished
パシリNPCを呼べるようになった7 Days to Dieっぽいけど何もかも足りない何か
めっちゃ簡単になったフォールアウト4の集落運営みたいなやつ

採掘や伐採のためにツールを持つ必要は無いが、効率がマインクラフトの石ピッケル以上鉄ピッケル未満なので何かと歯がゆい
野原にベッドを置いていてもRimWorldのように幸福度が下がって発狂したりしないので手の込んだ建物を立てる必要性が無い
というか装飾用のブロックが絶望的に足りないのでどうしようもない
夜になるとNPCはベッドへ向かうのだが障害物関係なく一番近いベッドへ向かうので
地下の採掘要員用のベッドへ地上の農作業してるNPCが向かったりする
で、押し出される形で地下の人間が地上に出てくる
時々やってくるゾンビはブロックを破壊したりよじ登ったり暗闇から突然沸いてきたりしない
なので集落の回りに２マス段差つければ毎晩の悩みは即解決
衛兵増やすなら農家増やそう
どらえもんの4次元ポケットのように離れた場所にある箱の中身がすべてプレイヤーのバックパックと共有
クラフトNPCの隣に箱を横付けで超効率を達成
しかしプレイヤーがクラフトできるものが限られているため
飢饉が発生したから自分でパンを焼くなどという事はできない
素手で岩を割り地中深く進むことのできる主人公はNPCより不器用なようだ
そして集落の人口が100人200人になってくるとぶつかる問題がある
することが無くなるのだ
リリースされて間もないというのもあるだろうがコンテンツが薄すぎる
最初は面白い最初だけ
面白いと思うがまだ人にオススメできない

author: {'steamid': '76561198000784481', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3782, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1267, 'last_played': 1659360660}
review: Exactly what minecraft was missing, a NPC with at least some intelligence. The terrain seems to flow much easier, not so blocky i mean. All around better then minecraft i think. Keep up the great work, the game has a very promising future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198218212805', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2074, 'last_played': 1607362531}
review: Colony survival as of today is what happens when people start with a concept, simple, but powerful and with potential, and continue to build on it. I went into this game expecting the basic village builder from the first alpha stages, but now, with the variable tech levels, monster difficulties, and renewal/revision of early systems, this game has brought new depth and challenge. Here's to hoping that further updates will be positive and that the devs maintain this game going forward.

review: Once you understand the concepts of keeping a balance of food and workers, which takes maybe 30 minutes, there isn't much to do in this game. There is a million more things to do in Minecraft. There is no reason to explore or really anything in this. Sure you can build huge buildings and castle and things but there are tons of block games out there at this point that offer litterally the same exact thing. Hoping devs add a bit more to this but as of right now I just can't recommend as there is so little content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084778649', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 27119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9463, 'last_played': 1567429727}
review:
저의 취향이어서 그런지 꽤 오랫동안 즐기게되더군요.
아직 업데이트가 많이 안되어 혹은 얼리억세스라서 컨텐츠가 적다고는 하시나 그건 아무래나 좋습니다.
만약 이 게임으로 건설을 하고 거주민을 지키고 식량관리를 동시에 하게되신다면 
컨텐츠는 일단 뒤로 미루고 생존을 먼저 고려하시게 될겁니다. 
차근차근히 확장과 성장, 연구등을 하게되면 의외로 시간이 엄청나게 소요가 됩니다.
머리는 머리대로 써야하고 좀비의 이동경로또한 고려하여 구덩이도 파고, 연구도하고 
그리고 마침내 모든 생산사이클이 안정화 되면 정말 기분이 뿌듯해지죠.
근데 이게 끝이 아닙니다. 
안전반경이 늘어나면 욕심이 생겨서 늘어난 땅에 건물을 지어주고 거주민을 받고 식량을 증산하고 더 많은 좀비들을 막게되죠.
또다시 시작되지만 더 즐거운 도전이 되기도합니다. 
처음 지어낼때와 늘어난 땅에서 증설할 때와는 또다른 문제가 몇가지가 생기거든요. 
컨텐츠가 부족하다고는하나 언제나 머리를 굴리고 각 문제들을 어찌 풀어나갈지에 대한 도전이 생기기에 이 게임은 정말 대단하다봅니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053761676', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 26409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12093, 'last_played': 1697317313}
review:
Colony Survival hat das Potential ein echter Konkurrent zu Minecraft zu werden, aber dafür braucht es noch sehr sehr viel. Das Gameplay ist einfach und auch für einen Neuling schnell zu erlernen. Die Steuerung ist noch etwas hakelig und nicht zu 100% Präzise. Aber dafür ist es ja ein Early-Access und noch in der Entwicklung.
Was dem Spiel gut tun würde wäre ein Bedürfnis-System der Kolonisten, dass man seine Kolonisten auch weiter entwickeln kann. Vom Bauern oder Bergmann zum Bürger zum Beispiel.
Ansonsten wird das Spiel schnell langweilig. Felder anlegen Kolonisten rekrutieren, wieder Felder anlegen und Kolonisten rekrutieren, mal ein paar Wächter einstellen
Während der Forschung muss man eine Vielzahl von Produkten und Gegenständen herstellen die man, wenn der ganze Forschungszyklus beendet ist nicht mehr benötigt. Was soll man z.B. mit den Nieten, Schwertern, der Kleidung und dem Stoff, den Schmiedeeisen und Eisenblöcken anstellen.
Ich habe jetzt ca.154.000 Strohballen, für was? So viele Häuser kann ich gar nicht bauen damit ich das gesamte Stroh zum Dächer decken verwenden kann. 
Was soll ich mit dem ganzen Laub anfangen das angefallen ist, als ich das erste Holz selber geschlagen habe. 
Übrigens, wozu sind die Kirschsetzlinge nützlich, die man im Marktplatz kaufen kann, den einen Kirschbaueren bzw. Kirschplantage finde ich niegendwo.
Anfänglich war die Begeisterung groß, solange die Forschung lief und man sein Gebiet erweitern konnte, da hätte ich es vorbehaltlos empfohlen. Nach etwa 50 Stunden Spielzeit kommt die große Ernüchterung in Form der oben beschriebenen 
Langeweile. Ich empfehle es dennoch, da ich an die Entwickler glaube und das Potential sehe.

review: Great game. Lots of fun. Found it from draegasts channel, and had to have it. If you get it you wont regret it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198032105910', 'num_games_owned': 95, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3583, 'last_played': 1544298767}
review:
I've loved playing this game so much, I'm writing my first review on steam just to show support for it.

While it's looks are very similar to another game, this game is far from the same. It's very enjoyable to deal with the issues that rise during play, figuring out the correct defenses and the necessary amounts of food and getting to watch your economy grow. Seeing your village itself grow from a tiny spec to a formidable city. It has a research system that's interesting and challenging, it's been updated every week since I've bought the game, and as expected, it has the freedom to do what ever it is you want.  Overall, 10/10 would play again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143635665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 4869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2163, 'last_played': 1670798744}
review:
I like the game alot but I have encountered a bug which makes me not want to play with monsters on anymore. Me and a friend were playing and at first the game worked fine. Then all of a sudden the monsters stopped dying at daylight and it caused my colony to be wiped out. If this is fixed I might consider playing with monsters on but until then I am playing on my other world without monsters. If the devs see this please fix this bug as it really makes me not want to play with monsters. If you want to play without monsters I highly recommend the game but if you play with monsters I don't because of this problem. Playing with the monsters the game is a lot more challenging but without the monsters it is a little boring. Until the issue is fixed i won't be playing with monsters anymore.


Update: The developer contacted me and said monsters don't die at sunrise anymore so I guess 
 I need a new strategy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086436188', 'num_games_owned': 350, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 17835, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9727, 'last_played': 1675296766}
review:
Il gioco è carino e ha una bella idea dietro, elenco sotto quali sono i punti positivi e quali negativi del gioco:

[code] Positivi:	[/code]

[list]
    [*]Nonostante gli sviluppatori siani pochi vengono rilasciati aggiornamenti e bug fix molto frequentemente, questo aumento davvero la godibilità del gioco, sopratutto per la velocità con la quale risolvono i bug post-update;
    [*]Possibilità di hostare server dal proprio pc: il gioco non pesa molto quindi hostare un server da la possibilità di fare partite con gli amici e divertirsi molto di più rispetto al solo single player;
    [*]Il gioco di per se può sembrare corto ma non è così: per avere una colonia autonoma e con tutte le ricerche sbloccate ci vogliono tante ore di gioco per non contare della possibilità di customizzare pienamente la propria colonia;
   [*]Dalla sua uscita il gioco è enormemente migliorato, adesso il supporto per il multiplayer è completo: è possibile hostare partite, inserire la richiesta di una password, i caricamenti sono migliorati in velocità e schermate (esteticamente parlando decisamente pià carine).
   [*]Ottima cura sull'ottimizzazione, sono passato a fare 50/70 fps a 240, può sembra un dato inutile ma quando si va in late game con tanti colony e mostri le differenza si sentono davvero tanto.
[/list]

[code] Negativi:	[/code]

[list]
    [*]Assenza di anti-grief nel gioco: come detto prima, è possibile hostare un gioco per fare partite con gli amici ma se uno volesse hostare un game aperto a tutti cadrebbe preda di chi entra e smonta letteralmente la colonia. Una cosa molto importante da aggiungere secondo me sarebbe questa.
    [*]I letti ed il rapporto che i coloni hanno con essi: Ora i coloni vanno a dormire nel letto che gli è più vicino, questo è normale ma il problema sta nel fatto che i coloni vanno nel letto più vicino in linea d'area non secondo il percorso. Mi succede spesso che i coloni vadano in letti 20 cubi di distanza invece che quelli a 5. Questo causa problemi in colonie di grandi dimensioni.
    [*]Mancanza del workshop (di Steam): molti giochi vanno avanti grazie alle milioni di mod presenti, secondo me sarebbe un ottimo passo avanti sia per gameplay che per longevità aggiungere un workshop di Steam. 
C'è tuttavia da dire che il supporto per le mod esiste e ce ne sono alcune interessanti, da scaricare e installare manualmente. 
[/list]

Recensione aggiornata al' 04/06/2019

author: {'steamid': '76561198114612860', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 313, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1512064809}
review:
Ich kann ehrlichgesagt nicht verstehen, warum das Spiel doch so hohe Bewertungen hier auf Steam hat. Das Gebotene für 20 Euro ist ein ziemlicher Scherz, hat man nach keine 2 Stunden im Prinzip bis auf ein paar Upgrades (oh, mehr Leben...) alles Gesehen. Noch schlimmer: In einer aktuellen Umfrage möchten die Entwickler sogar noch den Preis auf 25 Dollar anheben, was auf dem aktuellen Content bezogen ein absoluter Witz ist.

Zu Erkunden gibt es nichts. Also wirklich nichts. Das Einzige, was die Spielzeit ein bisschen strecken kann ist, wenn man daran interessiert ist "schön" zu bauen. Nur leider gibt es selbst hier so gut wie keine Bauteile. Es gibt kaum Animationen (keine Angriffsanimation, nichts), kein wirkliches Spielziel, die "Bedrohung" der Zombies ist ein schlechter Witz usw. Man kann selbst das ganze Spiel exploiten, in dem man erst eine Basis baut, und dann den Banner aufstellt, weil keine Zombies spawnen solange man dies nicht getan hat. Auch so Elemente wie das Interface sind im Moment eher zwecksmäßig implementiert worden. Gut ist etwas anderes. 

Ja, dass Spiel ist noch Early Access, und ja, die Grundidee ist gut, auch wenn nicht wirklich neu. Nur leider ist es im aktuellem Zustand absolut keine Kaufempfehlung.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105632907', 'num_games_owned': 336, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1763, 'last_played': 1517401488}
review:
Colony survival is one of those games that I always wished I could play - a colony management/building game but that actually lets you be a person in the game and not just a disembodied overlord. That niche is something I always wanted to get a chance to play - where I could help my colonists fight and wander the streets of my town myself.

So that is essentially what this game is. You not only get to build your colony (however you wish in style) but also get to wander around, fight/defend, mine, give orders, organise defences, and be a part of what you create. It looks very similar to other voxel games, of course much like Minecraft, but if you are like me and loved Minecraft and the Kingdom mod for that game then CS is heading in a somewhat similar direction.

The game is (at time of writing) in EA so you of course have to be aware that nothing is fixed, there will be more features and content coming down the line, and some features are not there yet. For instance, currently the colonists lack personality or dialogue and mechanically move from bed to their jobs and back again, even lacking AI to run from a zombie if it is attacking (rather they go on as if the zombie isn't there until they die). Similarly there is no means of managing your colony from a central location - such as a monarch's desk - but rather you have to go to each person's desk to change their orders. Other nice features such as ordering troops (other than where they guard), melee attack, and such are yet to be implemented.

BUT none of this detracts from the game!! It is EA and the devs are always updating the game, very much engaged with listening to players' feedback and desires for the game, and the game itself still has a lot of good content, is fun, and for me is definitely worth the price!

For instance, you can build however you want (like in Minecraft). So want a castle? A moat? A lake city? A floating city? A small village? Walls? No walls? Where do you want your farms? Want houses/buildings for each profession or have them all together? All are possible. You can upgrade your guards through four levels, mine several different resources (all of which are useful), buy things with gold (a bit basic at the moment, but like I said it is coming!), have numerous different professions for your colonists, research through different things to build more, open up new professions, and even expand the size of your kingdom! There are zombies to fight (about three different kinds) - which, while limited at the moment is something I believe the devs will keep adding to so as to add variety - and you can choose difficulty and whether they constantly attack or just during the night. And so much more.

I paid the full EA price for this game, and as I currently have 19 hours in the game and still have not opened all research - let alone that more is coming - I definitely found it to be worth the price and more! It has been fun, made me want to play it more, given me ideas for this playthrough and others, made me think not just how tough I need to be as a character but also that I have to build defences, keep an eye on my kingdom's resources (i.e. can I build more guards? Will they have enough ammo?), and think how best to defend agains the next attack. All while trying to make my kingdom look cool! So is it worth it? Yes. Fun? Absolutely. Does it have potential? You are damn right it does!

Just keep in mind it is EA and how the devs DO regularly update the game and listen to/engage with players and you won't go far wrong. Like Minecraft and wished you could also have colony running mechanics? You will like it. Yes there is not as much for you to do to update your character yet and no there are no dungeons (that I am aware of), it is very much (at the moment) focused on running the colony - but there is a whole world of things this game could (and hopefully will) implement and the devs certainly are on the right track with how they work in taking the game there.

As with all games, check an LP on Youtube to see if you like them (and keep in mind that some LPs are the older versions of the game) but for me, I love it and really look forward to seeing more!

(My on-going Let's Play of CS, beginning with an introduction to the game, below (if this is any help))

https://youtu.be/LRtYWsv6a9g

author: {'steamid': '76561198065143842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 8859, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3, 'playtime_at_review': 1911, 'last_played': 1712073034}
review:
O jogo ainda está em desenvolvimento, porém mostra um grande potencial! O sistema de farm e defesas é bacana, pois você precisa optimizar a produção de comida, gerenciar os recursos da base e construir ao mesmo tempo.

O único porém atualmente é que o game está bem cru, então para os apressadinhos que nunca participaram de um Early Access, recomendo esperarem para comprar. Os desenvolvedores já promoteram que irão lançar muitos recursos novos como escadas (atualmente não há escadas, os NPCs sobem bloco por bloco), barcos, sistema anti-grief para servidores multiplayer, novas profissões para os trabalhadores, criação de animais etc.

Desde o lançamento do Minecraft, vários jogos voxel surgiram, porém poucos conseguem se equiparar em qualidade, e Colony Survival trouxe algo que não existe em nenhum deles: Construção, farm e defesa da base ao mesmo tempo.

EDIT: Nos últimos 2 updates os desenvolvedores adicionaram blocos brilhantes (semelhante a Glowstone do Minecraft) e as escadas, como prometido.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989936178', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1511778042}
review:
There simply is not enough content to justify the price.  Even for Early Access this is minimal at best. No animations, weapon models, or varied enemies. The game lacks basic features like being able to assign your workers to a specific task. The world generation provides no reason to explore, as there are no spawning enemies, biomes, wildlife, points of interest, etc. 

The interface is pretty clunky. The command mode as 1 and 2, then 3-9 being your inventory is an odd choice that you never quite get used to. Having Left click as cancel, and right click as confirm feels backwards, especially when there are no UX considerations like tooltips, the ability hold to drag in the inventory, placehelpers (for objects), etc. A lot of the interface feels like guess work for the player.

I also ran into multiple bugs during my 6.5 hours, some causing me to lose random workers for no reason. Many times the worker count would erroneously be displayed in the negatives which caused red text to run all over the screen.

Maybe at $10, but at this price I am disappointed in where this stands and can't recommend as a purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561197982024574', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 389, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 389, 'last_played': 1512741336}
review:
This is my first negative review on any game on Steam but I feel it nececessary due to the overwhelming positive reviews that duped me into buying it. 

This game, it just has... no content. No reason to explore, no animations, no music, terrible UI and is just mundane. Even for an early access title (which I own dozens) there is nothing that breaks up the monotony. I started on the tons of zombie difficulty and had no issues getting to a point where I felt I've seen everything in 6 hrs. I got to crossbows and felt no urge to continue the boring tech progression. The concept is brilliant, kind of a Factorio meets Minecraft but is poorly executed. The selection of banners and zones for your workers seems to go out of its way to be unintuative. For $20 the price point is extremely high for what you receive. The devs seem to be geniunely nice people and go out of the way for their community (which I commend) but $20 or even $15 for this game is way to high for 6 hrs of content. Tried to get a refund, no luck. I do hope the devs the best of luck with their game but for now I felt cheated buying this game, which I patiently waited to go on sale while having it on my wish list.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015100898', 'num_games_owned': 610, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 13524, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1351, 'last_played': 1680883226}

author: {'steamid': '76561198014503096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1619, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1589839674}
review:
A minecraft voxel world where you recruit NPCs to stand in front of a crafting block all day and craft stuff for you.
Zombies try to attack your base at night (with attacks during the day option as well)
Planting down a flag forms the center of your kingdom and creates a safe zone around it.

- Minecraft level graphics..nothing much to say here.
- Tech tree is pretty shallow. Some crafts feel like they are just there to bloat up the research tree (Crafting currency for the store to buy stuff, bags of black powder, clothing - cant be worn)
- Enemies are just differently dressed zombies with different levels of health. Thats it.
- Minimal animation. NPC guards and crafters dont even have craft/weapon attack animations, just a progress bar above their head.
- Just building a wall around the safe zone with an entrance is sufficient for now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161396032', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1525884074}
review:
I've found the game to be confusing and weird in several different ways:

- First of all, everything seems to be manual, from building to assigning roles, and I had no idea what I was doing. The tips they give you when you press f1 are hard to follow along with. I suggest giving a walkthrough at the beginning that guides you on what you need to do to get started. It would help with getting people drawn into the game.
- Second, It's hard for me to see what block I'm holding and where I'm going to place the block. The brightness during the day is too intense, which makes it difficult to navigate the toolbar and the rest of the world. Please give us an option to remove the light reflection or turn down the brightness! It makes my head hurt!
- Alongside the navigation, the UI is also confusing. So far I haven't found a shortcut that takes stuff from my toolbar and puts it into the stockpile or the other way around. Dragging it from place to place is a pain in the butt.

However, all of the things I've listed here can be fixed, and I've heard that the developers are good listeners. This game has a lot of potential and I can't wait to see how it will improve. I have a lot of faith in the developers!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989138441', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1548, 'last_played': 1594009525}

author: {'steamid': '76561198038694050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 9365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2398, 'last_played': 1686371406}
review: I wrote a review for this game a long time ago after playing 25 hours in 2 days and gave it a very positive review. I said in that review if this game ever gets better multiplayer support even with every other aspect as is it would easily become one of my all time favorite games. I probably played another 30 hours with it as it was then and enjoyed it quite a lot however grew frustrated with the very limited multiplayer functionality and ended up giving it a long rest. It took a very long time for the changes I wanted to see in those regards make their way into the game but the devs communicated extremely well what was going on, what they were working on, ect, they constantly stayed in contact with the community on every front and involved us with the games progression, through polls, through direct interaction with the modding community and through weekly or even more frequent blog posts. Fast forward to 2019 with the release of version 0.7.0 and we have gotten all the quality of life I could have hoped for and more. This game is a must buy for all fans of open world crafting, strategy, tower defense, and city managment games, it seamlessly combines many of the best elements of all those genres to create something truly unique and entertaining. On top of the fact the game it's self is awesome I have to say the devs are amazing, dedicated, and I know even with the game as fun as it is to play now there is only more amazing updates yet to come, and while they may take a while I know they will be worth the wait.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056427840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2537, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1017, 'last_played': 1699113250}
review:
ほかの方も書かれていますが、
「StoneHearth」と「Minecraft」を足したようなゲーム。

民衆運営ゲーによくある「プレイヤーは指示するだけ」というセオリーがなく、
自分自身もある程度クラフトや戦い・建築・採集などが行える点が個人的に嬉しい！

管理する人数が増えていくとそれに伴ってゾンビの種類がアップグレードされたり、数が増えたりとバランスはそれなり。
時折ゾンビが増えすぎると夜間～朝にかけてが重くなったりも…

研究していくことで、
加工できる金属が増えたり、
領地が拡大されたり、
原始的武器から重火器の開発ができたりするのも段階別で面白い。

現在マルチでプレイ中ですが、
他人の民と自分の民がごっちゃになってしまうので
見分けが付くようになったら良いかな。

author: {'steamid': '76561197974074683', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7884, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3738, 'last_played': 1595022344}
review:
I love this game.  

I've been playing city building games since SimCity and Caesar 2.  I started Minecraft at Beta 0.7.2.  

This game feels a lot like the Minecraft Mod Micecolony.  I always felt like Minecraft lacked a point.  In this game you can use resource management skills, city building skills, and FPS skills.  Since you are in the game it's like you are a shepard rather than a god manager.

Right now there are updates that change many aspect of the game on a regular basis.  Enjoy this experience.

My only complaint, the name Colony Survival could be better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132070555', 'num_games_owned': 384, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1023, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1005, 'last_played': 1565926212}

author: {'steamid': '76561198036972841', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 5493, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1152, 'last_played': 1635021050}
review:
My Opinion - Game is worth 10-15 bucks as is. Has all the pre alpha flaws - mainly lack of polish due to still being in construction; but i haven't been this excited for a game in a while. So much potential. I was convinced to buy it cause of the good reviews and i'm here to add another.

Gameplay -
Phase 1 your an aspiring king looking to start a villiage. You get to explore the map to pick the place where you are quite literaly planting the flag of your future kingdom.

Phase 2 build, protect, research, explore the minerals under your claim, manage the  FVP ratio - Food - Villiager - Protection ratio that is. The more villigers in your town the more appetising it becomes to the zombies so you'll need more protection, which increases your villiagers which increased the amount of food you'll need.  The difficultly of FVP is dependent on how cleaverly you build your castle. Its pretty dope.

Phase 3 Growing your tribe into a village, that into a town, city. Researching different techs. This is were i'm curretly at in the game.

Favorite aspect of the game? The 'evolving' crafting system is why i'm so excited about this game. When your a nobody you have to do all the things yourself and might even have to help plant food, chop trees. As the game pregresses and your villiage gets bigger you can hand the annoying 'craft more nails' to the artesian whom you just unlocked. Long story short your the king. You can micro manage if you want, help the peasants out with there work, cut trees, stand guard with your faithful pals at night. But you can also go back to being a king and do kingly things - like add another defensive tower on the North wing, manage FVP, hire more scientists, eat bread. 

Cons? 
If the art style of minecraft bothers you, you wont like this
Lack of good resource icons - some you have to simply read to understand what they are (They will probably clean this up later though)

But if you like designing, building and defending the things you just built this game is for you. Its looking to be one of my favorites. a few more addons and tweeks and it could be better than minecraft. Like minecraft it also has coop so thats cool.

I'm hoping they add reasons to leave your fortress in the late game - trade, cure zombieism, explore for unavailabe resources idk

Thumbs up if you were able to read all this? thanks

review:
Basicamente um jogo de construir e administrar cidades no Minecraft.
Muita coisa faltando no jogo ainda, mas pelo que vi até agora os DEVs estão sempre ativos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055772843', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 2853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 873, 'last_played': 1674537285}
review:
I really like this game. 

I'll start out with what I like: 
the building mechanics are pretty nice and crisp, and the game plays properly like a sandbox in the sense that you can do as you please. Me and my friend have had loads of fun building mazes to elongate the zombies travel paths and kill chutes so that we can make short work of the ones that make it through. 

The colony managment system is pretty fun, and you are forced to use your colonists to do certain tasks that you just aren't capable of doing. It's a nice way to make them relevant. It's also great to see them going about their tasks, and gives you a sense of a lively town as your workers bustle about doing their tasks. 

Here's what I think could be improved: 
the pathing for the A.I. is very, very limited. They can only travel in a linear direction, and currently don't have the ability to strafe. There's to animation for your guards to draw and shoot their bows. The number of aesthetic blocks is pretty limited also. 

The zombies have no variation yet either. They all look the same (except for the tougher guy with the green eyes) and can only go linear directions. This leads to some funny moments where you can force them to chase you even though your on the tile verticle to them. Since none of them have any special abilities, there comes a point where the game becomes very easy when you create a maze for the zombies to move through to get into your base. Where I'm at, hundreds of zombies are forced to funnel through my maze and two guards make short work of them as they get confused on where to go. 

TL;DR: 
despite its current limitations, This game is still extremely fun in its current state. Ive had a lot of fun getting my colony up and running and defeating the hordes of zombies marching on my doorstep. This is a game that I can wait for future updates on. I would definitely recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029544842', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 35834, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3464, 'last_played': 1673048674}
review:
Ein Sehr Entspanntes spiel für Zwischendurch oder auch eine Action geladene runde ohne Pause, was man möchte darf man sich aussuchen aber Fakt ist es wird eine Kolonie errichtet, diese Kolonie muss Verteidigt, Versorgt und Ausgebaut werden.

Anfangs muss man noch einiges selbst erledigen aber durch die Kolonisten wird alles Automatisch Hergestellt und man kann sich auf das Wichtigste im Spiel Konzentrieren: Grosse schöne Bauten Errichten und die Kolonie Optimieren.

Mir Gefällt es sehr und ich freue mich auf Zukünftige Updates!

author: {'steamid': '76561198031754497', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2653, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1642, 'last_played': 1605172436}
review:
The logic for the villagers is often frustrating. Career changes in particular can be a big deal.

The game plays a little like someone got frustrated at the villagers in MC and wanted to make a game around them. If the villagers had better job assignment criteria, and perhaps could be used as meat shields, or drop things, or interact in any fashion I think that might make them feel more dynamic and as if there were strategies employable in the game.

Then there are also elements in the game, like biomes, that seem to have little effect on the current game play, which are currently superfluous.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116227977', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 6927, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3244, 'last_played': 1638265089}
review:
마인크래프트 느낌의 마을경영게임이 하고싶다면 이 게임을 강력 추천해드립니다!
아직은 모자란 점이 많지만 꾸준히 발전하고 있고, 개발자들의 의욕도 넘칩니다.
유튜브 컨텐츠를 꾸준히 생산하고 있는데, 조회수가 상당할 정도로 잠재적인 팬층이 쌓인 게임이기도 합니다.

* 한글 지원이 안되는 것으로 나와있으나, 최근에 개인적으로 한글패치를 진행해서 개발자에게 전달했고, 0.4.1 버전부터 공식적으로 지원되고 있습니다. 한글패치는 앞으로도 꾸준히 업데이트할 예정입니다.
혹여나 한글패치를 도와주실 분이 계시다면 아래 메일로 연락주시면 감사드리겠습니다 :)
pdkkoedol@gmail.com

author: {'steamid': '76561198313889813', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 3095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 850, 'last_played': 1595244305}
review: Well, I have Hardly played the game, (on a friend's Reccomendation.) and I See A Great deal of potential in this game. It's an interesting game, if not particularly good at this point, but worth a look nevertheless. there are a couple issues I have with the game, but we will cover those later. first, I want to say that this is a game which, though lacking in polish, seems to be on the road to minor success, perhaps ending up as a "Cult Classic" of sorts, which tends to be a good sign. thankfully, this is not a full release, for if it was, this would be considered an unacceptable and worthless thing, however, being in it's early days as it were, I hold out hope that it will improve. Among my issues is that the controls are terrible, somehow managing to be slippery and stiff at the same time, and the frame of view is way off where it should be, seeming too zoomed in for easy gameplay. the concept is fairly fun, and the execution is decent, but another glaring issue presents itself very quickly. the in-game instructions, and even the PDF, Don't tell you how to do ANYTHING. you almost have to look up a guide online to get anything done, most annoyingly, the things that it doesn't cover are things like HOW to not have seige mode happen every 5 minutes because it doesn't tell you how to connect the banner to the world after telling you that the banner isn't connected to the world. I appreciate the lack of hand holding, as that can be annoying, but this is undertutorialized, rather then the more common overtutorialization, and I'm not sure which is the lesser evil. But the clever usage of what appear to be noise graphs to make the faces of several of the blocks, most notably logs and stone, add to the few features this game has as of yet. the price is Far higher than it should be for the game in this state, but all the same, the potential is high for this, and it could turn out to be one of the better games I end up having purchased recently. my rating for this game is 6.3/10, and if it keeps improving, It could rise far higher.

review:
I highly recommend it.
The devs are active, and they pay attention to what their community wants. They even create surveys and watch their forums for it. It has a variety of things to do from it being research and keeping your colonists alive. It has the creativity of minecraft, you can build whatever you want with just less blocks. Even the fact that if you beat the game and start getting bored, you can count that they will add more content like their newest update 0.4.0. You can make the game more difficult for some players who want more difficulty like monsters spawn during day..

author: {'steamid': '76561198152757171', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 4441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2531, 'last_played': 1639649772}
review: The game is fun and pretty good and it will be even better once more and more updates come out, I think the game is a bit overpriced though for how much content it currently has. now I know that you devs need money and what not but you should consider lower the price a bit and not raising it so that more people will be inclined to purchase the game. I also read the update post for 0.4.0 and the devs talked about raising the price to $25 and that would be fine maybe if it had a lot more block types and monsters but as of now it does not really have the content to "justify" upping the price. as for multiplayer I have had no issues although I think there should be an option to work with your friends and not just building separate kingdoms. I will give this game in its current state a 6.5/10 This game has a lot of potential and I will enjoy seeing it grow.
