author: {'steamid': '76561198199455857', 'num_games_owned': 49, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 117948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31308, 'last_played': 1554308450}
review:
I have been around the game since 2.0, rather late when I think about it.   

I've personally talked to the Developers of the game, they make excellent efforts to appeal to every player here.   They take the time to explain in detail their fixes, make improvements and work with the players to improve game experience.
I give this game a 10 of 10, it has become an addiction of sorts, and talking to the large assortment of friendly players and the creators themselves, I can say for certainty, this is a game worth taking the time to Explore.


Pros:  Fun, addictive gameplay
An assortment of Zombies
Expansive, creative world
Always Unique biomes.   
Many Jobs to keep you occupied
Multiple Researches to expand your projects
The Ability to kill your own Colonists(eh, who cares if it's my own personal like)
New additions, constant fixes as things go
Friendly, active, helpful Developers(My Personal View)
Friendly, active, helpful community(My Personal View)



Cons:  Every game has cons, but I can't really think of any that are worth mentioning.

Griefers who go out of their way to ruin the game for others(My Personal View)
People who lie in their reviews about a game because they can't grief and harass others on it(My Personal View)

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044218150', 'num_games_owned': 404, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 14548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 21, 'playtime_at_review': 7609, 'last_played': 1712274865}
review:
Man, this game is a lot more fun than it may appear at first. I've been hooked since I started playing it. The depth and detail in it is surprising, and the lighting in the game is breath taking.

Update 5/11/18:

I recently got over 100 hours in the game and since I first got the game its improved a ton. The above is still true, but I thought I'd update this a bit more.

When people ask me about the game, I always describe it as "Minecraft the way it should have been". I have dozens if not hundreds of hours in minecraft but I always found it somewhat lacking in motivation to continue. Once you finish a project there's nothing to do but move onto the next. Here though, there's always more to do. Work on improving your area towards appearance, economy, optimization, defense, research, etc.

The game is always growing and improving. The builder and digger update for example, made the game so so so much more fun and less tedious. Instesd of you placing those thousands of blocks have your people do it. I have a massive base now which can hold 1k people and I have maybe 10% of the area I want to cover all the way down from ground level to bedrock. And it's only going to grow as I go verticle. 

The creatures are simple, 3 types of zombies with different health, with 3 variations in speed. But more types are coming. They plan to add actual threats to the game and make the defense aspect of the game an interesting challenge.

Honestly, this game is a blast and truly deserves a chance if you loved minecraft but thought it could do more.

The developers are active and they listen to suggestions. A feature was suggested by a player and it was in the game a few days later.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083353424', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 715, 'last_played': 1509105760}
review:
画面很MC，有点环世界的感觉，但是村民没有ai，[spoiler]每天起早贪黑，睡着被咬死了都不知道……[/spoiler]需要身为（大概是）国王的你来消灭僵尸守卫城镇。
这游戏你可以玩出几种模式，什么塔防啊，建造啊，射击啊，养成啊……玩法挺多，就是后期就觉得没什么玩的了。[spoiler]或者你可以建一个大大的城堡门口多做几个迷宫后期僵尸多了说不定你还能玩出塔防的乐趣。[/spoiler]
游戏前期还是很有玩头的，后期略单调，我没有尝试过多人联机。希望后期能多更新一些玩法吧~

author: {'steamid': '76561197981808133', 'num_games_owned': 482, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 5869, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1011, 'last_played': 1688935362}
review:
Für alle die gern bauen und werkeln geb ich mal nen Daumen hoch.
Persönlich hab ich nicht viel erwartet und bin positiv überrascht worden.
Man ist quasi der König und baut sich seine Kolonie auf.Genug Nahrung vorrausgesetzt braucht man nicht viel selbst farmen
sondern rekrutiert für jede Aufgabe einfach einen Arbeiter und zur Verteidigung Bogenschützen.
Die Craftingmöglichkeiten erweitern sich pro Arbeitsstation und machen jetzt schon Spass werden aber noch erweitert.
Wasser kann umgeleitet werden so dass man auch bewässerte Burggräben usw bauen kann.
Die zahl der Zombie's die des nachts angreifen steigt mit der Zahl der Siedler und wem das noch zu lasch ist kann in den Optionen die Anzahl verdoppeln.
Das Spiel wird von zwei Brüdern entwickelt die auch fleissig daran werkeln.Diese Woche kommt zb das Update auf 0.4.0 was dem Spiel noch ein wenig mehr Pepp gibt.
So ich bin dann mal wieder in meiner Festung ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198021732714', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 10886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4762, 'last_played': 1700764961}

author: {'steamid': '76561198002253376', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 19075, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9148, 'last_played': 1552453692}
review: I've never been one to publically post my opinions of a game, but I've never gotten such a high degree of enjoyment from a game before. The community, admin, and even developers are the most helpful, responsive, and approachable group of individuals I have ever met. 2 out of 5 stars. Just kidding, it's a perfect 5. It's hard to believe that, after only four months of development, the game is already this good.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983201980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 5339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2015, 'last_played': 1702574759}
review:
For its current stage, I cannot recommend this game. You discover and achieve everything in 2 - 3 hours of your gameplay. After the first half an hour, the challange is gone. I wish there were better enemies and different traits to enemies over time but that's not the case in this build. Maybe in a year it can be better but for now, stay away.

Edit : After update, they increased the play time of the game significantly, but that doesn't mean it's a better game now. It's unfortunately the same thing with more play time. This game seriously needs a better game design, different variety of enemies (not bullet sponge zombies) and a better crafting system. I am at the population of 450 + colonists and at the day probably 50 - 100 and the game doesn't stop getting more difficult. Yes, replacing your archers with a better and upgraded version gives the feeling of progression but that would be better if the game would have more meaningfull difficulty system. Because as of right now, it gets more difficult untill to the point where you cannot keep up with the zombies and overwhelmed by the bullet sponge red ones. (Not overwhelmed yet but 1 - 2 more days and I'll be there)

So, This game could be really good. As of right now, it's a mess. A promising mess at least. I believe in 1 year or so, it will come to a point where it is a lot more playable. I'd suggest you to avoid untill then.

author: {'steamid': '76561198308316994', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 11987, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1708506438}
review: I really enjoyed the games mechanics after I got a hold of them. I feel it has a lot of potential to become a unique basebuilding sandbox game. Although all it is right now is potential. I want more variety in gameplay but how i see it right now this game has very low replayability. If it had animals, more monsters than zombies and more biomes then I could definately play this over and over again. as it stands i'll probably get bored of it in 30 hours but as new things come out im sure that it will become a fun replayable game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198160401448', 'num_games_owned': 281, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 6046, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2354, 'last_played': 1647986375}
review:
This is an amzing game. Absolutely. Four things I have problems with (and solotions): 
1)   Workers just work. Nothing else. heres what I think. Increase the length of the day by something like one minute, then have the workers take a minute long break (including travel time) where they wander around. This break could be randomly throughout the day, not all at once, and it would look nicer. 
2)   Fighting. Oh yeah. Archers who stand still 24/7, and don't take breaks. Have a day and night shidt for archers on the smae quiver, (no day shift if no day zombies) and also: HAVE THEM MOVE!!! It looks like crap if they just stand there! Why do they even need beds if they never use Them! And then, theres only melee enemies and no ranged, vice versa for colonists. Have knights who patrol outside your walls or whatever and they can fight, and have enemies with bows! 
3)   Other people. You are the only Colony. You can't make others and you there is no enemy colonies. Have some enemy colonies, and bea ble to make a second banner and second colony with a second set of crates, and have trade!
4)   Whenever you get to large scale bases, you have to do large scalle buildings, and clear forsets. IT TAKES FOREVER!!! there needs to be a faster way to clear forests, lumberjacks on their spare time or something. PLEASE!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198014973776', 'num_games_owned': 775, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 729, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 644, 'last_played': 1549567179}
review:
So, if you are going to play this game by yourself it is a decent game. There isn't a lot of content in the game and in 3-6 hours you can have most of your colony set up and ready to go. If you are going to play it with someone understand that you will not be working together for the most part. As you don't share anything, you can't drop anything, basically you have to place it down to have another person break it. Also, the commands in game are annoying to try and use. 

All in all, not work the cost right now I would pay about $10.00 for this game until more content is added. Multiplayer is actually together and not along side each other. As there really isn't a co-op as you are working along side one another.

review:
Edit: Currently playing 6.1. still an amazing game.

I cannot say enough good things about this game. Tower defense meets Minecraft. It has a nice challenge curve that currently flatlines after a certain point, but that should be changing with the 0.4.0 update. At least the curve will stretch further out. It is a ton of fun to just let everyone fight the waves of enemies that start attacking your base. While mazes are fun, they take something away from the game. I can't wait to see where this game goes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198208070071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 909, 'last_played': 1586320813}
review: Major problem with this game that renders it completely un-enjoyable... Now, I don't know if it is only an issue my brother and I are having but it seems that everytime we start an local LAN game together, we spend our time building up our defenses, collecting resources, creating huge structures, and recruiting colonists, and then we initially save it to play another day... Only problem is everytime we return to our saved game, ALL OF OUR DAMN COLONISTS ARE GONE. EVERY. TIME. And by then we usually don't have enough food to recruit anymore. The game is very fun and enjoyable but it becomes so pointless when you know you can only play for that one session. If anyone has come across the same problem and has resolved it please let me know. So far I don't see anyone else who has figured this problem out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198239508858', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 28156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1677, 'last_played': 1692109397}
review:
I used to say that colony survival is sort of like playing minecraft with the mid eval craft mod. But that mod no longer resembles that remark so it is best disregarded.
What colony survival is, is a developer's fun little minecraft clone project that randomly turned into one of the most under appreciated games on steam.
The basic loop of the game is to build a wall to keep the zombies out, refine your techniques for building mideval inferstructure, get new technology, rinse and repeat. Essentially a weird combination of tower defence and a cube based base builder.

10/10 would recommend to everyone, have already reccomended to most of my friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198074444029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2546, 'last_played': 1514044812}
review:
Pros: 
Inticing gameplay, quite challenging and punnishes you if you make a mistake or aren't paying attention to food or arrows.  Although it may look similar, it's completely different from any minecraft clone. Colony Survival nails the real time stratedgy part of this game, with the colonists that can have jobs that will benefit survival of the player and the rest of the colony. Highly worth the early access price even at it's early state!

Cons:
There are a few bugs and missing features I would really like to see. There is no cherry tree farmer, and although it seems useless, the leaves are very nice. Colonists also seem to try and find the neares bed in the XY coordinates, but this is a problem if you have built beds underground for miners and othere colonists go in the underground bunkers, and miner in the above ground ones. A solution would be finding the closest in the XYZ. There is an annoying bug where the player gets caught on a weird hitbox on blocks, and cannot move past it until they jump. This also allows players to sometimes scale two block high walls. I don't know why this happens or how it can be fixed It's just frustrating. Sometimes when breaking blocks or walking into walls, the playing merges through and can swim in the ground or any blocks above. This isn't too annoying and doesn't really need to be patched soon.

TLDR
Totally worth the money and support for the two devs. They really care about this game and it's community. A bit buggy but totally awesome ideas and mechanics

author: {'steamid': '76561198114063871', 'num_games_owned': 96, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 15773, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2769, 'last_played': 1682193629}
review:
What I think = For an early access game with only 2 people working on it, it is suprising stable bug free. 

Review = It has a minecraft feel at first but quickly developes into it's own game once you begin recruting coloninests. Though as of this review there is not much to do in the game, it is definitly addicting with what you have. You can build a great castle and watch it be destroyed with one mistake which keeps you on guard. The food system is well thought out but more varity would defintly go a long way. The AI is simple yet proficient at what it is supposed to do. The multipayer is good. All in all, great start towards what looks like will be a great and awesome game.

Pros -
Oddly Satisfying
Simple to learn
Relatively few bugs
Stable
Addicitng 
Easy UI
Well rounded and thought through game
Good Graphics 
Multiplayer support

Cons -
AI is a little to simple
Not much to do (ATM)
Building can be quirky at times
Tuturial could use some expansion 
When deleting a saved world, there is no secondary text.(The "Are you sure?" text)
(Edit after posted review)
After a few hours the graphics can start to hurt your eyes a bit, maybe they should be softened some.
Often times I find myself phasing though and floating/walking halfway in a block
I have played this game now for quite a few hours (apx. 50) and it has become a little repetitive, definitly would like to see some more mechanics/general activities added to the game in the future updates. /10-17-17\

Consensus = Love the game, great with friends, would recommend to friends, would like to see mroe diverse gameplay in the future though.

-Typhoon Nova

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198220978060', 'num_games_owned': 210, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 29882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25647, 'last_played': 1638548151}
review:
It's already a full game and its FAAAAR from finished... I have enjoyed a good few hundered hours.

Build a colony, survive enemy attacks each night, produce more resources and create better guards. Build a base block by block OR get your colonists to build/dig structures for you. In 0.7.x keep your colonists happy, upgrade everything, explore and create new colonies for new resourses. Trade and defend against even larger swarms of enemies. Go online or LAN witsh some friends and do it all as a team effort. 

NOTE: The most dedicated duo of developers I have ever encountered. Check out their blog, they never stop developing the game or keeping us up to date.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094029341', 'num_games_owned': 46, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1631320765}
review:
So I've played about three hours of this game so far (Ill Update in a while) and let me just say so far this is my game of the year. Im playing with my friend on his server and were just having the greatest time. It really brings back that feeling of adventure from my days playing minecraft for the first time, but still it manages to feel like a completely original game. I've put my pros and suggestions down below.

PROS
Gorgeous graphics. the attention to detail in the lighting right down to most of the blocks is phenomonal
Great terrain generation. The red taiga mountains with snowy peaks and the forested hills really feel grand and majestic
Good sense of progression, this could be improved in terms of skill tree but I love watching this small village grow to a city
Devs are fantastic! Super responsive and helpful

Suggestions
I love most of the blocks, but the logs just look way to much like dirt for my taste. 
Some of the items are almost the same color gray as the uncraftable things in your menu, so sometimes it looks like you cant craft things you can.
Also, I totally understand that this is early access, and I know that dev's have lots of plans but just, more more MORE!
Although my friend and I still have tons of stuff we want to do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030886687', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1879, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1479, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1712245360}
review:
20€ la bonne idée, c'est trop cher payé.
Et je pense que si ce jeu a un tel ratio de bonnes évaluations, c'est que tous ceux qui auraient voulu en mettre une mauvaise se sont fait rembourser.

Certes, un minecraft avec gestion automatisée des ressources, c'est une bonne idée. Mais c'est tout. Pas de contenu, pas d'exploration, pas de tension. Nada. En 5h j'ai fait le tour.

Je ne doute pas que les dev soient à l'écoute et qu'ils soient de gentils gars, mais c'était beaucoup trop tôt pour sortir ce jeu .

author: {'steamid': '76561198215993557', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 1785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1179, 'last_played': 1557560104}
review:
ColSurv хороша тем, что в нее не надоедает играть. постоянно появляются проблемы в колонии, новые фишки и т.д. 
Если в майнкрафт надоедает играть из-за того что ты уже развился и делать нечего, то здесь есть хоть небольшой смысл - сделать огромную колонию, в которой будет овер дохрена колонистов.
Так же хотелось бы отметить то, что теперь возможна установка модификаций. Не воркшоп, конечно, но МОДЫ!
Ну и... в каждой игре есть минусы. Для примера можно взять то, что на средних компах игрушка подвисает. Даже на минималках, когда набирается 50 колонистов
А так. 
100 хлебушка из 10)))

review: This is a really fun game.  I enjoy how easy it is to start, and how the difficulty increases at a nice but manageable rate. The controls are more than easy enough for anyone to learn, and the automatization system isn't complex, but you do have enough options to keep it interesting. As for the building, you can make many amazing structures, both comsetic and/or functional. I would recommend this game to people who like games focused on building, resource management, and strategy. 5/5 stars, and it's only going to get better from here.

review: Currently the game is a blast, things work the way they should and the concept is fun, I have run into a few issues though when it comes to moving across blocks that are connecter on the conner, the game tends to push you off, like there is an air block in your way. I would also like to sugggest an addition where the zombies can't spawn on worker fields, such as wheat fields, I keep gettting a hoard spawning in the middle of mine. I have high hopes for this already fun game and I can't wait for the full release.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127784360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 893, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 893, 'last_played': 1504444334}
review:
Very nice game. Mixture between Minecraft and any Tower Defense. 
You can basically build structures in the way you are used to in Minecraft, after that you can assign workers to do some of the tasks (farming, mining, crafting) automatically for you - and assign some of them as archers for defense. At night zombies spawn and try to kill you. 

+ Unlimited building possibilities as block-based "Minecraft" building style
+ Automatic resource gattering
+ Very easy to understand

- No automatic building, "blueprints"
- Very easy to defend/survive
- Still lacking some features (stairs, automatic building, weather effects, water requirements, advanced AI)

If you are looking for a more advanced game very similar to this genre, try "Stonehearth". It includes a much nicer graphic, is more challenging and has more content.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998824286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 99, 'playtime_forever': 403, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1504414646}
review:
---------------------------------
Die erste Minute:
---------------------------------

"Wa... was ist das denn... das spielt sich ja aus deer Ego-Sicht!"

---------------------------------
Nach etwa einer Stunde:
---------------------------------

"Bisher keinerlei Bugs - macht viel Spaß!"

To be continued...

author: {'steamid': '76561198149508256', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1504146480}
review:
Плюсы: 
-Интересная задумка непрямого контроля поселения.

Минусы:
- Все блоки квадратные
- Все иконки нарисованы крайне неприятно
- Бревна похожи на блоки грязи
- Ночью очень скучно
- Шахты работают очень неприятно. Сначала нужно вручную прокопать тоннель до нижнего слоя мира и поставить маркер шахты 1х1, на котором рабочий будет вечно добывать материалы.
- Кроме деревьев, в мире ничего нет.
- Весь контроль поселения заключается в маркировке зон, на которых будут "пастись" ваши поселенцы.
- Тулбар не удобен. Инструменты управления поселением следовало поместить либо в конец тулбара, либо вовсе привязать к другим кнопкам.
- Расстановка лучников, смотрится глупо.
- Контента просто нет, эта игра - чистая заготовка.

Итог: Игра не стоит своих денег, будь она по цене 150, я бы плюнул, мол, пусть валяется когда-нибудь дорастет до чего-то стоящего. НО ОНА СТОИТ 400+ рублей! Это непроиемлемо для проекта, все наполнение которого сделано за пару часов.

author: {'steamid': '76561198307941948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 594, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 574, 'last_played': 1622668080}
review: Very fun game. Amazing to watch your kingdom progress and grow as you improve at building, fighting and keeping your workers in place. It's great and all but it needs more. It's only in early access and great to play but I recommend adding more enemies as soon as possible to make it have more of a variety and keep it interesting. As i said it's only in early access and a great price for what it is. I'm excited to see new major updates and cool ways to keep the player intact with the game. Hoping for new big updates soon and hope the creators keep up the beast work. ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197991925600', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1546695346}
review:
Das spiel ist echt net aufgebaut. Es ist schön eine Stadt bauen zu können die nicht nur Leblos da steht sondern bewohnt ist.

Es ist ein kleiner anfang aber noch sehr ausbau fähig.

z.B. 
- bessere Verwaltung von Bewohnern. Bei zuordnung von freien Arbeitsstellen selber Entscheiden können wo man die Bewohner hinschickt. Momentan wird es eingereiht. Was man als erstes baut wird auch zuerst besetzt.
- andere models denn die aktuellen sind mir ein wenig zu langweilig (Zombies sowie Bewohner)
- System Einstellungen fehlen wie Tag und nacht Rythmus Verlängern.  Der Tag geht etwas zu schnell vorbei.
- andere Zombies (arten) etc.
- Menü-steuerung, -führung des Spielers überarbeiten und etwas schöner Gestalten. Die Tasten 1 und 2 nerven ein wenig wenn man bauen will und dann doch die berry farm baut. ^^


Das sind so die sachen die noch geändert werden sollten. Ich werde mich zu meinem Teil überraschen lassen was die oder der Entwickler sich noch einfallen lassen werden/wird.
Es ist halt noch langweilig das Spiel aber ich sehe da noch sehr viel Potenzial.

author: {'steamid': '76561198239386520', 'num_games_owned': 371, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 797, 'last_played': 1586126258}
review:
Исходя из скриншотов этой игры, я подумал, что ничего крутого от неё можно не ожидать. Когда она устанавливалась, в моей голове была только одна мысль - "На что я только что потратил свои деньги?*_*". Но стоило мне только зайти в мир, все сомнения отбросились. Я увидел перед собой не клон майнкрафта. Я увидел перед собой оригинальную игру с идеей колонизации поселения и очень даже красивую графику (особенно порадовало качество текстур у блоков и этот божественный фокус). 
Вот только в игре маловато возможностей и один тип туповатых монстров. Но игра вышла всего пару месяцев назад и находится в раннем доступе. По этому, я уверен, разработчики хорошенько поработают над ней.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139170968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7982, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3874, 'last_played': 1672418868}
review: This game is really fun and I would definitley recommend it. You get to build and create in an open sandbox and also get to micro-manage your colony to succeed. It puts a lot of aspects of a fun game into one. It feels so rewarding to see your colony succeed when you remember starting with bare materails to a huge city. The multiplayer is seemless with little lag and cool settings where you can shut down the server or leave it up. It fun with freinds or alone. Definitly would recommened

author: {'steamid': '76561198116722329', 'num_games_owned': 279, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 3509, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2965, 'last_played': 1563575851}
review:
Всем привет.
Одна из серий летсплея по игре:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_wftOE3xjvA
Гайд по установке модов:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZYC1ndl-1O4

Это скорее мое мнение, а не обзор в прямом смысле слова. В дальнейшем, наиграв больше времени, я возможно изменю свое мнение и дополню данный текст. Вообще, клоны майнкрафта я не особо люблю и к этой игре, сначала отнесся с некоторым сомнением, добавило сомнений малое, пока, количество контента в игре.
Но сам геймплей полностью поменял мое отношение к данному продукту. Совершенно примитивная графика и довольно простая идея по не прямому управлению поселением, - затянуло меня с головой. 
Утром я поставил игру с мыслью, что не плохо бы поиграть пол часика, чтобы разобраться в игре, а через 3,5 часа, я подумал «Блин, я же хотел ее снимать для канала», - просто не оторваться. 
На данный момент в игре довольно мало возможностей и всего один вид врагов, но это все, явно будет исправлено, особенно учитывая новости от разработчиков.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058111101', 'num_games_owned': 291, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 675, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1686877672}
review:
I would like to recommend this game, but in its current state, I can't quite do that. Colony Survival is a neat idea on what visually looks like Minecraft with shaders. You build, farm, mine, and harvest wood to build up a colony of villagers. You can create jobs for villagers to do such as farm, mine, grind wheat, bake bread, run a store, chop down trees, smelt ores, etc. However, the game doesn't give you the tools to make managing these villages easy, or quite frankly at all.

Colony Survival also lacks where it counts. The game has zero animation for anything. Shooting arrows, mining blocks, placing blocks, etc. The game has almost no content. There are no doors, windows, ladders, stairs, etc. You have a few rudimentary stone/wood blocks and tools. No room for outside the box creativity.

I would place this game in the "Wait and See" category because the concept is fun and intriguing. However, the severe lack of basic game function just doesn't make it worth the $20 price tag.

author: {'steamid': '76561198256938875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 675, 'last_played': 1511556623}
review:
I enjoyed playing the game, but like others, found myself with not much left to do after only 7.5 hrs. Hardly worth the current $20 price. HOWEVER, this game has great potential. Here are my ideas:

1) More monster variety
2) Have the ore deplete after awhile, so that players have a reason to extend their mine shafts. As it is right now, once a handful of each ore is uncovered, I have no reason to keep digging other than for stone.
3) More building materials: glass, fences, doors, ect.
4) Animals! Introduce shepards to the game, that will tend to farm animals for leather, milk, meat and wool.
5) Allow the villagers to breed as long as there are enough beds, it would give the game a more natural feel by allowing the colony to expand on its own.

Yes, these ideas sound a lot like Minecraft but most of the reason I loved playing this game was because it had a Minecraft feel, but with reasons to build a city. In Minecraft, it was pointless to build beautiful cities that had only defenseless villagers wandering around. 

Keep up the good work and keep improving, I'll be anxiously awaiting updates for sure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170123502', 'num_games_owned': 357, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4596, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1763, 'last_played': 1615064207}
review:
Before I begin, I reviewed this game earlier on in development and was dishappointed with the game. This is my previous review below.
______________________________________________________________________________

I have played this game for around 10 hours now and i am already beginning to get bored of it. In its current state the game does not have enough content to be worth the £15 price tag. The game mostly consists of you doing the same thing over and over again only on a slightly larger scale each time.

I have also had issue with the multiplayer not allowing any of my friends to join my server stopping any of us having fun playing the game together and competing against each other. This would make the game more fun to play and give you a reason to continue playing which the main game doesn't do very well.

This game shows promise but needs to be given more features and the multiplayer needs to be fixed and improved upon. Therefore I cannot recommend this game in its current state and feel the game would be benefit from a price drop.
______________________________________________________________________________

Now I have come back having given the game some time to advance. I am pleased to say that the game has improved a lot in that time. The much needed detail the progression system needed is now there and even though the game still mostly ends up the same way doing the same thing repeatedly, the new research tree does help to add some variety into the game.

The multiplayer, as far as I can tell, has been fixed and me and my friends can play together without issue, or at least until someone decides to join our server that you don't know and decides they wants to have some fun at your expence. Something despirately needed in the game now is a password for multiplayer servers as this would fix this issue. I would however, recommend that if you do buy this game that you play with a friend as it gives you someone to compete against and give you another reason to continue building.

The developers are always looking for ways to improve on the game. The game has improved a lot since my last review and I can't wait to see what they do next. I would definately now pay the £15 price tag.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066310618', 'num_games_owned': 3195, 'num_reviews': 124, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1502607592}
review:
Colony Survival is a colony management game that's actually quite fun. Basically the objective of the game is to expand your village. You can recruit people, and you can set them proffesions such as a miner or wheat farmer. Ultimately, the game boils down to pure automation so there is quite a lack of interactivity. 

This game is enjoyable to play when you have a nice village set up with defenses and farms and managing food and beds for people. Pretty soon though, it gets to a point where it just gets boring. There's barely anything you can do, if you've erected efficient defenses against attack monsters, then at night time there's nothing really for you to do. I would just go AFK and wait until it's day time again. 

The visual side is very well done in my opinion. The game bears sleek voxel graphics and beautiful shaders, and it's quite visually appealing. Unfortunately, the lack of interactivity and variety does mean this game turns into monotony. I can easily see this game improving, if only they added more content, which I'm sure they will. In it's current state, it feels very barebones.

For a few hours, it is quite a fun experience. But when the asking price is $20, I don't think that is very good value for a game with so little content. Buy it if you enjoy developing sophisticated structures and bases, otherwise there's not much else to it.

[b][u]Highlights[/u][/b]
[list]
[*] Visually appealing
[*] Initially, it's quite fun
[*] Setting up automated processes is rewarding
[/list]

[b][u]Downsides[/u][/b]
[list]
[*] Gets boring fast
[*] Lack of content and interactivity
[*] High price
[/list]

[b][u]Conclusion[/u][/b]
This game isn't bad, but it's currently lacking content to justify the $20 pricetag.
I also must note it is currently very early in development.
I will definitely update my review as this game progesses, because it does have very good potential

author: {'steamid': '76561198097856781', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 6900, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1570, 'last_played': 1700194475}
review:
[h1]UPDATE 4/13/2019[/h1]
It has been over a year since the last content update, leading me to change my review to 'Not Recommended'.  The developers put out a blog post every week but after reading through dozens of them I have now completely lost interest.  I understand their desires to release a large update and they continuously make claims about their progress, but the truth is the actual game has been in purgatory for well over a year now.  From a consumer-end point of view the game is practically dead and there is little room to encourage new players to join a game that withholds [u]any[/u] progress for massive game-uprooting updates.  Consumer feedback is impossible when those of us who PAID to experience development are left with nothing. Stop selling promises and start showing results.

[h1]ORIGINAL REVIEW[/h1]
This game is enjoyable and definitely an early access game worth buying. The development team is active, and the game itself provides a unique environment for players to test out various strategies and designs. As an alpha game, there are of course bugs, but I have yet to encounter a bug that made the game unplayable. Adding onto this, bugs are worked out relatively quickly compared to most EA titles. This game shows a lot of future potential, while still being fun and engaging in its current state.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054579108', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 47650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18363, 'last_played': 1505588010}
review:
With almost 500 hours, I now feel I can give an honest review of this game. This IS my first review, hence why I see so much potential in this game because i normally don't do reviews. Also, 1/3 of these hours are from me being afk in game while working on additional content for the game and my server, so keep that in mind. (This will be updated in the future if nessecary)

Here are some of the conerns I've seen from potential players of this game:

1. It's expensive
    - Keep in mind, this is an early access game. To continue development on a game, you need funding, funding that will overall improve the quality of this game and allow the developers to potentially get better gear for developing the game, hiring more staff to work on it, and allow them to live off of funds so they can put more time on the game. 

2. Servers
    - Yes, there are issues with servers. You'll be playing on one that you've put 20 hours in, only to never see it again after it goes offline. Yes you can play in single player, but lets face it. Multiplay Is what keeps these kind of games alive, and some of us server owners know this. Currently there ARE several dedicated, 24/7 servers that are out right now that have wonderful communities and helpful staff, and server owners ARE communicating with each other so they can provide entertaining playing experience for everyone. This way, you won't have to play alone or just pray that the server your on goes down. So don't think every server is the same on this game as far as reliability. This game came out a few months ago, it's only now that you will start seeing more dedicated servers pop up. We hear your cries, and we are responding with answers.

Also, it's relatively EASY to set up a server for this game, so if you want to set up a dedicated server, you can easily, and if you'd like help, there are plenty of helpful people on the forums.

3. Content
    -Yes, there is a lack of content in this game. Right now all you can pretty much do (base game wise) is craft a few jobs, recruit some workers to farm food, craft nessecaries, and protect your NPCs. However, behind the scenes the developers have more in store as far as implementing content, and they are constantly working on the game based on how active they are on the forums and how much communication they do with players and mod developers. Also, thats another thing to mention: MODS!!! There are currently a few mods that bring a TON of stuff to the base game, including new blocks of differen't colors, shapes, and looks (iron bars, fences, etc), you can now trade and claim land as yours in game with mods (soon you can protect your land from greifers), you will soon be able to level up your NPCs to improve their job efficiency, there's now new server utility tools to improve servers, and so so SOOOOOO much more!! Don't believe me? go check out the mod showcase discussion boards. While there are only a few mods, more are produced every week, bringing more content to the game and improving the overall quality of servers, especially dedicated ones.

4: Greifers
   - Currently there's an issue on servers where people will destroy your stuff, there are those kind of people everywhere, and I can understand how that can frustrate players into not wanting to buy this game, or refunding it. However, be glad to know that with the next Colony survival update, that will no longer be an issue as you can protect your land (however you'll need the mods that offer this feature, which aren't hard to install at all)!! ^_^

I've played this game for quite a while hours wise, and I don't see myself getting bored of it anytime soon. I've even started a dedicated 24/7 server because I enjoy this game that much. Yes, there are the occasional bugs that can be a nusience, but what game doesn't have them? As long as you report them to the devs, they usually are able to fix them for the next update (they have thus far). So for those hesitent on buying this game because of:

- Lack of content
- Unreliable Servers
- Di**s destroying your stuff

Just know these are being addressed, whether its from the devs themselves, mod developers, or dedicated server owners. Do I recommend this game as of this moment? It's hard to say. I can't honestly tell you that you'll enjoy this game because that would just be a biased statement because I myself like it. However, what I CAN say for certain is if you enjoy these kind of games similar to minecraft, but are looking for more to do and are looking for more of a challenge similar to managing a kingdom successfully, Then this is your game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994610769', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 21794, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3136, 'last_played': 1709529834}
review:
- Original review, sometime about AUG 2017, 50ish hours played-
A game that I'd like to see evolve into something of it's own master piece. The mechanic of having workers assigned to do tasks needs to be implemented in more gmes.

- Revised review JAN 2021, approx 275 hours-
After putting quite a bit of time into this game I'd say that it has some very good potential still, and is capitalizing on it very well. The way the game runs has been improved, at least to me, the new addition of content is very nice. You can settle multiple villages in to my knowledge; 5 unique biomes each with their own exclusive resources and jobs. I'd love to see some kind of AI village system to compete with, the multiplayer is kinda meh as of right now.

A big issue this game solved in my eyes is I use to dread starting new, looking for a good place to start, but with the new builder workers you can make clearing a spot a breeze.

I'd give this game a 9/10, it's still being built upon which is amazing, you're not buying an incomplete game but a seemingly ever evolving one with a discord to help you put your ideas in for it too. LOVE IT

author: {'steamid': '76561198066140736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 995, 'last_played': 1704987036}
review:
Before I go in-depth let me first say that I absolutely love this game. It is original, creative and I could play it for hours. The reason why I do not recommend it is because of two things:
1) It's early access. There still are bugs and glitches. Some things do not work as well as they should, and there are things that could be added to improve the game.
2) It isn't for everyone. Although from a first glance it may look good, and it may lood like you wil enjoy it, you might not. It is a game about strategy, trial and error and repetition. You first must understand how to ration what jobs you assign, and you must stockpile. These things I didn't know on my first attempt. On my second I did much better, but in order to achieve the satisfaction of having created and managed a successful colony you must be like me. Have several hours on your schedule, and you must be ready to deal with stress. If you find these kinds of games interesting enough to keep you occupied day and night without getting bored, then please go ahead. But if you will find yourself bored within the first hour, then it is likely this game isnt for you. If you prefer a more exhilarating experience then a game such as Battlefield 1 or COD would be a better option. Ultimately, I recommend it but don't at the same time. The game does require a certain amount of thinking to keep your colony alive. And as I said, it is lacking in content. There is still a ton of things the developers could add to make the game more interesting and immersive. At the end of the day the developers of this game are onto something and I back them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060562716', 'num_games_owned': 254, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 8106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 905, 'last_played': 1604167810}
review:
I started my first game off well, a couple of berry farmers and a wheat farmer. To defend them I hired a guard, just the one guard. This was my first mistake. After hiring about a dozen more colonists over time, I was defending them myself aswell as my solo guard shooting the zombies down - they were safe. That was until I decided to go down to the mine and gather some extra stone. This decision proved fatal. Suddenly my ears were filled with the sounds of all of my colonists being slaughtered. I ran upstairs and found my singular guard slowly chipping away at the 20+ zombies who had infiltrated and murdered everyone in my colony - not just the men, but the women and children too. 

I had to restart, I had failed.

Lesson: BUY MORE F*CKING GUARDS

author: {'steamid': '76561198052193344', 'num_games_owned': 99, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 2265, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2126, 'last_played': 1502845792}
review:
EDIT: The dificulty of the game has been changed since this review, I have not gotten around to writing a new one.

The villager management of Stone Hearth, with the hands on ability of Minecraft. You can spend hours in this relatively simple game building up a nice, productive village for your settlers, and they in turn under your guidance will farm food, mine, smelt and craft up useful items to expand your village. 

Zombies come out at night, and there is an anti-cheese mechanic that punishes you if you're completely closed in. 

On the down side its pretty easy once you get going, more zombies spawn the more villagers you have but with any number of very simple defense setups, you can bottleneck  the zombies and have a relatively small number of guards mow them down.  In other words your village scales a LOT higher in power compared to the monsters which makes the game incredibly easy. 

I still very much recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198122702027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 683, 'last_played': 1612180887}
review: 이 게임 한지는 얼마 안됬지만 나름대로 재미있다. 우선 몬스터 들이 약하고 느려서 물량빨로 오긴하는데 그건 일꾼들의 수량만큼 오기 때문에 쉽게 막을수 있습니다. 무엇보다 블럭을 못 부순다는 점입니다. 물론 이렇게 되면 생존하기에는 별 지장이 없겠죠. 그래서 우린 식량을 주목표로 합니다. 식량확보를 하고 일꾼들을 늘리면서 궁수를 모집하여 방어합니다. 무엇보다 이렇게 몬스터가 약해서 재미가 없다 하시면 방 만들기 전에 몬스터 2배,낮에도 출현 등이 있는데 이걸 체크 해서 하면 말 그대로 몬스터가 그대로 출현된다. 그럼 디펜스 하기 바쁘고 빨리 궁수 모집을 해야할것이다. 그만큼 집 짓는것도 빨리 지어야한다.아직 얼리 엑세스라서 성공할 가능성이 높다. 좀 더 몬스터를 다양성있게 하고 일꾼들도 다양하게 덩치 큰 일꾼,재 빠른 일꾼 등으로 나눠서 하면 더 좋을거 같고 덩치 큰 일꾼들은 내가 지정한 곳 에 블럭을 쌓아서 성벽등을 수월하고 빠르게 만드는걸 도와주면 좋겠고, 재빠른 일꾼들은 자원채집,농사 등을 빠르게 할수 있으면 편하고 좀 더 시민 다운 중세시대 모습을 보일수 있겠다. 여기서 더 보태보자면 동물들도 출현하게 해서 일꾼들이 사냥꾼 역할도 만들어 사냥할수 있으면 좋겠다. 무엇보다 너무 몬스터한테만 죽으니 좀 식상하고 주의할게 그거밖에 없는거같아서 사냥 도중에 죽거나 할수 있으면 좋겠다. 사슴,늑대,곰,멧돼지 등을 추가 해서 늑대,곰,멧돼지는 공격할수  있어서  농사할때도 좀 방해할수 있고 일꾼도 죽일수 있도록 설정해놓으면  우리가 신경써야할게 더 늘어서 좋을거같다. 무엇보다 사육을 할수 있으면 개를 키워서 사냥 개를 만든다던지 돼지를 키워서 도축을 해서 식량 확보를 좀 더 수월하게 하던지 할수 있겠다. 사육할 장소는 울타리를 추가 해서 하면 좋을거같다. 그 울타리를 부스고 노리는 야생 동물이나,몬스터들도 있으면 좋겠다. 이 것은 몬스터 낮에도 출현,2배 출현과 똑같이 서버를 만들때 체크 해서 하는것도 좋을거 같은 방법이다. 블럭은 몬스터가 파괴할수 없게 할거면 자연 재해 등으로 파괴 될수 있게 하면 좋을거같다.  무엇보다 날씨도 추가 했으면 좋을거같다.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971043302', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 419, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1561171773}
review:
As one of the other reviews mentioned, this is a Minecraft clone with a different focus.

Rather than exploring and crafting things, you'll spend most of your time managing your resources(food, arrows, wood, iron, etc) and recruiting colonists. You'll give them jobs and grow your city.

For each colonist you recruit, the zombies attack in greater numbers, so you'll need to hire more guards. But your guards need arrows, so you'll need to recruit crafters. But crafters need supplies, so you'll need to hire miners and foresters. Everyone needs food, so you'll need to hire farmers. And food needs to be cooked, so you'll need bakers.

It truly is a great concept and a very fun game. But let's not get ahead of ourselves--it IS early access, which means there's currently only one type of monster (zombie), one type of guard (archer), and certain functionality isn't present at the moment (why can't I smelt my own ore?!? Why can't I assign and reassign colonist jobs?!!) , so the game does get a bit repetative faster than it really should.

But assuming that the developers continue to add variety and functionality to the base of their game, this will definitely be a must-have for any fan of the Minecraft genre (not sure what else to call it).

My only issue with the game is that once I have enough workers to make my colony self sufficient(took about 2-3 hours), there's very little incentive to keep building.

Still, I'm happy so far with the $20 I spent, and I'm anxious to see what the final product looks like.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070058340', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 505, 'last_played': 1595172096}
review:
Colony Survival is an interesting RTS game in where you have to build a colony and have it survive. Every night a horde of zombies come, and the more people you get, the more zombies show up. You must also manage the food of  your colony. But the challenges seem to end right about there. After that, this game has very little to offer. 

Pros
 - Interesting art style.
 - Fun early game.
 - Building is pretty fun. 
 - Pretty satisfying to see your workers go to work every morning. 
 
Cons
 - Very little content.
 - Very few animations.
 - Almost no danger.
 - 20 dollars is super expensive for this little content.
 
I just find this game generally boring after you get a sustainable food source. You can recruit as many archers as you want and have no reprocussion. But I've never actually had zombies break into my encampment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072344618', 'num_games_owned': 113, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 15548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5194, 'last_played': 1632516474}
review:
This game is pretty good being in early access, i got dragged into this game from a youtuber playing it and i thought it was really cool concept, i eventually got it and it lived up to what i thought it would be like.

Note: you will get into this game thinking "Oh, its just another minecraft clone you mine, craft, build, whatever" but those are just about all the similarities that minecraft and colony survival have together, and what is so cool about this game is that you have to use all the features or it gets boring really quick.

You have to hire colonist with your starting 300 food and beds maybe a bowman and 2 berry farmers then you can do whatever you want next, build a mineshaft, hire a crafter, get to work on wheat farms, and more. the bowman protects you and your colonists from the angry monsters that look like miners. however they only spawn when you get some colonists so your not being rushed in time. after a few nights you can hire more and more colonists till you get a village/kingdom and with the limited number of blocks you have, you can actually do a lot in terms of houses and structures, not much with other things but you still can do stuff.

Now to the pros and cons

PROS:
~Biomes (I have only seen about 5, Forest, Plains, Taiga, Mountain, and Snow, but there is probably more)
~Colonists (You finally don't have to do everything yourself!)
~Graphics (Gets a bit repetitive and a bit grid like if you pay attention to certain blocks but amazing eitherway)
~Ambiance (Its really descriptive on when its night or day)
~Detail (Looking at a block from the side actually shows some 3D look to blocks. Thats cool)

Cons:
~Not enough gameplay unless you restart multiple times (Seeing some sort of conflict that only happens on certain days would be pretty cool)
~No Weather (No Rain, Snow, Storms, etc.)
~Not enough blocks (Seeing some different blocks/items would be cool to work with)
~Not enough variety (Seeing some different variety in blocks in how you place them would make the game more realistic)
~Sounds (Some sounds were a bit too loud, like when jumping into water, it sounds like a cannon ball and it freaked me out when i first heard it)

I think some things should be added aswell things like:

~Creative Mode: Being a minecraft fan (Oh no, here come the haters) I really enjoy building on Creative Mode, having some sort of mode where flying is instantly enabled, you have all the blocks & items, and being able to break blocks instantly would make building much better, and easier
~Weather: I think it would be better if you could get rain and lightning storms, just immersion into the world not really needed
~Animals: Wheat is a pretty good source of food but what about animals? Animals could be in farms and stuff and you could get meat, milk, wool, and more from these animals
~Disasters: Floods, Storms, other disasters that would happen naturally,
~Stronger Monsters: Some Monsters are bigger, take more arrows. (I think I'm trying to add more ways to fail...)
~Biomes: maybe something like a desert surrounded by mountains
~More Blocks: Things like Wool, Carpet, more Flowers, Plants, etc.

the devs don't need to add any of these, they were just suggestions to what they could add

But i totally recommend the game, it has promise and i can't wait to see how it goes! :D

This game keeps getting better and better. A few ease-of-play quirks here and there, but as I can see the devs are hardworking and take advice and tips into consideration and some of them have been implemented in the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198173218153', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2918, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1388, 'last_played': 1677946606}
review:
Ein Tolles Spiel!
Das Spiel errinert Positiv an die guten alten anfangszeiten von Minecraft, wobei Colonie Survival doch einen ganz anderen Schwerpunkt hatt.
In Minecraft geht es ums eigene Überleben, was leicht fält, wenn man sich einfach einbudelt.
In Colonie Survival geht das nicht und man ist auch nicht allein! 
Mann ist Herrscher über seine Kolonisten und muss sie Verteidigen und Ernähren, was anfangs durchaus Schwer fält.
Leider verliert das Spiel ein wenig den Reits, sobalt man sich des Tricks bewust ist, wie man sich die Zombies auch ohne Guards leicht vom leibe halten kann (der Trick ist nicht die Mauer Torlos zu lassen, da sich die Genialen Entwickler für diese Idee bereits eine Lösung haben einfallen lassen!).

Das Spiel ist durchaus Lohnenswert und bitet viele viele Stunden Spielspaß (auch Multiplayer), wobei der Preis sich dem Preis Minecrafts durchaus nären dürft.

Ein Dicks Lob an die Entwickler !

review:
Got this game from a friend after watching some gameplay of it on youtube. Made a world together and within hours found a way to hillariously mess with the zombie AI and made a massive tower with enough beds and farms to keep 200+ colonists inside at all times and all the zombies out. So much variablity and creativity in not only the way you build but also the way you eliminate the zombie threat makes for amazing fun and with mod support being added recently the game can only get better from here.

10/10 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q9joOlIkf6s

author: {'steamid': '76561198169299825', 'num_games_owned': 10769, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1501218039}
review:
未开拓的殖民地

——简评《Colony Survival》

图文版地址：https://cowlevel.net/game/Colony_Survival/review/2590587
此游戏的key自奶牛关社区的野蔷薇计划获得，感谢开发者与相关社区工作人员的努力。

+ 创新性的殖民系统

+ 较完善的游戏玩法

+ 稳定的联机机制

- 粗糙的贴图与动作

- 游戏内容偏少

总评：5.9/10，有潜力的微创新3D沙盒类游戏，内容偏少，尚待完善。

在奶牛关这边获得这游戏的key时，刚好碰到网易搞的Minecraft国际服回归活动，两边对比着玩，Mod不要命地加，成功地把显卡搞炸了...

言归正传，MC在商业上获得的巨大成功，带动了沙盒这一游戏元素的发展，时至今日，3A游戏不带沙盒元素，都不好意思说自己是大作。在这股风潮中，方块沙盒这一游戏类型也渐渐成长起来——也许我们可以称之为MC-like game？

《Colony Survival》就是这么一个MC-like game： 玩家们要在方块构成的世界里收集资源、制作道具、击退怪物、堆砌建筑，并可以立Flag招募殖民者，给他们指派任务，让他们完成那些需要重复劳动的工作，慢慢建设起一个自给自足、抵抗夜游尸的殖民地。

说实话，《Colony Survival》的精致程度远不如MC的早期版本，游戏中存在不少简化的贴图与动作，看起来像是偷工减料的快建房，粗糙无比，让住客怀疑是不是下一秒这房子就要塌了。但这种简化给游戏带来了相当不错的画面与联机流畅度，比MC早起那种联机掉线如喝水、炸了地底就死机的游戏体验好很多，可以说是有得有失吧。

目前，《Colony Survival》的玩法相对单一，没有MC红石系统那种能升华游戏玩法的创新点，同时，开发者迟迟未开放创意工坊及相关的Mod工具，提升了玩家自主发掘游戏多样性的难度 ，希望开发者能尽快认识到这点并加以改善。


整体而言，《Colony Survival》是个有潜力的类MC沙盒游戏，但这潜力能否转化成玩家所需要的游戏乐趣，还需要开发者不断努力。希望他们能像游戏中玩家开拓殖民地那样，开拓出一片属于《Colony Survival》的领地。

author: {'steamid': '76561198077996611', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 498, 'last_played': 1589599881}
review:
I'll be honest. When I first heard of this game, I was interested but I didn't think it was worth the $20. I'd still say in it's current state it's worth much less however it is a very promising design. I pirated the game at first (not saying where or how so I'm not breaking any conduct rules pls don't ban me), but seeing how entertaining it was and doing research on the future plans of the developers I just had to support them. It's worth a couple hours of gameplay right now but I'm excited to see what the future holds. 

Rant: The AI is disappointing right now. From what it looks like, colonists just go to the left around obstacles until they reach their destination. I had a wall with one enterance and all my farms were on the outside. When night struck, colonists just to the left of the entrance walked all the way around the perimeter until they reached the entrance rather than just taking a few steps to the right. This led to several deaths before I realized what was going on and I had to build a secondary moat to protect my mentally challenged wheat farmers. The same goes for zombies except they seem to circle to the right.

review: Hi, i've been playing this game for a while now and i've got to say that im totally hooked. Devs please continue on from this brilliant idea and i hope you found this commant supportive. however i'd like to see a few things added: maybe add a new type of zombie, add an enemy colony somewhere in the world maybe more than one, let the enemy colony raid you, you can raid enemy colonys, a new colonist called an explorer, explorers can find enemy colonies and can fight zombies, explorers walk around the colony until assigned to do something, explorers will keep their distance from colonies and instead spy on them until they come back, new colonist called a knight, knights can be assigned to stay out of the city walls during night time to walk around and fight zombies but will always stay near the colony, maybe add a machine which you can craft which sets off a siren telling knights to come back in, a new zombie called muncher (change the name if you want), munchers can slowly eat through walls, once a muncher has eaten through your walls you will be alerted, in the event of a breach by the muncher nearby guards and knights will attempt to block up the hole,you can assign a group of guards and knights to attempt to secure the hole instead of nearby troops, this group will be called security. and there you have it, my feedback. i hope you took some of my requests into consideration, best of luck - Roach_j1

review:
You'll hear the comparison to Minecraft with this game of course, but that is nothing new. However where Minecraft felt like you being the ruler of a lonely little kingdom, Colony Survival feels more like being a king/queen with some actual subjects. Granted they don't have much personality. but they do make things run more on their own when it comes to things like resource gathering and crafting. That in itself can be a bit of an issue simply because removing the need for you to gather resources can make it less challenging. Of course you have to balance that with protecting your colonists from the undead hordes, so that is somewhat offset.

The big downside with this game that you hear from people is that it reaches the "endgame" period pretty quickly. It can be pretty tense in the beginning when you are stretched for resources and your colonists keep dying, but it doesn't take long before you can start to reach the point that you can leave things to run by themselves. Which is great, but it leaves you with not much to do once you've crafted everything. This is something that I encountered in Minecraft as well, and the solution is the same here. Find yourself a project. That's it. For me I decided that the modest villa that I was using as my main base would make a great town hall and set about making a city wall and filling it in with actual houses for my colonists to live in. I do hope that more gets added before too long, but as long as you have a good imagination this is a great game to play.

For my closing words I would just recommend two things:
1.) Go into this game with a plan/endgame strategy in mind. If you know what your long term plans are it makes it much more fun.
2.) Do yourself a favor and play with "double monster numbers" on. You could put the option that makes zombies spawn during the day as well, but you will draw out the tension much longer with the greater monster spawns.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057436025', 'num_games_owned': 3761, 'num_reviews': 197, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 354, 'last_played': 1500880794}
review:
首先感谢野蔷薇计划提供的Key能让我在开发早期体验到这款游戏。

[h1]潜能，潜能，还是潜能——简评早期版Colony Survival[/h1]

如果让我介绍这款游戏，我挺想发两张对比图给诸位看看。
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1088246403

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1088263692


上面那张是我自己尝试圈的一小块地儿，下面则是玩多人模式误入大佬房间看到的盛景。

这款游戏现在的情况有点类似当年Minecraft Beta1.2_02左右的状态，但是自带了一个简陋的有点类似村庄mod的游戏系统，赋予了玩家插上一只旗子，征召村民，建设家园的权利。

玩家要用一开始系统赋予的有限资源生活足够的天数，建立起足以支撑自己循环的殖民地系统（圈一块地，指定做XX事，新招募的殖民地居住者就会自动来干活），种地挖矿自动合成一个也不能少。在完成目前游戏内设计的所有内容（并不多）之后，游戏就变成了纯粹的建筑游戏。

因为游戏还处于开发初期，先讲缺点再讲优点，问题并不少，这里一并列出来。

1：画面层面上虽然有光影，但是没有任何刨东西的反馈，弓箭手没有动作，撸方块目前还只有进度条，贴图虽然相当“高清”但图案也实在太规律了吧。。。

2：挖矿系统被大幅精简。为了省掉做一个自动挖方块的工作量，作者选择曲线救国，改为底层自动刷出无限矿源，只要指定特定方块赋予工人挖矿任务就会无限出矿。

3：内容实在是少到可怜。2h足够你把整个游戏目前所有的内容探测完（不包括成就），可能你都可以玩完之后退款。

但是，如果你有先看过Colony Survival的商店评测页之后再过来的话，你可能会发现那边的大部分好评都会认为这款游戏很promising，很有potential。

老实说一开始我也没看出到底哪儿有潜力，更何况EA游戏的潜力一般都是很难兑现的。但玩了玩就发现几个在现在的Early Access游戏当中很难看见的优点：游戏目前确实几乎没有BUG。载入时间也特别快。多人模式还相当不错（250+ping目前不算太卡）。而且开发团队已经准备进一步的拓展游戏对mod的支持。

作为一款两人开发的游戏，作者团队通过在内容量上暂时进行妥协换来了游戏基础的扎实。游戏基础扎实带来的好名声会让游戏的社区环境加速成长（现在就已经是了），想必能让游戏的内容量得到Mod社区的足够支持。

既然把自己定位为一款殖民地管理游戏，Colony Survival如果想要成长为一个对的上自己名号的游戏，需要干的事还有很多，但好在steam仍然有这样一个early access的环境，路还很长，畅想一下未来也不太坏。

author: {'steamid': '76561198097372462', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 5731, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2544, 'last_played': 1529021922}
review:
Bloody ripper game!
These guys are going down a really strong track, I will put some pros and cons but overall 8.8/10!!!
Now the game is fun as hell especially with a couple committed mates! But being so new it's not without it's issues. 

PROS:
- Unique concept of an over flooded crafting market. 
- Simple and fun
- Easy community building
- Great visuals 
- No learning curve, soooo easy to play
- Next to no loading time/ render
- Overwhelming sense of achievement when your community is kicking ass. 

CONS:
- Servers are complete shit, always disappearing losing hours of work.
(This is the only real reason the game doesn't get a 10 from me)
- Lack of building depth, stairs etc (I'm sure more will come)
- Cheats ruin some servers and NON cheat servers need to be implemented. 

OPPORTUNITIES:
- Need faster mining options, eg player can equip a pick or axes and mine quicker. Will just help clear big areas when building. 
- Smarter AI, because you build a tunnel, put archers on the side and bang you have won. Maybe had some other enemies that can climb or can jump, I dunno, more of a challenge I guess. 
- EQUIP MORE THAN 50 STONE.

Great game, will keep playing and keeping an eye on updates!

author: {'steamid': '76561198061643796', 'num_games_owned': 472, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1500766763}
review:
Die Idee des Spiels: Eigentlich ganz okay 
Das Spiel selbst:  schlecht

Was kann man in dem Spiel machen?

In einer langweiligen Welt, die aus Bäumen und Gras besteht, kann man Getreide anbauen und seinen Kolonisten als Bauern oder Holzfäller oder sowas 5 verschiedene Berufe zuordnen. Und dann muss man noch Zombies töten die einen Nachts angreifen. Das wars.
Und das macht man immer so weiter, bis man keine Ahnung wie viele Kolonisten hat, die alle das selbe machen und immer das selbe passiert. Spannung pur.

Die Anzahl an Blöcken und Objekten die man bauen kann ist ebenfalls SEHR überschaubar.
Habe mich von Anfang an gefühlt wie damals in der Minecraft Alpha. 

Das Spiel hat einfach nichts zu bieten, ist schlecht umgesetzt, es gibt nichts zu erreichen, kein wirkliches Tutorial( wenn man mehr erfahren will als die sehr geringen Grundinformationen muss man, im Spiel, eine Internetseite besuchen und eine PDF runterladen. Ernsthaft? eine PDF?), die Charaktermodelle sind minimalistisch und alle sehen gleich aus( bis auf das Oberteil vlt), die Ki ist langsam und eigentlich komplett dumm, Animationen sind NULL vorhanden, Sound ist eintönig und langweilig ( Wenn man die Soundregler nicht zwischen 80 und 100 % hat, hat das Spiel null Ton).

Jetzt werden viele wahrscheinlich sagen " ist doch noch EA" und ja das stimmt theoretisch. Aber dieses Spiel ist selbst für EA zu schlecht, ganz ehrlich. Es ist eine sehr sehr sehr sehr sehr sehr frühe Alpha vielleicht.

Alles in allem, so wie es jetzt ist, ein sehr schlechtes und langweiliges Spiel. Auf keinen Fall die 20 Euro wert.
Für 2,3 euro könnte man sich das kaufen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067016966', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 8701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1365, 'last_played': 1634148106}
review:
It has somewhat the basics of Minecraft (mining, farming, ores, etc), but what makes this game stand out is the difficulty of this game and the smoothness (it runs like butter). Each night zombies attack your colony and you have to fight them of by placing archers. You yourself can't fight. This makes it that this game is a bit of a challenge. Not only do you need to protect your colonists, you also have to feed them. 

I highly recommend this game to people who like survival type games as well as building.

Quick note: The trailer for this game looks amazing. The game itself is just as the trailer suggests BUT the amount of time and effort you have to put in to build cities like you see in the trailer is just astronomicle... I have "only" 12 hours on record, of which 7 in 1 world save and the only thing I have are 4 buildings, around 8 wheat farms and a wall surounding my "city" which is 1 layer thick. This shows that it's a prety slow paced game. Just to clarify this is NOT a bad thing! It keeps the game interesting and makes you think before placing stuff (not easy to delete an entire base once it has been build).

review: I have a had a lot of fun with this game so far, even though it is early access. It's really fun watching your colony boom and surviving night after night. The developers are still working hard, are all ears to the community and are mod friendly. The only problem I have with this game at the moment is that you eventually get to a point where your colony is just too proficent and too well defended that there is no challenge...once they make stronger monsters I will be playing this game much more. Definatley worth the buy, and when more content is added it will be like an amazing first person game of Banished.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000259978', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 612, 'last_played': 1500426576}
review:
[h1]  Think Minecraft, but it's not about mining or exploring... It is about creating towns for you and your people! [/h1]

Anytime recently when I felt like playing Minecraft I've felt like building cities, castles, and towns. You can use creative mode for that but without anyone to inhabit your houses and buildings, it feels... Pointless. You can play survival to extend the amount of time to build your cities and towns, but the same result occurs over-time and you don't feel any reason to keep building and creating. You find that you want to explore, loot, spelunk in Minecraft more than build. And that is where this game is different.

Colony Survival is focused on building a town or city for colonists that can then inhabit and serve under you. They might farm, mine, guard, own shops, etc.  Your growth is limited by the amount of food you are able to produce which therefore requires a great deal of time and energy to achieve. You are also limited during the night as zombie like creatures invade and try and kill your colonists, while they sleep. Very simple dynamics that becomes fairly challenging pretty quickly. 

Currently I would not say the price is worth it to everyone. There are no animals, the colonists can be buggy, there is no weather system, and few blocks and materials to build with. It feels a bit vacant, but the devs have appeared to be pretty invested in this game so far. If they keep up the pace they have been at, this game could become great.

I would recommend this game to anyone with an edge to create and manage cities from the first person perspective. If you prefer running around and fighting zombies, exploring the Nether, or Mining then just check out Terraria and Minecraft. 

Recommendations...

I am sure the devs are perfectly aware of where they want to take this game but I would still like to offer suggestions on what, I think, would make this game fantastic.

- Weather based farming
  ~ This to me is a must. Currently a farm produces food at a constant rate and therefor present little challenge to the player. The colonists do not need to aquire water or depend on rain to grow crop. This would naturally present a reason to create animals that can also be used as a food source like Harvest Moon and Stardew Valley uses. Especially if winter becomes factored into the game, it would really add a sense of immersion and fun to it.

- More crops
  ~No doubt this is on their list of things to make

- More defence systems, stronger zombies and creatures, pets, etc...

review: While still in its early days I have been playing this game with a couple of friends and having a great time doing so.  Despite a currently somewhat limited selection of blocks to build from (though it isn't all that bad) we have loved creating all sorts of medieval style bases and playing around with different defense systems.  While a basic create a colony and keep it safe from the threats concept it leaves lots of space for creativity.  If you enjoy base building, strategizing, or management style games I would certainly advise this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198062259956', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 355, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 355, 'last_played': 1500138602}
review:
Very solid concept and fundamentals, but it is (July 2017) EARLY Early Access in terms of content. I think the devs are on the right track but I will add suggestions/limitations anyway:

- The number of blocks/jobs is very limited. Jobs/management are the fun part of this game, so there definitely needs to be more.

- Colonists have no personality and there is no way to manage them efficiently. For example, you can't assign people to jobs, they assign themselves. There should be a UI for this. It would be a nice touch if colonists had variable looks and names, maybe even skills or preferences that would make them better at some jobs rather than others and level up over time.

- I would like to see in the future more high-tier "culture" type jobs; musician, artist, priest, etc. Maybe that sort of thing could affect colonist "happiness" and therefore productivity.

- There should be clothing/armor.

- More types of food, perhaps variety of food available could affect colonist happiness. Drinks (alcohol)? I would really like to build a tavern but it would be kind of pointless currently.

- Farm and war animals? It would be cool to ride around horses. Also, guards should be able to be given patrol routes.

Overall, I'd give it about 3-6 more months of development before buying. It is not worth the price with the current content, but by all indications, it is getting there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117644110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1500102115}
review:
I like the game in its current state, I think it is well worth your money in its current state. However, to the Devs Im gunna list some suggestions down below that I feel would improve the game and add to the longevity of playtime. Apologies if something I list is already in the game, I only have about 3 hours as of writing this review so I may have missed it.

+Melee fighter units would be awesome to see that use weapons like swords,clubs,etc.

+Some home decorations i.e chairs, tables, stands, etc.

+Different zombie type variants

+A type of castle seiging PVP thing would be SO COOL against players in a multiplayer game, it would be so awesome to just be able to declare war on your friend and besiege their castle with your soliders and archers going up against theirs. This could also open the doors to a whole new array of options such as catapults.

+More interactions between players in multiplayer sessions such as trading, war, etc.

+Animals roaming around (could open up 2 new villager classes as well that could be hunters that roam around and collect the animals leather with the second class being tailors that could make clothes and different apparel for yourself and the villagers.

+Armors would be awesome to see.

+Horses which could be tamed to have cavalry type villagers that ride on horseback.

+Castle Gates, Doors, etc.

+Windows.

+More block types.

These are just a few suggestions, the possibilities with this game are virtually endless and could permit this game to be one of the best if the devs play their cards right!

author: {'steamid': '76561198036853555', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1048, 'last_played': 1699977496}
review:
Not bad for what i thought it was going to be (Minecraft rip-off) it is a fairly well planned out and brilliant building game, i know this is an alpha/beta so it still has things to add to it. This is my opinion, so my opinion may be right or wrong depending if you liked the game or not.

The only problem i have seen is the siege part, i know why it is there at the minute and hope the zombies can start breaking things because securing a postition and boxing yourself in is how siege mode is activated and the food you had becomes a meal deal for your inhabitants, and its gone by the morning. which is how they start dying because they have no food because they ate it all... explain that?

But again this is in alpha/beta and so the full game isn't finished, so really i made a point that will most likely change...
Well the games amazing and i hope the that the creators keep up the good work!

author: {'steamid': '76561198265701382', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 843, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1582794552}
review: 对于一个还处于测试版本的游戏我觉得这个价格还有些小贵，游戏的题材不算新颖但是是结合了以往游戏题材的一款新游戏。就现在来说，这个游戏的可玩性还是一般，游戏中包含的元素较少。对于我来说这游戏从早上玩到晚上就没有什么意思了。这款游戏我玩了十多个小时，其中有三到四个小时都是挂机挖金矿状态。但尽管如此，我还是给了这游戏推荐。第一点是因为这款游戏题材虽然算不上新颖，但是也是我从未见过的游戏方式；第二点是因为它的潜力，我认为这款游戏的潜力是非常大的，其包含了沙盒·第一人称视角·创造·多人等游戏元素，它的后续可开发空间是巨大的，我也希望这款游戏能够担当得起它本身的价格。总而言之，这款游戏现在还不成熟，很期待制作方后续的开发。

author: {'steamid': '76561198383787246', 'num_games_owned': 309, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 4078, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1608217673}
review:
简单评述一下这款游戏吧。

毕竟是在开发阶段，所以内容可能不是很多，但是确实很有意思。
和MC那边的方块世界不一样，这边的世界你不会再是孤单一个人。(仅限单人模式）你能有自己的……子民（？），他们能帮你做很多事情。
前期寻找定居点，构建城市会很有意思，不过的话，这个游戏可能就不是那么鼓励玩家去探索了。

方块很少，希望以后能多加一点吧。
城市发展到后期，就会有一种在玩挂机游戏的错觉。坐等收获东西。
没有中文，难受qwq
希望有创意工坊吧，能爽到啊！！！
希望加入更多的怪物种类，不然很好守城。
想去探险！为什么我不能组建自己的探险小分队呢（要求别太过分了）

就目前版本来看，我可以给：7.5分吧

现在还是很单调的（到后期的话），希望以后能多加一些内容 2333

review: 마인크래프트와는 전혀다른 게임이고 운영하는 게임이여서 좋네여 좀 더 업데이트되서 이것저것 추가되었으면 좋겠어요.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030961669', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1603461171}
review:
In short Huge potential , lots of fun , good devs.

The game is very fun. I picked it up for a mincraft clone with some other elements but got somthing alot better. 
Although in early access the core concept of the game to build a little home and get the supplies and resources nessacary with the help of your villagers/serfs is very rewarding. At first you build a mudhut with a moat and laughing thinking you have won the game. 5 hours later you have a tripled walled castle with ditch moats and other defenses with a huge community. I look forward to the updates to this game and watching it develop.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972479222', 'num_games_owned': 243, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1499825960}
review:
Ok, so I had to write a review of this game. In summary, its awful. 

1. The user interface is not intuitive enough for me.
2. You have to hire people to do things, which is not bad until the point where they just stand there with a red line above their head not doing anything when there are jobs to be getting on with.
3. There is currently very few actions and activities to do right now.

Its not overly bad for a game that would cost a few quid, but £15 currently is madness.
