review:
Jogo muito bom, idéia muito boa, mas falta ainda muita coisa.
Joguei multiplayer com um amigo, em 3 dias já não tinhamos mais o que fazer, resolvemos aumentar a quantidade de zumbis que aparecem para dar uma dificuldade maior no jogo... o server crash com a quantidade.
Enfim, pouca coisa para ser feita; dificuldade baixa; sem configurações reais multiplayer como: Grupos ou Factions ou simplesmente compartilhamento de baús e etc.
Esperaria um pouco mais para comprar, mas tem um potencial muito bom.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120348104', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 961, 'last_played': 1605129790}
review:
[h1]Overview[/h1]
I highly recommend getting this game some time in the future. Even now, in Early Access, there is a surprising amount of content and the concept has a lot of potential. Two things that really caught my attention were the graphics and controls. It looks and plays better than a lot of "finished" games.

I've seen a lot of people compare it to Minecraft, but really the similarities are only skin deep. They both have cube-based worlds and some focus on surviving. Aside from that, the gameplay and pacing are radically different. Colony Survival is about managing your units (colonists, who can have various jobs) and building a practical and efficient base (that can still look very nice). Your character is not an invincible warrior, he is a fragile king, and the danger of falling or getting attacked by monsters is very real and frightening.

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
The creators have done an excellent job of making shaders appropriate for a cube-based world. All the little details are there: your "eyes" adjusting to different light levels, the blinding effect of looking at something light from a dark area, the rays of sun coming in through gaps, the focusing of your "eyes" on the surface in front of you (blurring things at different distances). It looks better than any other cube-based game I have seen.
The blocks are proper 3D models. They're not just 6 flat planes--they have bumpmaps that work very well to create a feeling of texture through lighting. It's clear that the creators have put genuine effort into making this a quality game.

However, there are some minor issues that still need to be worked out. Blocks diagonally adjacent to one another have ugly edges when viewed up close due to the way the edges of the blocks are defined, among other small problems.
It is sometimes hard to tell what item you have selected because the outline around the currently selected slot is faint. This might be fixed by adding tooltips or making the outline easier to see.

The water needs a lot of work. The opaque, bumpmapped water blocks just don't look good from up close.

[h1]Controls[/h1]
The movement is acceleration-based and feels very nice right away. It doesn't take any getting used to and it's fairly easy to get close to a ledge without falling off, as the game does not have Minecraft-style crouching.

The inventory can be finnicky. It sometimes takes a few tries to get something or put it down in another slot. I'm not sure if this is due to the hitboxes on the slots being off or if it's failing to register clicks somehow.

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
The best single-phrase description I can give is "First Person Real Time Strategy." There is very little emphasis on your own character. You do not need to make tools for yourself--those are for colonists. Inventory space is not an issue. Your main responsibility in terms of manual labor is building the colony (this might change once colonists can build from blueprints). You need to design an effective defense. Right now it is easy to "cheese" the system by making a maze, but this may be fixed in the future. Most of your responbility lies in managing your colonists. You need to have enough food coming in to sustain them all, and you need to position your archers correctly. 

The pacing of the game in the early stages is very nice. The amount of monsters spawned is based on the number of colonists, so you are safe to build your base and get it ready before recruiting any colonists (and thus letting monsters spawn). However, unless you go out of your way to make something that looks nice, it's easy to have the game "done" and your colony defended very quickly. Just build a 2 high wall and put a bunch of archers around a single entrace with a maze in front. There needs to be some reason to expand the colony and have high, strong walls around it. Perhaps new monsters that can climb walls or jump. Perhaps more complex processes for grinding wheat and baking bread that require more space. As it stands, a single, small building will work forever, and that leaves you with little desire to continue into the late game.

[h1]Multiplayer[/h1]
As a lot of other people have pointed out, multiplayer is very much unfinished. There is no way to share resources, have colonists work together, or prevent griefing. However, the creators have said that they will actively work on this. I see huge potential for multiplayer in this game. I would like to see more resources, some of them rare, to give incentives to trade with other players (perhaps automatically with "trader" colonsists?). 

[h1]Other[/h1]
Going on with the idea of trade, I think having more biomes with biome-exclusive resources would be a huge step forward. It would give players a reason to explore in singleplayer and trade in multiplayer. There should also be resources that take a lot of effort and time to process, allowing specialization and, again, giving a reason to expand the colony and give the process its own building or other area.

The AI needs a lot of work. The pathing seems wonky and rudimentary right now, but it does work. I can't say what sort of algorithm would work best, but I'm sure the developers are planning to take another look at it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967093566', 'num_games_owned': 634, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1622244209}
review:
I bought the game, my mate bought the game, we played it for about 7hrs multiplayer.

I gave up on mincraft a long time ago, so my expectations of this game was no more than a minecraft game.
When I sunk my teeth into Colony Survival I was quite amused by its villager/food management system.
It had me hooked instantly. I Started building massive farms to have a huge population, then quickly realised I didnt have the seeds to make these farms. So then I had to mine gold, to then mint the gold and buy seeds from the shop.

Brilliant Idea, game could be a bit harder though.

I think this game could go a long way with some extra evil creatures and more blocks/features.

I cant wait to see where this goes!

author: {'steamid': '76561198035513912', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2128, 'last_played': 1676094177}
review:
CAUTION: The 'delete' button will delete your game instantly when you press it, it will not ask if you are sure, your game is terminated forever.


Now the review.

PROS
 - Great AI with NPC's, it's straight forward but I have not had any bugs
 - All except one feature has worked for me
 - Large amount of potential
 - Gameplay is balanced
 - Options to play on a harder difficulty
 - Multiplayer 

CONS
 - Lag on multiplayer servers after a large amount of people and colonies
 - No extra check when you click the delete button
 - Limited options for materials while building
 - Limited combat options


Bias points:

- In my opinion this game is unique and hasnt really been done in this way yet, at least nothing ive seen.
- Going back to point 2 under "PROS" above. Considering what is out there this is a major bonus because these developers take the time to make sure every single feature works and test it properly, they care about making a quality game this actually causes them to remind me of Bethesda, and the way they have always made quality games, no matter how long it takes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198395123467', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 11113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2611, 'last_played': 1626540449}
review: Since I have, as of writing this review, 41.4 hrs on record in this game, I think I can write a review. [Notice: the current version of the game, as of this review, is 0.2.5] Colony Survival is a very good game for an alpha; it has nice visuals, a wonderful shader, and decent A.I., but it's not without its quirks; if you build a wall around your base there's a chance the zombies are likely to glitch through said wall and find their way to your colonists (Hopefully if that happens, you have enough food to rerecruit your colonists.), if you have get a water block by using the "loot" command and place it on top of a mountain without it being contained, then the entirerty of the world will be submerged. (Improving the gravity physics of water would be greatly appreciated.) In the future, it would be wonderful to, at least, see those bugs fixed and more content added as the game continues development.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018595337', 'num_games_owned': 739, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 12322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1392, 'last_played': 1684296042}
review:
~~ This review is for v0.2.3 in July 2017 ~~

After playing a while of this, I can only describe it as a Minecraft mod idea that was too hard to implement into Minecraft itself, so they made their own game for it. And that's perfectly fine. I like Minecraft and this is a unique twist on the concept. I dunno if that's actually what happened, but I wouldn't be surprised.
I don't normally review games until I've completed them, nor do I like to review early access games as they're an incomplete experience. This one, however, makes me want to review it to support it and encourage others to try it too. At time of writing I have all but one achievement, but that just requires me to stockpile some more food.

Let's get the first big hurdle out of the way. This looks like Minecraft. A lot like Minecraft. It uses metre-cubed blocks for everything and features a procedurally-generated world with grass, dirt, stone, woods and lakes. It also has biomes like snow and rainforest, but I've yet to find them. Every night zombies attack and try to kill your colonists and destroy your banner. And that's where this game deviates from Minecraft.
While you're all alone in the former aside from a few brain-dead animals and some big-nosed villagers, Colony Survival is all about the collective. The main drive is ensuring food and safety for your burgeoning colony comprised of...admittedly brain-dead workers. If you play right, you'll never need to collect a single grain of wheat or fire a single arrow in defence.

To keep everything running smoothly, you hire colonists to perform these jobs and others for you...or for the colony, I guess. You place a quiver and an archer will stand at that post forevermore, firing on any zombies that come within range. You allocate a field and a farmer will plant and harvest wheat. Millers turn the wheat into flour, bakers make bread from that and so on. This is a bit like Minecraft meets Factorio, which is weird as Factorio is always described as Minecraft Tekkit but bigger... This game is massively more simplistic than Factorio, however.
I said that I'd completed almost all the achievements, and that's in about 8 hours of playtime. At the moment, there is not a lot here. But again, that's perfectly fine; what is here is fun, addictive and has a lot of room to expand and improve. I couldn't stop playing this last night and now I have a beautiful little colony with golden fields, cherry trees and 67 eager young idiots who take very circuitous paths to stuff.

As this game is very early in development (v0.2.3 at time of writing), I don't begrudge the issues I'm about to recount, but I feel they should be recounted nonetheless. The pathfinding is painfully bad; I had colonists walking three quarters of the way round my perimeter to get in instead of taking the path a third of the length. I have guys who bagsy the beds meant for (and much closer to) the miners because, as the crow flies, they're technically closer. Doesn't matter that there's a giant ditch between them meaning they need to walk a bloody long way to get there.
The game is also very easy. I had two archers early on and have NEVER had a problem with zombies. More zombies attack based on the number of colonists, but I kept on top of it with so much ease that they might as well not be there. You can also set it so zombies attack during the day and in double numbers, but these are on world creation and I don't think they can be toggled later.
The shader can also be a bit obnoxious, but that's getting into some very subjective and petty griping. 8 hours of play and that's about all the bad stuff I have to say, because there isn't that much in this game yet.

Overall, this game shows great promise. I've seen many games that could be called 'Minecraft rip-offs' and while this is a solid contender for the title, it's one of the few that I really want to see grow, expand and earn the right to quash the comparison.

~~ Ideas For The Devs ~~
Just in case the developers are reading this, I had some suggestions for the future. I dunno how many of these are already planned, but take what you will.

1. Pathfinding. While it might be tempting to keep adding more features, I think this should be a priority. A couple of my other suggestions would require better pathfinding.
2. Carriers. I read that you want to do something with the crates to make them more realistic. How about they act like item dumps and other colonists could carry items to a central storage. Think of the carriers from Settlers, for example.
3. Central Storage. Some kind of vault room could be cool. I really like the creative-style collective inventory for the player, but the colonists should have somewhere to ferry items to/from.
4. Auto-Builders. I read that you already plan on adding colonists who can build to a plan. If that's true, nevermind.
5. Happiness. Instead of just adding more zombies or something like that to increase difficulty, some kind of happiness or approval system would be cool. Luxury items, decoration and extra food could all contribute to happiness while cramped housing, shared quarters and working outside (for non-farming jobs) could reduce it. Happy colonists could work faster but unhappy ones could revolt.
6. Pathfinding. See number 1. Sorry. Just really important.
7. Hitboxes. Not being able to place a block because you're standing in the 1m cubed hitbox of the torch, for example, should be fixed. Also being able to place and remove fields without removing the wheat. But that's kinda minor.
8. Area Clearing Tools. These could be a player-only thing. Some kind of axe to chop down a whole tree or clear a 3x3 dirt or stone area would be good. Something to make the manual labour bit a bit less time-consuming.
9. Bed Allocation. After my annoyances with the miner's village being overrun by shopkeepers, I think being able to set beds or areas for certain jobs would be very good; miners bunk together, farmers in their huts, etc.

That's all I got at the moment. I shall update this with more as I think of stuff.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012041821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 6777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1171, 'last_played': 1672705469}
review:
Loving the game so far. I played it all day with my little brother yesterday. Thanks for the hard work.  Some things I would like to see include: More monster variation to challenge different defense setups.  I put it on double monsters and night/day monsters) before I got a sense of challenge, so more guys like flyers, ranged mobs, or the spiders from minecraft would be cool, aoe ranged bombers, fire, and maybe a few random bosses appearing once the colony hits x size. More options for food would also be great. Apple trees that give food and wood when harvested for example, mercenaries you can buy at shop that shoot faster, live longer, etc. I can also see player built siege weapons or traps being really fun. flinging a fireball into a crowd of zombies that just pushed through a door (another thing I'd really like to see) would be immensely satisfying. I mentioned traps. I dont need anything too extravagent, a spike trap that needs reset, and bundle of logs coming down with a switch, a floodgate to swamp your ditch around the base with fire or water for x seconds, these would be cool. 

     Anyway, I know my review mostly consists of suggestions so let's give some recommendations. The gameplay is smooth and I didn't run into any obvious bugs. I wish hosting a multiplayer server didn't require me going out of the game and navigating to the .exe in steamapp/common. Watching your loyal guards shoot down hordes of zombies feels great, but I feel bad for them since they don't seem to need sleep like their buddies, so a rotating shift would be cool. Building is fun and easy and should remind people of minecraft, minus some of the more complicated additions. As I mentioned above there are a lack of food options to choose from and the shop doesn't feel as great as I thought it would be considering how much effort you need to get it going, so I wish I had more cool things that I could buy there to kill zombies.

Thanks for the game and I'm looking forward to additional updates!

author: {'steamid': '76561198357206659', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5065, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 888, 'last_played': 1683936150}
review: If I have had to describe this game now I'd call it an automated minecraft, but I know this game could take on a persona of it's own. I believe this game is promising and could host an array of features to seperate it from its well-known counterpart. I suggest the devs add more types of workers like a builder, trader and types of warriors. They should also add other kingdoms/colonies which you should be able to trade and war with along with a diplomacy feature. The game should also have more enemies. The game could also take on elements of fantasy, whether that means there are orc and elvish kingdoms of magical wizards and warlocks. There should also be quests to complete. Overall this is a good game with the potential to become great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132042690', 'num_games_owned': 478, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1507, 'last_played': 1521845206}
review:
Честно говоря, эта игра будет места. Колонии выживание имеет массу возможностей, чтобы быть фантастическая игра, но, как он сидит сейчас, там просто не так много, чтобы сделать, ремесло, а монстры довольно хилое. У меня двое "охранников" у моих ворот, и они могут легко убить целые полчища зомби. 

Как она сидит я рекомендую его, потому что он имеет потенциал, чтобы быть большая игра с учетом времени и финансовых затрат, и я куплю его, прежде чем они подняться в цене, как и mojang сделал с minecraft.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080006271', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1655424543}
review:
I had some extra money to get this game and I watched some lets plays on youtube. At first I thought it was kind of bland until I played it because at first it can be difficuilt to find out how the game truly works. Such as the job system and farming but after the first couple of days (in game) you get the hang of it and I really enjoy it. One main reason I wanted to get this was because it was still early access so it will still have developer support I suppose for a while now. I can't wait to see what comes in the final release version.

Complaints: The AI path finding is a little messed up but at some point they find their ways to thier jobs.

I may be taking this game to far by saying that I wish later (or in the final version) that you will be able to play with friends, visit colonies, fight other players or have more gaurd units. Like rifemen or swordsmen. But I understand if they are going for a little more child friendly as it uses a voxel like texture on the blocks like minecraft does.

If you like building small villages that turn into kingdoms after fighting waves of zombies at night and managing all your people to uprise. This game is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049109664', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 19451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5308, 'last_played': 1701209244}
review: This game is like a combination of many of my favorite things. It's like a Minecraft colony management tower defense game... And that is beautiful. I love colony management where you are a part of the kingdom yourself. You walk around your own villages and build things with your own customization. But you're every bit in charge as you are in something from a top-notch "god view." The graphics are charming, updates are frequent, and gameplay can be quite challenging or very relaxing all depending on your personal play style. It's definitely an early access game right now, but it is certainly already worth it's $20 price tag. Love this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052507767', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 1948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 918, 'last_played': 1698531776}
review:
You have to make your own entertainment. 

For now, that's just how hte game is. Technically, you can "win" the game within the first 2 hours. 

But, if you set your own goals and give yourself a project like: "I want to build an underground mining colony that never sees the light of day" then you can have countless hours of entertainment. 

The game still has a VERY long way to go, but it's already very good considering it's so early in development. 

If you can't make your own entertainment, don't buy it YET click "Follow" and save it for later. But if you CAN make your own entertainment, mostly revolving around building large scale creations. Then buy away and enjoy watching the game grow.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966649882', 'num_games_owned': 2002, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1499374800}
review:
[h1] Colony Survival [i] Do you have the organisational skills to run a small colony?[/i][/h1]

When you first look at this game you can not help but think “minecraft” this is understandable as minecraft is the big daddy of voxel based games and this does look like Mc with the unbelievable shaders installed and does include the 1x1 meter squared blocks that we know and love…. But this is where the comparison stops under the hood of this game is both a much more complex ai and much less complex game, it is a confusing thing to behold so let me attempt to explain.
The actual mining and gathering in this game done by hand is really simplistic, no tools no real effects etc (hopefully a product of it being very early access) but the ai behind the colonists you recruit is pretty cool, we are not talking amazing here but good enough that you do not feel alone and better than what i have seen in some minecraft mods that have promised the same functionality.

[b]CONTROLS/CONTROL PAD[/b] 
It is mouse and keyboard, i can not imagine playing this style of game with a control pad sadly.

[b]GRAPHICS[/b] 
They are pretty cool, basic yes but really good use of shaders for lighting and depth of field. The colonists are also pretty cooly done (though i confess whenever i see them i think south park canadians lol) 
I also like the rag doll when zombies are killed.
They do need to add more to the visuals though as it does get a little repetitive.

[b]INTUITIVENESS[/b] 
There is quite a good guide that you can access by pressing F1 but there are some things that are a little confusing, you can only use what is on your hotbar for crafting and many of the items you make can only be used by your colonists who insist on only doing one job. It is at this stage a little frustrating at times and there is the real danger of spreading yourself too thin too fast as you have gotten a tad bored of waiting for x to be done.

[b]PROS:[/b] 
[list]
[*] There is a good game here, just needs to blossom a bit more.
[*] Ragdoll on the enemies
[*] cool graphics style and shader use
[*] has the potential to be very good
[/list]

[b]CONS:[/b] 
[list]
[*] very very early in its life.
[*] pathfinding can sometimes get a little confused.
[*] Frustrating that you can not use some items to help out your colony
[*] can get tiresome.
[*] very steep learning curve.
[/list]

[b]Videos[/b]
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=arZH72m4Xzw

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vdppVtfaMSs


[b]VERDICT[/b] 
Well i am going to recommend it but on the condition you know what Early Access is,if you want a game to play right now then i do not think this is for you, though i do know many would disagree and have created some very impressive colonies. 
With the frequency of developer updates and info i do expect big things for this game in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044937829', 'num_games_owned': 1021, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 1369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 783, 'last_played': 1562816873}

author: {'steamid': '76561198070390788', 'num_games_owned': 502, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 546, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1565498135}
review:
After 6 hours of playing I'm ready to review Colony Survival. 

Let's start with the pros-
-While textures are blocky, they are not perfect cubes and have a nice 3d effect
-Visually really good- god rays, depth of field, etc
-Easy to pick up and start playing
-Active developer (too many indie games don't have this!)

Now let's go with the cons-
-After building a base and making sure your colony will not starve, there is not much to do (as of 7/6/17)
-Only 1 enemy type (zombies)
-Not very many building materials
-No animals
-a $20 price tag for about 10 or so hours of gameplay before you "beat" the game
-after getting everything set up there is basically nothing for the player to do except add more colonists, but at a point that gets pointless and boring.

Some things that would be nice in future updates-
-animals (part of the dev's roadmap)
-a "happiness" system (have to keep your colonists happy)
-more building materials
-enemy variance (stronger enemies and enemies that look different)
-more crafting in general
-different gendered colonists (as of 7/6/17 only male colonists)
-a reason to explore (i.e. certain materials found in only certain parts of the world) (also part of the dev's roadmap)
-armor for colonists (also if the happiness system gets implemented it would be cool if the colonists started in rags and you had to make clothes for them.) {otherwise they would be unhappy}
-different weapons for colonists (i.e. swords)
-traps for enemies (i.e. spike pits)
-draw bridges
-other colonies that you could run a caravan to and trade with

All of that being said, I highly recommend this game, and I look foward to future updates.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022584980', 'num_games_owned': 523, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1497711850}
review:
While this could become a good game some day, that day is not anytime soon. This game entertained for about 2 hours and then you have done everything there is to do. 

Sure you can make a castle or something, but not even a castle is as useful as a moat and the moat is far easier to make. There is nothing to warrant this charging 20 Euros and while you may feel like the fact that it is early access excuses all this, I beg to differ. There are early access games that off beyond more than 200 percent more entertainment in that you can spend 400 hours on them, while you can only spend 2 on this one.

So to summarize this game could get fun, but it needed a year more in development before it should at all have been submitted to the Steam Store, then maybe I wouldn't resent the game on top of it being extremely lackluster.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071051775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1143, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1555578824}
review:
This game is certainly very promising. For an Early access game barely a month old on steam it is entertaining. I am hopeful and curious to see what the final game will look like. Since its not even a month old I feel like its necessary to be a bit more lenient on how I judge the game. 

The Game is in no shape or form to be called complete but it is a great foundation/starting point. Currently you can set up a fairly productive town however a few things do need to be mentioned.

Breaking game mechanics:

- Monsters dont attack your walls as long as there is an opening somewhere to get in making them easy to kite... (aka sealing off your whole colony but leaving a 1 wide bottleneck will make all the zombies go through the bottleneck instead of being sensible and smash the walls)

- When your walls get to a certain size because of the amount of colonists you have you still will be safe if you put 5 guards at the one entrance cos the zombies will all be dead (Dawn) by the time they walk all the way around.

I feel like in order to make things ever more challenging as you progress will be to stop having the zombies die at dawn because it is a little silly that you can potentially defend your metropolis of 1000+ colonists with 5-10 guards.... 

Wish list for things that may be fun in game:

- More enemies. Right now after I set up a wall and guard I literally can stop giving a **** about the zombies. It will be fun if there are things like (NPC Thieves/Pillagers), NPC Colonies that can potentially go to war with you if you piss them off or even ranged monsters just to keep people on their feet.

- Ability to share resources.... despite a tag that says Co-op it really feels not Co-Op.... I played with my friend the other day and I cannot share my food with him and we cannot split responsibilities up... aka I am the food producer and miner while my friend is the builder and guard.... we ended up having to make two separate buildings for our individual colonists and despite me having a surplus of food I cannot share any with him when he suffers a famine.

- Technological advancement?? I am not clear if the intentions of the devs is to keep this game in the medieval  stage or to introduce some kind of tech andvancement.

- More Weapons. A bow is good and all but it will be nice if we can make catapults, ballistas or even sword and shield for guards to use.

- Animal Husbandry. Animals are cute and delicious rite?

- Colonists that build. For those that arent very creative with building. It will at least make their village look interesting instead of having wooden or stone cubes everywhere....


Verdict: Great start for Early access

9/10 Early Access points

author: {'steamid': '76561198060737623', 'num_games_owned': 418, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 659, 'last_played': 1682142530}

author: {'steamid': '76561198206528704', 'num_games_owned': 150, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 8114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1204, 'last_played': 1656205423}
review:
My friend showed me this game overnight and at first I looked at it skeptically. I have played minecraft for years and I thought it was just a silly knock-off from the videos and photos. 

As soon as I loaded up for my first time (which was with my best friend, who gifted the game to me because he didn't want to play alone) I instantly realized I was wrong. There is a lot of real potential for future updates to new jobs, and the current ones are very satisfying. 

We quickly set up a massive wall around both of our areas and had one main "Gate" in which we made a windy path with a plethora of archers to defend. I personally went a little bit overboard making berry farms.. and soon I had well over 200 colonists. While the main premise of the game seems to be to survive and gain as many items as possible, I do have a lot of fun building with the blocks provided, however limited they are. 

We played for a couple hours and then my internet started to slow down with my sisters hopping on their netflix, and I have since then been playing singleplayer. I do not see myself stopping anytime soon.. 

I HIGHLY recommend this game to anyone who wants a change of pace from normal minecraft play, or other city managing type games. I think there is a lot that can be improved, but the base of the game seems extremely solid much as the first alpha of minecraft was. I can't wait to see what the developers add in the near future! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561197983750025', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1661346117}
review:
A nice concept-proof that you can make a nice game with classic ideas. Always wanted a mod like this to Minecraft and I do agree that as a separate game this feels better. So despite of simplicity and early version limits, this game is a nice one. If you are not ready to invest in the idea, don't buy it now since it's too raw. I hope they'll polish it in the right direction and I'll be able to play it for longer.

Nice things:
1) Simple managment that still gives a sense of a working system. No dull schedules, no RPG, only jobs and workers. Few major resources to look at. Build a system step by step and watch it working.
2) Meditating surroundings, everything just works.

Negative things:
1) Minecraft is 10 steps ahead in terms of biomes, architecture e.t.c. So I hope they'll add more architecture (stairs/slopes?), caves, better terrain generation and some reason for exploring (other castles, traders, artefacts maybe?).
2) Dull zombies that die in front of a closed castle. You can just close / open / close / open the castle in order to survive. And even if you close it for the night and open in the morning, the food penalty does not work. Doors / gates + a destruction model for doors would be nice. Not yet there. No diversity in monsters as well (which would be nice). So I think they should add a lot of things from tower defence genre (maybe be original and not copy-paste minecraft). Now this part of gameplay is very dull. So no "Survival" yet. Only "Colony".
3) Failed to find ores.. So caves + generator tuning needed.

So, this is not yet a game, this is a proof of concept. But a nice one, so I decided to support the developers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198348962712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1499182888}

author: {'steamid': '76561198030754853', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 3240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1769, 'last_played': 1523479712}
review:
Colony Survival is a (you guessed it) colony survival game with solid mechanics and an intriguing amount of potential.

Even in its incomplete state, the early game and mid game are a total blast. Since enemy numbers coincide with colonist count, the initial task of finding the right spot for your colony (defensible, scenic, and with easy access to resources) is actually a pleasant experience. Trying to build and populate your colony while keeping it safe can be beautifully tricky. It's surprisingly intense when you're digging a mine 50 meters underground, looking for iron to replenish your sentries' dwindling supply of arrows, and you start seeing your colonist numbers drop because zombies have overwhelmed your guards and are now flooding into the bunkhouses and killing your colonists in their sleep. There's a real sense of satisfaction to building a thriving town, alive with motion and industry, and finding a way to keep the zombie horde at bay that isn't "cheap" (i.e. digging a trench around your colony and making it traversible only by a zig-zagging bridge under a catwalk manned by a couple archers).

It's got its imperfections, of course. It runs into the same problem a lot of in-development sandbox games do: as soon as you've reached the outer boundaries of the finished content, there's that abrupt, disappointing plateau where the game isn't [i]over[/i] exactly, but there's no motivation to keep playing. Although the block textures have beautiful sculpted depth you rarely see in cubic Minecraft-like games, the character and enemy designs (identical except in color) are particularly unappealing. Finally, the challenge feels rudimentary. The enemies are completely predictable, homogenous, and completely foiled by a two-block-high hedgerow. I'm going on faith that this is just an artifact of its early access status, and that more interesting enemies and a more sophisticated challenge will be forthcoming.

I'm eager to see where this game will go. Although it's never a good idea to speculate about early access games, it's hard to not imagine what Colony Survival [i]could[/i] become. Varied enemies that can climb/fly over fortifications, break through walls, build stairs/bridges, or fire projectiles. Colonists that are born, cycle through unproductive childhood (perhaps apprenticed to other colonists to increase their skill at their future "career"), work for a few weeks as adults, then die. Sentries that need to sleep and become exhausted if no replacement relieves them from their shift. The need for water, requiring you to build near a lake or create a reservoir/aqueduct nearyour town (along with better water behavior). Travelers. Random events. Underground dangers. Exhaustable resources. Friendly and unfriendly neighbors. Sickness. Field blight. Diverse villager behavior. The need to set up multiple colonies and connect them by roads (for example, prairie colony A has arable land and can grow food, but only forest colony B is able to supply ample wood, and only mountainside colony C has access to a decent amount of ore). While it's unlikely that all of these will come to pass, the developer seems extremely engaged, motivated to create a robust, quality game, and receptive to community suggestions.

review: wow this game is everything i could ever want . its so fun and great but after a while it gets a bit stale . there should be something about upgrading the banner which allows the attack of better enemies like flying or something . i have 109 citizens and 16k+ food and i get 1k pretty much everyday . i built 3 giant castles and 1 japanese style building and i am so proud of myself it looks amazing i took screen shots but thats only part of the beauty to this game . i approve :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198113063806', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1458, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1676678068}
review:
This game has a LONG way to go. But it is very promising. I love the game so much, at the moment, there isn't really that much to do, but as they add more things, it will become better. People who are saying it is "too simple" have to remember, this game literally came out a month ago. One indie dev group can only do so much in 1 month.

I think the price point of $20 is a bit much for someone who is not vested in waiting for the updates, and if that is you, then I would follow the game, wait a month or two and then buy it. I think for someone like me, it is easily worth the $20.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072719635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 5790, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1421, 'last_played': 1651406916}
review:
얼리엑세스다. 그래서 추가적인 컨텐츠가 너무나도 부족하다 
무슨 일본풍의 부속이나 체리나무(벚꽃)을 추가 했을까? 굉장히 쓸데 없다. 기본적인 부속을 더 추가하거나 제작환경, 버그등을 고쳤으면 하는데 -_-;;; 이런 것들은 꼭 알고 게임하길 바란다. 그리고 제작자들에게 꼭 말해주고도 싶다.
1. "물"이라는 파일(벽돌을 파일이라고 명칭하겠다)은 일종의 바이러스다. 
 아무 쓰잘데기 없고 단순히 미관상의 파일. 속도가 느려지며 앞이 보이지 않고 명령을 물 속에서 할수 없다. 다만 다른 파일을 깎고 쌓는것은 가능하다. 특히, 내가 지금 말하고 싶은건 물 1파일이 만약 지하에 넘어오게 된다면 파일을 바로 막아버린다고 해도 그 지하 전체가 물 파일로 변한다. 무한으로 증식해서 지하의 빈 공간을 모두 물로  채워버린다는 말... 더 웃긴건, 그 안에서 일하던 애들은 상관없다. 잠수하면서 계속 일을 한다. (물론 내캐릭도 익사하진 않는다 절대, 몬스터도 마찬가지.)

2. 게임이 너무 쉽다. 
 그래서 다들 미적인 건축에 힘을 쓰는것 같다. 초반에 10~15명정도로 안정적인 세팅을 이루어 내면 두려운 것도 없으며 몬스터도 매우 약하다. 많은 종류의 몬스터나 벽을 기어오러간 부순다던지 속도가 빠르거나 체력이 높다던지 등의 몬스터도 없으며, 무기또한 활과 화살 그리고 경비병밖에 없기 때문에 이 부분에 대한 전체적인 업데이트가 없다면 바로 질린다. 물론, 나도 건물짓는 재미로 조금더 즐기고는 있으나 이 시간 아깝고 미친짓이 끝나면 더 이상 이 게임을 안하겠지.

3. 그나마 장점이라고는 그래픽과 속도.
 마인의 그것과 비슷한 그래픽이지만 광원효과는 정말 멋있다. 내가 지금 200명의 콜로니를 세웠는데 속도가 느려지지도 않는다. 서로간의 낑김현상이런것도 없다 (물론 서로 통과가 가능하고 배드도 통과가능해서 그런걸지도)

4. 위 모든 것들 중 가장 단점은 낮은 컨텐츠
 컨텐츠가 정말 너무 없다. 베리농사, 밀농사, 나무심고, 채굴하고, 마지막 플렉스(200골드 모아서 씨 사야된다) 그래봤자 플렉스는 쓸데없는거(미관타일에만 사용함) 베리농사는 하자마자 바로먹을 수 있고, 밀농사는 가는것, 오븐만 하면 바로 빵, 나무도 바로 사용가능. 이 어찌나 단순한가. 이것들만 알면 생존 끝이다. 길을 잘만들든 건물을 잘 짓든 몬스터한테 보호되게 경비병(화살통) 세워두면 끝이다. (물론 화살, 도끼, 곡괭이는 만들어야 한다지만 제작이 너무쉽고)
 위의 것들을 1~2시간이면 모두 할 수 있다. 앞서 말했듯 10~15명 생성하면 그 게임 끝난거다 즐길꺼 다 즐긴거다...

솔직히 돈이 아까운것은 아니나 시간이 아깝다. 이럴꺼면 나중에 컨텐츠 추가된 후에 시작해도 될껄....

author: {'steamid': '76561198089088400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 4475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1069, 'last_played': 1583769205}
review:
J'aime beaucoup ce jeu ! Il manque beaucoup de choses pour en faire un très bon jeu, mais il est déjà bourré d'idées et de potentiel ! 

Je suis un peu saoulé des "minecraft-likes" dans lesquels on passe notre vie à récolter pour construire trois pauvres murs incomplets... 
Du coup, ce jeu est vraiment idéal :
Vous êtes saoulé aussi de récolter le bois, le blé, les minerais, etc ? Assignez-y un colon ! 
Pareil pour le craft ? Vous ne voulez pas vous prendre la tête ? Assignez-y un colon ! 
Et la défense ? Vous n'avez pas envie de faire des allers-retours dans le village pour trucider du zombie ? Assignez-y un colon ! 

Les colons peuvent tout faire sauf la construction qui vous est dévolue (et tant mieux). Le jeux est beau ! Vraiment beau ! Sauf les animations des PNJs... On a l'impression que des PlayMobils ce sont échappés et courent partout... Et c'est pas top. 

Mais c'est une Alpha, une bonne Alpha et je recommande vivement !

author: {'steamid': '76561198203675284', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1500169292}
review:
Colony Survival is very early in it's development but it has a nice charm. It looks a lot like Minecraft with a texture pack, but it is more relaxing to play, I really hope the game adds more difficulty as right now it is a bit too easy even with double zombies. But I love how I can just play the game and relax at the same time. It looks beautiful but I find the brightness of the sand to be a little too much sometimes. I think it's a great game, the developers seem to be updating it frequently and I have high hopes for the game. 

It's a lot of fun but it doesn't have much to the game yet, I have high hopes for the game and look forward to seeing it grow!

author: {'steamid': '76561198384104911', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 9018, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2226, 'last_played': 1706615907}
review:
现在这个游戏越来越完善了，但是仍然有很大的问题。
1.屁民ai问题
屁民在很大程度上几乎0智商。。。遇到僵尸只能乖乖挨打。。。
2.水的蔓延问题
之前有一位玩家叫baozha猫，在建造他的地堡时渗水，导致地堡全淹。
后来他在评测中反映此问题。但在最近的实验中，水依旧没有改善。。。
希望作者能修改一下，类似于minecraft的水蔓延。不然，会有熊孩子玩家在服务器使用水崩服。
最后还是希望这个游戏更加完善！
---2017年的评测（下方）
怎么说呢，这游戏是好玩，但是最近几天我和我的朋友都遇到了bug。那个bug是聊天的bug，有时聊天框里的聊天看不见了，不得不重启游戏呢，
而且，现在的熊孩子泛滥，希望作者能弄个防熊孩子系统，OP可以在后台踢掉熊孩子。
我还是挺支持这个游戏的,现在已经有许多地形了，值得一玩。

I really really hate minecraft but the direction this game is goign will make me enjoy that style of gameplay. Keep up the good work and please make it all worth it by finishing the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561197971298030', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1499084207}
review:
I played this game in alpha during July '17. I had just finished Stardew Valley and was looking for something that would give me a similar experience for a few hours, and I'd say that Colony Survival did that (for around 4 hours). 

The basic premise of this game is "idle game meets minecraft." It's in alpha, so there were relatively few features and mechanics.

Pros
- Open world and Minecraft-style building system allow for nice flexibility
- Provides a fun "optimization" experience ("hm, where is the bottleneck in my resource production? Ah, I need more grain, so I need more seeds, so I need more money, but I need more gold to make money," etc.)
- Simple combat (zombies attack your base at night) makes the difficulty more serious and compelling.
- This game is the only one I've ever played that _didn't_ implement bloom to be as annoying as possible; the day-night cycle made it most intense during early morning (when there'd be humidity and bright sun), and then it gets less intense as the day goes on.

Cons
- The UI is a little janky (forgiveable since it's two devs and in alpha). You have to drag items from your storage to your inventory to do any crafting, and the add/remove block system with mouse-clicks is a little unintuitive. 
- The AI is also a little janky and frustrating at times - as far as I can tell, the zombies move non-stochastically (probably using some version of A* search), so they wind up hugging the walls of your base and attacking predictably. I was able to counter the zombie threat entirely by surrounding my base with a 2x1x1 moat and 1x1x10 bridge and then just stacking archers in front of it. 
- Retasking your colonists from one job to another is _really_ frustrating. You either have to destroy the thing they're working on, or just add another job site and hire a new colonist. 

Suggestions to the devs (obviously not all of these are doable, but any individual one would probably have kept me playing for at lease another hour or two):
- Make it possible to direct colonists or re-task them once assigned to a job.
- Make more weapons with different types of damage (melee weapons, different range weapons, etc), and make them upgradable.
- Make different kinds of enemies, especially ones with ranged attacks.
- Allow for buildings (other than the banner) to be destructible - this would force more strategic gameplay and base design.
- Maybe implement some feature where your colonists can level up themselves with regard to how efficient they are at tasks?
- Allow for multiple (with a maximum) colonists to work on certain job sites (i.e. I'm pretty sure my 10x10 farming sites can support more than one worker). 
- This is my inner Stardew Valley nerd talking, but I'd definitely love it if there were livestock, a fishing system, and different regions to explore. :P


Overall, I would say it was an enjoyable experience. Don't go in (right now) expecting a AAA experience; it's a fun indie game that's worth a good few hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015848436', 'num_games_owned': 598, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 4516, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 801, 'last_played': 1665314929}
review:
[h1]Challenging[/h1]

Between fighting off the hordes and keeping your colony fed this game proves that being a leader sucks, yet its rewarding, you can challenge yourself to try and get as many people as you can, keep them fed and alive while fighting off zombies, you'd think with one hit kill it would be easy, I dare you to try this.

[h1]Fun[/h1]

Build what you want, where you want, with whatever you want, make paths that mess with the minds of both zombies and colonists and see them follow a maze that would confuse even the most seasoned players. Having people do all the work for you while you only worry what work they do is pretty fun too, since you don't have to do anything, you can just build, build and build.

[h1]Cons[/h1]

[b]In its defense this game is still in Beta[/b]

There is no variety of monsters, colonists and monsters follow a square grid and can't move diagonally, making setting up defense wasteful and hard, should too many monsters gather in one place, the game starts glitching, at first I thought it was the CPU being killed by the game proccessing the movements of the creatures and I ran a monitor, turns out it wasn't that, archers have a really low fire rate and there are no means of increasing this.

[h1]What I want to see next[/h1]

[list]
[*]An upgrade system, where you need to do research to make better equipment for the colonists.
[*]Job level system, the longer they do their job the more experienced they become, the better they are at doing it
[*]Builders and Arhitects, you build your first building and then get the architect to make blueprints from it, which give them to the builders should you need more of that building.
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198377740248', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1510417800}
review: Well, I don't really buy games that often, usually I'm sceptical about games of an artstyle like this (just like Minecraft's) but this one stole my heart. author: {'steamid': '76561198009817827', 'num_games_owned': 808, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 169, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1498945336}
review:
Interesting spin on this genre, but doesn't feel like much more than a demo at the moment.

Feature requests, from most wanted to least:
[list]
    [*]More intuitive UI, especially for the inventory and crafting. Could learn from the console version of Minecraft in this respect.
    [*]Variation. More monsters, more jobs, more weapons, etc. Equipment beyond the basic, such as armor, better tier tools and such.
    [*]Stairs, doors, buckets for carrying water, perhaps drawbridges of some form for moats. More light types than the torch. Furniture!
    [*]Animals that can be hunted, domesticated, etc.
    [*]Less clunky management. This ties in with the UI aspect. Also, a feature for blueprinting buildings and making colonists build them autonomously would be fantastic.
    [*]Some villager needs other than food. Perhaps a quality of life system similar to Rimworld, to incentivize actual expansion and buildings other than the bare necessities. Building a square building and covering every square inch of the interior with beds shouldn't work as well as building a luxury estate for every villager.
    [*]Shops having more use than they do currently. Although I'm sure this will happen naturally as the list of items is expanded. Maybe roaming traders with rare items that can be purchased with gold
    [*]Some sort of technological progress. For example, guards could start with clubs and slings and progress toward matchlock firearms or something neat like that.
    [*]Villagers actually being people, with randomly generated names. Maybe a system where they can have kids, age and die, etc. Would facilitate very large colonies and allow for natural growth.
    [*]More in-depth defense system. For example, certain monster types can break through weak materials like wood, and also perhaps defensive installations like trebuchets or ballistas (big weapons to fight big monsters, which I hope will be included at some point)
[/list]

I don't know how much of this is probable with a two man team, but I think it's important to shoot for the stars, especially in such a saturated genre. I wish the team the best and look forward to seeing this game take shape.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120423353', 'num_games_owned': 139, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 8077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3211, 'last_played': 1534967818}
review:
他のﾚﾋﾞｭｰを見る限り・・・四角いブロックで遊ぶことをマインクラフトと
言うのだろうｗ先駆けに洗脳されちゃうのはしかたなし。

サバイバル（まだそんな要素はほぼ無い）とタワーディフェンスって感じですね。
拠点の旗から一定範囲はゾンビが沸かないので周囲を壁で囲い
迎撃位置を作りあとは農業（放置）して食料におおじて職業（住民）を増やしていくゲーム
難易度設定で昼夜問わず（基本夜のみ）ゾンビ沸きにしたり２倍スポ＾－ンなど新感覚ではある。
昼夜２倍ゾンビ設定にすると、農業より鉱山（地下生活）になって別感覚で楽しめていいのではないでしょうか？
まだまだ新要素も出てくるようで、桜の木などＪＰには嬉しい要素があってイイゾコレ！！

まぁしかし　やれる事がまだ少ないので急いで遊ぶ必要もないでしょう。
今後の展開も合わせてオヌヌメします。今じゃなくても大丈夫。

と、２倍にした場合、住民１００人以上にするとｿﾞﾝﾋﾞがﾊﾞｸﾞ始める（処理落ち）
光源による沸き潰しなんて出来ないからねｗ

author: {'steamid': '76561197971828236', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 3084, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1615, 'last_played': 1551231208}
review:
This game is definitely not worth $20, not even close.  It is extremely Alpha and more like a proof of concept than a game.

It's not difficult enough to be a tower defense game and it's waaaaaaay too slow to be a resource management game. 

You build a moat around your beds, build your farms, grow slowly, add some archers and you're done.  This all takes about 3 hours to do and isn't even fun.

This is a $5 game at most in its present condition.  I would wait if I had to do it over again, especially with all the wonderful summer sales.  This really isn't a contender.

author: {'steamid': '76561198162749666', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1500177085}
review:
To start off, this game is really good. Even if you dont enjoy other manegment games, slowly developing your own kingdom in this game is an experience to be had. That being said, i think that a PVP component on some of the servers would be great for the games longevity. I can imagine myself playing for hours on end if there was some sort of competition between players. Imagine have your own armys and alliences, all supported by you massive capital city. Even if its more simple than that, i think it would be a good feature.

Overall, this game is a cool and engaging idea that i have been trying to find in a game for a long time. I hope the developer keeps up the good work and ads many more features to give the game more depth. Definitly reccomended!!

review: A fitting game for the players of minecraft who just want to build. Keep the people safe and fed and you get all the wood you need to build yourself a massive castle just for yourself. Or be a good king and build a massive village for your people to live and work in. Colony survival used the mincraft idea but brings it to the management genre and lets you build the kingdom of your dreams with little to no resource collecting on your hands.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043906800', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1499530757}
review:
As others have said, this game, while feeling simplistic at first, has a lot of potential. The crafting system and colony management somehow feel expansive while not overwhelming the player with tons of things to do at once. The graphics are pretty good even on low-end systems (I really love the auto-focusing feature when you look at zombies, all you can see at first is the glowing eyes). The atmosphere is immersing, the little chirps and buzzes around your settlement really add a character that not many other block-games provide.

Overall, this game sends waves of nostalgia back to the old days of Minecraft, a simpler time, full of possibilities and discovery.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090747294', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 8304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2342, 'last_played': 1591034963}
review:
Gioco stupendo in crescita continua!
Viene costantemente aggiornato con bug fix e nuovi blocchi/ ricette / oggetti..! 

Se credete sia un clone di minecraft vi state sbagliando di grosso. Hanno essenzialmente solo lo stile grafico in comune.
Il gioco è a tutti gli effetti un gestionale in cui dovrete far lavorare dei coloni come farmer, guardie, minatori, crafter..

Contiene localizzazioni in varie lingue, tra cui se non sbaglio anche una in italiano, non l'ho provata, ma dovrebbe esser li!
Compratelo! vale tutto!

author: {'steamid': '76561198034070226', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1087, 'last_played': 1501431053}
review:
The game is pretty much solid for an early access title. Its core mechanics was strong and pretty enjoyable too. I really enjoyed building my fortress, reasearching medieval fort for references and managing the citizens, farms, bakers, artisans. The mining system is also simplified, which is a good thing in its own way. It makes the game less grindy and enjoyable. Pretty much a "minecraft" that enables you to recruit soldier to defend and manage your Kingdom and creation. The game is also really stable. There's no bugs and crash so far on my current gameplay. However, please be noted that this is still an early access review of the game, so the lack of content is quite acceptable.

I would like to suggets. 
1. A varieties of troops like pikemen, swordsmen, cavalry etc. (paper, rock, scissor system to counter different types of enemies)
2. Bodyguard/Companion system. (A King needs his bodyguard right? XD)
3. Different factions to encounter add for Singleplayer and Multiplayer.  (It would be great to wage war againts random faction. It will make the gameplay much more interesting and longer)
4. An armor and weapon system for the player. 
5. More varieties of enemies orcs, trolls, giants, dragons etc. 
6. More furnitures tables, chairs, carpets, ladders, stairs..*we need doors and stairs..seriously we need it*..well, the basics (Would like to see a throne, it would be awesome)
7. Etc...........The game has so much thing that can be added to make the game mechanic stronger and the potential will be even greater. It doesnt need to be good, it needs to be great. :D

I'd pretty much recommended it for its solid core gameplay.  The game has very good potential and lets hope that the devs can improve this game furthermore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088895355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 702, 'last_played': 1639874344}
review:
So, I've seen some reviews saying the lack of content makes the game boring. Well, let me say this.

First off, yes there is a lack of content, but that is obivous for a game so early in development. 
Second off, Why not try having double spawns and endless waves?

From personal experience, even with my mighty kingdom of 32 archers 40 farmers and so on, I still have zombies get in and murder people. Then it always ends up being a farmer and than you gotta replace him with the little food you have, than people start starving, zombies still attacking, arrows running low, beginning to panic. Die and lose all your stuff trying to keep them away. Then, you sit there... All your hard work burns. Corpses line the roads. Workstations and houses abandoned. And you, as a gamer, questioning how so many things went wrong so fast. (Alpha 0.1 was when this happened.)

So yeah, if you want that stress, annoying, heart breaking, morale deminishing, Hardwork pointlessness. Go ahead and enable those two options! :D

But, on a serious note, this game is early in development and has much to come. Judging it harshly is a little excessive since they managed to get it in a state that is both playable and enjoyable, with very few bugs. If you feel like you're up for a few hours of fun that can be turned into days. Don't hesitate to get the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121653329', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 6443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 846, 'last_played': 1670437473}
review:
Imagine Minecraft but you can control the villagers, that's basically what they're going for here and I LOVE IT. Obviously theirs a lot of work to be done but I see HUGE potential in this game. In my opinion when this game gets finished it could be a master peice, but only if the devs don't get too greedy and give up on it.

Basically you have to defend your colony against zombies that raid you every night.
It might seem dull but it's actually really fun if you get into it.
I spent 4 hours building my colony and at first I didn't understand the importance of food. 
So I ended up letting my people starve to death by accident Lol. 
After that I had to harvest and plant my crops on my own since I didn't have any colonists Lol.
After harvesting my food I managed to recruit 16 more peasents and now my colony is thriving again :D

Overall I think this games a blast :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198162236961', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 66, 'playtime_forever': 1070, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 434, 'last_played': 1675830074}
review:
It's essentially a minecraft mod escalated to the max, with the minecraft part being less in depth but still well executed.

If you expect a full game at the moment, I recommend not buying it at the moment, for the game lacks much content and it pretty much ends around 4 hours in. However, this game has an immense amount of potential going for it already, as much of the main game mechanics are already finished.

You yourself in the game is basically 100% dependent on the AI colonists that inhabit your lands and do all your dirtywork. Eventually, late into the game, everything in your colony is automated by your colonists, and the game just becomes a cycle of building more space for your colonists to work and live in.

I do highly recommend the game as of this moment, as I only bought it a mere 2 days ago and already have 7+ hours as of writing this review. It's incredibly well made and great for those who want a true medieval management game based on minecraft style graphics.

Buy it now if you want to support an early access game with tons of potential, or if you're wanting a full game, come back later.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033836833', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 9382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2570, 'last_played': 1616434678}
review:
A less lonely (And less grindy) minecraft.

Personally, the biggest issue I had with minecraft is that I always felt like I was playing alone, even on servers. Everything felt incredibly grindy and in the end, it felt like there was little point aside from creative freedom.

Granted, this game is still early access and is rather thin on content, but what we have so far changes plenty, giving you plenty of NPC slaves to do anything you wish, regardless if it is mining, farming, defense, or crafting. All you have to do as the king is keep them safe and fed. The monsters don't seem to target you directly in the current build, and none will appear if you have no colonists. Still, I rather like that I don't have to constantly grind for metals, wood, and stone and instead focus more on the world building aspects.

While a minecraft clone, this game still seems to do its own thing as well. I'm interested to see how it develops.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965916889', 'num_games_owned': 332, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 1426, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 765, 'last_played': 1559350092}
review:
Imagine creative minecraft where you get to have your own workforce to do your dirty work.

There is a certain appeal to the idea of building your own settlement and very gradually turn it into an impenetrable kingdom, granted the opportunity is there, the question is how much work you're willing to invest in keeping your banner standing, which actually is incredibly easy to do.

It has some enjoyment, there just is not a lot of it ...yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050936564', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1032, 'last_played': 1521242029}
review: This game is something that I have been wanting for so long to happen! I wanted a game that allows you to build your own thriving towns with a voxel building system and that's what this is. Your first playthrough will be scary, unorganized, and quite challenging. As you continue to get better at the game, you learn many tricks to outsmart the Monsters and grow food most efficiently. This game is peaceful (except at night), creative, challenging, and fun. I highly recommend it and cannot wait to see what the developers implement later with our support. (And if you didn't believe my review, I have unlocked every achievement within a day... it's addicting).

review: this game is very early and at the moment doesnt have a lot but if you are a fan of the type of game then i highly recomend it. even though there isnt a lot of "stuff" there is still a lot you can do. that said if you are on the fence about the game i would recomend you watch a video on it and wait to see if it gets any updates as the game does run kinda poorly at times (atleast on multiplayer which is all i have played with my freind)

author: {'steamid': '76561198053194841', 'num_games_owned': 526, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 238, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1497890683}
review:
Colony Survival has practically no content and is not challenging for more than 2 hours.
Most of the challenge comes from 1min of figuring out how to do something, 10-20 min getting the materials and then 1 more minute to become perfect at that action.
So you build a farm, build a bed, build a wall and/or moat, dig down for mining and.... you're done.
The rest is just waiting until night so you watch your towers kill zombies and then waiting until day so you can watch your farmers farm and your miners mine. Neither of which are interesting to look at.


I haven't seen a multiplayer server that delivers a playable game, the zombies skate all over.

The most replay value in this game comes from building intricate castles.
Though you only have a few block types, so even that is not interesting.
All blocktypes have the same properties, only the colors and patterns are different. 
Even If you like voxel sandbox games purely for building stuff this game is not worth it.

Even the game title is uninspired.

Let's hope it gets better, otherwise we have been swindled.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066043853', 'num_games_owned': 83, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 504, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 324, 'last_played': 1599051968}
review:
Colony Survival is a very refreshing take on the management/building/survival game genres. It lets the player play not as a hunter-gatherer, warrior or craftsman, but rather the mind behind an entire society entirely.

It's tough to be critical of a game that's only 15 days old, but right now this game is a little lacking when it comes to gameplay, as you'll find that once you've built your first few farms, placed some guards and allocated mining/forester jobs, there really isn't much to do, apart from building structures and racking up materials.

This is not to say that the game is boring, it's quite entertaining even after reaching the current endgame.

I see a lot of potential in this game, and it is definitely a good purchase before the price shoots up once they've incorporated more elements into the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049022199', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 14126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1749, 'last_played': 1675611224}
review: This game is well worth the asking price - even as a fresh EA title. I've got about 25 hours in it now and plan on putting many more. I think of it as a Tower Defense/Minecraft/Banished lovechild. As long as the Devs continue to squash bugs and make small changes consistently this will become a great game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198131888063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3373, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 802, 'last_played': 1652845586}
review: Bought this game because I had cash and thought it looked fun. Little did I know what I was getting into, I am writing this a 3:35 AM after spending 6 straight hours playing this game. I have gotten all but one achievments (where are you snow) and currently have a colony of 84 people which I plan to expand. 9/10 game would recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021396321', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 10291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6150, 'last_played': 1672790076}
review:
A still in development colony builder with a lot going for it (the 9.0 alpha release looks like it will expand the game quite a bit) but is really undone by the inability to assign individual colonists to a specific bed for them to sleep at during their off-shift hours.

This [b]inevitably[/b] leads to problems with colonists choosing the "wrong" bed (often on the other side of the colony) and still has not been adequately, or at all, addressed by the Devs.

Unfortunately the flaw has been long enough and big enough that I must down-rate this game now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051421156', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 8074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3223, 'last_played': 1680315857}
review:
I played this game last about the same time last year. The game is a thousand times better than it used to be, and it was already addictively fun to begin with. However, the pathing of colonists seems to be worse than it used to be. I know they said they are working on zombies, but I haven't seen anything about colonist AI. I haven't looked through the whole year's worth of patch notes, so excuse me if they have already addressed this. 

That being said, the way colonists behave sometimes can be very frustrating. When it comes to night time and finding a bed, they seem to search for one that is the fewest amount of blocks away from their immediate location, not one that takes the shortest amount of time to get to. One solution I have to this would be adding the ability to assign each colonist a bed that they will always go to. This would make the game more realistic, because usually people don't sleep right next to where they work. It would allow you to build dedicated homes for your colonists, and make the game feel more alive. 

Also, I have sometimes seen colonists take a longer path to their job in the morning than they did the previous day. They will exit out of a doorway on the opposite side to where their job is, then walk all the way back around the side of the building to where they need to be.

Despite these small annoyances, I am immensily enjoying this game again. All the mechanics feel very good, nothing really seems clunky or awkward. It's a little annoying how few items I can make myself in the crafting menu now, but it makes sense.

author: {'steamid': '76561198216677907', 'num_games_owned': 28, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5508, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1714, 'last_played': 1645852767}
review:
This game is fun. But I would like more monsters, and more jobs. If you are into things like this (and willing to pay the current price of 18$) then I would reccomend it. 

Pros: Easy controls
         Ability to turn on cheats
         Easy to survive

Cons: A large price for the stage the game is in
          Even without cheats you can accidentally glitch into the ground
          Not many things to do
          Many minor bugs
     

That is my review. I would reccomend it to anyone that would buy it. 
But if you want this game I would wait for it before buying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004521833', 'num_games_owned': 810, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1690230624}
review: This is the kind of game I've been waiting a long time to see!  I love games like Gnomoria, Rimworld, and Towns but I haven't seen one where you are in first person mode.  This is a very very dumbed down version of those games (at least while it's in Early Alpha).  I highly recommend you support the devs by purchasing this.  $20 is very steep for what little content exists in the game, but if you're interested in seeing how awesome this game can get, think of it like a kickstarter that actually works.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991291504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2965, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1463, 'last_played': 1602194267}
review: The game has great bones to work from and I cant wait to see further updates. Ive played *cough* a few hours, and would recommend this game to those that enjoy a dynamic element to city building games. I personally play on the double zombie mode for increased difficulty because the regular mode seemed far to easy (I could do all the guarding on my own). Expanding slowly is the best strategy and restarting lots an even better one. This game should have lots coming to it so its depth once everything stable and running is limited. This makes the game rely on your own imagination to keeps its replayability (not a bad thing) by building and expanding or trying new layouts!

author: {'steamid': '76561198135389626', 'num_games_owned': 60, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1498682779}

author: {'steamid': '76561198185270027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1464, 'last_played': 1690902150}
review:
First of all, I have played the game for about a week now. So far I have enjoyed it and I love the initial idea of the game but at the same time theres so much room for improvement and development.

1. Colony VS Colony, recruit sword Guards that you can send to attack another colony on multiplayer, steal their food and resources.

2. Builders that build pre made houses etc.

3. Fisher men that get fish which can the be cooked by an oven unit.

4. Boss Zombies that come when a certain food storage is hit something like 20K etc.

5. Guard/Knight Upgrades such as armour, sword sets and strength.

6. Zombies can come with swords, bows and armour, the player can also get armour and swords that are made with ores.

author: {'steamid': '76561198203371266', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1426, 'last_played': 1581284796}
review:
I bought this game in the sale because it looked okay.
I've read reviews oh both sides, negative and positive.
They're all correct.

You don't have a lot to do.
You can build really big cities and the zombies are hard.
There's a learning curve on how to play, I learned by going online and playing with people.

What is so good about it and bad about it? Here's your pros and cons!

+ Good 3D textures on a square block
+ Fun to play together
+ Good idea

- Not a lot to do after you have around 20 colonists
- Bad pathfinding by AI
- Lightning by the beach is way too bright
- Price is too high right now

So my overall:
It's a good game and has a great idea but the price is too high and there isn't a lot.
I've got 9 hours now and it's getting more. I do hope there will be an update fast and it get's updated a lot.
Curious where the developers will go to!

author: {'steamid': '76561198004704042', 'num_games_owned': 247, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1541543458}
review:
Let me just let it be know that I don't usually review games so bear with me.

The game is nice even though it is early access.
I havent run into any bugs, its not bad to play for a bit while watching a show.

As it stands there isn't too much to do, i was able to within 2 hours manage to wall off a nice enough section to have my colonists generate food, mine for minerals,  smith both gold and iron, manufacture every item using colonists, and buy seeds with newly minted coins, and i was able to defend it simply with 1 archer and a long zigzagging path into my base. Technically you dont even need the archer if you make a long enough zigzagging path into your base, the sun will just kill all the zombiles.  It didnt even take too long to get to the point where I was swimming in resources.

Even though you can reach the early access "end game material" within an hour or two, it shows promise. 

If you have some cash burning a hole in your pocket go for it, if not wait a bit untill more features are added.

Ideas for the developers, It would be nice to see:
-  more complex production line to get end game items. 
-  additional monsters, (maybe ones that climb walls? or ones that are more impervious to arrows?) 
- colonists you can assign to be soldiers that fight with sword and shield (patrols to guard walls against climbing monsters?) 
- some form of storage area that needs to expand to hold items rather than an "infinite magical list of stuff collected"
- events of some kind, like day time raids
- places of interest to explore 
- more block types, maybe ability to place water for moats.
- colonists that can fish?
- colonists requirement for variety of food.
- animal farming (cattle, pigs, sheep, etc)
- clothing, armour
- drawbridges?

author: {'steamid': '76561198311365060', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 8531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2563, 'last_played': 1702953773}

author: {'steamid': '76561198002368729', 'num_games_owned': 326, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 4716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3267, 'last_played': 1586609861}
review:
このゲームは「マイクラを超えた！」や「マイクラの進化」など呼ばれいていますが、私的に「ストーンハース(Stonehearth)とマインクラフトの合体！」の方が合っていると思います！

確かに、マインクラフトみたいな世界観ですが、ストーンハースと同じで村人に指示を与えます。しかし、ストーンハースだと、プレイヤーはまるで神のような役割で、上から指示したり、見守ったりしますが、コントロールできるプレイヤーキャラクターが実際にありません。このゲームなら、プレイヤーキャラクターでアイテムをクラフトしたり、物を建てたり、ゾンビと戦ったりできます。

ゲームには色んな村人の役割があります。傭兵（ゾンビを倒してくれる者）、クラフター(作業場で代わりに色んなアイテムを作ってくれる者)、小麦農家（小麦の種まきと小麦の収穫をしてくれる者）などがあります。

開発者たちはとてもフレンドリーな二人で、よくフォーラムでみんなと話したり、時々サーバーに参加したりしています。あとは、よくゲームをアップデートしてくれています。

日本語化モッドがもうすでにインストールされています。ゲーム内のSettingsで切り替えられます。私が和訳した物なので、間違っているところがあるかもしれません。あったら、ぜひ教えてください！

いつものことですが、私はアメリカ人なので、私が書いた日本語が間違っているかもしれません。申し訳ありません。

この前にも今でもこのゲームの動画シリーズをアップしていますので、よろしければ、ご覧になってください。

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4BzgLIN0itg&list=PLPOc4OEIzq4hxm1C6aUvsG5-I78s7GlyO
