author: {'steamid': '76561198083231730', 'num_games_owned': 383, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1002, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 868, 'last_played': 1600040739}
review:
This game deserves an honest review. So I’m going to give it my best try. 
As of Now the game is 11 DAYS old on steam, and in these days the Dev Zun has been very active with the community. Players of this game NEED to have an active imagination in order to get the fullest of the game. People without it or only a small amount will only get a small amount out of the game. You can do everything in this game and be done with it with in a couple of hours (in its current state.) 

I have a price to hour ratio. If i can get a game for 1$USD then i want 1 hour of entertainment out of it. With that said I can see me getting 20+ hours on the game, thus making the price worth it. 

Pros-
POTENTIAL is huge
Devs are active
The game is updated regularly

Cons
- The game is small incontent (Currently)

author: {'steamid': '76561198163986674', 'num_games_owned': 196, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 4024, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 919, 'last_played': 1608843574}
review:
After watching a ChilledChaos video on YouTube playing this game (and loving watching it), I decided to pick this game up along with other games as my "steam sale" bundle.

After playing over 10 hours of this game, I found it very addicting to play. It was like playing Minecraft for the first time, but having a twist of having to shelter, feed, and protect colonists. It starts nearly identical to Minecraft, but eventually starts to go off on its own road. There were a lot of things I was impressed with, such as the different jobs a colonist could have that benefits not only me but the rest of the population. It also has the same creativity as Minecraft, where you can build your colony however suits you.

There are some things that could be improved or did not go well with me. First off, the game gets kind of stagnent the more you play on your world. Hopefully since this game is in Early Access, the creators can add more items, jobs, etc. to the game to "spice" it up and make your world more long-lasting. Another thing that was kind of annoying was the lag spikes with having numerous wheat farms and the wheat all growing at the same time every day. Of course, I can't really complain when I have so many farms, but it's a bit of an annoyance. There are some other minor annoyances, such as the colonist pathfinding not being so direct, not being able to choose which job a colonist does, only one kind of enemy, etc.

If you like games like this and want to invest money in to an Early Access game, this would be the safest bet. There is so much room for improvement and additions in this game and could easily be worth $20 in no-time. I can't wait to see what direction this game heads towards!

Note: This is a singleplayer only review.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978110282', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 989, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 626, 'last_played': 1510818646}
review:
Pretty solid for an Early Access title. Definitely a nice recast of Minecraft with base building and colony management.

Possibly the most valuable part is feeling as though there is a purpose to your building a base. It is inhabited, and lived in by the doe-eyed drones of your hive. Their bustling industry cuts down on a lot of the truly unrewarding parts of Minecraft and its clones, and allows you to explore and build with a bit more ease.

Definitely needs more content, but if you're not okay buying a concept, why are you buying an early access game? It's a game I look forward to booting up every other week to check out new updates.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145840577', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3439, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 991, 'last_played': 1633389656}
review: After 3-4 days of playing, I have had so much fun. The feeling of leadership when managing who does what while trying to protect everyone from starvation and zombies has made this game very special for me. I've already turned my once small colony into a thriving self-sufficient country. This is one of the most addicting games I've ever played. The only critiques I can give are that the zombies are a bit too easy and there are not that many jobs for the colonists. The game just came out and is still in early release so I hope we can get things like gates or something that we can close but zombies could still break it, as well as different monsters like giants that can break walls or zombies with siege ladders (lol). Also the multiplayer is ok but no pvp is kinda boring. Overall the game is fantastic, I cant wait for the every next update and will continue to advance my colony.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025425407', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 732, 'last_played': 1553177245}
review:
11/2/2017 (MM/DD/YYYY) Update

So large update came through recently, and it expands on the game a ton, the addition of different types of guards, and stronger monsters makes things significantly more interesting as does the science/research stuff.  There actually feels like a sense of progression now, which wasn't really there before, and that's good.

There are some complaints I have but they are pretty minor, if you wanna build a town of identical sheeple (seriously, they only differentiate themselves when you give them a job, and even then only by changing shirts) but at least they are there, and are animated fairly well (even if they don't move their torso's and their arm/leg movements remind me of wacky arm flailing inflatable tubemen, which is rather impressive to get such fluid motions when animating things)

Some Itemized good things
-Performance is muuuuch better now (4x fps increase on my laptop)
-Game is starting to get some depth
-More decoration options (yay carpets)
-New Monster types are pretty easy to identify
-Devs actively read reviews and care what people think about the game (which is amazing especially with how the Steam store has gotten as of late)

Now then onto the 'downers'
-For some reason 'shadows' cast between vertical stacks of blocks that are adjacent to other verticle blocks (walls casting shadows on themselves)
-A number of the things for science are ONLY used for science making it feel like an extra step just to keep advancing
-Would be nice to have a 'your looking at blah' type deal if only to tell what ores I'm looking at so I can better identify some of them without having to destroy the block (and to tell if flax is full grown)
-A thing to assign beds based on colonist or job would be nice (why are my berry pickers pathing around my base, going down into the mines to sleep)
-Pathing can bork if your building something and the ai tries to go through there
-Miners have a 'facing arrow' now, which comes across as how it works for the guards, when they still only mine the block they are standing moitionlessly on, the 'facing' for them is just which direction their souless eyes, and featureless faces look while they do so
-Noticed the 'crafter' colonists seem to ignore the amounts you have set and kind of do whatever, would also be nice to be able to set a priority on what order they should focus on building things in
-Sometimes when you go to hop up a block you 'float' into it some which is easy enough to fix by backing up till you 'slide out' of the block
==========================================================
[strike]
-Yes, I know about the other biomes that you can, potentially reach, but I don't feel you should need to use cheats to find them because of the rediculous size of the starting 'forest' area
-They recently added in some new things, namely red planks, black planks, and cherry blossom trees/sapplings as an homage to the first 'translation' for the game being Japanese
-They finally added a penalty for not protecting your flag!  This is a good thing, trust me
-They fixed some issues with folks being unable to properly jump up blocks, again, a good thing

I will continually update this review as things in the game change/are tweeked, with devider lines like notable above this 'addition' to the review.  I still feel that the game simply does not have enough content in it's current itteration, to justify the price, yes the things in the game look nice visually (grass/stone are actually textured if you get close enough to them you can see this) but there is simply not enough to do currently to justify $20, $10 sure no problem, $15 your kinda pushing it, but $20, in this current state, is a bit overly high, like starbucks coffee, it is overpriced for the amount of what you get.
[/strike]
=================================================================
[strike]
so: just a heads up folks don't get Colony Survival unless you reaaaaaaally want it and don't just wanna try it to see if you like it it will keep a task of it's self open in the backround to tick up the time so you can't return it which is pretty damn shadey.

It also has such a lack of content in it's current state that early alpha minecraft had more actual content, for less money.

When enough content is added to justify the price tag, I will likely change this review, until then though, I want this to be a warning to people so they know what to expect.

There are maybe 2 dozen things you can build, and less naturally occuring blocks in the game
Guards tend to waste arrows by all shooting one creature at the same time
It's pretty much just endless forests, and occasionally some sand/water if your lucky, or after 8, in game days of travel, maaaaybe you'll stumble across a baren tundra.
Alot of the harvestable blocks serve no purpose than to take up a slot in the stockpile (leaves)
Grass doesn't grow, so if you have dirt you don't wanna see, you gotta go find grass blocks or buy them at a trader

You can have fun with the game in the sense that you can build and see things 'progress' to an extent, but unless your just looking to make a ren fair in a game, don't expect to have much to do.
[/strike]

author: {'steamid': '76561198075372619', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 402, 'last_played': 1644123277}
review: I bought this game as a recommendation from my friend, and I have to say, I'm quite intrigued by all of the gameplay elements. Him and I like to play modpacks in Minecraft, so we enjoy the complexities and micromanagement aspects of the game that are recurring features here. Our first session was about four hours long and we got our individual colonies up to about sixty-ish people each, totalling about 120 colonists, and the only thing that we regret is that it doesn't have more gameplay elements. Even with the relatively limited gameplay, it managed to capture our attention for quite some time, and for this reason I can't wait until the game is implemented with new and improved mechanics, building blocks, enemies, plants, functions, employment types, and so much more. Usually I don't especially like buying early access games, but I'm glad I dropped twenty dollars for this one, as I am now allowing the devs to spend more and more time making this the masterpiece it has the potential to become.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003613881', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 9071, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2079, 'last_played': 1672027867}
review:
So I have had this game for three days and just to let you know my opinion of the game I have already put 30+ hours into the game.  This game is suprisingly addictive if you enjoy managing a kingdom and manually building what you want to build.

I was introduced to the game by watching a youtuber (Draegast) it looke dinteresting so I decided to pick it up.  My first colony I started was in a flat plain kind of area with a lot of forests around I had a little bit of an idea of what to do from watching the youtuber play but it was still a bit challenging figuring everything out.  I let the colony grow for a while got it up to about 300 people then realised that my game looks extremely similar to all the other screenshots i have seen of the game.  Small village/castle in a lush green forest so I stoped that town.  I then went to start a new game and before placing down my flag I figured i would do a little exploreing to find someplace I had not seen yet and I did.  I came to some pretty impressive Snow caped mountains with some tagia redish grash just below the snow caps. I climbed to the top and saw a most awesome view and I looked out I could see even more snow caped mountains that were even taller than the one I was on stretching out to the edges of my view distance (which isnt as much as my pc could handle maby having a option to increase it would be nice).  So I decided to plant my flag and start setting up shop but before I recruited any colonists I grabed my bow and waited the first night to see if any of the monsters would come they didnt.  I realised that they would not start ot attack me till after I had recruited my first colonist so I set about building and getting ready for when I would start to get attacked.  So I striped off all the snow from the top of my montain as well as all 10 layers of stone and dirt down to the edge of the red grass (that took a feew in game months to do).  Then i set abotu tunneling down to the bottom of the world were I could start gathering ore since I new I would need iron to make more arrows (also took about a month to dige that whole).  Once that was done i started recruiting and building up my colonists.  Leting them farm in my farmland made from dirst hauled up the side of the montain.  Letting my archers rain death down on all the monsters stupid enough to make the climb.  It has grown and grown and has spilled over the edges of the montain in all areas except one that is a winding maze for the monsters to work there wy threw the whole time being attacked by archers and getting decimated during their acent up the sides.  However ont he survace my montaintop is just that some walls that stretch down the sides of th emontain to accomidate more amd more farmland and a small tower that is as tall as the montain used to be with my flag on top.  But I needed room for my people and the vantage point my archers have was to perfect to try expanding down the sides of the montain so, I decided to go down somewere else more specifically I went down my mine shaft that I had dug for iron and the other recourses available at the bottom and used that long winding stairway to make a Vast underground city.  I had always wondered Why dwarfs were always portraied as living in montains.  Now I know why.  10/10 will build on a mountain again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985550665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 25287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12123, 'last_played': 1607043088}
review:
Ok so I just picked up this game and i must say for an alpha game that just came out it is looking pretty good. Amazing concept. It is like my dream come true! all those empty minecraftian homes now filled with ai that work with you. You actually feel like a king in your kindom and not just a player in your giant model castle (minecraft) As long as long as they keep adding content (which is its obvious sticking point) this game is on track to becoming legendary. For the record. I would like to see them come out with much more content. Warriors that melee the monsters. Diffrent types of monsters. Combat animations. Scouting parties and explorable pois or procedural generated content. Please oh Please god keep adding and adding more stuff with little time in between. I can't wait to see where this game goes and i have faith this game will be epic when its done! Can't believe i am having this much fun with so little content!

Update: This game has now been out for almost a year and the developrs are still constantly cranking out content. Though i am slightly concerned about the direction they plan to take this game. It is just a slight concern and even if they take it there is still far worth the money spent and guaranteed days and days of fun. I think i would play alot more now adays if they gave us way more reasons to explore outside our banner radius. Right now its still a city in a bubble. However thats ok its still alot of fun. But i do see many ways they could make this and even more amazing game than it already is. Bad ass game. Keep it up Devs!

author: {'steamid': '76561198016419675', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 3279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1114, 'last_played': 1649706371}
review:
Tolle Aufbauspiel ala Minecraft und bisl Forest Village

Man muss es sich so vorstellen, du bist der König oder Königin. Alles was du herstellen und abbauen kannst, können deine Bürger dann auch, allerdings nur 1 Aufgabe pro Bürger. 
Am Anfang lohnt sich ein Beerenfeld, da es sofort Nahrung gibt (Nahrung ist das A und O). Dann baut man einen Bogenschützenplatz und die erste Nacht kann kommen. Am Anfang baut man nicht wirklich Mauern, da sonst die Sicht des Bogenschützens beeinträchtigt ist. Mit dem dritten Bürger baut man ein Weizenfeld. Nun lässt man sich ein wenig Zeit und wartet bis das Weizenfeld gewachsen ist und man es abernten kann. Wenn es soweit ist, baut man eine Steinmühle um Mehl herzustellen und einen Backofen. 
Ohhh es kommen jetzt mehr Zombies in der Nacht (hängt nämlich davon ab wie viele Bürger man hat) ergo stellt man einen zweiten Bogi etwas weiter weg. Ich hatte am Anfang die Betten (die werden benötigt für Bürger) im Freien gestellt.
Erst ab 12 Bürger habe ich mich wirklich um ein großes Haus (später war es eine Burg) gekümmert.
Ich stellte dann an jede Ecke einen  Bogi. In der Zwischenzeit habe ich gemerkt das 1 Getreidefeld bei weitem nicht ausreicht, ergo wurden schnell noch weitere Gebaut. Die benötigten Erze findet man ganz weit unten im Erdreich. Am Anfang baut man die noch selber ab und später......genau^^........lässt man Bürger eben Eisen, Kohle etc abbauen.
Bin jetzt bei 40 Bürgern und leider habe ich jetzt schon alles ausgeschöpft, was man so bauen kann bzw. die Bürger abbauen und bebauen können.

Fazit Early Access ist gelungen. Preis (aktuell 19.99 Euro) in meinen Augen etwas zu hoch (nach 5 Std alles mögliche erbaut und gecraftet).
Jetzt könnte ich einfach die Stadt meines Traumes erbauen mit Schlössern etc..... aber irgendwie fehlt jetzt bischen was.
Ich hoffe es kommt noch mehr von den Entwicklern, dafür sollten 20 Euro schon reichen um noch mehr Items, Resourcen etc einzubauen :-) :-)
Z.B. Angeln (Fische), andere Getreidesorten, Nutztiere (Kühe, Schweine, Hühner etc), dadurch andere Nahrung als nur Brot und Beeren, bessere Verteidigungsanlagen (Katapulte, Balisten etc) oder einfach div. Werkzeuge (beginnend am Anfang aus Holz und Stein, später aus Eisen, Stahl, Titan etc)

Aktuell Daumen HOCH ...... (ändert sich wenn nichts mehr eingebaut wird von Entwicklern^^)

Gebe dem Spiel aktuell 7 von 10 Punkten

author: {'steamid': '76561198108549333', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2024, 'last_played': 1599440444}
review:
I never leave reviews on games, almost ever, doesn't matter what the game does wrong/right. But I feel like I have to leave a review on this one. If you asked me if you should get this game, I would say absolutely, yes! It has so much potential I wish I could skip into the future solely to see where this game went. However, it is still in early access, which means bugs and emptiness. What I mean by emptiness is, this game has very little content currently, and I would like to make a few suggestions to the creators.

Enemies:
There should definitely be more enemy types. Maybe after a certain amount of nights a ranged type appears that can deal with your archers easier? Or maybe just another type of zombie that can run fast or jump high, or at least survive more than one hit. There should also be some kind of boss, maybe after you reach 200-300 colonists, a super monster appears that can break blocks, has lots of health, and can reach your archers easier.

Colonists:
For this game to have variety, there needs to be much more jobs. The creators have an amazing concept with this and they need to take a hold of it and use it to its most. I suggest making more types of guards (melee, cavalry, maybe some kind of AOE attacker?) and also, more domestic jobs. The one I would like to see most is a builder. Maybe make it possible for you to make an outline of something like you do with farming, set the materials, set the hight, and tell them to go make it. Another idea would be to make something, and then select it and use the builders as a type of copy/paste, tell them where to build, and then have them build a copy of what you built. This would be amazing and would allow you to make huge kingdoms much faster.

Player Character:
There definitely needs to be some kind of tier system. Probably with armor and weapons, a bit like Minecraft, you know, having armor and weapons made out of different materials that are stronger/weaker than just your normal bow. You could also find rare types of materials from monster drops that can be crafted into multiple different things. Also, for controls, please add a way to crouch so that you can go to the edge of a block without accidentally falling off to you death while your building a tower. Also, I've noticed that sometimes when you go to the edge of a block, you kind of get stuck, and aren't able to walk back to the middle. I'm still not sure if this is an attempt at achieving what I was just talking about or simply is a bug.

Blocks/Materials:
This is also extremely important. There needs to be many more blocks. Glass, stairs, sloped blocks, and all different shapes and sizes should be added. This alone would make the game seem much bigger and more developed. I'm assuming gypsum will be used sometime in the future? Can't wait to see it (unless I just haven't reached the point where you use it.)

I know that many of you potential buyers might be put off by this list of things that the game still needs, but seriously, it is a great game and you should get now, not only because it will shoot up in price and popularity, but because even with such little content, it is an extremely good game that can keep you occupied for many many hours.

Bugs: Also, the most noticable bug that I have found is, if you dig a straight staircase into the ground and don't make extra room above your head, when you climb back up it, you will glitch through the ground and are able to fly extremely fast under the surface, before popping back out of the ground wherever you want (I actually found this one quite useful).

Thank you for reading, I can't wait to see this game's future!

Edit:
So, after writing this I remembered a few more things. First off, there is already multiplayer where each player in the server gets their own colony, so you know what needs to be added next... COLONY WARS!!! This would be absolutely amazing. The second thing I wanted to say is, I built a huge wall around my colony, it worked, kept a bunch of the zombies out, but I ran out of space to expand so I figured I would make another layer, named them Wall Rose and Wall Maria. However, once I made the second layer, I realised that the zombies simply spawned inside of it, and I think my time may have been wasted on this endeavor. I'm not sure what the requirements are for a zombie to spawn (darkness, trees, etc) but could you please make it possible to build a huge wall to protect your colony?

author: {'steamid': '76561197980826816', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 931, 'last_played': 1547879131}
review:
Being a huge minecraft person, I saw Colony Survival and just had to have it, for a change from minecraft. For a voxel game that has only been out a couple weeks at most, and being early access at that, this game is pretty dope. I really like the HD textures and the near/far camera focusing. I would however like to see more added to the game in a major update/patch. Things like ladders and stairs, because lets be honest, the space bar is getting angry from tapping it so much going up and down the blocks to the mining areas then back up top again.

I am also hoping the devs add in more food choices for farming, as well as maybe some fishing, for added food. I did notice for the food they show how much food is consumed during the day, I would like to see a comparison of how much food is being made vs. how much is consumed each day. 

Back to the textures, the HD textures are great! But the water.....omg.....looks like foamy clouds shifting back and forth on the ground. They def need to improve on the water textures. Not much to build with as of yet. You get stone bricks and wood, later you get clay and some type of smooth stone. I would like to be able to do something with the sand that you can dig up. maybe some kind of sandstone or something. 

But overall the gameplay is great. Once you get past the first couple days and get your food output equalized with the number of colonists you have, it goes pretty smoothly. Just make sure you have enough guards to keep the zombies away from your front door and you'll be ok.

Bought it yesterday and already have 14.4 hours into it, love it and will continue to play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126088535', 'num_games_owned': 54, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2097, 'last_played': 1580862784}
review:
Everyone compares this game to Minecraft, but honestly apart from the cubes it's more like The Sims. Yes, it's open world/sandbox, but really the most important part of the game is the colonists. They're adorable--you instinctively want to protect them and personally I get a warm happy feeling when the birds start singing in the morning and they file out to get to work. 
The only downside is that right now, there really isn't a lot of content because the game is early access. You will have explored everything the game has to offer only a few hours in--but so far I've been playing for several days with the same old content and it's STILL NOT STALE! Sure, there isn't a whole lot of diverse stuff to do and explore just yet, but the colony mechanics are so simple and fun that you never get tired of them. The creativity and diversity comes from the players!!! I've seen people build sky bases, underground caverns, and good old fashioned castles. Everyone's colony playstyle is different--some people like to have as many colonists as possible, while others want to build the most fantastic base. The fun of this game is in the wacky civilizations you can contrive!
Also--unlike Minecraft, there are very few assholes in multiplayer. When I first started playing multiplayer, I would get a stab of fear every time a new player joined because, having experienced Minecraft, I thought they'd immediately begin destroying everything and trolling. But so far, they never have. 
This game can only get better from here. 7/10 as it is (early access), 10/10 when looking excitedly to the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094749892', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 3968, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1124, 'last_played': 1639853617}
review:
O jogo é muito bom, tem uma ideia de solidão no começo mas depois que começa a fazer os trabalhos com os aldeões fica melhor. AINDA está bem no começo mas depois de um gamplay de 5 ou 6 horas eu e meus amigos já sabíamos exatamente oque faltava e que  poderiam colocar muitas coisas novas essenciais como por exemplo: 

Portões e portas - os zumbis ficam tentando entrar de qualquer forma mas seria interessante colocar os portões com um tipo de barra de saúde, assim se os zumbis atacassem muito ela quebraria deixando a invasão proceguir.

Drop de itens - eu procurei infinitamente o botão se drop para soltar alguém para para meu amigo pois os dele acabaram, mas eu não encontrei.. não sei se tem uma função de largar,soltar ou jogar fora.

Novos objetos de furnitude - como cadeiras, mesas, armários, estátuas e decoração. 

Armas - o arco em si é muito bom, porém pra diversificar poderia ter outro tipo de armas como espada ou uma lança.

Npc - novas funções para os Npc como um guarda diferente, um com outro tipo de armas. E uma nova profissão.

Mapa - seria muito produtivo sabermos onde estamos, pra onde vamos e quem está perto.

Mundo - como disse no começo você tem a sensação de estar sozinho de mais. Por isso acho que algums animais não fariam mal também no mundo. Como pequenos animais e até mesmo alguns agrecivos.

Facções - nada melhor que um grupo fechado de melhores pessoas jogando junto. Criem facções em nossos reinos!

Divisão de território - é horrível quando alguém começa a tirar e a mexer em nossas coisas, se pudéssemos por nossas coisas e somente nos ou quem for da nossa facção tirar seria muito melhor e menos frustrante.

Monstros - soldados inimigos, barbaros, vikings. Qualquer coisa a mais seria muito legal.

Enfim. O jogo é muito bom mesmo na fase 0.2 e olha que sei que adicionarão muitas milhares de coisas eu estou adorando jogar e continuarei aguardando novas surpresas. Eu super recomendo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198312838541', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3063, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2579, 'last_played': 1500487965}
review:
初期感想：
すごくおもしろいです。普通設定で15時間連続でつくって130人ぐらい簡単にいけました。
雰囲気無視で効率重視の建築をするとぬるげーになるんで
雰囲気を作りながら、大量のゾンビに攻められる俺の最強都市って感じを
作りながら都市計画を考えてるときが一番おもしろいんだとおもいます。

※ゾンビは人が多いところを優先して向かってくるみたいなので
　進撃の巨人のように壁をつくって敵を倒す感じを作ると面白いです。

やりはじめる方へ：
作業ボックスのバグで、まだ細かい数字振り分けできないので
常にマックス指示でBOTに生産をランダムで任せてます。

言語は日本語化が進んでるので、最初に迷子になること少ないです。

板の種類が二種類ありますが、タイガ？のほうは、作られないし使うことないです。
板の温帯を作る指示を設定すると、自動でタイガも設定されます。

食料問題は、最初はベリーファーマーを選んで作ると楽です。
小麦農家で小麦つくったら、Grindstone で粉Flourにします。
オーブンつくってパンできます。これがメイン食になります。

木は、土か草あると地下でも育ちます。
逆に施設の屋上に土草を置くと、小麦とか育ちます。

生産の最高位アイテムは、加工の板とアドベのレンガですが
色が微妙なので使いみちなく溜め込んでますｗｗ

author: {'steamid': '76561198009775253', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1017, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 716, 'last_played': 1595915238}
review:
I bought this on somewhat of a whim yesterday, and I'm not disappointed. I can tell I'm going to get a lot of hours out of this game. Calling it "Banished meets Minecraft" might be simplistic, but it has that feel. If you pay attention and read through the little introduction / help manual (F1), getting started should be fairly simple.

Mechanics so far seem pretty solid. On a decent Win 10 machine (AMD 6x, 8GB ram, GTX 970) I didn't have any crashes or major bugs. I'm happy with the path-finding of the AI. I didn't build anything too crazy at first, but later added a giant tree with a "branch" that held a flax garden, and the villager had no problem navigating up the winding staircase to get to it. The monsters seemed to wander when my colony was smaller and were only a problem when they happened to get near the entrance to my walls, but now at "colony size 3" (30+) they seem a lot more focused on getting in, and there are a lot more.

With the right setup, the game isn't too hard. I have four archers covering a 2x20 "entrance" with a stock of 300 arrows and at 31 villagers, the monsters don't get further in than about 4 blocks, and that's rare. I haven't checked to see if I can change the number of monsters at any time, but the devs have included a "2x monsters" option at map creation.

The downside is that the game is still in EA, which means there are a limited number of things to do. My modest village has 4k food in storage and uses around 150-200 food/day. I have every resource possible, and for the most part a lot of it. That being said, there's a lot of potential here and even in it's current state, I like building and creating in games enough that I'll definitely get my money's worth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031592079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 20171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 724, 'last_played': 1701119855}
review:
Das Konzept ist stimmig und der (noch wenige) vorhandene Content soweit gut implementiert. Es fehlen noch viele Animationen und die Grafik ist generell noch bescheiden. Nichts desto trotz hat es mich bis jetzt 15 Stunden zu unterhalten geschafft.
Nach zwei kleineren Anläufen baute ich mal eine grosse Burg und habe die Einstellungen härter gestellt (Zombies tagsüber, doppelt so viele). Auf diese Weise war es doch ab und an fordernd.

Ich hoffe, die Entwickler machen fleissig weiter und fügen nun vor zu den Inhalt ein. Ich freue mich jedenfalls darauf.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136970957', 'num_games_owned': 296, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1503767809}
review:
Nach 2 Stunden SpielZeit auf einem vom Freund gehosteten Servers komm ich zum folgenden Fazit:

[h1]Grafik:[/h1] [b]9/10 Punkten[/b]
Wer denkt es ist bloß ein billiges Minecraft Double, der täuscht sich hier. Die Grafik sieht viel besser aus und hat auch 3Dimensionale Effekte wie Schatten(Auch in den Blöcken Selber) und EntfernungsUnschärfe. Zwar hat es nicht grad die Grafik die man in The Division oder Grand Theft Auto V bekommt. Aber es hat eine gut gelungene eingebaut bekommen die sich Sehen lässt. Bloß die Verschwommenheit wenn man nah an Blöcke kommt ist manchmal etwas nerfig.

[h1]Overlay:[/h1] [b]10/10 Punkten[/b]
Das Overlay im Menü ist schnell zu kappieren. Alles ist ordentlich beschriftet und man findet sich gut zurecht.

[h1]Tutorial:[/h1] [b]10/10 Punkten[/b]
Das Tutorial ist In-Game und nicht im Menü. Ebenfalls ist es kein Scenario sondern schriftlich. Dies kann man jeder Zeit(wenn nicht geändert) mit F1 öffnen.


[h1]Steuerung:[/h1] [b]10/10 Punkten[/b]
Das Bewegen basiert auf der Standard Steuerung wie fast in jedem Spiel. Es gibt auch ein Handbuch als PDF-Datei.

[h1]Gameplay:[/h1] [b]10/10 Punkten[/b]
Das Spielprinzip basiert auf einen Städtebau. Man kann Kolonisten rufen die dann gewisse Arbeiten wie Nahrung anbauen und verarbeiten, Erze abbauen und schmelzen, etc. für den Spieler machen. In den Nächten kommen Zombies je nachdem wieviele Bewohner schon existieren.


KomplettFazit:  [b]49/50 Punkte[/b] für das Spiel und damit eine Kaufempfehlung meinerseits

author: {'steamid': '76561198086686594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 273, 'last_played': 1499008449}
review:
Knee jerk comment - It's another Minecraft clone!

Except that it isn't. The major and grindy part of Minecraft is the digging and crafting. You want ot build massive citties and not be on a creative server, right? This will let you do just that with while doing a little civic planning. Design your base to be nigh impregnable from the hordes that stalk the night and make it look good while doing it with plaster, bricks, wood planks or just the random raw materials to get from the world. The depth of involvement in your new community is entirely up to you. If you do enjoy doing it all, you can. If you just want to build, great! Assign your plebs to do all the menial things while you build the monument to all things about yourself.


To the Devs - Bring back the Bricks please!

author: {'steamid': '76561198057952888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 946, 'last_played': 1673068518}
review:
Honestly the game turned out better than I expected - except one horribly inane flaw. the character jump height is obviously set for just above one block. Like literally a pixel higher than a block. 7/10 times I can't even get up my own stairs. 
If they really feel that itty bitey space is enough room for jump error, then for God's sake make actual stairs or ladders or anything. 
Otherwise its tons of fun so far. But i'm putting it down till something happens with this whole "can't even climb my own stairs bs." 
Would i recommend? Its fun, but needs alil more time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079894406', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1578, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1148, 'last_played': 1512692067}
review:
Bomb ass game. Basically build your own civilization from day 1. If you like that concept, youll like this game. Its pretty limited right now with the things you can do, but I know for a fact that the updates the devs come up with will make the game SOOO much better. The game came out on steam june 16th and they've already added a new update with berry farmers and a grinder(make flour and thus make bread) and before the only way to obtain food was from wheat fields. 

The only thing I dont really like about it right now is the difficulty level of the zombies. They all die with one shot and theres no variety. As your colony grows, the amount of zombies that come each night increases. Right now im at around 126? colonists. And the wave is quite large. But against my forty something archers, they cant really do anything. 

The game also has incredible graphics, a very pretty game, very relaxing, quite serene. With (hopefully) added biomes, different types of zombies, new gamemodes, creative mode, more blocks, more jobs, and mechanics, this game will turn out to be a hit. BUT, the game literally just came out. So give it a break, I know the devs are working hard and they already pumped out an update after 6 days. 

I would reccommend this game highly. Its fun for what there is, and updates to come will make it even more of a blast!

author: {'steamid': '76561198007027903', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 665, 'last_played': 1516286713}
review:
Initial thoughts ==========================================================================

All I can say is: FINALLY. 

I have been waiting for a game that allows one to be immersed in the creation of a society instead of floating around the top of it telling it what to do. This game is what I have been looking for FOR YEARS. I can not wait to see where it goes. 

For people who are looking into buying the game =================================================

It's in early stages, there isn't a whole lot to it yet. But what IS there shows an immense amount of promise. 

The lighting engine is gorgeous and the bump map on the block textures is wonderful. 

You have a decent selection of building materials for a game that's this early in the process. 

There are ragdoll physics (!!) when a colonist or a monster is killed. (it's amusing when a monster ends up pushing a dead monster around until the body despawns) 

As far as GAMEPLAY goes, it's got a similar feel to Minecraft. You will start out with some materials so you can get your colony started. Otherwise you just have to mine resources until you can assign a colonist to do the work. At night when everyone goes to sleep, monsters will come out. You just have to make sure they don't attack your colonists! Otherwise the only real goal is to keep getting bigger and bigger and bigger until you have a city! 

For the developers ====================================================================

You guys are fantastic. Keep up the incredible work! I will try to be here along the way and I can not wait to see how you and the game will grow. I looked at the roadmap and that's a pretty solid plan. I do have a few questions/thoughts that popped in my head as I played the game. 

Will you be adding more materials like glass and various forms of stairs? 

Will there be any sort of factory automation aspects to the game? It would be really cool to have some sort of mid to end game  factorization. Like a colonist would be needed to shovel coal into a boiler for a steam turbine. Conveyor belts/pipes used to transport resources. 

I also couldn't help thinking about the colonists themselves. I want to build them individual homes but I don't see a point if all they need is a bed. I saw the point about the happiness on the roadmap. Perhaps quality of housing/living arrangements could have an effect on that? 

My final thought is families. It would be neat if colonists would develop "feelings" for other colonists and create families so that they all live in a house together. That would also probably require a name feature for the colonists. 

==================================================================================

That's all I really have to say haha, food for thought! It's a great game and I really hope it goes far. I wish only the best for the developers. 

I hope this was helpful! 

- Uncle Don

author: {'steamid': '76561197993187270', 'num_games_owned': 384, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1324, 'last_played': 1672081821}
review:
Was in the market for another builder/survival time killer when I saw one of the YouTubers I follow playing this. Decided to give it a go, though I has hesitant with the cost on yet another Early Access game. Been burned before.  I've "beaten" the game to the point that my colony has an overabundance of food, the "zombies" can't get past my guards and I have enough beds for everyone with room to grow if needed.  First update I got, pointed out to the devs that a tooltip needed updating, and less than 3 min after getting a direct response, the game was updated.

There is much room for growth in this, and I'm looking forward to seeing what they add. Right now it's very bare bones, though there might be more on the multiplayer side (I don't play well with others) but as for what I was looking for, it delivered and has the promise to be much more down the line.

review: Game is very rough.  It is not clear from the videos but this is a Minecraft ripoff with subpar menu navigation and not a game like Dwarf Fortress or a Real Time Strategy god game.  The only perk is the ability to create NPCs that do things but the menus to do that are cumbersome. author: {'steamid': '76561198296095167', 'num_games_owned': 85, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1726, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 853, 'last_played': 1543638662}
review:
首先这游戏有汉化，不过非常重要的操作说明却还是英文的。。。
“1”是选择工种；
“2”是插旗或者招人；
“3、4、5、6、7、8、9、0”分别对应那几个物品栏；
按住鼠标左键是拆物品；
鼠标右键是建造物品；
i键是合成栏加共享仓库（和AI共享）；
建造田地：先按1选择类型，然后用鼠标右键选取范围。选好后再按1再按鼠标右键就好了。
个人照明：G
床或箭袋摆放方向：按R调试方向
WASD移动，不能跳跃。shift是跑。


前期很好玩，但建造完成后基本就没事可干了，丧尸太弱。后期人数越多就会吸引来越多的丧尸导致游戏非常卡（尤其在服务器里多人游戏时，夜晚卡的什么都干不了）。
推荐这款游戏，但感觉价格有一点高于他的可玩性了。




以上是17年的测评，现在我改为了差评。原因很简单，曾经许诺的汉化快3年了还没有更新一丁点。

author: {'steamid': '76561198000637671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 29922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 780, 'last_played': 1680736163}
review: This game is off to a great start. Game play is like mine craft but with a tower defense aspect. Content seems quite limited in that after a couple hours you will have built everything there is to build then it starts to feel a bit like a scaling grind. Needs more defensive weapons/units, more variety in zombies/attackers, more block types (steps/slopes). Noticed some big issues with AI and pathing. Great job so far to the devs, Ill be keeping a close eye on this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198270927816', 'num_games_owned': 46, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9716, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 466, 'last_played': 1709099129}
review:
wonderful set up, intuitive controls, just needs more expansion, the one negative thing i have found so far is that once you get to where your economy is set, then there isnt anything else to do... you can build bigger but as long as you place your flag outside the castle you dont even have to deal with the night zombies unless you dont lock yourself up.there are some loop holes that can easily be exploited that really make the game too easy and then there is the lack of challange after setting your economy up. Even when keeping the flag inside your base,  if you have just 1 enterance and 4 archers creating a box they decimate the biggest rush of zombies the gaem can create.

still though, awesome premisses and i am really looking forward to see where the developers take this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079454685', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1562509311}
review:
Honestly speaking, this game is going places. Colony Survival has a ton of POTENTIAL to be a fantastic game, but as it sits right now, there just isn't much to do, craft, and the monsters are pretty wimpy. I have two "guards" at my front gate and they can easily kill entire hordes of zombies. 

As it sits I'd reccomend it, because it has the potential to be a great game given time and funding, and i'd buy it before they hike up the price like Mojang did with Minecraft.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066720615', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 2342, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 790, 'last_played': 1662509829}
review:
Been playing this game since the 16th. Honestly I love every second of it. I can't really say what's wrong with it or what needs improvement, there are more in-depth reviews that perfectly describe its state. The game looks amazing and I love walking around and looking at my loyal citizens work hard. Get it, damn it.

UPDATE: I wrote the above review years ago and have since then come back and had another playthrough of the game. Since my last time playing it seems to have improved and added a lot of new roles for your colonists, more things to research, and tons more. The devs have been adding consistent features. I would still recommend it!

review: Where do i start, the game just came out but is asking $20.00 which is pretty high, i gave it a chance tho, i get they have updates but this game for what is has should be like $5-$10 max, what really set me over the edge was the fact i built a whole colony, had 60+ colonists with over 4k bread, i was set! well i logged off, woke up and started my server, my whole server was there, everythign i built! but it started over.. so it said i had no beds when i had over 80 beds, it gave me another banner and it said i had no colonist or items but everything was still right in front of me, isntantly asked for a refund and i wouldnt play this game if it was free! terrible game.

review: Played this over the early access weekend.  Fantastic game, lots of fun both in Singleplayer and Multiplayer.  Had absoutely no issues with the game, was flawless.   Only thing I disliked is that it really needs to be fleshed out more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054193192', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 248, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1498082751}
review:
So far the game is pretty elementary. Once you get about 12 colonists farming the basic stuff it is a pretty self sufficient game in terms of supplies so the difficulty of playing is gone by then. There are other settings that increase difficulty by allowing more monsters during the day but it would not change the difficulty much. The videos you see on the store page are accurate as what you could do but why would you? Your colony is on auto pilot and all you are doing is scaling up more of the same. Perhaps more texture packs and building options would help but when I log in now I just watch my workers work and kill monsters at night and think wow this is it. The game has the potential to go farther with continued development and that depends on just two people at the moment. 

My only real gripe is personal as I am an older gamer and mouse and keyboard gaming is getting rather uncomfortable so controller support would be nice. This is strictly a creature comfort issue though and not a knock to the game. 

Since I like early access games I dont mind paying for them, but if you have a budget pass on this until it develops a little more. Eighteen dollars (US) at the moment may be a bit steep for the redundancy of the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138843381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2061, 'last_played': 1658001933}

author: {'steamid': '76561197993109528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 599, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1573341917}
review:
I was intrigued by the premise of Colony Survival when I saw it scroll past on my recommended list. I like games where you have resources to manage and base building as a part of your success, so figured I'd give this a shot. 

During my few hour stay in the game, I was pleased with the gameplay and the block textures. Future content updates will do wonders for the replayability, as of right now you follow a pretty simple cycle. You build your base, add workers, feed workers, provide jobs for your workers, and add a guard or two. Then you wait for night to pass, and you go back to that same cycle.  There's a really solid foundation to build off of here. The game would initially benefit greatly from added variety and challenges. 

My main complaints lie with the controls, especially when placing blocks and moving about the terrain. It just feels sloppy and not very precise. I'm hoping this improves as the devs deliver some updates, the future is bright!

author: {'steamid': '76561198194364343', 'num_games_owned': 661, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 10156, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4811, 'last_played': 1686709591}
review:
Have a social life? A job? Anything you need to get done this month? Don't buy this game. If you do, well, kiss your wife, your job, and anything else you were planning on doing goodbye for a while, because you won't be standing up much after this purchase. 

It's extremely addicting, and it has a learning curve. The graphics aren't that great, but, after you understand the mechanics, it's super fun! I do intend to make a comprehensive guide on making aesthetically-pleasing, yet defensible and efficient colonies very soon, and I would reccomend new players read up before jumping in, because it's easy to get destroyed if you don't know how to train the Zombie Horde to walk into traps. 

I reccomend that anyone who enjoys building, tower defense, or just seeing your creative solutions come to life check out this game. 

SIDE EFFECTS: YOU MAY LOSE YOUR JOB FOR NOT SHOWING UP FOR ABOUT A WEEK AFTER DOWNLOADING

author: {'steamid': '76561197962849564', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 17793, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1588, 'last_played': 1565392949}
review:
Although this game may have potential, I dont think Its much more than a tower defence game right now.. enclose everything you own and leave just one entrance that lets the monster in at night, surround it with archers and your done. 
Command your collonist, well that's not true, you can assign them a jobs but that's not commanding.Build a village, well I was expecting them to be building their houses, but that's not true either, you have to build everything yourself.. (you can build just about everything without ever recruiting any collonists)
I do like it, like I said it has potential, but the lack of doing anything other than building yourself a defence leaves the game a bit flat and theres not enough in it right now.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007899390', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2540, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1683940040}
review: needs more materials and content in general but for 20$ and only early access so far its great. Essentially a dumbed down (so far) minecraft minus the tedious rescource collection.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020277065', 'num_games_owned': 329, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 10984, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1589755870}
review:
Colony Survival is a great game that offers what most RTS players always wanted when they played games like Minecraft, or even games such as Rust. This game is for the people who like to have others work for their empire, colony, kindgom, or whatever you want to call it. You can have others (NPCs) do the hard work for you, such as farm and mine, while you can continue to build and expand the kingdom yourself!

Colony Survival needs a lot more features but for right now in its current VERY early alpha stage, I can recommend this game! I have had a lot of fun so far and I have plans for my castle so I have a lot more time to put into this game even before they start to release more features.

It's a great game and it's a game I have been looking for for a long time!

Overall, it's a good game and the amount of potential it has will surely see this game gaining more popularity if the devs add more content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116999420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1497986331}
review:
[h1]Okay, an honest reveiw[/h1]

Note: I played this game on another account, I only own it on this one.

Summary at the bottom ->

Okay, so I saw a youtuber play this (Draegast) and I really liked the concept, so even after the rather steep 20$ price tag I decided to get it. Since then (the 18th of June, review written on the 20th) I have put in roughly 20 hours. My colony is up to 289 people, I have 43,000 food in reserves and it grows a thousand or so every day. I have massive walls and gates around my multi-castle city with a ton of guards with 10,000 arrows in storage, and the zombie horde has gotten to be pretty big every night (too many to count, all around my castle, occasionally overwhelming and killing my gaurds. Overal, I have had great fun with the game so far and cannot wait to get my colony up to 500 or even 1000 colonists, with a city as far as the eye can see (or my PC can render). 

That being said however, this game does have some pretty serious flaws that almost makes the game broken.

 First of all, while I was beginning my colony, It would randomly go into seige mode, so my food consumption would be multiplied by 6. Early on this wrecked my colony, and it took me awhile to figure out why. Even though my Banner was still in the open, my colonist's autopathing could not find a bed, so it put me into seige mode, I fixed this issue by putting several barracks around, but almost made me lose my colony.

Which bring me to my next point: Autopathing. The autopahting for this game is bad, which is even worse for a game that relies so much on it. Ive had colonists get lost in the woods only to be eaten by zombies, colonists deciding to take the path that is 5x longer than the one I made for them, and the zombies at night will pick a block and swarm it (Pretty funny to watch though when there are 50+ of them swarming a tiny area). The game will be much much better once the autopathing is tuned out a bit so my colonists actually go where I need them to go :)

Next, lag spikes. In the beginning, there was none of this of course, but over time ( ~90 colonists or more) the game will have very specific lag spikes. Eventually I figured out that this was because having 30 farms (3,000 wheat blocks, not counting flax or orchards). Overloads the game. I know my PC can run this game very well, and any other time Im always at a constant 60 FPS. I'm not sure what can be done to fix this, but it can ruin the experience when youre fighting off an unusually large horde of zombies with your guards.

Which reminds me... the guards. They fire slow, they all target the same zombie, and theyll either have great range or they wait until they are two blocks away. This makes it rather frustrating because it means I have to put a lot more guards than what seems neccisary, for instance on one wall I have 15 guards, and zombies (even if there arent very many) will still get through. This is frustrating as well, but I've been able to make due with multilayered defenses.

Another problem I have noticed: Zombie Spawning. Around ~150 colonists I started to notice that I would lose 3-15 colonists in one night, seemingly ar random. When I respawned them the next day, I would watch them go to one of my most heavily guarded areas. 30 Minutes before posting this reveiw, I found that I have had zombies spawning in my barracks and city. I do not know what zombie spawning is based off of, but I have tried several things (More lighting, more guards, closed roof, smaller rooms, etc) but I will still lose colonists to zombies spawning in my base. 

There are a few graphical issues as well, for instance the sun is blinding, to the point where I cant see what block I am looking at, its just blinding white. That is also a problem for the UI, as the selection outline for your inventory is white, if you are looking at the sky you will not be able to see what block you are using (inconvienient but not game breaking). Also, if you place a block on a dead zombie, the body (ragdoll physics) flip out and it doesnt look pretty.

[h1]Summary[/h1]

All in all, I have really enjoyed this game. I can't wait for more things to be implemented (new zombies, guards, jobs, blocks, weapons, etc). My city looks really cool I think at night (even with hundreds of zombies pouring in through the gates) and I would really like to play this game more. However, as listed up above, there are several key issues that need to be fixed. I'm really hopeful for this EA game, I know they have a bad reputation, but I've decided to give this one a shot, and I think you should too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198209496343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1589, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1166, 'last_played': 1499111259}
review:
Hey, I'm a gamer who loves to play games and I will review Clolony Survival. I usually don't make game reviews, but there's always a first, right?

Let's first start with what I did so far. The game came out on a Friday and on the Saturday night, I was already at 20 hours played. It is very adicting and very fun. I think I did a 3 hour expedition with my friend and we walked threw every biome and we got to the end of the map to an endless ocean. There are 4-5 different biomes in this game, temperate taiga, toundra, flat snow biome and mountain snow biome. I say 4-5 biomes because the snow biome has an area with very flat lands and then you can meet mountains that are so high, it takes a few in-game days to go across the mountains. 

The temperate biome is usually your normal biome with small to normal sized trees with small to medium lakes and where you usually place your kingdom. You spawn in this region. It's very nice, but also very unoriginal.

Then, when you walk for a bit, you can find the taiga biome. It has a darker kind of grass and different trees. The trees are usually from medium to large sizes. The lakes are small to medium like the temperate biome. 

Then, when you walk for a while, you meet the toundra biome. Definitely the most original and coolest biome. The grass is a kind of red and it looks kind of creepy. There are no trees and it has a few medium sized mountains. One of the coolest factors is the huge lakes. There are masive lakes there that you can't fully render! It isn't a good place to build because it dosen't have trees, but it still is a beautiful place to visit.

Then, when you walk for a long time, you get to the snow biome. This is where you find snow for the steam acheivement. It is probably the biggest biome. There are no trees and no lakes. At first, you encounter this huge flat area that kind of seems endless untill you reach the mountains. They are so gigantic that crossing them takes days! You can get a bunch of great screenshots there. After a very long time of walking on the snow biome, you finally reach and endless ocean where you can see a beautiful sunrise/sunset.

So that is it for the biomes, now let's talk about the textures. At first glance, it looks like minecraft or any block game. But when you get closer to textures you can actually see that they have 3D textures. It looks amazing because it makes everything look so much more real. Even though some materials look fluffy, they did a great job on the leaves. There is also a blur effect when you look at stuff that are close. You can see the object very clearly, but the far away stuff become blurry like in real life.

The games is not hard at first, but if you have two kingdoms close to each other, so many zombies spawn that the server seriously lags at night. It gets hard to shoot the zombies how laggy it becomes, but during day you're fine. I suggest not building to close to someone or their zombies might attack you!

Making a server for your friends is also really easy!

Improvements: This game has just lauched last week so of course it is not complete yet. They should add more blocks. Mostly different coloured blocks. When you get at a certain point, you don't need to work anymore, you just want to build and when you want to build something colorful, well you can't. There is no block in the game that is blue. Also they should allow you to change your render distance because when you explore the snow mountains, you don't see much because it's not all rendered! But the thing they need to change the most is the public multiplayer. I went on a server once and someone found my place. Other people can destroy your things, they can build on your land and you can't even kill them. When someone comes to troll you, you can't do anything about it! It's very fustrating and I strongly beleive they will change it soon.

So, do I recommend it? Of course! It's a great game with a unique style that has a great potential!

author: {'steamid': '76561198201904905', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 674, 'last_played': 1586045465}

author: {'steamid': '76561198010892916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 2010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 33, 'last_played': 1681577620}
review:
This game has a lot of problems right now, archers don't have shooting animations, jumping up blocks is strangely difficult, which is pretty important when trying to run away, and theirs really not much to do once you've "unlocked" everything, which is very little mind you. Honestly I could go on and on with the amount of issues this game has. But it really just boils down to, the game is not worth $20. Maybe it will be later in it's development, but the price is far to high for it's current condition.

Side note: I have around 8 hours in this game, it was mostly in offline mode and steam hasn't registered the time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081297957', 'num_games_owned': 1321, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 372, 'last_played': 1497990529}
review:
好玩！这游戏很有潜力！

author: {'steamid': '76561198107971394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 6922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 858, 'last_played': 1632975587}
review: I recommend this game, I have over 14 hours on this and I am enjoying it a lot. My biggest problem so far is the bad jumping. I don't know why it is so hard to jump. It is very annoying and inconvenient. Other then that I only have suggestions for the developers. More skins for the colonists, add some female for more variety. Add stairs, more blocks, maybe melee weapons and armor whether its for the player or the guards. Both should have it. More enemies, its the same zombies that come every night that my 10 guards easily keep at bay. I definitely recommend getting this game but maybe wait til the full game is released where there will me a lot more content. This game has so much potential, I hope it wasn't just a cash grab.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971430039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 465, 'last_played': 1563948617}
review:
Picked this up after seeing about 5 minutes of a let's play because it looked like fun. This is an amazing basis for a great game and as long as the developer continues to add more content and such, it will be an amazing game.

So this is just a minecraft clone right?
Wrong. It has a lot of similarities to minecraft, but it also has a lot of similarities to dwarf fortress. Whilst you build structures with blocky resources you collect int he world, the reason you do this is to set up a working colony. You build a farm and recruit a farmer. They, in turn, product food for your baker to make into better food. But, as soon as you start recruiting your colonists, zombies will start to attack at night, so you have to recruit guards. This in turn, not only increases the amount of zombies, but also the amount of food you need to remain healthy as a colony... and so it goes!

Currently, the games weakness is that after a few hours you run out of things to do, as once you have a reliable food farming system down, the zombies, even when you get a lot of colonists, don't offer a good challenge. This is fine - as the game IS in early access. As long as the developer is able to build upon the foundation they have laid here this will be an amazing game.

Long story short - if you like Minecraft, Dwarf Fortress, Rise to Ruins, etc. and you actually understand what early access is, give this a go!

author: {'steamid': '76561198352649128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1509490830}

eehhhhh its early access so I wont bite much but theres a few things that need to be tweaked such as;

author: {'steamid': '76561198083606527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1537747696}
review:
So much potential! Enjoyed every second of this game so far.

I thought my first base was safe after 5 nights, with a population of 4 and 1 archer.
I alt tabbed out for the night, and came back to everyone being dead!

Lots of tactics to learn, do you want to build a moat around your base with a bridge, a maze to maximise your archers shooting time, or just have a small army of archers at your entrance?

author: {'steamid': '76561198059840610', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 509, 'last_played': 1618681988}
review:
Very "Minecraft with peasents" kind of game play.

Pros:
  -Pleabs do the work for you
  -Fairly easy to get the hang of
  -Not overly expensive

Cons:
  -Unlimited ore means you don't really have to move or explore much
  -Easily defeated "monsters" makes the survival rather boring once you get a wall / trench set up
  -"Shop" sells just one item and it's entirely for cosmetic purposes so gold and anything tied to it is pretty much useless at this point (June 19, 2017)


Overall, I actually enjoy the game. It has potential to be really amazing but right now, not much more than a (somewhat) creative time killer. If the monsters got stronger over time (ranged attack, more tanky, wall damage?) or there was a periodic event thing (kinda like "7 Days to Die") it might give more drive after the first few days.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995063746', 'num_games_owned': 670, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 860, 'last_played': 1697855959}
review:
This is what I wanted out of minecraft in 2011. If you can think back that far, before hunger or the nether. I just wanted to build elaborate castles in survival mode, but monsters were swarming the doors and I had to kill them all by hand from the ramparts. Now I have archers on the ramparts, and all is well.

I like the peasants farming, mining and crafting as well, though there are a lot of different jobs for such a basic economy. It will be interesting to see how this develops from the current bare-bones feel into something with more complex colony systems. But it has a pretty good place to start from.

Note that while it says "RTS", I'd more specifically call it a tower defense with a robust economy section to the gameplay. Don't expect to micro anything (unless you count juggling the creeps).

author: {'steamid': '76561197993748260', 'num_games_owned': 619, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 4364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1689, 'last_played': 1656388628}
review:
Fun, simple (so far), graphics have potential, retried a few times, tried out multiplayer (bad for players with terrible upload rates, the monsters and plebs jump back and forth) but was cool to see how the multipleplayer system works, of course with MP on these kinds of games, there are hurdles to get over like griefing. Creating groups players can join that battle each other during scheduled events, may be a way of stopping the grief. Sticking with SP until I get better inets, so I decided to run the development branch for this in case I come across any defects, to research and report them.

I've got a ton of screenshots for the game during my maze building venture, if you're interested.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040884867', 'num_games_owned': 2434, 'num_reviews': 901, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1497739822}
review:
EDIT: This review is dated. Perhaps I'll revisit at some point. Until then, these were my thoughts.
---

[b][i]Colony Survival[/i] hits that [i]Minecraft[/i] soft spot for me, and so I just had to buy the ticket and take the ride.[/b] And don't get me wrong - this title could end up being really cool, but for the moment, it's too early. Things are broken, and there just isn't enough depth, well, really in any aspect of [i]Colony Survival[/i]. 

And yes, I will reference [i]Minecraft[/i] because apparently this was originally a mod for it.

[i]Essentially, this strips away a lot of the 'simulation' aspects of [/i]Minecraft[i] and streamlines the whole experience.[/i] That's a good thing in this case, because now you aren't just a single adventurer - this is much more 'colony management' which is an awesome take on the whole thing. Think [i]Gnomoria[/i] in a voxelized world. Very cool concept.

But again, it is so early in it's developement that whole portions of the design still need to be worked out or are altogether broken. I thought of listing all the problems, but the more I thought about it, the more I could actually take issues with nearly every worker job in some way (some bigger than others, mind you). And for that, the asking price is too high. I won't refund, because I'm excited to see how this developes over time. If it fully developes into something awesome, I'll gladly revisit this review if I can find the time.

[b]Pros:[/b]
+Cool idea of FPS colony management in a voxelized world
+It's fun for now (albeit limited), but the asking price is too high for such little/broken content
+Lots of potential
+Devs seem active in the community and are listening

[b]Cons:[/b]
-Potential needs to be realized (I understand it's Early Access, but I paid my money and will certainly voice my opinion to buyers that are on the fence; my 2cents is that the devs released it too early - they should have put in another 6 months and given us something more meaty)
-To pricey for what you get right now (6/17)
-Tons of rough edges, broken content, and just unfinished ideas/portions

[b]Keep it on your radar.[/b] This could turn into something really special in time.

review: Colony Survival may be the game I've been looking for.  I enjoy Minecraft, but the problem was that I was the only one using the facilities (life of a loner :( ). But now, this game offers that very thing I believe Minecraft was missing. Assigning tasks, collecting resources, arming guards, and simply eco management. This game feels like what your doing actually matters. I imagine being in a RTS, but in first person. Definitly recommend this game and looking forward to future content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139283279', 'num_games_owned': 166, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 4648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1755, 'last_played': 1685625290}
