author: {'steamid': '76561198106528054', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1429, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 863, 'last_played': 1537483754}
review:
I would say that this game has a lot of potential to getting better. Altho its similar to minecraft platform but definitely can be more unique and even better
Suggestions:
 - Allow host to take away the flag of strangers/players that are banned or kicked 
 - Try to add in many things such as making quest available otherwise workers do not want to work. Hunger strike. (Roleplay, for short)
 - More difficult mobs, probably range zombies or higher hp, even tall mobs that can reach the height of the wall of 3-4 maybe even 6 blocks high, probably different heights mobs. Thus results in nerfing the archers/guards ability to kill and not get affected.
 - Add in more jobs available, probably allowing the building of military vehicles
 - More building designs, doors :D stairs :D
 - Less blocky maybe
 - Allow the retrieval of items in the inventory?
 - Allow the change of mobs spawntime in the settings even when the server is already created because as far as me and my friends know is that we can only allow mobs spawn in daytime during the creation of a new server
 
 
Reasons the game won't be popular/Bugs:
 - It is hella expensive, 20$ or 18$ (my case, SGD) isn't all that worth as compared to a better version like minecraft out there!
 - Bugs: 8x10 wheat farm blocks, not sure about others. In it, 1 block out of 80 blocks will not be used
 - Pretty sure it will be fixed but it gets too laggy when the empire gets too big, for someone whose hosting a multiplayer server with his friends, definitely wouldnt be his fault because there are games that... You get my point... 
 
But eitherway this game is awesome, yes what I've mention are indeed in your plans of fixing but no harm telling yall too. After all, the main purpose of early access is to have suggestions from players! AND ILL DEFINITELY RECOMMEND IT!

author: {'steamid': '76561198112647528', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 6765, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5275, 'last_played': 1499954322}
review:
My gaming rig is currently being upgraded, so I'm limited to what I can I play on steam due to low hardware capabilities.

So my brother sent me this game 3 days ago, just a few hours after it was released on Steam in Early Access.

I've gone to download, 110MB in total size... I begin to wonder if said brother is merely taking the mickey.
Either way, I proceed with this monstrous download.

After completion, we decide to just start our own server and wing it.

So. Much. Fun!

A blend of 7 Days To Die and Minecraft in my eyes. 

I might have lost about 20 colonists before working out the mechanics, but I think in order to understand and become better at this game, some colonists must pay the ultimate price.

We've also managed to create a mini community on the server, some very friendly players - all working together to protect their colonists. Already some very epic bases being built, which I can certainly see some Minecraft influence in a few and 7 Days To Die in others.

Plenty of aspects to the game, with: wheat farming, forestry, mining, archery, furnace, oven and to a lesser extent flax farming, workshop, minting and the shop.

Certainly lots more to be added to the game, with room for improvement in lots of mechanics. But overall, if you love the games I mentioned above, enjoy base building and don't mind killing or watching the odd Zombie perish, this is a game you will certainly enjoy.

11 Snows out of 10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202131684', 'num_games_owned': 66, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 17123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 138, 'playtime_at_review': 1032, 'last_played': 1711928768}
review: Good game

author: {'steamid': '76561198058864935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 5931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2495, 'last_played': 1510102091}
review:
So it's liike a mix between Minecraft and Dwarf Fortress, allowing you to be creative and build anything you want while also having an aspect of survival, but has the twist of putting you in charge of colonists. 

The strategy in the game of how to build your base and lay it out is something I'd like to see grow, to where there may be different types of zombies you have to plan for as the days go on, because in the current stage design doesn't matter too much in the beginning since you can just put guards up 3 blocks  and zombies can't touch them.

There comes a point in the game where your focus shifts from surviving to thriving and you begin to focus on building up and improving your kingdom rather than expanding because you reach a point where you have pretty much everything you need. Which is actually a nice change of pace once you've played for that long. I'm at the point where I just want to see how big can I get before the number of Zombies is just too much to defend and I'm forced to go into Siege mode each night.

Very fun game overall even in this early stage, I'm most excited for where this game can go.

-Currently up to 470 Colonists with Primary and secondary Multi-Level Farms

author: {'steamid': '76561198081158159', 'num_games_owned': 604, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 774, 'last_played': 1653923173}
review:
HD Minecraft: Wheat Plantation Owner Edition

Pretty fun, if a little barebones at the moment. It's basically alpha Minecraft with the additional gameplay element of having your own assignable workforce.

Pros:
Good graphics
Tower defense gameplay
Colonists make for easy automation
Zombie attacks forces you to plan bases strategically, not necessarily purely for aesthetics. Pathing is super important for oyur colonists and the zombies.

Cons: It is very early in development still, so I expect all of the following will be worked on shortly, but for now:
No methods of preventing griefing in Multiplayer
Insufficient moderator/admin powers in Multiplayer
Too few block types
No equivalent to Redstone
Zombies are not threatening
Zombies quickly begin to glitch out when too many of them are spawned. If you have more than 70 colonists, good luck keeping track of zombies during the night
Resource balance issues

All in all, it's fun, but.... just remember it's early in development. I'll give it a good faith thumbs up, but, if you want to wait to see how it develops further, I do not blame you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067353996', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1117, 'last_played': 1687602183}
review:
It's a voxel based building game with player-managed NPC's automating a large portion of the repetitive resource gathering neccesarry for large build projects. There's infinite inventory, so there's no annoying item managment or countless chests to organize, so that's a nice feature.

Content is relatively limited at this point as it's still in alpha/beta/whatever, but if you enjoy voxel building, it's worth a shot.

review:
"มาสร้างอาณานิคมบนโลกที่มีแต่ซอมบี้กันเถอะ" สำหรับคนที่เห็นเกม Colony Survival แว่บแรก อาจจะมีความรู้สึกว่าเกมนี้ ดูจากภายนอกแล้ว มันเป็นเกมโคลนนิ่งของ Minecraft ที่ลง Mod Colony หรือป่าว? เพราะดีไซน์ก็ไม่ได้มีเอกลักษณ์อะไรที่เด่นมากมาย เหมือนกับเกม Voxel บ้านๆทั่วๆไป แต่จริงๆแล้วเกมนี้มีดีกว่าที่คิดครับ

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VrCMRusYMLk

Colony Survival เป็นเกมแนว Survival เหมือนที่เราเคยเล่นๆกันนั่นแหละ คือ มีทั้ง Action , Adventure และก็ยังเป็น Sandbox อีกด้วย แต่สิ่งที่เพิ่มเข้ามาก็คือ การที่มันเป็นเกม Strategy ด้วย โดยเราต้องวางแผนในการสร้าง อาณานิคม (Colony) ของเราไปด้วย ซึ่งเป้าหมายหลักของเกมมันก็ ง่ายๆครับ แค่ให้เราขยายอาณานิคม และเอาชีวิตให้รอดจากฝูงซอมบี้ในทุกค่ำคืน ก็เท่านั้นเอง

รีวิวเกมฉบับเต็ม : http://thaigameguide.com/review/colony-survival/

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ygIgK4jgeYw

สำหรับเกมนี้ ราคาเต็มอยู่ที่ 369 บาท ถ้าเราประเมินจากจุดนี้ แอดมินรู้สึกว่ามันยังแพงเกินไป เพราะเนื้อหาของเกมที่มีอยู่ ณ ตอนนี้ มันยังน้อยมาก แต่ก็เป็นเกมที่น่าสนใจว่ามันจะพัฒนาต่อออกมาเป็นรูปแบบไหน ก็ถ้าให้แนะนำ แอดมินแนะนำให้รอผ่านช่วง Early Access ไปก่อน หรือรอให้เกมอัพเดตระบบใหม่ๆ แล้วค่อยสอยมาก็ยังไม่สายครับ แต่ถ้า ณ ตอนนี้ให้สอยราคาเต็ม คิดว่าไม่ค่อยคุ้มค่ากับราคาซักเท่าไรนัก แต่ก็ต้องรอดูกันต่อไปครับ เพราะมันยังเป็น Early Access

author: {'steamid': '76561197992954027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 7214, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1680920376}
review:
It's actually suprisingly fun! It's not got much depth yet (Early Access), but the right kind of person will enjoy this game for a very long amount of time. If you're the kind of person who likes to play resource management games, and you are never satisfied with having enough, this is a fantastic game.

The basic gameplay loop is that you need guys to do jobs, and you need food for your guys, and one such job is a farming job. When you want to be able to sustain more guys, you make more farms. Each plot (10x10) can sustain a handful of guys. Those extra non-farmers can go do things like mining, auto-crafting, guarding with bows, baking bread, etc. It sounds simple and boring. It kind of is! But it is 100% my kind of game. Expansion is the name of the game and it is extremely easy to lose hours without noticing.

Also the shaders look pretty darn good. I initially considered the game was quite ugly, but after some time, I came to appreciate the graphics of the game quite a lot more. This game would easily cross from "okay" to "amazing" if the devs shove it full of cosmetic building blocks. If they really let players get creative and go crazy with building, this game would shine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071045116', 'num_games_owned': 161, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 11809, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1589, 'last_played': 1708472511}

author: {'steamid': '76561197965803870', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 11060, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 746, 'last_played': 1690200297}
review:
Those giving negative ratings clearly didn't buy Minecraft upon its Beta release.  The game has plenty to do.  Current end game is to make fancy stuff and survive.  This kept me busy all day.  The replayability comes from how I would do things different or majorly transforming my colony.

You manage a population that will enable you to build fancy things without doing much labor (terraforming is still manual).  It's Stronghold meets Minecraft and I adored both games.  I can't wait to see what the developers come up with next!

author: {'steamid': '76561198002019259', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 824, 'last_played': 1618529344}
review:
At the current state of the game, I would not recommend this game to anyone wanting a fulfilling experience. I would, however, recommend this game to anyone who's wanted to be the architect in a Sim City game.  

Two features that were not mentioned by the devs as upcoming but really need to be in the game is some sort of blueprint/builder system letting you assign unemployed citizens to build out blueprints you've saved, and another would be an excavator or a deeper mining system than what is present. As is it is far too time-consuming digging out new sections and being able to mark out a specific area to be leveled is much needed. 

The biggest con I see is the graphics: they're too good. The lighting is beyond annoying and makes the blocks look like plastic pieces that
have been slobbered on. A secondary worry is how unexplained the zombie spawn system is. I've had multiple neighborhoods flooded with torches, and Zombies will manage to just pop into existence in seemingly lit walled in areas. This became a headache as I would spend every night not excavating a nearby hill but instead running from neighborhood to neighborhood making sure my factory workers weren't getting killed in their sleep. 

Overall this game is a great concept and if you'll like to fund the developer's moving forward buy this game and enjoy a good week or so of content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016052372', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 3196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1083, 'last_played': 1673806403}
review:
I bought this game with low expectations but I was amazed to find that in my opinion this game is one of the best games I've played in a while, on the first day I have played 10 hours of it, encountering no bugs whatsoever. This game is for the imaginative people and although people are calling it a Minecraft clone, Minecraft hasn't come near to satisfying what I wanted to do with that game, this has. It is a beautiful game and can take up much of your time if you wish to invest in it. Construction of buildings actually feels worth while in this game because you know it is getting used by the people running around. This is a game I will be playing a lot of in the coming future and I hope the Dev's add lots of new stuff that I can mess around with. In my opinion some suggestions for things to add would be doors, stairs, possibly glass windows, varying skins for the colonists, putting guards to bed in the day else they just stand about all the time, bridges would be good, water buckets to make moats feel more realistic with water, actual battlements would be good as my guards just tend to not be able to shoot when they are between blocks that are supposed to be battlements. And perhaps allow me to select which colonist I want to do what with, and where he/she sleeps and works to make it easier to know who is doing what. Maybe make a menu for lists of people doing what where you can customise their names. 

I think the one problem I had with this game is that it took a while to figure out what I was doing wrong, and it came to that the food situation is a bit confusing as in the top right there is information on how much food your group consumes a day (so for example 600 / Per Day) it also says how much food you have (6000 Food) it takes 2 nights for crops to grow and each crop is 0.5 Food, a couple of crops together is a bread which is 3 Food... so there is a bit of mathematics to make sure your colonists aren't going to starve, I measured with my little group that if they consume 600 food per day, they would need 1200 food altogether before they would have access to any more food, so initially I needed to make sure I had the food to survive the two days to be able to get more food to be able to increase the number of colonists, and as I was getting into the 1000's I just had to check every 2 days that it was vaguely staying at the same amount. I would suggest colour coding it if possible so as to easily identify if any colonists are going to starve in the next 2 days, and if there is enough crop food for all of the colonists to be able to survive. In summary, just buy it and play it for an hour and if you don't like it, refund it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997666563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6194, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 866, 'last_played': 1597628087}
review:
So far, so good.
I have always wanted a game were you can build a kingdom from the ground up in first-person and Colony Survival seems to be the game to finally scratch that itch. 

Pretty impressive graphics for a voxel based game and the villager A.I. seems to be competent enough. The U.I. is a bit confusing but once you figure it out it is not an issue. I had a lot of fun building my small kingdom and managing the villagers.  
But the game isn't without some issues. There isn't much to do in the initial Early Access build and the building options seem pretty anemic. I know this is common for a Early Access game but $20 seems a little much for what is there right now. The most glaring issue right now is that the Zombie Sieges, which are one of the main draws of the game, can be easily thwarted (I just dug a two-block deep ditch around the village, thus securing my kingdom from undead invaders.)

But overall, I am exicted to see what additions they bring to the game. What is here right now isn't much but it is stable so I have high hopes for the game. I recommend supporting this game and I hope the developers see the project through to the end.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044504740', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1497769181}
review: i dont reccomend this game yet. The game is deffiantly something cool that i will be watching but as of now even alpha bare bones minecraft back in the day had more content then this game does right now. I mean fuck you cant even build a door yet. A door some sound effects are also like literally ripped off from minecraft. Cant make armor, cant make swords, hell you cant even use the pickaxes that you make for your colonist i have to assume your character is smashing their head against stone and granite.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963890670', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1571483361}
review:
WARNING! Recommend is a strong word. I recommend this game if you don't bother wasting 19 bucks with a rather experimental unfinished great game idea. 

After a few games so far I can describe some gaming experience:
- Joined a multiplayer server
- First thing I see side to side is that 2 playes have already built some decent bases
- Build my modest room for my first colonist
- One other player joins and starts trolling my base (removing blocks)
- I remove some of the blocks below him and bury him so he will stop annoying 
- Night arrives, and a few crappy zombies too. All dead by my colonist archer and other human players (thanks my fellow strangers!)
- It's day again. Just out of curiosity, I remove the blocks right where I buried the troll player (I assume he already disconnected)... but HE is still there!!


If you think this is fun, so be it. Honestly, I think it's worth trying but the gameplay is very limited. You probably get tired of doing all the same again after five or six games.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983436748', 'num_games_owned': 1123, 'num_reviews': 89, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1497791358}
review:
This game is really the definition of Early Access, there's really nothing here yet. When I watched the videos and saw the screen shots I thought Minecraft mixed with a management game is PERFECT for me and I like the idea but there is just so little content and at the price point being asked it should have way more content this. The UI is horrible and fiddly, the AI is pretty rubbish too. Gameplay wise I can see there is some potential but since they have been working on this game since 2014 I do wonder if it will get any better.

There needs to be way more block types, things to see and do. Different zombie types, colonists changing and acting differently (like when they become defenders changing clothes maybe also they need some sort of expression they just look dead inside! Overall it just needs way more content 

On the plus side the graphics are nice, the lighting effects are good and they have a solid foundation.

Can't recommend for right now but I'll maybe revisit in the future.

Check out the video below.

https://youtu.be/L3zXJ8tzKCc

author: {'steamid': '76561198040787921', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 289, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 289, 'last_played': 1497834041}
review:
I don't think I've ever bought a game faster on steam. Reason being is this is the game I thought Minecraft was going to become. I've been playing Minecraft since it was in Alpha, and all through it's development I was hoping it would turn into a game like this. Where you start by building up your own armor and weapons, then have other humans join you and eventually you can build up towns and even cities. Which you'd have to defend from harder and harder monsters. 

At the moment this game DOES NOT have all that. But I can see that being it's potential future. At the moment this game is very reminiscent of a Minecraft mod called SIM-U-Kraft. Which was basically the same premise as this game (Workers need to be paid wages and kept safe and they mine, farm and build for you). 

This game IS very bare bones so far, but a couple things I saw that need improvement are:
-Menu Sounds. They are obnoxiously loud at default volume. Luckily you can change that volume
-AI reaction time. I've had archers not fire on Zombies until the zombies were nearly on top of them.

A feature I would also like to reccomend to the Devs is extensive modding support. It's the one thing Minecraft never did and should have done. But I believe in modding support for games like this because it allows players to make the game into what they want it to be. And as an early access game, having players develop their own content has shown (In games like ARK, minecraft, space engineers) to be beneficial . 

On a final note: I see a lot of reviews saying this isn't worth the price at the moment. This, I feel, is a very selfish viewpoint. When you purchase an early access game, you're not always buying something with the immediate value assigned to it (which "what is 20 dollars worth of fun" is a totally subjective view anyway). Rather you are making an investment to help a game be worth that price point in the future. It's different from, just naming games here, NO MAN'S SKY not being worth it's 60 dollar price point since it released as a full package and not an early access deal. But you have to view an early access game's potential and not it's current state, before deciding to invest. That's why I invested in this game. I feel it has potential, and I can't wait to see how it grows from here!

author: {'steamid': '76561198041346218', 'num_games_owned': 193, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1497809879}

author: {'steamid': '76561198005910938', 'num_games_owned': 1391, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 736, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 629, 'last_played': 1554883742}
review:
<18th June 2017>

Alright, im gonna do a review for once.
this game is nowhere from finished (obviously, came out yesterday).

for how new this game is. i must give credit for how it runs. no lag for the most part. i get medium lag when like 400 zombies die at once when morning comes, but thats only for a few seconds. i currently have a colony for around the 140 people.  and incase the dev sees this, you need to work on the zombie spawns. i get zombies spawning inside the walls killing my people before they have a chance to get to safety.

ofcause this game has bugs and lacks content but comeon. its been out for 1 day. 
This game currently, is a gamble for that price. i just sold a 20 dollar CSGO skin and brough it, so no problem there.
i would say that 20 dollar is pretty high for whats currently on the table. but we just hope he wont run with the money and leave us here to rot. 

i'd say give it a chance if you can scrape 20 dollars together from skins and just let it sit in your library for half a year and see whats new.

TL:DR buy it to support the dev now, play it when it has gotten more content.
follow my twitch :P  (shameless plug)

author: {'steamid': '76561198074463944', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1497787998}
review:
クイックガイドが現在日本語化されていないので、初期の流れを軽く書いておく。（必ずしも書いてあるとおりにする必要は無いし、間違っている可能性もある）

①適当なところに、2キーを押してから、クリックで旗を建てる。
②1キーを選択し、クリックすると麦畑・亜麻畑・林業エリア・採鉱エリアを設定できるので、小麦畑を選択し右クリックで範囲を指定し、右クリックで決定する。（入植者は1人あたり、毎日5の食料を消費するが、小麦は植えてから成長し切るまで2日かかるのに注意）
③Iキーでインベントリ及びクラフト画面が開き、ベッド（雇用できる入植者の上限を増やす）を4つ、作業台（クラフトの自動化）を1つ、かまど（小麦をパンにする）を1つ、ストレージボックスを幾つか作成する。この時、材料がインベントリ内ではなく、画面下部のショートカットベルト（？）内に存在する必要がある。
④作ったものを適当な場所に設置し、2キーを押してから右クリックで入植者を4人（小麦畑・作業台・かまど・傭兵各１人）雇用する。
※材料が足りなければ適宜集めること。
小麦の種子は草（芝？）から、藁は小麦の収穫時に入手可

⑤作業台を右クリックし、矢筒と弓を１つストックしておくようにする、矢はデフォルトだと300になっているのでいじらなくても大丈夫。
⑥夜になるとモンスターが襲ってくるので拠点の周囲に高さ2マスの壁を設置するか、塹壕を掘る。

⑦朝になったら、岩盤まで掘り進み、鉱物が含まれるタイル（銅っぽい赤茶けた色が鉄、金色が金、白は普通の石や粘土が主に出る）を探す。見つかったら1キーから採掘地点を設定し、すぐそばにベッドとストレージボックスを置き、新たに入植者を1人雇用する
※MMORPGの金庫の様に、全てのストレージボックスから全てのアイテムにアクセスできるため、無駄な移動が必要なくなる。

⑧炉を作成し、適当な場所に設置、すぐそばにベッドとストレージボックを設置し、新たに入植者を雇用する。

あとは、小麦畑の拡張と鉱物の採鉱ポイントを増やしていくことで、規模を順調に拡大できる……はず。

なお、亜麻の種は、お店で購入できる。購入には金鉱石を造幣局でゴールドコインに変える必要があるので、結構面倒。



【総評】
クラフト、採掘、製錬と言った作業が、村人の手により自動化されているので、ある程度軌道に乗ってしまうとプレイヤーのすることが建築だけになってしまう。肝心の建築も、内装どころか窓やドアすら無く、いささか以上に物足りない。又、夜になると攻めてくるモンスターは、2ブロック以上の段差を超えられない為、戦力さえあれば防衛設備は最低限のもので事足りてしまう。ポテンシャルは十分にあると思うが、アーリーアクセスのために今後のアップデートに期待したい。

author: {'steamid': '76561198004840560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 13166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1136, 'playtime_at_review': 852, 'last_played': 1712407999}
review:
Though this game shows promise and is fun for what it is, it's currently not worth the 18 euro's I've paid. You'll quickly find yourself to have build every kind of item you can make, after which it becomes a game of upscaling.
The water mechanics can be anoying as a single block will flood everything as it creates new water blocks in all cardinal directions except up, which can do the same.#

I do want this game to succeed, and will update when I feel it can be recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198315152080', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3067, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1308, 'last_played': 1551276374}
review:
Dear Creators,

The basics of the game is so much fun, it is way better than Minecraft is (for me at least).
The HD quality blocks are awesome, you did a fine work with it.
In its current state, I give you 10/6. In order to improve it 10/10, I would love to see these modifications:

- more type of blocks (glass)
- please give round heads for block-men
- block-women?
- special craftable tools, such as: doors, windows, weapons, and bucket (!!!) to take water home from a lake and make mine
- more type of soldiers and weapons/armours (catapult, fire arrows, chainmail, wizard, knights, etc.)
- a "happiness indicator" just like in Total War games would be fine
- the possibility to have and use an army (moving it, conquering other colonies, etc.)
- more and stronger monsters (skeletons, orcs, anything)
- some NPC-s, for example traders, hunters
- trade with NPC-s (now I have loads of gold coin but for what?)
- other colonies in single player: some friendly to trade with and some hostiles to fight with
- story mode: for example I have 120 settlers and a huge kingdom now and I don't know why should I continue the game. A story mode would change it I think.

Coclusion: I know it is "just" az early access and I knew it before purchasing it, but I tought there will be more craftable things and blocks to use. Don't get me wrong, it is a promising and fun game-material. Promise me one thing: fill it with tons of content please. If you do so, this game has the chance to grow even bigger than Minecratf I think.

Thanks in advance.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965028388', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4015, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3752, 'last_played': 1605484614}
review:
I was going through the usual "I don't know what do you want to play?" with a friend of mine when I noticed this game come through my recommended on Steam. It piqued my interest, but a minecraft style voxel crafting game is a hard sell. I'll be honest it wasn't until the next day when the same question came up I went back and gave it a serious look.

I decided to roll the dice and bought it for myself and my friend. For 18 bucks why not, give it a shot and see what it had to offer. Within an hour I had a multiplayer game going with 4 friends and some surprising interest on my twitch channel from older and newer viewers. The "test" session ended up lasting 7 hours until I literally had to pry my friends off the server.

It doesn't seem like there's alot there at first, but the game is honestly robust for even an Early Access game. Every time I thought I was on cruise-control, I'd turn around and a monster would be walking right in my gates past a very stressed out line of guards. The seemingly small amount of materials to build with already provided alot to work with if you get creative.

It goes without saying a large part of the evening was filled with a laundry list of hopes and wants for the game's development. New blocks, a way to interact between each other's kingdoms (co-operatively or aggressively attacking each other), new jobs and definitely some new monsters would make an already enjoyable game very fun - but it was clear we were all very excited for a new game and a gem that came from absolutely no where! Do yourself a favor, talk a friend into picking it up with you and give it a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561198124069830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1391, 'last_played': 1581064600}
review:
マインクラフトにRTS要素を足したようなゲームです。
今のところ使用できるブロックの種類が少なく、サンドボックスゲームとしての面白さはまだまだこれからに期待です。
RTS要素も敵の行動パターンが単順なため、まだ難易度が非常に低くゲームになっていません。
シンプルでわかりやすいNPC管理システムは非常に良く出来てると思います。

アイテム集めなどの単純作業をNPCに任せ、自分は建築に専念できるというのが非常に面白いです。

新しい職業や敵の追加、アイテム集めのバランス調整などまだまだ物足りないですが、これからが楽しみなゲームです。

author: {'steamid': '76561197985848071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2815, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 987, 'last_played': 1548238769}
review:
I picked this up a day or two after going into Early Access, so if your reading this months down the line, keep in mind I’m writing this Review from that point.

First, I’ll say the game is very bare bones. It’s got a very good foundation for an amazing game, but that’s all it is for now, a foundation. What’s here works well and is fun, all the art is crisp and clean, the mechanics are nice and enjoyable, but you quickly run out of things to do.

The potential for this game is extremely high. If the Devs add a dozen more NPC jobs, and resources being needed for many things and a half dozen more monster types then this game would be awesome.

So, what is there to do now?
-Buildings are just a few simple block types, no slopes, no doors, no stairs. Only cubes. In reality, you don’t even need to make a building, just a giant wall around your crops and beds/ crafting stations clustered up on the grass.

-Harvest is just Wheat for food, and trees for planks. 

-Mining is rather sad, Just dig down about 30 blocks and you hit bedrock and all the minerals are on the bedrock level, carve out a square and you will probably find all 4-5 ore types in that small square. Assign some miners and then forget about it. No need to keep tunneling or exploring. Half the Ores I never even used because they just make a couple decorative blocks and I had already built everything I needed out of Stone and wood.

-Zombie Attacks can be rather fun, more of a constant drizzle of them every night than an attack though. Just stack archers at the gate, make sure you have arrows, and you’re good. No fear of zombies breaking yours walls anywhere else.

-The Landscape is nice, mostly flat with some mountains and lakes. Maybe oceans, but I never saw. Of course, none of that is useful. Nothing to do with mountains or sand or water. Just pick a flat area and build.


In conclusion I enjoyed it, but once id built everything and had enough archers that nothing got through my gate there wasn’t much more to do beyond the 6 hours Id played this map. As is, this games not worth the money, but if the Developers build on the potential of the game then I wont regret the money spent. I’ll wait and see how it goes and check in again after some updates.

把能造的都造过一遍了，家里也有了一个五层的城堡，收纳了100多号小弟
感觉游戏还有很大发展空间，玩到现在没什么别的事可做了，最好能多增加一些元素
还有一点，我的小弟和晚上的僵尸总是会忽有忽没，太空步加瞬移蛇皮走位，不知道你们的会不会这样，到了晚上几十个守卫卡得一动不动根本不打僵尸
总之目前还是不太推荐大家买，等以后更新吧

author: {'steamid': '76561198290610281', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1259, 'last_played': 1664702346}
review: Since getting Colony Survival, It's been almost impossible for me to put down. I have been playing for hours to get my colony just the way I like it. There are a few problems with the game though. Sometimes I'll clip through the ground, and there seems to be a lack of things to do after getting the trader. On the other hand, It's a very simple and fun game that has taken very little time to master. I strongly recommend this to anyone who likes to play minecraft, or enjoys building in general. Please keep in mind that this is a new release, so it won't be perfect, but it's still well made. If were to rate it the game would be a solid 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071948526', 'num_games_owned': 327, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1529029347}
review:
so my review may say reccomended but i would really say "Get it if you like, but don't expect a lot of stuff"

so i'd say this game is pretty fun, howver it does have some drawbacks all of which are because of the fact that the game is in alpha. what are these problems at the moment (but expect to change over time)
-limited content: not a ton of stuff to do for the moment (but more is going to be added soon)
-limited building materials: i'd estimate about 25 different blocks (citation needed) exist in the game right now.
-only one enemy type exists: zombies, the only thing they do is spawn more as you get more colonists.

but what are the positives?
-suprisingly well optimised
-nice graphics for a block based game
-nice lightning system

the neutral?
-AI: the pathing on them sometimes borks itself and colonists cant find their way to their job areas, and the zombies are limited to the point that you have to give them a cance to attack your colonists otherwise lose all your food in a short amount of time


overall i'd say get this game if you would like. i like it personally and am hopeful that it will do even better in the future. however i would personally reccomend that you wait until there is a bit more content in the game before buying or wait until it's on sale for a bit cheaper. 

the game is good, but not amazing at the moment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045037287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2910, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1245, 'last_played': 1532560057}
review:
HOLY COW!!!

This game has so much potential. i played it all day today and didnt realize it. 

Pros
-beautiful, beautiful, beautiful!!! i cant wait to see what people do with texture packs...
-ai is wonderful so far
- mechanics in the game work perfectly so far i played for 10 hours and the only bug i found was once out exploring when i returned all the arrows that had been fired by my villagers were still in the air frozen... for an early release this is epic...especially for a bethesda and paradox fan...
-the concept is brilliant mixing a game like banished and adding the ability to be in the world like minecraft is awesome.
-takes an already good product (minecraft) and all its spawns and adds some very refeshing spins... an inteligent ai that does more than eat and ask for stuff... the way they do mining in this game is very neat and not so dang grindy...you could spend days gathering resources in some of the other games i like the fact you get people doing it for you...
-huge potential
-they have a person on the reddit that seems to be their spokemen answering questions and suggesting fixes... day one on the launch this was neat...

Cons-

- umm its brand new so there is a lack of variety once i get an established colony its going to have an expiration date.. hopefully the devs stay this enthused and push out content....and please god almighty dont rob us blind while doing so
-lack of any small or angled pieces makes it very hard to do anything pretty...

author: {'steamid': '76561198077297773', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 2220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 640, 'last_played': 1638724804}
review:
Colony Survival is a very simplistic, yet somewhat challenging survival mangement game. For more information about the game and development team, visit this link (  http://gametunnel.com/colony-survival/  )

The game has been a blast in this early stage of development. If you are more into gameplay, mechanics, systems than glorified graphics....then this game juts might interest you!

Ill try to keep it short and sweet, but if you are looking for a more drawn out review with every tiny detail about my experience, you may want to move on to the next review! With that said, Ill jump right in!

Gameplay is fun! Once you get the hang of how things work, you get a lot more time to focus on a very elaborate blueprint of how you want to build your colonies base! The title for the most part isnt that complicated, however, you do have to watch how you recruit, grow, mine, construct, etc..... it does take planning!

There is a few options when playing Colony Survival. There is MP (still in development and working on features to enhance MP play, so patience with the MP portion is required. You can play with others, but sharing reosurces, etc, isnt implemented yet. However, being able to speak with one another and building a community is in fulll swing.)
You also have a choice for a Single Player experience! There are a couple of options for SP that will allow you to play without monsters, having monster invade constantly and doubling the ammount of monsters that invade....

I choose to play without monsters till I could get the hang of the game and even in this "build only" type option, its still a blast to play and survival and mangement is still needed! Pro Tip: If you want to build up a lot of resources for the game before recruiting any AI, simply do not plop down your towns flag and you can pretty much go at it alone performing your own tasks till you feel ready to experiment with AI....however, it is limited and some features will require you do have AI to play ( unable to bake your own bread, for instance! AI only function for the time being! ).

Theres a lot planned for the game to bring it to a fuller experience and the developers roadmap can be checked out at their main website.....A lot will be going into the title during development. The devs have been nice to take in suggestions as well and have been really responsive and answering even the toughest of questions about the game.

Price Tag....A lot of people complaining about the price and are constantly complaiming 24/7, threatening of never buying or trying to persuade the devs to lower the price. Its a very simple matter when it comes to price....1. Dont buy it if it doesnt fit your budget. 2. Wait for a major sale. ( But you maybe waiting a very, very long time! ) 3. Get a job? 4. better get it while its at this price, once new content is added and more fetaures included, the price will surely go up! You might see a half price sale sometime next year, but I wouldnt hold my breath. The price will surely be more than $20 at release. 
The last time I checked, I paid around $20 to see a movie, including the price of a soda, and got 2 hrs of entertainemt out of it.....thats it. Im able to replay the game as much as I want, therefore the price of the entertainment is justified, afaic!

As for how the game runs? I cant tell you when it comes to MP. Im currently playing SP and I have had no bugs that I have experienced as of yet. It has been a solid title so far in this stage of development! Pathing seems to be on point and AI reactions to tasks has been smooth. FPS is no problem with everything turned up....even for potatoes!

Overall, its not graphically exciting, very minecraft. However, the systems, mechanics and gameplay has made the game, so far, very fun to play and replay and replay! If you are offset by the price, then I would suggest find another bargain bin game to buy....the game, imo, has been worth the price.

A lot of streamers has enjoyed this title as much as me! Check out the "lets play" vids on youtube if you are still on the fence about purchasing!

author: {'steamid': '76561198074503806', 'num_games_owned': 412, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 532, 'last_played': 1547371666}
review:
Bonjour à toutes et à tous, voilà mon avis pour le jeu, dans l'état actuel à ce jour. (Le 18/06/2017):

• Niveau Graphisme: 
→ le jeu est un minecraft-like avec les Shaders installé de Base. Il est très beau actuellement, les effets de lumières sont bien, l'effet de blush pareil. Rien à dire de se coté là, a pars l'eau qui est un peu étrange, mais je pense que ça changera avec le développement. 

• Niveau HUD:
→ Cela reste passable, une amélioration sur celui ci afin de l'épuré, serait mieux, pareil pour les items qui sont dedans, par exemple les "Log Temparate" ressemble énormément à la "Dirt".

• Niveau Animation:
→ Il n'y en a aucune a part les Fours et les Forges qui s'allument, j'aurais souhaitez que les Archers tienne l'arc, voir vise lorsqu'il apperçoivent un Zombie. 

• Niveau Gameplay:
→ Malgré qu'on fait vite le tour du jeu en une heure, on s'y amuse toujours autant en voulant créer plus de PNJ afin de voir spawn plus de Zombie la nuit. 

► Choses à Améliorer:
→ Certaines fois, en multi, des zombies ou mes amis disparaissaient et réapparaissent deux minutes après. Rien d'affolant, en soit. 

→ Alors, ce n'est pas un beug, mais un truc assez dommage, je fais une maison pour faire reposer mes colons, vous fermer la porte d'accès avec vous à l'intérieur et les zombies iront despawn sur votre banière et ça sans avoir aucun malus... C'est dommage. 

→ Comme je l'ai dis, on fait vite le tour du jeu avec les crafts actuels, il y a du sable mais impossible de faire du verre, il y a de l'eau mais impossible de la récupérer. Bon après c'est qu'une early access sortie il y a deux jours, on peut penser que d'autres craft apparaitront (ainsi que d'autres job, et la possibilité de dire a tel PNJ de faire ce job à la place de celui là.) avec le développement futur.

→ Les zombies actuel sont trop faible, on les oneshot, et leurs IA est entièrement débile, en espérant que dans les futurs mise à jour, cela change et qu'ils rajoutes de nouveaux type, des Zombies qui cours plus vite ou Certain qui peuvent casser des blocs, etc... par exemple. 

→ La possibilité de grouper une colonie avec une personne en multiplayer serait aussi grandement apprécié ! Car sinon il faut faire sa colonie chacun de son coté, et ce sans pouvoir échanger des ressources... Bah ça ne sert à rien, autant jouer en solo. Je pense que de ce coté là, il y a pas mal de choses à changer/améliorer/rajouter. Comme la possibilité de rajouté tel ou tel personne dans sa whitelist de colonie et donc que cet personne aura la possibilité de transferer ses ressources dans votre "Stockpile" ou au contraire la rajouté dans une Blacklist et dans se cas pouvoir attaquer cette personne, pour PvP ou plutôt RoyaumeVsRoyaume.

▬ CONCLUSION ▬ 
Pour le moment, je ne vous conseil pas de l'acheter tous de suite, il ne vaut pas ses 20€ (Et encore moins, la promo actuelle jusqu'au 23 juin, pour 18€). Achetez-le si vous voulez encourager le développeur, mais vous êtes au moins prevenu de son état actuel.

C'est un très bon jeu prometteur, en espérant que le/les développeurs ne l'abandonne pas et qu'ils soient à l'écoute de leurs communauté.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080213822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 2912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1535, 'last_played': 1592266304}

author: {'steamid': '76561198138608852', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 655, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 403, 'last_played': 1709961302}
review:
Please note that this game is in Early Access, VERY early access. It is very bare bones. 

I think as an Early Access this game has great potentional and will do great if the developer keeps on working on this game, maybe become something such as 7 Days to Die. 

In this game you will build a castle, hire colonists which then become guards, bakers, wheat farmers, flax farmers, and a few other "jobs."  You have to have enough farmers and bakers to help feed all your colonists, you can have someone make you items instead of doing it yourself. If your farmers die, be from zombies or lack of food, guess who's job it is now, yours! At least until you hire more. 

You will have to wait the 2 days for the wheat to grow, then you have to harvest it or replant it yourself. If you don't have guards you have to run around and kill the zombies yourself. 

If you are like me you have a farmer house, a guard house, etc etc, so you have to run back and forth to make sure there are no zombies trying to kill the colonists. The zombies hunt after your colonist flag and/or colonists.

10/10, will become 20/10 when there is more content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198114921941', 'num_games_owned': 181, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 7305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3310, 'last_played': 1675389488}
review:
COMPLETELY HONEST REVIEW

Not a whole lot do to atm but this game definitely has great potential. Not sure if the $20 price tag is worth it at the moment but in the future this game should be more than worth. Until then try to pick it up on sale if you can.

Pros:
-fun to play for a while
-can easily have a large colony with many colonists without much lag or frame loss
-runs great
-looks great
-doesn't crash under stress (ran for a solid 31 hrs straight with a coloy size of 340 with no crash)

Cons:
-not a whole lot to do after the first two hours or so, mainly just expanding and building
-ai is a bit wonky at times (mainly pathfinding)
-i feel that the day/night cycle should be longer, i feel like i can barely get anything done in a day

Things that should be added (in my opinion)
- food produced per day (currently only total food and food consumed per day)
- some sort of melee unit or weaponry
- more monster types
- maybe some form of pvp
- traps for monsters
- stairs
- npc controlled colonies
- trade goods between colonies
- more food types
- animal farming
- horses for riding
- miners that dig their own tunnels
- more animations (bow firing, harvesting, etc)
- guard patrols (would be awesome with melee units)

I'm currently having a lot of fun with the game for the time being and i'm excited to see updates coming (hopefully soon) if you can get the game on sale i suggest doing that rather than paying full price, or wait for some more updates. if you ever played the minecolony mod for minecraft and enjoyed it but didn't like the game breaking bugs that came with it then this is the game for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969333093', 'num_games_owned': 590, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 1593, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 427, 'last_played': 1698329514}
review:
Yes it is Early Access. However, if an EA title is ready to charge money, it's ready to be criticized. I will make quick observations in the usual categories to help you decide if this title is something you'd be interested in:

[b][u]Gameplay[/u][/b]
I think we've all built our own cities in Minecraft, and hoped that the AI that accompanied pre-built villages would do more than just wander aimlessly and occupy a house at night. This game does exactly that, by focusing heavily on the AI elements that heavily lacked in other voxel-based games. It's especially great if you're like me, and not a huge fan of the multiplayer elements in survival games due to the amounts of trolling, toxicity, and the general attitude of "kill first, never ask questions". This game allows you build whatever you like, while adding a survival purpose to it ala 7 Days to Die.

The game itself is currently lacking, but still fun. You get the basics so far, with wood, stone, and various metals to build and craft with. Other than that, here are the current available jobs: wheat farmer, flax farmer, forester, baker, smith, and guard. This gives you everything you need to have fun for a while, but after a quick time playing you will become profitable and self-reliant. Then the only point to continue is to build whatever you like, or to just grow your town to as high of a number as possible. There is currently only one weapon as well: the bow.

[b][u]Sound[/u][/b] 
The sound is lacking currently in this build. There is no background music, but there are sound effects for every action in the game so far. This is passable for me, as it's Early Access, and I'd rather see more content added than music currently.

[b][u]Graphics[/u][/b] 
High definition voxels. Bloom that makes for amazing sunrises and sunsets. Depth-of-field. It's as modern as Voxel-based games can be, in terms of visuals.

[b][u]Bottom Line[/u][/b] 
This game comes in a small 100+ MB package, but looks amazing. In it's current state, it runs easily at 60 FPS and doesn't require a high-tier setup to accomplish this. It's nowhere near being feature-complete though. However for the price, it's already a very competent Early Access title. I would recommend it if building a functional Minecraft city sounds appealing, as that is already possible. If you're a bit hestitant due to the lack of features, I would advise adding this to your Wishlist and watching it for a while. The updates seem to be fairly constant for now, and the dev is engaging and diligent, so I'm willing to put my money down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169662786', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1479, 'last_played': 1605851484}
review:
I don't normally write reviews, but this is a great game. It may look like mincecraft at first glance, but its not. The graphics are more in dephth thank minecraft. The game is great for being early access, but i feel there should be a few things added to the game.  

-other rival npc civilizations to clash or ally with (in survival and creative)

-better artillery like cannons and swords

-stronger enemies (maybe a boss or somthing)

-more food and job options/choices

-a way to interact with other players like pvp or trading

I could go on and on, but these are the main ones I feel that should be added to the game. I rate this a 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198012447184', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1497739956}
review:
Just bought the game, booted it up and played for a tiny bit of time. 

The idea behind the game is really good, it looks weird (?) as in I don't understand what style the developers are going for. The lighting is amazing, shadows flawless, but the blocky Minecraft style feels out of place. 

Colony Survival is, what the name says, a game where you control a colony and have to survive. But as of right now the game feels sparse and lacks a lot of things. HOWEVER if the developers keeps updating the game and improving it then this game got potential. In my opinion they just need to decide on an artistic style and not try to mix two different styles, and yes I do know it was made by two guys and what they got so far is good. It just needs more, right now it feels empty and lifeless even with colonists. 

Should you buy it? hard to say, on one hand yes! The idea is amazing and as the game contenues through developing and (perhaps mods?) there will be more to do and maybe the world will feel alive. On the other hand though... The game doesn't have much and it is expensive. 

All in all, buy it play it for some time, learn the mechanics, wait and keep on eye on updates. I myself got a lot of ideas that I would love to share with the developers to make the game feel better but it would just take up too much space here. Let's hope they keep improving this game cause the premis is quite good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198232853708', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 130, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1497737144}
review: This is an Early Access Game, so there are bound to be bugs, as with any game no matter how long it has been out. I've only played two hours, but this is something I can see myself playing much more of. There is no real object of the game other than the grow and expand. Controlling the lives of your colonists is much more amusing that doing all the work yourself. The only problem I have so far is that the days are too short. Some people may find this less annoying, though. As the game develops maybe there would be options for the length of days/nights. I'm looking forward to what's next.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049449791', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 11562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1284, 'last_played': 1703257084}
review: In the pretty short time that I have played this game,  I have come to absolutly love it. It has a nice texure technique which makes every surface look smooth and deep, although the texures themselfes are pretty basic. It's also the FIRST Colony Building/Managment Game which actually makes you feel like you are part of the community you are building, not just some benevolent hand of god from up above. You can really feel like a Landlord/Baron seeing your little town grow and thrive. I am hooked and can't wait for future updates, as I will come back to this game very often.

review:
After Playing this game for 10 hours straight, and 5 of which being on the fun, but buggy multiplayer, I can say i really enjoy this game, even though it is in very early access. I like how in this game, just watching the colonists do farming is very amusing to me in some way.

Things I think would be fun:
I think in multiplayer, since you have multiple colonies, if they do add pvp maybe they could add sometihng like, if you destroy a whole colony and the owner of that colony is dead, maybe you would be able to liberate that colony and own their castle and maybe own their colonists.
Another thing they could do is, nake it so that you can live in someones colony and you be there colonist or a co-ruler

author: {'steamid': '76561198033473866', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1641560915}
review:
Colony Survival. Wenn man den Namen hört, denkt man sich zunächst erst einmal: Was ist das? 
Ich selber las mir die Beschreibung durch und dachte mir: So ein Spiel klingt interessant. 
Genau das ist es auch. Die Idee wurde meiner Meinung auch soweit gut umgesetzt. 
Der Anfang ist ein wenig kniffelig, aber danach geht es recht zügig aufwärts mit der Lernkurve. 
Man merkt kaum, dass da nur zwei Leute hinterstecken und Bugs habe ich noch nicht einen einzigen gesehen, 
was für einen EA-Titel noch lange keine selbstverständlichkeit ist. 
Die Deutsche Übersetzung (einfach im Menü umstellen) ist soweit solide. Hatte glaube ich nur ein oder zwei Rechtschreibfehler entdecken können. 

Das Spielprinzip ist schnell erzählt, sorgt aber für ausreichend Mikromanadgment, wenn man perfektionist ist. 
Die Idee, die Angriffe mit der größe der Siedlung stärker werden zu lassen ist durchaus gut und ist mal etwas anders. 

Das einzig negative ist meiner Meinung nach, dass sich die Welt noch ein wenig leer anfühlt. 
Ein paar Wildtiere wären schön, die man auch vielleicht jagen könnte, ebenso vielleicht Fischerei. 
Auch agressive Wildtiere wären gut, dann muss man auch am Tag ein wenig aufpassen. 
Ansonsten ein grundsolides Spiel, bisher aber leider nur für Zwischendurch. 
Mit mehr Kontent jedoch und Zeit, könnte hieraus noch eine wirkliche Perle der Aufbaustrategie werden, 
gerade auch, weil es so ein Spiel in der Richtung (meines Wissens nach) bisher noch nicht gegeben hat. 
Dafür Hut ab, so etwas inovatives abzuliefern und das auch noch so Bugfrei. (Wären doch die meisten EA-Titel so) ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198067422629', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1686462541}
review:
Wayyyy too bare bones for me to suggest it.

Has some potential, not worth it for the price atm. Feels very 'my first unity game'-like. Could have some potential in the future, absolutely not worth 20 bucks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271987002', 'num_games_owned': 55, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1518845025}
review:
This game is very fun to play. I bought this game a day ago (June 16th) and I would recommend this to anyone who likes the concept of building a town and running it. 

I only have a few suggestions.
There should be some extra ways to get food other than farms. Maybe fishing and killing animals.
There should be a bit more blocks. Some blocks like stairs and personal chests would be nice.
This is a big suggestion but it would be cool if you could connect to multiplayer and be able to build your town and be able to raid other peoples towns. Like one kingdom vs another. 

This is all of my review, 100% recommended to anyone who thinks its cool.

review:
I like minecraft but I stopped playing it because it gets boring when you make a badass castle and there isnt anything going on in there. This game is fixing that problem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039550105', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1497717437}
review: I saw a review saying it wasnt like minecraft...it was wrong. Its minecraft with a few extra steps and less content. Game got boring after a hour and then it was just painful to play. Your colonists all look the same so your cant identify any of them. You cant even give them names. There doesnt seem a way of assigning people to specific tasks. Got the impresion from the screen shots it was going to be a overhead strategy game, instead its literally minecraft. no strategy needed.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989155982', 'num_games_owned': 1560, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 528, 'last_played': 1605339015}
review:
The framework laid out for this game is FANTASTIC. You can tell the devs really care about this game. The little content with have right now is very fun to work with. I can't wait to see what they add in the future. 

As it stands right now the game has very little content, but what it does have is very solid. You can recruit colonist, make them homes, give them jobs, and survive. The game allows for some creative colonies. It should be able to suit even the most un-creative people out there.

The main question most people will be asking: Should I buy this?
Well that depends. Do you want to support a dev that obivously cares about the game and is constantly adding new things? If yes, then buy it. 
If you want a game with a bunch of content and is completely finish, no. Do not buy it. This game is very early.
In the end it all comes down to if you want to support an indie dev make something amazing. What they have here is special and could become big if they keep churning out contnet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104529020', 'num_games_owned': 462, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 272, 'last_played': 1504418107}
review:
간단하게 이게임에 대해 말한다면, 생존 + 디펜스 게임입니다.
게임들이랑 비교하자면 마인크래프트 + 킹덤 정도로 볼수 있습니다.
간단하고 또 그리 어렵지도 않은 게임이고, 적당히 영어만 조금 된다면 쉬운 게임입니다.
하지만 이게임을 솔직히 원가에 사기엔 아직 아까운 감이 넘치는 게임이라 세일을 노리시는 걸 추천하겠습니다.

#8/28#
최근에 이게임이  한글패치가 되었다는 소식을 듣고 그걸 확인하고 블로거 주인분께 양해를 구해 주소를 올리게 되었습니다!
한글패치가 정말 필요한 것들은 다되어 있어 지금 편하게 하고 있습니다.
한글패치를 해주신 감자님께 감사드립니다!

## 네이버 블로거 감자님께서 이게임의 한글패치 직접 작업하셨습니다!     ##
## 그 정보를 알려주신 ULSANPUNKYO 님 감사합니다!                             ##
## 블로그 주소 : http://blog.naver.com/hwoo74449/221062872278            ##

#11/23##
#왕군님께서 개인적으로 한패를 작업하여 그걸 개발자 분께 드렸다고 합니다.#
#인제 게임내에서 설정에서 바로 한글로 바꿀수 있다고하네요!#
#랄까 저는 요즘 안하다보니 확인은 못하고있습니다....#


이 아래부턴 게임 설명글입니다.

--------------------------- 방어 시스템   ------------------------
이게임의 방어 목표는 플레이어 보단 깃발 입니다. 제가 첫회차로 플레이 했을땐 한번 털렸을때 깃발로 들어가더군요.
그리고 이게임에서 공격해들어오는 좀비들은 블럭을 못부숩니다. 그래서 가는 길목을 막는 등의 행위를 하여 안전하게 있을수도 있습니다. 대신 패널티로 소모 식량이 6배가 되는 걸 볼수 있으니 사용에 유의 하셔야 합니다.
깃발로 가는 길목을 미로 처럼 만들어 막을수도 있고 대량의 아쳐를 만들어서 방어할수도 있습니다.

물론 깃발에 들어가기전 일꾼들 부터 죽이고 들어갑니다. 그러니 최대한 조심하세요.
일꾼들은 모두 한방에 죽습니다.

--------------------------- 일꾼 + 배치     --------------------------
처음 시작시 플레이어는 필요량의 블럭과 식량과 화살을 받고 시작합니다.
이때 식량은 일꾼을 고용하는데 사용 하게 되고 이를 과도하게 사용하면, 유지식량 갯수가 부족하여 일꾼이 죽는걸 보게됩니다.
일꾼을 소환하는 방법은 2번을 눌러 깃발을 땅에 꽃고 그 깃발에 오른쪽 클릭을 하면 식량 50과 배치된 침대 하나를 사용하여 일꾼 하나를 받아 올수 잇습니다.
일꾼들은 자동으로 자신의 직장을 찾아 떠납니다.
이때 일꾼들에게 줄 직장이 부족하면 깃발 근처에서 놀고있는걸 보시게 될겁니다.

---------------------------- 농장 + 광산   ---------------------------
농장은 쉽게 지을수 있습니다.
1번 왕관모양의 그 아이콘은 일꾼들에게 일을 줄수 있는 하나의 공간을 설정 할 수 있습니다.
1번을 눌러 오른쪽 클릭을 허공을 보고 하면 툴 메뉴가 열리고 그곳에서 식량과 나무, 광산을 설정 할수 있습니다.

식량 : 이경우는 쉽습니다. 최대 10x10 까지 가능하고 퀵바에 있는 재료를 소모하여 땅에 지을수 있니다.



나무 : 이 경우도 식량과 비슷합니다.(아직 나무가 주변에 넘쳐서 필요할때 직접 캐느라 자세히는 모릅니다)

광산 : 이 툴이 조금 애매합니다. 일단 이 툴을 쓰기 위해선 맨위의 땅이 아닌 최대한 파서 들어갈수 있는 곳까지 가서 툴을 써야합니다. 이게임은 마인크래프트랑 비슷하면서 다른 점이 땅을 일정 깊이를 파면 주변 돌과는 다른 바닥 타일이 나오게 되는데 이곳에서 무한자원 형식으로 계속 캘수 있습니다. 그리고 이 바닥 타일에서 부터 광석타일이 일정확률로 뜨게 됩니다.
그리고 광산 툴은 이런 바닥 타일에 일꾼들이 돌이나 광석을 캐게 하기 위해 쓰는 것입니다.

--------------------  궁수 배치    -----------------
위 게임의 영상이나 사진을 보시면 몇몇 일꾼들은 한자리에서 가만히 있는걸 볼수 있습니다.
이들은 모두 궁수들입니다. 이 궁수들을 같은 경우에도 일꾼들이 자동으로 자리를 잡고있는 경우인데, 이들을 배치 시킬려면 인벤토리에서 화살통을 제작하여 설치를 해주셔야 합니다.

--------------------- 인벤토리 + 제작 + 방향변경   ------------------------
우선 인벤토리는 거의 창고 수준입니다. 왜냐하면 일꾼들이 수확하고 캔 아이템들이 다 플레이어의 인벤토리로 들어가기 때문입니다.
위 사진에 농지들을 보면 그 근처에 나무 상자들이 있습니다. 이 상자들에 넣어지는 아이템들은 모두 플레이어의 인벤토리로 들어가게 되고 일꾼들은 그 인벤에 있는 재료를 가지고 자동으로 설정해놓은 아이템들을 만들어 냅니다.
이쯤되면 인벤은 나라의 국고라고 생각하시면 됩니다.

제작같은 경우 플레이어가 제작할수 있는데 인벤을 열고 왼쪽에 나오는 래시피들 뿐이 없습니다.
그리고 제작을 위해 필요한 재료를 퀵슬롯으로 옮겨야 제작이 가능하죠.
철 주괴를 만든다던가 식량을 만들려면 일꾼들이 만들어야 합니다.
작업대와 용광로, 화덕들은 모두 하나의 일꾼들이 필요합니다.

물건을 배치할때 방향 전환을 하는 방법은 R입니다.


--------수정사항(내킬떄마다 보고 적습니다) -----------
6 / 22
이번에 0.2로 가면서 베리 농사가 생겨 빵을 만들지 않고 농사 짓고 나온 수확품을 바로 먹는 식량으로 대체가 된다고 하네요.
그리고 빵은 생산할때 밀 -> 가루 -> 빵 으로 바뀌지만 식량 량을 더욱 늘리겠다고 되어있습니다.
(개인적으로 우리나라 언어 번역도 해주고 그래픽도 조금 깔끔하게 해주었으면....)

author: {'steamid': '76561198018264227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 2112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 553, 'last_played': 1655243086}
review:
At first glimpse, I thought 'oh no, not another minecraft clone', but somehow it made me curious. 
Now I'm glad I spend the money to support the development of this game!
Differently to minecraft you're not just Steve who hast to do all the annoying work by himself. You are king: Let them work for you! 
The storage system is different from what you know from Minecraft: One storage which holds all the gathered recources and the king (you) has access to it wherever he is. No more stupid half-way-back-running for an item you forgot to take with you. Just let your colonist collect stone, while you are building the castle to protect them. The chests are more like 'access points' to the one big inventory and colonists use them to take what they need or to put in what they've produced. 
Sometimes it feels to me like a build-up strategy game which you can actually walk in. Especially when placing archers on the walls like in, for e. g. 'Stronghold'. 
You see, I'm totally catched by this game and I can't wait to see more features added to it in the future. 
Please hang in there devs, it has great potential!

author: {'steamid': '76561198318932754', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 937, 'last_played': 1673191611}
review:
I cannot reccomend this game more in the first two days I have managed to play over eight hours (and i'm still going), hire 86 colonists, build a  30 by 30 fort, and build the walls of a 100 by 50 castle that i'm still working on. this game allows me to build bases wich was my favortite part of minecraft, and it lets me hire setllers to take care of the tedious task of collecting resources. Even if you aren't a fan of base construction like I am it's not very hard to build an effective base, but if you really love base construction i would say this game has even higher value for you because it will allow you to take on bigger projects without spening as much time collecting resources for them.

below I will list anything I want to see in the game eventually for the developers if they evevr happen to see this 

#1 more enemy types. I am fine with the zombies that are in the game now but I want more interesting opponents to test my overzealous defenses with.

#2 more ways to defend. Archers are great for defense but I don't fell like its enough to just have sationary archers defending positions. maybe ther could be knights who would be equipped with a full set of iron armor (that you would have to make) and they could stay close to your walls but move around outside and fight. Another option could be allowing archers to patrol areas so that i won't have to have 30+ archers on my massive castle walls just to cover it all.

#3 flags. banners and other castle like items. just to add more decorations to my castles I would love to make multiple purely cosmetic banners

#4 construction jobs. not jobs that involve prefabricated buildings but in the command tool I could set up an area for them to romove or place a certain type of block

That is all I have for the moment, and if the developers do see this I want you to know that I've been loving your game

author: {'steamid': '76561198173303282', 'num_games_owned': 68, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 781, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 660, 'last_played': 1680373365}
review: The game might seem pricey, but it is worth it even for an early access game.  The single player mode is fun for yourself.  Me and my friend are making 2 seperate castles and we are having tons of fun.  It also lets you sort of go through the steps to become a king too.   I also find it neat that you can play online with different people already in this game.  The controls are similar to other games and are easy to master too.  I personally give this game a 9/10.  I hope the developers will contiune to work on this game to make it better for me and everyone else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202282942', 'num_games_owned': 33, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 486, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 484, 'last_played': 1499514685}
review:
Un Gioco molto bello che seppur dovesse sembrare una copia di Minecraft, questo non lo è affatto. Dietro questo gioco c'è comunque originalità. E' divertente sentirsi all'interno di un gioco RE per davvero e preoccuparsi solo che i proprio coloni possano vivere in pace, lavorere per Me, e ampliare il Regno lasciando fare tutto a loro mentre io do loro la capicità di farlo.

Seppur non abbia ricevuto gratis questo gioco, ho preferito addirittura contribuire al progetto degli sviluppatori traducendo il gioco il meglio possibile (mi potrebbe esser scappato qualche errore ma il gioco è in alpha e quindi c'è tempo di italianizzarlo ancor di più col tempo).

Lo consiglio a tutti!

author: {'steamid': '76561198053168762', 'num_games_owned': 435, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 366, 'last_played': 1598183654}
review:
This game has a lot of potention and is very fun to play. It's a combination of base building, micro management and survival. One thing that is very great about the game is that you can skip the "boring" part of gathering resources and assign your colonists to do the  jobs (mining, cutting wood, farming and guarding). 
Your colonists only require a bed and food which both can be easily obtained. 
During the night zombies will attack your settlement, the more colonists you have in your town the more zombies will attack but with a few guards or guarding yourself you can easily defend your city.
This game is still very small and hopefully a lot of content will be added in the future but this game is well worth the price!

author: {'steamid': '76561198075188482', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 9206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1629, 'last_played': 1702776684}
review:
I highly recommend this game for people who enjoy minecraft, survival games, and resource managers. The game is very well thought out and designed well with pretty great graphics for such an early release (and for it being voxel based). Every world you create or start should be different too, the worlds are randomly generated, forests, plains, lakes, mountains, and you can build all of your own structures and everysingle block of your castle, village, town, or whatever you desire! I just bought the game yesterday and played it for 6 hours, only stopped once to eat, so that should tell you something haha.

Just remember the game is in early access, BUGS ARE EXPECTED! 
Some to be warry of:
- AI is somewhat broke, colonists will get to there designated post BUT take the weirdest paths sometimes
- AI is somwhat broken for zombies aswell
- Guard AI will usually hit their targets very accuratly but if a zombie sneaks up behind them I'd say they have a 50/50 chance of survival

Other then that, the game doesn't have a whole lot of items or goals yet, but again, EARLY ACCESS. With that being said, I played for 6 hours and will be playing again in about 10 minutes so the game is very fun even with very few goals.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012487999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2043, 'last_played': 1598281998}

author: {'steamid': '76561198050813027', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 797, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 718, 'last_played': 1571381359}
review:
For a rather small game, this isn't that bad. Sure there could be a lot more done to this game as it does have a long way to go as in term of progress and development. The game is only around 100MB which makes it even better as it's a rather small game compared to most other games on steam.
 
The game is easy to get used to and is rather straightforward with you at the start, giving you both a photo as a example as well as instructions to follow while you set up your kingdom. Don't stress about setting up right away though and make sure you explore first as you won't have much of a threat against monsters.
 
As for performance, it's smooth but it will need some much needed work in the future once you reach a total population of around 50 or higher. Other then that, the game runs smoothly with little to no frame drops depending on your settings.
 
As for buying this game, I would give it some time as there is still a lot to be done to it. It will need a lot of time before it becomes something great. Other than that, it's a good game to enjoy for short periods of time unless you care to challenge yourself and your friends to see how quick you can grow as well as seeing how long you can last for.

review:

few things i would like to see in the game.

1, animals (for the colony to set hunters) more food :)
2, more defence options (like swordsmen and trap like items) i thinks i few sword guards at entrances would look cool
3, i think i lookout scout colonist would be cool, as he rings a bell letting you know Monsters are coming (just a personal idea that lol)
4, the idea of being able to make a moat round your "castle" or "town" (maybe with buckets and water, would take time but i think it would add a cool feature)

ohh and one more little thing i hope they do is add dedicated servers.

but overall i do like the games idea of protecting your colonists and and town, and i think i could really get in to the game playing on a dedicated server sometime in the future.

and to all the negitive reviews, its been out ONE DAY, give it time more features will come

happy gamings peeps. :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198031425506', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2770, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 675, 'last_played': 1631104725}
review:
bought the game the moment it was released (16/6/2017)[dd/mm/yyyy]

so far (17.06.2017) the game is really bare bones, like minecraft alpha sence it IS an alpha as i am writhing this review, but i am having fun non the less. the game is clearly made for artists that have alot of fun in sadbox games like minecraft and i am one of them.

the only thing i have a problem atm is the game burns out of content really fast (to be expected. that will change over time) so DO NOT play only this game in one sitting. take break and come back with fresh ideas!

so far the game is still really buggy (again to be expected) and here is a list of bugs i found out:
(i am running a colony with currently 150 active colinists)
when leaving the game to run on its own for some time (afk) to gather seeds for farming expantions, the colonists pathfinding may glich out and they wont leave there beds, effectivley doing noting so watch out!
just remove some blocks on the way and placing them back solves the issue untell it happends again.
the most noticeble thing i have with a really large colony (>150) is the amout of zombies spawning at night is too big. its easy to defend againts, but the game is NOT optimised yet for these numbers. the result is "moonwalking" zombies and some are out right liying up to the sky and sliding all over the place. imagine 100 chickens in a one block space in minecraft. yeah.

i also had a glich that happend to me once and i could not replicate it, as i was going back up from my mining shaft i sort of gliched out of the shaft and drifted back up. that was wierd.

over all i love the idea of minecraft tower defence :3 cant wait for updates!

author: {'steamid': '76561197969393466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 487, 'last_played': 1497688048}
review:
Also ich mag die Spielidee und die Dinge die im Spiel vorhanden sind, funktionieren auch ganz gut. So gesehen macht das Spiel wenig falsch und ich werde es weiterempfehlen.

Dennoch sollte man folgendes wissen, bevor man das Spiel kauft:

- Es gibt bisher eigentlich nur 3 Baublöcke (Wooden Planks, Stone Bricks, Clay Bricks) > Das schränkt die kreativen Möglichkeit im Gebäudedesign stark ein.
- Viele abbaubare Blöcke sind nicht weiter verarbeitbar und damit recht unnütz.
- Die Präsentationsvideos täuschen mehr "Leben" in dem Spiel vor, als tatsächlich da ist. Wer das klassische Siedlergewusel mag wird hier enttäuscht werden. Die Bürger gehen morgens zur Arbeit und Abends wieder ins Bett (das sind die Szenen in den Videos). Zwischendurch legen sie bestenfalls den Weg zwischen Arbeit und Kiste zurück, aber meistens stehen sie einfach herum. 
- Die Bürger haben leider gar kein Eigenleben oder Bedürfnisse, ausser dem globalen Nahrungsverbrauch - sie agieren wie Roboter. Etwas mehr RPG/Sim würde ich mir bei diesem Genre Mix wünschen.
- Die Welt regeneriert nicht, z.B. breitet sich Grass nicht weiter aus.
- Die Spielwelt ist noch recht leer. Es gibt ausser schönem Ausblick eigentlich keinen Grund entfernte Gebiete zu bereisen.
- Es scheint nur einen Monstertyp zu geben (bisher)
- Die Steuerung erscheint mir teilweise etwas umständlich. Der Bannermodus erscheint mir z.B. völlig sinnlos - da hätte man auch irgendwo in der GUI ein Button vorsehen können, um einen Bürger zu spawnen.
- Es gibt für den Spieler ausser einem Bogen eigentlich gar keine Ausrüstung.
- Das Targeting der Guards ist teilweise noch buggy - da laufen Zombie direkt vor ihnen entlang, ohne das sie schießen.
- Das Pathfinding, gerade wenn Bereiche unterirdisch liegen, ist teilweise haarstäubend 
- Die Animationen sind noch sehr minimalistisch und alle Einheiten ausser dem Spieler bewegen sich recht langsam.
- Es gibt wenig wirkliche Gründe unterschiedliche Gebäude zu bauen. Theoretisch reicht auch eine Mauer ohne Dach drauf, denn den Bürgern ist egal wo sie schlafen (bei mir stehen auch Betten in der Mine).

Aber viele dieser Punkte würde ich dem dem frühen EA Status zuschreiben und auf Besserung hoffen.

Also wenn man mich heute fragt, ob das Spiel 18 bzw. 20 Euro wert ist, müsste ich klar "Nein" sagen, aber das Potential wirklich gut zu werden sehe ich schon. Dennoch hätte ich es gut gefunden, wenn die Entwickler vor der EA-Phase etwas mehr Inhalt (z.B. unterschiedliche Attribute der Bürger, Bürger Bedürfnisse, mehr Baublöcke, Treppen!, Dächer, mehr Interaktion der Bürger, mehr Monster, mehr Waffen, Handelsrouten, bessere Ressourcenverteilung in der Welt, NPCs und NPC Dörfer, Tiere, Minimap mit Koordinaten, Waypoints, Ausrüstung, Kollisionen, mehr Farming, mehr Rezepte und Verarbeitung usw.) vorgesehen hätten.

Daher ist meine Empfehlung: Kauft das Spiel für diesen Preis nur, wenn ihr die Entwickler unterstützen wollt oder der hier skizzierte Spielumfang euch zum aktuellen Zeitpunkt wirklich genügt. Ich hatte nach ca. 4 Stunden alle gemacht, was man aktuell im Spiel tun kann.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002905750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 78, 'playtime_forever': 2627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 205, 'last_played': 1683580249}
review:
Colony Survival mixt Timber´n´Stone mit Minecraft auf eine sehr angenehme Art. Und ich liebe es!
Erste Einblicke gibts hier:
https://youtu.be/_L42G3vr0yc
So simpel wie das Spiel zunächst erscheint, ist es gar nicht. Schnell wird klar. Die Tiefe und die Möglichkeiten, die sich in der kleinen Aufbau-Kolonie verstecken, können umfangreich werden. So gilt es neue Mitarbeiter zu erschaffen und ihnen nützliche Aufgaben zukommen zu lassen! Endlich sind wir beim Minecraften nicht mehr alleine!
Natürlich ist das Spiel noch im Aufbau und so gibts auch offen zu erkennen, woran die beiden Brüder noch programmieren müssen. Dennoch: es ist liebevoll gestaltet, die Mechanik ist einfach und intuitiv und die Herausforderungen aktuell noch sehr geschmeidig. Leider fehlt es an Musik und so sind die Arbeiter und einige wenige Sounds der Umgebung noch etwas wenig. Aber das stört weder den Spielspaß noch den Wieder- und Wieder- und Wiederspielwert. Für den aktuellen Preis von 18 Euro (im Angebot) durchaus eine KAUFEMPFEHLUNG!
