author: {'steamid': '76561198216996861', 'num_games_owned': 278, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 6580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3892, 'last_played': 1697396265}
review:
**Ive uploaded some screenshots to my steam profile If you'd like to take a look at some things possible with the game.**

I bought the game a little after release and have put 13 hours in it already (its 12:30 am the morning after).  Theres your review :D.

I absolutely love it.   Its got its quirks; early access and all.  Ive had a couple crashes, but your progress seems to be saved constantly.  When you load in, even after a crash, you are exactly where you left off.  

There isnt "a lot" of content right now, as some people have mentioned, buuuttt that doesnt really matter at the moment.  After 13 hours I am still thinking about what I'm going to be building next.  So many plans :D!!  What is here is plenty for many many hours of enjoyment.  I'm sure that I will have plenty to do until the dev's start adding things.  I mean, I've "got" everything in the game as of right now (minus some snow, lol) but that doesnt have any real impact on what I am able to do with the game.  The only real limit for "value" is yourself (imo).  If you wont have fun in a sandbox, the game isnt for you.  If youre looking for a hardcore survival sim, this game isnt for you.  This is a relaxed colony management sim and a builders canvas. 

It must be said that the graphics are actually beautiful.  The depth of field and "dynamic eye adaptation" work wonders.  Depth of field is usually the first setting in a game I turn off, but I really enjoy it here.  The textures are quite good as well!  This is not a simple box game. And the lighting....man, the lighting looks simply amazing sometimes.   

The difficulty is on the easy side for sure, as of right now.  Ive got a colony of 62 with a 7k+ surplus of food and a bounty of everything else.  The hordes are def increasing in size, I actually lost my first colonists about 10 hours in when I expanded my village without properly considering all the paths the monsters may take.  But if you build smart, place defenses accordingly, and secure your food situation, the game really lets you do whatever it is you want to do.  

Loving it! I cant wait to see what these devs do with the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119798549', 'num_games_owned': 144, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1497684958}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969738345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1454, 'last_played': 1498592659}
review:
Yup, it's early access, but man it's doing it for me.

Do you wish for Minecraft reborn as a resource management / tower defense game?  That's what this is.

No, you won't be digging through miles of stone looking for ores or looking awestruck at majestic caverns.  The terrain isn't all that deep and the ores are plentiful and each instance is infinite.  What that means is that you can build a nice little home for your coal miner - he'll dutifully roam between his bed, his coal block and his crate, dropping off the ore into the common stockpile on each trip.

I personally feel that the blockish aesthetic has run it's course - sure it's a voxel game, and that's fine, but couldn't we still have some round bodies and heads?  Please?  Surely there's a balance between cubes and AAA shooters.  Here's hoping.  Even with the voxels though, there's some great work with alpha and normal mapping here; the rock looks rough, and guards' mail glints in the sunlight.

There's not a whole lot here, yet - Staggering archers along a few funnel paths to the town center is simple enough, but I think that's a good thing.  It allows room to breathe, plan your next colonist's home, and expand when the time is right.  It's early access, and I've had a couple hiccups, but man it's still fun.  It's closer to what I wanted Timber & Stone to be, even at this early point.

Yes, it's a touch pricy for such early access fare, especially given the rash of cash grabs out there, but I'm satisfied with the GAMEPLAY, which seems all too often to be an afterthought.  YMMV.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995038411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1497668233}
review:
Alors mon avis !!
CE jeu à pas mal de potentielle, le systéme de gestion en Mode FPS c'est une bonne idée, mais malleureusement je trouve que le jeu est sorti trop tôt, après une heure de jeu tu as déjà fais le tour, ça manque cruellement de contenue.
Après il y à beaucoup de point à modifier, mais dans l'ensemble le jeu est stable, j'ai pas u de soucie avec le multijoueurs, aucun RAM, à ce niveau là les dev on fait du bon travail.
Comme j'ai dis plus haut, le seul souci est le manque de contenue, le monde est vide, tu as fais vite le tour du jeu, tu peux pas assigner toi même les PNJ au JOB que tu souhaite. Ca manque de travail !!

Pour le moments je reste sur une note possitif, mais je vais quand même demander un remboursement, car en l'état actelle du jeu, les 18€ demander pour un truc qui devient répétitifs au boue d'une heure ne les vaux pas. Ils y à tellement d'autre jeu moins cher et plus loin que celui là ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198034550602', 'num_games_owned': 709, 'num_reviews': 98, 'playtime_forever': 20724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7970, 'last_played': 1708911528}
review:
>Be me
>Buy $17 early access indie game with heavy inspiration taken from Minecraft
>"This cannot end well."
>Get in game
>Look around and the world is actually HD wtf why would it need to look this good
>Recruit a single colonist
>He stares at me with big shiny voxel-eyes of innocence
>I love him
>In those eyes I see a dream. A dream of a vast Imperium of bug-eyed humans(?) ruling these wilds
>One hour later and I am having way too much fun living out my imperial fantasies in this little game of all places
>Tears swell in my eyes as archers gun down the eyeless savages that beset us each night from the battlements
>This imperium will not falter

10/10 would spend hours expanding the glory of humanity in a endless sandbox $17 voxel indie game that has been out for a day again.

Part 2:

>Haven't really stopped playing since day 1
>Every update vastly changes the world
>We now have research, gunpowder, laterns, and better AI on both sides
>This Imperium grows ever STRONGER.

review:
A very promising game this can be.

So far, this game is fun and the multiplayer is working well, the fact that you can create your own colony along with a friend is awesome. There are a few things that i think that can be added to help the overall gameplay:

-Maybe some type of trading system with other players online  ex.) npc trader

author: {'steamid': '76561198044524804', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 595, 'last_played': 1561822082}
review:
[h1]Summary[/h1]
Well worth the buy. May be slightly lacking in content currently, but with a few more editions you'll get your moneys worth. 

The game is very addictive, and for game comparisons I agree with other reviews that the game is like Minecraft, Prison Architect and 7 Days to Die all in one.

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
Good for a voxel game, comparable to a HD texture pack on Minecraft. Tons of settings are available. You shouldn't have trouble running this with low specification PCs.

[h1]Sound[/h1]
All player actions have sound, be it walking, mining or dieing. There are a few bugs with global sounds but i'm sure that will be fixed soon. NPCs themselves don't seem to have any direct noises other than their actions (planting crops / crafting).

[h1]A.I.[/h1]
Not award winning but does the job. There are a few ways to trick the game into spawning no AI, but I don't see the point in doing that. For what the game is currently the AI are more then okay, a few more fixes to be perfect.

[h1]Download Size[/h1]
If you're like me with bad internet then the download is extremely small. At the time of this review it is only 40MB.

[b]Tip:[/b] If it's just you and your friends playing I suggest turning on 2x Zombies, as the default amount don't seem to be much of a threat.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116408403', 'num_games_owned': 423, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 140, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1497652164}
review:
7 Days to Die + Minecraft + RTS + Micromanagement = Colony Survival

The building aspect is quite confusing when you first begin playing it but after 30 minutes (for me) You'll learn to understand that you completely fucked up when you have 10 recruits who are farmers but no have no bread maker to make the food when theres only 10 pieces of bread left. Here the game gives you one more chance to get your shit together and fix your recruit's roles. If you don't take that last chance then you're going to get raped when a storm of zombies molest you and your villagers.

One thing that needs to be worked on is the depth in the game because there isn't much you can do after you've gotten your base sorted out except for make it look bigger & better.

Apart from that, overall a fun game so far, and can't wait for the upcoming developments.

author: {'steamid': '76561198232371360', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1659248366}
review:
I first saw this game played by Paulsoaresjr (https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCP6f9x4iXk3LH8Q1sqJmYPQ). Immediately, it interested me. You start out as a lone surviver but you can hire colonists to help you. You can build a castle, mine for ore, chop down trees or plant wheat. The basic features of the game make it sound like any other sandbox game. However I guarentee this is not like any other sandbox game. You will constantly feel immersed in ruling and helping your colonists. I recommend this extremely and I believe it has higher promise than minecraft did when it first came out. 


Good Job to the developers 10/10

Also one question for the community.... Is there a way you can cook bread yourself?

author: {'steamid': '76561198103601761', 'num_games_owned': 212, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1553, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 590, 'last_played': 1557629029}
review:
I usually dont do reviews but this game really deserves it.
I've bin hyped for this game for a while and as soon as I woke up on the release date I instantly bought it, and im not disappointed.

Imagine having minecraft, mixed with oxygen not included and alittle sprinkle of sims to create a new Mona Lisa.
This game is truly a master peice, though if you dont like more of a relaxing, adventure feel then this game isnt really for you but if your intrested, buy it when you get the chance.

author: {'steamid': '76561198070578575', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 608, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1585564046}
review:
Tot nu toe een erg leuk spel. Het is wel te merken dat het nog een early acces is. Naar mijn mening is hij nog wat content light maar toch al leuk om te spelen. Tot nu toe nog geen vreemde dingen tegen gekomen.
Een perfecte combinatie tussen het creatieve van minecraft en de uitdaging van een toren verdediging. 

Dit spel heeft talloze mogelijkheden om het uit te breiden maar een paar dingen die ik zou willen voorstellen zijn:

-meer verschillende soorten aanvallers ipv zombies bijv. vliegende wezens
-Moeilijker naarmate de tijd vorderd in plaats van afhankelijk van het aantal npc's
-Meer soorten blokken
-extra biome's

Edit:
Ik zie hier heel veel mensen klagen over de npc movement. Ja het klopt dat ze in hoeken van 90graden en in rechte lijnen lopen. Echter vind ik dit niet storend sterker nog dit vind ik wel een leuke sfeer geven aan het spel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198101063989', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 203, 'last_played': 1512485473}
review: I haven't had too much time to play but as the game stands right now it is pretty fun and relaxing. Does it look like Minecraft? Yes it does. But don't let that fool you it is an entirely different game. Think Minecraft meets Factorio because of the automation and you'd have a good idea of how the building and resource gathering is handled. Add a dash of 7 Days to Die and you've got the night time survival aspect. It is possible right now to just sit down and do everything in one 4-5 hour session but if the development roadmap the devs released is anything to go by there is a lot of potential and content coming. Especially once Steam Workshop support is added.

author: {'steamid': '76561198133715278', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 2563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1679505131}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018396762', 'num_games_owned': 207, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1854, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1717, 'last_played': 1562010841}
review:
Bought it on early access release for 20$.
- The AI pathing is a bit buggy, especially for the zombies.
- The block edges get a weird bump where the normal maps meet.
- Mouse control feels floaty, even after adjusting the settings.
Other than that, it runs smoother than some of the AAA titles I've played, the textures are nice and it's doing alright for what it is; An early access of a voxel based survival/management game.

Looking forward to see where this game goes in the future.

0.2.3 Edit;
- AI pathing has been altered, still need to test this to form an opinion.
- I've either gotten used to the mouse controls or they've altered those too.
- Plenty of Optimization updates, such as reducing lag from plant growth, zombie death, etc.
- Small but active texturing and modding community.
- Fantastic Dev/Community interactions in the Discussion Forums.
With all the changes at this point, the game runs ever better than before and I've been running it on the highest quality settings with a Radeon HD 7770 1GB, with an average of about 40fps.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013536994', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2548, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1048, 'last_played': 1498253609}
review:
If you love to manage things in a game, this is the perfect game for you. You can help your Colonists by doing some of the tasks for them but all in all it's about creating a sustainable colony.

I do have to mention that this is a game that breathes Early Access. There's a lot of potential and you can see that the developers launched the game with some minimalistic features that makes it playable. Now it's up to us to suggest which mechanics we want to see in the game and then see the game evolve into something truely majestic.

I'm having a lot of fun in multiplayer already!

author: {'steamid': '76561197986048681', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1700258296}
review:
Although it looks similar to another game, it's quite a bit different in terms of gameplay. 

The colony management part of the game is obviously important and the game itself has a lot of potential and I can't wait to see what comes of it in the future!

However, due to being an Early Access game, there are some issues with it but that is expected. Hopefully we continue to see improvements every update!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049243982', 'num_games_owned': 417, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 8763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2622, 'last_played': 1653055904}
review:
it may look like minecraft on first glance, but it definitely isn't.
don't believe me? lemme explain:

of course you could run around and gather stuff. but why would you do manual labor if you can hire people to do it for you? food farming, wood and stone gathering, ore mining, smelting, crafting... all of the boring tasks of a survival game are being done by your own private workforce!
of course, people aren't cheap, as they require food and beds. but both of them can be automatically produced. and the process ofthat is simple, yet rewarding.
of course, these people 'could' use houses, but that's not necessary. you don't need to be a good builder for this game. just place some beds on the ground and dig some trenches to protect your little settlement.
if you do want to build nicely, but aren't  talented, as of now, you can easily let your dudes build stuff for you! you can even download blueprints from the workshop!
but if you somehow wall in your flag (the centerpiece of your colony), a siege mode starts, in which the game gets much harder.

having a ton of people attracts monsters too, but that is also no problem, as you can hire guards to deal with monsters easily. just place them strategically - or spam them, if you have a giant city.

this game also has far better graphics as minecraft, because blocks aren't just simple cubes: they're shaped, they have depth, they refract light. it's like minecraft on HD-steroids, just with a much better performance!

i like this game a lot. the developers are nice and eager to help their customers. they really want to deliver a good game. i've asked them to test this game, and they gave me a key for the alpha, and i'm happy i could help them by stress-testing the game and finding and submitting a few bugs and balancing issues.

and yes, that meant i got the game for free - but only because i've helped them translate the game into german, and they let me keep the key as thanks. this jsut shows how awesome they are!

i'm not used to writing reviews, and i never felt obliged to, but i feel like this game get's brushed off to quickly as a minecraft clone - which it isn't. the gameplay and controls feel different, it has a different artstyle, it focuses on different aspects. the developers are active and helpful. i (and my 250 (as of now) voluntary forced laborers) recommend this game highly.
if you still feel sceptic about it, you should check out some gameplay videos, or try the game out for yourself.
and don't listen to any negative review that starts out by saying that "this game is basically minecraft" - it isn't.

but writing about how this is not minecraft would take up too much space on a review, so i will stop here now. go on and enjoy the game, and if you have any questions, the community should be nice enough if you ask kindly^^

(also, this game already has multiplayer. go play with strangers or friends^^)

for those of you still sceptic, i've explained the differences betwen this and minecraft on the comment page of this review, which can also be found here:
http://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198049243982/recommended/366090?tscn=1497661101)

if you still have doubts about this game, then the current state of this game will not satisfy you, as in many places it is still really rough around the edges.
sure, you can get tons of playtime out of it already if you really like it, but if you're looking for flaws or reasons not to buy it, i'd suggest waiting and lurking for now.

don't blame me if you don't like it, because i love it and this game is definitely not for everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069353292', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 4573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1671922507}
review:
Best way to describe this would be 7 days to die had a 3 some with Minecraft & Prison Architect.  Between all the Micromanagement, base building and zombie killing love, this gem was born.  

From what I have seen so far, very active developer.
The graphics are very HD looking, And feels better than the Minecraft Demo I tried.

The gameplay feels relaxed and fun and engaging.  Small learning curve to start, which you will overcome in under an hour,

If you are a fan of base building, survival and micro managing, then you will enjoy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003418265', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 13311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13311, 'last_played': 1592948072}
review:
Well..
Grow your colony, defend it from zombies, research new technologies, try to keep the villagers happy, explore new lands and grow your empire of multiple colonies that can trade region unique items with each other.

To test all the features and technologies you can research in this game I’ve spent roughly 120 hours doing it all, and it’s been quite enjoyable.
Enjoyable, frustrating, difficult at times and in the end rewarding.

I truly enjoy this game and plan to play it more as it updates.

My full review can be found here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VF-zQAD28Kc

author: {'steamid': '76561198343326115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 17159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2535, 'playtime_at_review': 3058, 'last_played': 1712455366}
review: Colony Survival is a great Voxel Style game. The Devs are active. While keeping a, "whats best for the community" type of attitude, they have taken a lot of suggestions and implemented them in-game already. The survival is real, and the cost is perfect! If Voxel games are your thing, I recommend this game 100%!
